AppleShowAllExtensions.title: Show all filename extensions
AppleShowAllExtensions.description: Enable to forcibly show all file extensions in Finder.

AppleShowScrollBars.title: Show Scroll Bars
AppleShowScrollBars.description: When should the scroll bars be shown?

CSUIDisable32BitWarning.title: Hide 32-bit App Compatibility Alert
CSUIDisable32BitWarning.description: Hides the one-time alert shown when opening a 32-bit application.

MultipleSessionEnabled.title: Enable Fast User Switching
MultipleSessionEnabled.description: If set to false, fast user switching is disabled.

NSDocumentSaveNewDocumentsToCloud.title: Save New Documents to iCloud
NSDocumentSaveNewDocumentsToCloud.description: If set to false, applications won't default to save to iCloud.

com.apple.autologout.AutoLogOutDelay.title: Auto LogOut Delay
com.apple.autologout.AutoLogOutDelay.description: The autologout delay, in seconds. A value of 0 means autologout is off. In some cases, this delay may be restricted to values between 5 minutes and 24 hours.

AccessKey.title: Access Key
AccessKey.description:
Munki has a feature which enables Mac administrators to use middleware to change munki's HTTP request. S3-Auth uses this feature to create the HTTP headers necessary to authenticate to S3.

AccessKey for S3 bucket.

AdditionalHttpHeaders.title: Additional HTTP Headers
AdditionalHttpHeaders.description: This key provides the ability to specify custom HTTP headers to be sent with all curl() HTTP requests.

AggressiveUpdateNotificationDays.title: Aggressive Update Notification Days
AggressiveUpdateNotificationDays.description: This preference controls how many days after one or more pending updates are ignored that aggressive user notification begins. Setting this to 0 never triggers this aggressive behavior.

AppleSoftwareUpdatesOnly.title: Install Apple Software Updates Only
AppleSoftwareUpdatesOnly.description: Only install updates from an Apple Software Update server. No Munki repository is needed or used.

CatalogURL.title: Base Catalog URL
CatalogURL.description: Base URL for Munki catalogs. Useful if your catalogs are served from a different server than your packages or manifests.

ClientCertificatePath.title: Client Certificate Path
ClientCertificatePath.description: Absolute path to a client certificate. There are 3 defaults for this key. Concatenated cert/key PEM file accepted.

ClientIdentifier.title: Client Identifier
ClientIdentifier.description: Identifier for Munki client. Usually is the same as a manifest name on the Munki server. If this is empty or undefined, Munki will attempt the following identifiers, in order: fully-qualified hostname, "short" hostname, serial number and finally, "site_default".

ClientKeyPath.title: Client Key Path
ClientKeyPath.description: Absolute path to a client private key.

ClientResourceURL.title: Base Client Resource URL
ClientResourceURL.description: Base URL for custom client resources for Managed Software Center. Useful if your resources are served from a different server or different directory than the default.

ClientResourcesFilename.title: Client Resources Filename
ClientResourcesFilename.description: Specific filename to use when requesting custom client resources.

DaysBetweenNotifications.title: Days Between Notifications
DaysBetweenNotifications.description: Number of days between user notifications from Managed Software Center. Set to 0 to have Managed Software Center notify every time a background check runs if there are available updates.

EmulateProfileSupport.title: Emulate Profile Support (Big Sur)
EmulateProfileSupport.description: A bit of hack and not supported by Apple, it is disabled by default. To emulate profile installs, configuration profiles are read, and if they contain managed preferences, they are converted to MCX data that is added to a ComputerGroup in the local Open Directory store. Configuration profile payloads that are not managed preferences are ignored/skipped.

FollowHTTPRedirects.title: Follow HTTP Redirects
FollowHTTPRedirects.description: Defines whether Munki will follow all, some or no redirects from the web server. (none = The default behaviour. No redirects are followed. https = Only redirects to URLs using HTTPS are followed. all = Redirects to both HTTP and HTTPS URLs are followed.)

HelpURL.title: Help URL
HelpURL.description: URL to open/display when the user selects "Managed Software Center Help" from Managed Software Center's Help menu.

IconURL.title: Base Icon URL
IconURL.description: Base URL for product icons. Useful if your icons are served from a different server or different directory than the default.

IgnoreSystemProxies.title: Ignore System Proxies
IgnoreSystemProxies.description: HTTP and/or HTTPS proxies set system-wide will be ignored, connections will be made directly.

InstallAppleSoftwareUpdates.title: Install Apple Software Updates
InstallAppleSoftwareUpdates.description: Install updates from an Apple Software Update server, in addition to "regular" Munki updates.

InstallRequiresLogout.title: Require Logout for Installs & Uninstalls
InstallRequiresLogout.description: Managed Software Center will require a logout for all installs or removals.

LicenseInfoURL.title: License Info URL
LicenseInfoURL.description: URL for Munki to query a webserver to determine if there are available seats for licensed software (or any software you wish to make available via optional_installs, yet control the number of deployed copies).

LocalOnlyManifest.title: Local Only Manifest
LocalOnlyManifest.description: Defines the name of your LocalOnlyManifest. Setting this activates the feature. Unsetting it means Munki will remove the file on the next run.

LogFile.title: Log File
LogFile.description: Primary log is written to this file. Other logs are written into the same directory as this file.

LogToSyslog.title: Log to Syslog
LogToSyslog.description: Log to syslog in addition to ManagedSoftwareUpdate.log.

LoggingLevel.title: Logging Level
LoggingLevel.description: Higher values cause more detail to be written to the primary log.

MSUDebugLogEnabled.title: Debug Log Enabled
MSUDebugLogEnabled.description: Debug logging for Managed Software Center.

MSULogEnabled.title: Log Enabled
MSULogEnabled.description: Log user actions in the GUI.

ManagedInstallDir.title: Managed Install Directory
ManagedInstallDir.description: Folder where Munki keeps its data on the client.

ManifestURL.title: Base Manifest URL
ManifestURL.description: Base URL for Munki manifests. Useful if your manifests are served from a different server than your catalogs or manifests.

PackageURL.title: Base Package URL
PackageURL.description: Base URL for Munki pkgs. Useful if your packages are served from a different server than your catalogs or manifests.

PackageVerificationMode.title: Package Verification Mode
PackageVerificationMode.description: Controls how Munki verifies the integrity of downloaded packages. (none = No integrity check is performed, hash = Integrity check is performed if package info contains checksum information, hash_strict = Integrity check is performed, and fails if package info does not contain checksum information.)

PerformAuthRestarts.title: Perform FileVault Authorized Restarts
PerformAuthRestarts.description: Munki will attempt to perform a filevault auth restart.

RecoveryKeyFile.title: FileVault Credentials Path
RecoveryKeyFile.description: Absolute path to a plist file containing filevault credentials in key/value format. Used to perform auth restarts.

Region.title: Region
Region.description:
Munki has a feature which enables Mac administrators to use middleware to change munki's HTTP request. S3-Auth uses this feature to create the HTTP headers necessary to authenticate to S3.

Region for S3 bucket.

S3Endpoint.title: S3 Endpoint
S3Endpoint.description:
Munki has a feature which enables Mac administrators to use middleware to change munki's HTTP request. S3-Auth uses this feature to create the HTTP headers necessary to authenticate to S3.

S3 Endpoint for bucket.

SecretKey.title: Secret Key
SecretKey.description:
Munki has a feature which enables Mac administrators to use middleware to change munki's HTTP request. S3-Auth uses this feature to create the HTTP headers necessary to authenticate to S3.

SecretKey for S3 bucket.

ShowOptionalInstallsForHigherOSVersions.title: Show Optional Installs For Higher OS Versions
ShowOptionalInstallsForHigherOSVersions.description: Managed Software Center.app will show optional installs and updates that apply to macOS versions higher than the currently installed version.

ShowRemovalDetail.title: Show Removal Detail
ShowRemovalDetail.description: Managed Software Center will display detail for scheduled removals.

SoftwareRepoCACertificate.title: Software Repo CA Certificate
SoftwareRepoCACertificate.description: Absolute path to your CA Certificate.

SoftwareRepoCAPath.title: Software Repo CA Path
SoftwareRepoCAPath.description: Path to the directory that stores your CA certificate(s).

SoftwareUpdateServerURL.title: Software Update Server URL
SoftwareUpdateServerURL.description: Catalog URL for Apple Software Updates. If undefined or empty, Munki will use the same catalog that the OS uses when you run Apple's Software Update application or call /usr/sbin/softwareupdate.

SuppressAutoInstall.title: Suppress Auto Install
SuppressAutoInstall.description: Munki will not automatically install or remove items.

SuppressLoginwindowInstall.title: Suppress Loginwindow Install
SuppressLoginwindowInstall.description: Munki will not install items while idle at the loginwindow except for those marked for unattended_install or unattended_uninstall.

SuppressStopButtonOnInstall.title: Suppress Stop Button On Install
SuppressStopButtonOnInstall.description: Managed Software Center will hide the stop button while installing or removing software, preventing users from interrupting the install.

SuppressUserNotification.title: Suppress Update Notifications
SuppressUserNotification.description: Managed Software Center will never notify the user of available updates.

UnattendedAppleUpdates.title: Unattended Apple Updates
UnattendedAppleUpdates.description: Updates that declare no "must-close" applications, or have one or more "must-close" applications, none of which is running, and do not require a logout or restart will be installed as part of a normal periodic background run without notifying the user.

UseClientCertificate.title: Use Client Certificate
UseClientCertificate.description: Use an SSL client certificate when communicating with the Munki server. Requires an https:// URL for the Munki repo.

UseClientCertificateCNAsClientIdentifier.title: Use Client Certificate CN As Client Identifier
UseClientCertificateCNAsClientIdentifier.description: Use the CN of the client certificate as the Client Identifier. Used in combination with the UseClientCertificate key.

UseNotificationCenterDays.title: Use Notification Center Days
UseNotificationCenterDays.description: Number of days Notification Center notifications should be used before switching to launching Managed Software Center.

BaseUrl.title: BaseUrl
BaseUrl.description: BaseUrl tells MunkiReport where to find the MunkiReport server. It contains the full url to the server - and subdirectory - ending in a slash - /. Note: BaseUrl is set automatically when installing MunkiReport via the command line or a package.

Passphrase.title: Passphrase
Passphrase.description: If you have the MunkiReport server configured to use passphrases, you need to set these on the client to allow it to report in.

ReportItems.title: ReportItems
ReportItems.description: ReportItems contains a dictionary that tells MunkiReport where to look for the report files. The key is the name of the module, the value contains a path to the appropriate file. Note: ReportItems are set automatically when installing MunkiReport via the command line or a package.

UseMunkiAdditionalHttpHeaders.title: UseMunkiAdditionalHttpHeaders
UseMunkiAdditionalHttpHeaders.description: If the munki repository and MunkiReport are served from the same server, it may be necessary to use the headers set in munki.

scriptTimeOut.title: scriptTimeOut
scriptTimeOut.description: By default, MunkiReport kills a script if it takes longer than 10 seconds to run. You can override this behavior by adding the scriptTimeOut preference key. The entry should consist of an integer containing the number of seconds that a script can run.

com.1password.1password.title: 1Password 8
com.1password.1password.description: Use this section to define settings for 1Password password manager version 8

security.authenticatedUnlock.appleTouchI.title: Allow Biometric Unlock (Face ID & Touch ID)
security.authenticatedUnlock.appleTouchI.description: If present enforces whether biometric unlock is allowed (Preferences > Security > Unlock).

security.authenticatedUnlock.appleWatchU.title: Allow Apple Watch Unlock
security.authenticatedUnlock.appleWatchU.description: If present enforces whether Apple Watch unlock is allowed (Preferences > Security > Unlock).

security.autolock.minutes.title: Set auto-lock timeout
security.autolock.minutes.description: Enforces the lock on idle time preference (Preferences > Security > Lock).

security.autolock.onDeviceLock.title: Lock on sleep, screensaver, or switching users
security.autolock.onDeviceLock.description: Enforces the configured locked on sleep,screensaver, or switching users (Preferences > Security > Auto-lock).

security.autolock.onWindowClose.title: Lock when main window is closed
security.autolock.onWindowClose.description: Enforces the configured lock on app exit preference

security.clipboard.clearAfter.title: Clear clipboard after timeout
security.clipboard.clearAfter.description: The amount of time after copying a 1Password item that it is cleared from the clipboard (Preferences > Security > Clipboard).

security.deviceClipboardSharing.title: Allow Universal Clipboard
security.deviceClipboardSharing.description: Enforces whether the clear clipboard preference is enabled or disabled (Preferences > Security > Clear clipboard contents).

security.revealPasswords.title: Allow revealing passwords
security.revealPasswords.description: Enforces showing passwords and full credit card numbers (Preferences > Security > Conceal Fields).

AcceptedENX7.2EULA.title: Accept EndNote X7.2 / X8 EULA
AcceptedENX7.2EULA.description: Set to 1 to accept EndNote X7.2 and X8 EULA and hide the dialog from users.

AcceptedENX9EULA.title: Accept EndNote X9 EULA
AcceptedENX9EULA.description: Set to 1 to accept EndNote X9 EULA and hide the dialog from users.

IgnoredVersions.title: Suppress "Important Update" Messages
IgnoredVersions.description: Suppress "Important Update" messaging at first run. Correct value is the whole version number, e.g. 2019.7.24.0. Mulitple versions can be specified.

ShowGettingStartedX9.title: Show Getting Started
ShowGettingStartedX9.description: Set to 0 to disable EndNote Getting Started prompts.

com.agilebits.onepassword7.title: 1Password 7
com.agilebits.onepassword7.description: Use this section to define settings for 1Password password manager version 7

AutoInstallSoftwareUpdatesEnabled.title: Automatically Install Software Updates
AutoInstallSoftwareUpdatesEnabled.description: Should 1Password attempt to automatically install updates?

CheckForSoftwareUpdatesEnabled.title: Check for Software Updates
CheckForSoftwareUpdatesEnabled.description: Enforces whether to automatically check for available updates.

ConcealPasswords.title: Conceal Passwords
ConcealPasswords.description: Enforces the configured conceal passwords setting (Preferences > Security > Conceal Passwords).

LockOnIdle.title: Lock on Idle
LockOnIdle.description: Enforces whether the lock on idle preference is enabled or disabled (Preferences > Security > Lock after computer is idle).

LockOnMainAppExit.title: Lock on App Exit
LockOnMainAppExit.description: Enforces the configured lock on app exit preference (Preferences > Security > Lock when main window is closed).

LockOnScreenSaver.title: Lock on Screen Saver
LockOnScreenSaver.description: Enforces the configured lock on screen saver setting (Preferences > Security > Lock when screen saver is activated).

LockOnSleep.title: Lock on Sleep
LockOnSleep.description: Enforces the configured lock on sleep setting (Preferences > Security > Lock on sleep).

LockOnUserSwitch.title: Lock on User Switch
LockOnUserSwitch.description: Enforces the configured lock on user switch preference (Preferences > Security > Lock when fast user switching).

LockTimeout.title: Lock on Idle Time
LockTimeout.description: Enforces the lock on idle time preference (Preferences > Security > Lock after computer is idle).

OPPrefAppleWatchAllowed.title: Allow Apple Watch Unlock
OPPrefAppleWatchAllowed.description: If present enforces whether Apple Watch unlock is allowed (Preferences > Security > Unlock using ...).

OPPrefBiometryAllowed.title: Allow Biometric Unlock (Face ID & Touch ID)
OPPrefBiometryAllowed.description: If present enforces whether biometric unlock is allowed (Preferences > Security > Unlock using ...).

OPPrefMasterPasswordTimeoutInMinutesKey.title: Master Password Timeout
OPPrefMasterPasswordTimeoutInMinutesKey.description:
Enforces a configured master password timeout (Preferences > Security > Require Master Password every ...) if:

1) Biometric or Apple Watch unlock is possible based on the related preferences and the hardware configuration
2) The user has configured one of these unlock mechanisms

OPPrefPINAllowed.title: Allow PIN unlock
OPPrefPINAllowed.description: If present enforces whether PIN unlock is allowed.

OPPreferencesNotifyCompromisedWebsites.title: Check for Compromised Websites (Watchtower) Notification
OPPreferencesNotifyCompromisedWebsites.description: If enabled, creates a user notification when Watchtower detects a compromised website.

OPPreferencesNotifyOfTOTPCopy.title: One-Time Password Copied to Clipboard Notification
OPPreferencesNotifyOfTOTPCopy.description: If enabled, creates a user notification when a vault item's OTP code is copied to the clipboard.

OPPreferencesNotifyVaultAddedRemoved.title: Vault Access Added/Removed Notification
OPPreferencesNotifyVaultAddedRemoved.description: If enabled, creates a user notification when vault access is added or removed.

OPPreferencesWhatsNewDialogDisabled.title: What's New Prompt
OPPreferencesWhatsNewDialogDisabled.description: If enabled, on app launch following an update a What's New dialog box is presented to the user.

PasteboardClearTimeout.title: Clear Clipboard Time
PasteboardClearTimeout.description: Enforces the clear clipboard contents after X seconds preference (Preferences > Security > Clipboard)

settingClearPasteboardAfterTimeout.title: Clear Clipboard
settingClearPasteboardAfterTimeout.description: Enforces whether the clear clipboard preference is enabled or disabled (Preferences > Security > Clear clipboard contents).

com.alectrona.patch.title: Alectrona Patch Command Line Tool
com.alectrona.patch.description: Alectrona Patch Command Line Tool settings

License.title: License Key
License.description: Your license key provided upon subscription to Alectrona Patch.

ActiveIntervals.title: Active Intervals
ActiveIntervals.description: The Patch Agent will attempt to silently update any recently deferred app that exists in the InstallOrUpdate or UpdateOnly keys immediately after that app has been terminated by the user (even during an interval period). You can disable this behavior by setting to false.

DeferIfRunning.title: Defer If Running
DeferIfRunning.description: If an app is running when an update occurs, setting this key to true will suppress the update dialog and automatically perform a deferral.

InstallOrUpdate.title: Install Or Update
InstallOrUpdate.description: The software titles to automatically install or update (even if they are not currently installed) using the Patch Agent.

OtherManagedSoftware.title: Other Managed Software
OtherManagedSoftware.description: The software titles to enable the Active Intervals feature for even when not included in the InstallOrUpdate or UpdateOnly preference keys. These software titles might be updated using the patch command line tool in scripted workflows external to the Patch Agent.

ReconAfterInstall.title: Recon After Installs
ReconAfterInstall.description: Set to true to perform a Jamf Pro inventory update after a software title is installed or updated using the Patch Agent.

RemovePatchSymlink.title: Remove Patch Symlink
RemovePatchSymlink.description: Set to true to remove the symlink located at /usr/local/bin/patch. This will remove patch from the user's $PATH and allows for accessing the built-in BSD patch command (opens new window)without using it's full path. Note: When setting this key to true you will need to access the Patch CLT at it's full path (opens new window)in Terminal or custom scripts.

RunInterval.title: Run Interval
RunInterval.description: The Patch Agent runs every 4 hours by default. You can adjust this interval time for your environment. Note: This key is configured in seconds. The minimum setting is 600 seconds (10 minutes) and there is currently no maximum.

SkipFirstPatchAgentRun.title: Skip First Patch Agent Run
SkipFirstPatchAgentRun.description: When Alectrona Patch runs for the first time, it performs what is called a "Patch Agent Run" where it runs all configured installs/updates. You can skip the first Patch Agent Run by setting this key to true.

UpdateMAS.title: Update Mac App Store apps
UpdateMAS.description: Set to true to attempt to update and convert Mac App Store (MAS) apps to their non-MAS counterpart.

UpdateOnly.title: Update Only
UpdateOnly.description: The software titles to automatically update if installed and out-of-date using the Patch Agent.

ContentImagePath.title: Content Image Path
ContentImagePath.description: Path to a locally stored image to use as the content image of the update dialog (PNG/JPG/GIF/TIFF).

DeferButtonLabel.title: Defer Button Label
DeferButtonLabel.description: The label or displayed text in the defer button.

DeferralLimit.title: Deferral Limit
DeferralLimit.description: Sets a global Deferral Limit for all software.

DeferralLimitExceptions.title: Deferral Limit Exceptions
DeferralLimitExceptions.description: Sets exceptions to the global Deferral Limit, or irrespective of it.

Integer.title: Integer
Integer.description: Deferral limit for the specified Software ID.

Key.title: Key
Key.description: Software ID of the software title to include in the deferral limit exceptions.

DialogDeferralText.title: Dialog Deferral Text
DialogDeferralText.description: The text that appears below the main description in the update dialog.

DialogDescription.title: Dialog Description
DialogDescription.description: The main description that appears in the update dialog.

DialogHelpText.title: Dialog Help Text
DialogHelpText.description: Enable the help button and populate the text displayed on screen when clicked.

DialogHelpToolTip.title: Dialog Help Tool Tip
DialogHelpToolTip.description: Customizes the tooltip of the help button (when enabled).

DialogTimeout.title: Dialog Timeout
DialogTimeout.description: The duration, in seconds, that the update dialog will appear on screen before performing a timeout.

DialogTitle.title: Dialog Title
DialogTitle.description: The title of the update dialog window.

FinalDialogDescription.title: Final Dialog Description
FinalDialogDescription.description: The main description that appears in the final update dialog.

FinalDialogTimeout.title: Final Dialog Timeout
FinalDialogTimeout.description: The duration, in seconds, that the final update dialog will appear on screen before performing an update.

IgnoreDeferralText.title: Ignore Deferral Text
IgnoreDeferralText.description: Does not include the deferral text in the update dialog’s description.

RecordTimeoutAsDeferral.title: Record Timeout as Deferral
RecordTimeoutAsDeferral.description: When an update dialog timeout occurs, record a deferral rather than taking no action.

UpdateButtonLabel.title: Update Button Label
UpdateButtonLabel.description: The label or displayed text in the update button.

UpdateButtonPrimary.title: Update Button Primary
UpdateButtonPrimary.description: By default, the Update button is the primary button of the Update Dialog; meaning it responds to the Return key. Set this key to false if you wish to disable this behavior.

AllowAllAppsAccess.title: Allow access to all apps
AllowAllAppsAccess.description: Allow all apps to access the certificate in the keychain

CertServer.title: Certificate Server
CertServer.description: Fully qualified host name of the Active Directory issuing CA.

CertTemplate.title: Certificate Template
CertTemplate.description: The name of the certificate template as it appears in the General tab of the template's object in the Certificate Templates' Microsoft Management Console snap-in component. Usually Machine or User

CertificateAcquisitionMechanism.title: Acquisition Mechanism
CertificateAcquisitionMechanism.description: Most commonly RPC. If using Web enrollment, HTTP.

CertificateAuthority.title: Certificate Authority
CertificateAuthority.description: Name of the CA. This value is determined from the Common Name (CN) of the Active Directory entry: CN=(your CA name), CN='Certification Authorities', CN='Public Key Services', CN='Services', or CN='Configuration', (your base Domain Name).

CertificateRenewalTimeInterval.title: Certificate Expiration Notification Threshold
CertificateRenewalTimeInterval.description: The number of days before the certificate expires at which to start showing the expiration notification

Description.title: Description
Description.description: The description of the certificate request as shown in the certificate selector of other payloads such as VPN and Network

EnableAutoRenewal.title: Enable auto-renewal
EnableAutoRenewal.description: Allows the certificate to attempt an auto-renewal from the server.

KeyIsExtractable.title: Allow export from keychain
KeyIsExtractable.description: Allow admin to export private key from the keychain

Keysize.title: RSA Key Size
Keysize.description: The RSA key size for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR).

Password.title: Password
Password.description: The password with which to authenticate to the certificate server

PromptForCredentials.title: Prompt for credentials
PromptForCredentials.description: Prompt the user for credentials.  This setting is not supported for pushed profiles

UserName.title: User name
UserName.description: The user name with which to authenticate to the certificate server

AIMAccountDescription.title: Account description
AIMAccountDescription.description: The display name for the account.

AIMAuthentication.title: Authentication Type
AIMAuthentication.description: The authentication method for the server.

AIMHostName.title: Hostname
AIMHostName.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the server.

AIMPort.title: Port
AIMPort.description: The port on which to connect to the server.

AIMUseSSL.title: Use SSL
AIMUseSSL.description: Enable Secure Socket Layer for this connection.

AIMUserName.title: Account name
AIMUserName.description: The chat name of the user.

allowApplePersonalizedAdvertising.title: Allow Personalized Advertising
allowApplePersonalizedAdvertising.description: Disabling ad tracking ensures that applications and advertisers are unable to track users’ interests and deliver targeted advertisements.

forceLimitAdTracking.title: Force Limiting Ad Tracking
forceLimitAdTracking.description: Enabling this opts out of receiving ads targeted to interests in Apple Apps and macOS devices. May still receive the same number of ads, but the ads may be less relevant.

AllowCacheDelete.title: Allow Cache Delete
AllowCacheDelete.description: Automatically remove content from the cache when the system needs disk space for other apps.

AllowPersonalCaching.title: Allow Personal iCloud Data Caching
AllowPersonalCaching.description: Clients may take some time (hours, days) to react to changes to this setting; it does not have an immediate effect. At least one of the AllowPersonalCaching or AllowSharedCaching keys must be true. Data includes documents and photos, among others.

AllowSharedCaching.title: Allow non-iCloud Data Caching
AllowSharedCaching.description: Clients may take some time (hours, days) to react to changes to this setting; it does not have an immediate effect. At least one of the AllowPersonalCaching or AllowSharedCaching keys must be true. Data includes apps and software updates.

AutoActivation.title: Automatically activate content caching
AutoActivation.description: Users can't turn off the content caching service.

AutoEnableTetheredCaching.title: Automatically activate Internet connection sharing
AutoEnableTetheredCaching.description: Requires you to allow sharing the computer's Internet connection and cached content with iOS devices connected using USB.

CacheLimit.title: Maximum Cache Size
CacheLimit.description: The maximum number of bytes of disk space that will be used for the content cache. The value of zero allows unlimited space.

DataPath.title: Data Path
DataPath.description: The path to the directory used to store cached content. Changing this setting manually doesn't automatically move cached content from the old to the new location. To move content automatically, use Content Caching preferences. You can also set this value in Content Caching preferences.

DenyTetheredCaching.title: Disable Caching Over Shared Internet Connection
DenyTetheredCaching.description: Share this computer's Internet connection and cached content with iOS devices connected using USB.

DisplayAlerts.title: Display Content Caching Alerts
DisplayAlerts.description: Display Content Caching alerts as notifications.

KeepAwake.title: Keep Awake for Content Caching
KeepAwake.description: Prevent the computer from sleeping while caching is on.

ListenRanges.title: Client Listen Ranges
ListenRanges.description: A range of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses to restrict clients to.

ListenRangesOnly.title: Restrict To Client Listen Ranges
ListenRangesOnly.description: Provide content only to the clients specified by the listen ranges.

LocalSubnetsOnly.title: Restrict Clients To Local Network
LocalSubnetsOnly.description: Content Cache offers content to clients only on the same immediate local network.

LogClientIdentity.title: Log Client Details
LogClientIdentity.description: Log the IP address and port number of clients that request content.

ParentSelectionPolicy.title: Parent Selection Policy
ParentSelectionPolicy.description: The policy to use when choosing among more than one configured parent content cache.

Parents.title: Parents IP Addresses
Parents.description: A list of the local IP addresses of other content caches from which this cache should download or upload content instead of downloading from or uploading to Apple directly.

PeerFilterRanges.title: Peer Filter Ranges
PeerFilterRanges.description: A range of peer IP addresses that the Content Cache will use to filter its list of peers to query for content.

PeerListenRanges.title: Peer Listen Ranges
PeerListenRanges.description: A range of peer IP addresses the Content Cache will respond to peer cache queries from.

PeerLocalSubnetsOnly.title: Restrict Peers To Local Network
PeerLocalSubnetsOnly.description: Content Cache will only peer with other Content Caches on the same immediate local network, rather than with Content Caches that use the same public IP address as the device.

Port.title: Port
Port.description: TCP port on which the content caching service accepts requests for uploads or downloads. Set to 0 to pick a random port.

PublicRanges.title: Public Ranges
PublicRanges.description: A range of public IP addresses that the cloud servers should use for matching clients to Content Caches.

FFCheckedUpgrade.title: Upgrade Checked
FFCheckedUpgrade.description: Suppresses the popup to upgrade Compressor on first run.

LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Whats New displayed
LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Whats New screen on the selected versions of Compressor.

ADAllowMultiDomainAuth.title: Allow authentication from any domain in the forest
ADAllowMultiDomainAuth.description: Allow authentication from any domain in the forest.

ADDomainAdminGroupList.title: Allow administration by specified Active Directory groups.
ADDomainAdminGroupList.description: Allow administration by specified Active Directory groups.

ADForceHomeLocal.title: Force local home directory on startup disk
ADForceHomeLocal.description: Force local home directory on startup disk.

ADMountStyle.title: Mount Style
ADMountStyle.description: Network protocol to be used to mount home directory.

ADNamespace.title: Set primary user account naming convention: "forest" or "domain"
ADNamespace.description: Set primary user account naming convention: "forest" or "domain".

ADOrganizationalUnit.title: Organizational Unit
ADOrganizationalUnit.description: The organizational unit (OU) where the joining computer object is added.

ADRestrictDDNS.title: Restrict DDNS on interfaces
ADRestrictDDNS.description: Restrict Dynamic DNS updates to the specified interfaces (e.g. en0, en1, etc).

ADTrustChangePassIntervalDays.title: Password trust interval
ADTrustChangePassIntervalDays.description: How often to change computer trust account password in days.

ADUseWindowsUNCPath.title: Use UNC path for network home location
ADUseWindowsUNCPath.description: Use UNC path from Active Directory to derive network home location

ADWarnUserBeforeCreatingMA.title: Require confirmation before creating mobile account
ADWarnUserBeforeCreatingMA.description: Require confirmation before creating mobile account.

HostName.title: Server Hostname
HostName.description: The hostname of the directory server.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: Password of the account used to join the domain.

UserName.title: User name
UserName.description: User name of the account used to join the domain.

BurnSupport.title: Enable Disc Burning
BurnSupport.description:
• Set to off to disable disc burning.
• Set to on for normal default operation.
• Set to authenticate to require authentication.
Setting this key to on will not enable disc burn support if it has already been disabled by other mechanisms or preferences.

adRealm.title: Active Directory Realm
adRealm.description: The host name of your organization's Active Directory domain.

checkForNetworkServer.title: Network Server
checkForNetworkServer.description: The host Enterprise Connect should check for when connecting.

checkForNetworkType.title: Check For Network Server
checkForNetworkType.description: Check for a host in your organization's network.

checkShowLegacyCertificates.title: Show Legacy Certificates
checkShowLegacyCertificates.description: Automatically check the "Show Legacy Certificates" option in the certificate chooser window.

connectDelay.title: Connect Delay
connectDelay.description: Delay starting the connection process when your organization's network is detected. This may be useful for customers who use Cisco NAC and need to delay connection while host checks are performed.

connectReminderNagInterval.title: Connection Reminder Interval
connectReminderNagInterval.description: The interval, in seconds, between connection reminders.

connectionCompletedScriptPath.title: Connection Completed Script Path
connectionCompletedScriptPath.description: Path to the connection completed script.

dailyReconnectTime.title: Daily Reconnect Time
dailyReconnectTime.description: The interval, in seconds, that Enterprise Connect should attempt its daily reconnect. Set this to 0 to disable the daily reconnect.

destroyKerbTicketUponCardRemoval.title: Destroy Kerberos Ticket on Smart Card Removal

disablePasswordExpirationChecking.title: Disable Password Expiration Checking
disablePasswordExpirationChecking.description: Disable Enterprise Connect's password expiration checking, but still leave intact the ability for the user to change their password with Enterprise Connect.

disablePasswordFunctions.title: Disable Password Functions
disablePasswordFunctions.description: Disable Enterprise Connect's password management abilities, including expiration notices and the "Change Password" menu item. This is useful for customers who don't change their passwords in AD.

disableQuitMenu.title: Disable Quit Menu
disableQuitMenu.description: Disables the Quit menu item from Enterprise Connect.

launchAtLogin.title: Launch At Login
launchAtLogin.description: Determines if Enterprise Connect should set itself as a login item.

managedshares.title: Managed Shares
managedshares.description: List of shares that Enterprise Connect should attempt to mount. Users will still be able to add their own shares.

mountNetworkHomeDirectory.title: Mount Network Home Directory
mountNetworkHomeDirectory.description: Determines if Enterprise Connect mounts the user's network home directory.

orgLogoPath.title: Organization Logo Path
orgLogoPath.description: The path to a file containing your organization's logo, in PNG, JPG or GIF format.

orgUsernameLabel.title: Organization Username Label
orgUsernameLabel.description: The name your organization gives usernames.

passwordChangeScriptPath.title: Password Change Script Path
passwordChangeScriptPath.description: Path to the password change script.

passwordChangeURL.title: Password Change URL
passwordChangeURL.description: URL to open in the user's default web browser when they use Enterprise Connect to change their password. Standard password change functionality will no longer work.

passwordExpireOverride.title: Password Expire Override
passwordExpireOverride.description: Override domain password policy when calculating password expiration.

passwordNotificationDays.title: Password Expire Notification
passwordNotificationDays.description: Determines the amount of days before password expiration that the user receives expiration notifications.

pfc_preventUserShares.title: Prevent User Shares
pfc_preventUserShares.description: Prevents the user from adding custom shares to Enterprise Connect.

preferredDC.title: Preferred Domain Controller
preferredDC.description: Preferred domain controller when doing LDAP queries and getting a Kerberos TGT. If this domain controller is unavailable, Enterprise Connect will fall back to domain controllers it discovers from DNS.

prepopulatedUsername.title: Pre Populated Username
prepopulatedUsername.description: Upon launch or sign out, Enterprise Connect will pre-populate the Username field with this username.

pwReqComplexity.title: Password Required Complexity
pwReqComplexity.description: Tells Enterprise Connect that passwords should meet Active Directory's definition of complexity. Used to enable and configure live password testing.

pwReqComplexityDisableUnicode.title: Password Required Complexity Disable Unicode
pwReqComplexityDisableUnicode.description: Disables the "Has a Unicode character" password test from live password testing.

pwReqHistoryCount.title: Password History Count
pwReqHistoryCount.description: How many previous passwords cannot be re-used.

pwReqLength.title: Password Required Length
pwReqLength.description: Require passwords to be at least as long as the specified value.

pwReqMinimumPasswordAge.title: Password Minimum Age
pwReqMinimumPasswordAge.description: The minimum age of passwords before they can be changed.

pwReqText.title: Password Change Message Path
pwReqText.description: Path to a RTF file to display for the user during password changes.

runAuditScript.title: Run Audit Script
runAuditScript.description: Tells Enterprise Connect to execute an audit script.

runPasswordChangeScriptOnLocalPasswordSy.title: Run Password Change Script On Local Password Sync
runPasswordChangeScriptOnLocalPasswordSy.description: Determines if Enterprise Connect should run the password change script upon a local password sync.

runPeriodicStateCheck.title: Run Periodic State Check
runPeriodicStateCheck.description: Enable or Disable periodic state checking. Customers who expose their DNS to the public Internet will need to disable periodic state checking.

setupReminderNagInterval.title: Reminder Nag Interval
setupReminderNagInterval.description: The interval, in seconds, between setup notifications.

shareMountWaitSeconds.title: Share Mount Delay
shareMountWaitSeconds.description: Delay the mounting of network shares when your organization's network is detected. This may be useful for customers who use Cisco NAC and need to delay connection while host checks are performed.

shares.title: Shares
shares.description: List of shares that Enterprise Connect should attempt to mount.

showKeychainIdentities.title: Show Keychain Identities
showKeychainIdentities.description: Automatically check the "Show Legacy Certificates" option in the certificate chooser window.

showMenuExtra.title: Show Menu Extra
showMenuExtra.description: Determines whether the Enterprise Connect menu extra is loaded.

showUsernameWithSmartcard.title: Show Username in Smart Card Mode
showUsernameWithSmartcard.description: Determines if Enterprise Connect should display the username field if smart card mode is enabled.

smartCardMode.title: Enable Smart Card Mode
smartCardMode.description: Determines whether smart card mode should be enabled.

syncLocalPassword.title: Sync Local Password
syncLocalPassword.description: Enables Active Directory to local account password sync. This only works if the user is logged into their Mac with a local account.

LKWelcomeDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Welcome displayed
LKWelcomeDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Welcome screen on the selected versions of Final Cut Pro.

LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Whats New displayed
LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Whats New screen on the selected versions of Final Cut Pro.

com.apple.MCX.title: Wi-Fi Managed Settings
com.apple.MCX.description: Use this section to define managed Wi-Fi settings

RequireAdminForAirPortNetworkChange.title: Require Admin Credentials for Wi-Fi Network Change
RequireAdminForAirPortNetworkChange.description: If true, requires administrator authorization for network changes.

RequireAdminForIBSS.title: Require Admin Credentials for IBSS
RequireAdminForIBSS.description: If true, requires administrator authorization to enable IBSS.

RequireAdminToTurnAirPortOnOff.title: Require Admin Credentials for Wi-Fi Power
RequireAdminToTurnAirPortOnOff.description: If true, requires administrator authorization to turn Wi-Fi on or off.

com.apple.MCX.FileVault2.title: FileVault 2
com.apple.MCX.FileVault2.description: Use this section to define settings for FileVault 2

Certificate.title: Certificate
Certificate.description: DER-encoded certificate data if an institutional recovery key will be added.

Defer.title: Defer enabling until logout
Defer.description: Defer enabling FileVault until the designated user logs out. For details, see fdesetup(8). The person enabling FileVault must be either a local user or a mobile account user.

DeferDontAskAtUserLogout.title: Dont ask at logout
DeferDontAskAtUserLogout.description: When using the Defer option, set this key to true to not request enabling FileVault at user logout time.

DeferForceAtUserLoginMaxBypassAttempts.title: Maximum number of times FileVault can be skipped
DeferForceAtUserLoginMaxBypassAttempts.description: When using the Defer option you can optionally set this key to the maximum number of times the user can bypass enabling FileVault before it will require that it be enabled before the user can log in. If set to 0, it will always prompt to enable FileVault until it is enabled, though it will allow you to bypass enabling it. Setting this key to –1 will disable this feature.

Enable.title: Enable FileVault 2
Enable.description: Set to 'On' to enable FileVault. Set to 'Off' to disable FileVault.

ForceEnableInSetupAssistant.title: ForceEnableInSetupAssistant
ForceEnableInSetupAssistant.description:
If 'true', and this payload is installed after enrolling with MDM in Setup Assistant, it requests Setup Assistant to enable FileVault at setup time. In this case, the system also ignores all other keys in this payload, except for 'ShowRecoveryKey'.
To use this, enable the Await Device Configured DEP configuration option, send this profile with this key set, before sending the DeviceConfiguredCommand.

OutputPath.title: Recovery key path
OutputPath.description: Path to the location where the recovery key and computer information plist will be stored.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: User password of the Open Directory user that will be added to FileVault. Use the UserEntersMissingInfo key if you want to prompt for this information.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Recovery Key Certificate Payload
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the payload containing the asymmetric recovery key certificate payload.

ShowRecoveryKey.title: Show the personal recovery key
ShowRecoveryKey.description: Set to false to not display the personal recovery key to the user after FileVault is enabled.

UseKeychain.title: Add institutional recovery key to keychain
UseKeychain.description: If set to true and no certificate information is provided in this payload, the keychain already created at /Library/Keychains/FileVaultMaster.keychain will be used when the institutional recovery key is added.

UseRecoveryKey.title: Create a personal recovery key
UseRecoveryKey.description: Set to true to create a personal recovery key.

UserEntersMissingInfo.title: User enters username and password
UserEntersMissingInfo.description: Set to true for manual profile installs to prompt for missing user name or password fields.

Username.title: Username
Username.description: User name of the Open Directory user that will be added to FileVault.

BackupAllVolumes.title: Backup all volumes
BackupAllVolumes.description: Only startup volume is backed up by default.

BackupDestURL.title: Backup Destination
BackupDestURL.description: URL of the backup destination. (e.g., smb://server.example.com/backups/)

BackupSizeMB.title: Backup size limit
BackupSizeMB.description: Enter a limit in MB for the size of the backup. Set to 0 for unlimited.

BackupSkipSys.title: Back up system files and folders
BackupSkipSys.description: System files and folders are skipped by default.

MobileBackups.title: Enable local snapshots
MobileBackups.description: Creates local backup snapshots if the backup destination is offline.

SkipPaths.title: Paths to skip
SkipPaths.description: Enter additional volumes and locations to exclude from the backup.

com.apple.NSExtension.title: Extensions
com.apple.NSExtension.description: Use the Extensions payload to control which extensions can be used with macOS.

AllowedExtensions.title: Allowed extensions
AllowedExtensions.description: Add the bundle identifier for each extension allowed to run on the Mac. Any extensions not listed are unable to run.

DeniedExtensions.title: Disallowed extensions
DeniedExtensions.description: Disallow specific extensions by their bundle identifier.

AskBeforeSubmittingInsecureForms.title: Ask Before Submitting Insecure Forms
AskBeforeSubmittingInsecureForms.description: Display a confirmation alert when an insecure form is submitted from a secure site

AutoFillCreditCardData.title: AutoFill Credit Cards
AutoFillCreditCardData.description: Autofill credit cards in web forms.

AutoFillFromAddressBook.title: AutoFill web forms from contacts
AutoFillFromAddressBook.description: Autofill web forms using info from Contacts.

AutoFillMiscellaneousForms.title: AutoFill Miscellaneous Forms
AutoFillMiscellaneousForms.description: Autofill web forms using previously-typed text.

AutoFillPasswords.title: AutoFill Passwords
AutoFillPasswords.description: Autofill user names and passwords in web forms.

AutoOpenSafeDownloads.title: Open Safe Downloads Automatically
AutoOpenSafeDownloads.description: Automatically open downloaded files that are of certain well-known safe types.

BlockStoragePolicy.title: Block cookies and other website data
BlockStoragePolicy.description: Policy for blocking cookies and other website data.

BookmarksCollectionsIncludeAddressBook.title: Bookmarks Collections Include Contacts
BookmarksCollectionsIncludeAddressBook.description: Include the Contacts bookmarks in the Collections column of the bookmarks view.

BookmarksCollectionsIncludeRendezvous.title: Bookmarks Collections Include Bonjour
BookmarksCollectionsIncludeRendezvous.description: Include the Bonjour bookmarks in the Collections column of the bookmarks view.

BookmarksMenuIncludesAddressBook.title: Bookmarks Menu Includes Contacts
BookmarksMenuIncludesAddressBook.description: Include the Contacts bookmarks in the bookmarks menu.

BookmarksMenuIncludesBookmarksToolbar.title: Bookmarks Menu Includes Bookmarks Bar
BookmarksMenuIncludesBookmarksToolbar.description: Include the Bookmarks Bar bookmarks in the bookmarks menu.

BookmarksMenuIncludesRendezvous.title: Bookmarks Menu Includes Bonjour
BookmarksMenuIncludesRendezvous.description: Include the Bonjour bookmarks in the bookmarks menu.

CanPromptForPushNotifications.title: Allow Notifications
CanPromptForPushNotifications.description: Allow websites to request permission to send notifications

CommandClickMakesTabs.title: ⌘-click opens a link in a new tab
CommandClickMakesTabs.description: Open command-clicked links in a new tab rather than a new window.

ConfirmClosingMultiplePages.title: Confirm Closing Multiple Pages
ConfirmClosingMultiplePages.description: Display a confirmation alert when multiple pages are closed at once.

DefaultBrowserPromptingState2.title: Suppress Default Web Browser Prompt
DefaultBrowserPromptingState2.description: When Safari is quit for the first time, if it detects it is not configured as the default browser it will present a prompt to the user to choose whether to keep the current default browser or change it to Safari. Enable this preference to suppress this prompt.

DefaultBrowserPromptingState3.title: Suppress Default Web Browser Banner
DefaultBrowserPromptingState3.description: Suppresses the "Make Safari your Default Browser?" banner when Safari is launched and is not already set as the default browser.

DefaultDatabaseQuota.title: Default Space for Database Storage
DefaultDatabaseQuota.description: Default space reserved for database storage.

DidDisableIndividualExtensionsAfterRemov.title: Disable Extensions Immediately
DidDisableIndividualExtensionsAfterRemov.description: Necessary for extensions to be disabled from first launch

DidShowWhatsNewInSafari.title: Hide What's New in Safari Prompt
DidShowWhatsNewInSafari.description: If enabled, hides any What's New with Safari prompts.

DownloadsClearingPolicy.title: Downloads Clearing Policy
DownloadsClearingPolicy.description: Policy for when to remove items from the Downloads window.

DownloadsPath.title: Downloads Location
DownloadsPath.description: File system path (can start with ~) where downloaded files will be saved.

ExtensionsEnabled.title: Enable Extensions
ExtensionsEnabled.description: Allow extensions from the App Store to be enabled/disabled. This will only apply after Safari's first launch unless the "Disable Extensions Immediately" key is also set

HistoryAgeInDaysLimit.title: History Age Limit
HistoryAgeInDaysLimit.description: Policy for when to automatically remove items from History.

IncludeDevelopMenu.title: Show Develop menu in menu bar
IncludeDevelopMenu.description: Include the Develop menu in the menu bar.

OpenNewTabsInFront.title: When a new tab or window opens, make it active
OpenNewTabsInFront.description: Select a tab when it is created.

PrintHeadersAndFooters.title: Print Headers and Footers
PrintHeadersAndFooters.description: Print the URL, date, page title, and page number in headers and footers.

TabCreationPolicy.title: Open pages in tabs instead of windows
TabCreationPolicy.description: Policy for when to create a tab instead of a window.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Default Fixed-width Font Size
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: The font size used when a webpage specifies a fixed-width font.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Default Font Size
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: The font size used when a webpage does not specify a font size.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Default Text Encoding
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: The name of the text encoding to use for webpages that don't specify a text encoding. See http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Default Fixed-width Font
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: The font family used when a webpage specifies a fixed-width font.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Allow JavaScript to Open Windows Automatically
Display Images
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: Load and display images when a webpage is loaded.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Minimum Font Size
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: Minimum font size used for any webpage text.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Private Browsing
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: Prevent Safari from keeping track of most user activities.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Default Font
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: The font family used when a webpage does not specify a font.

com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.title: Press Tab to highlight each item on a webpage
com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentif.description: Highlight links and form controls as you press the Tab key.

ShowDevelopMenu.title: Show Develop Menu
ShowDevelopMenu.description: If enabled, displays the 'Develop' menu bar item (Preferences > Advanced > Show Develop).

SkipAppearance.title: Skip Appearance window
SkipAppearance.description: Skips the Choose Your Look window.

SkipCloudSetup.title: Skip iCloud
SkipCloudSetup.description: Skips the Apple ID setup window.

SkipSetupItems.title: iOS Skip Items
SkipSetupItems.description: List of setup items to skip

SkipTrueTone.title: Skip True Tone Display window
SkipTrueTone.description: Skips the True Tone Display window.

SkipUnlockWithWatch.title: Skip Unlock with Apple Watch
SkipUnlockWithWatch.description: Skips the Unlock with Apple Watch setup window.

SkipWallpaper.title: Skip Wallpaper
SkipWallpaper.description: If 'true', the system skips the Wallpaper selection window.

AllowPreReleaseInstallation.title: Allow installation of macOS beta releases

AutomaticDownload.title: Download newly available updates in the background

AutomaticallyInstallAppUpdates.title: Automatically install App Store app updates

CatalogURL.title: Catalog URL
CatalogURL.description: Specify a URL of the desired software update catalog in the form of http://server.example.com:8088/index.sucatalog

ConfigDataInstall.title: Install XProtect, MRT, & Gatekeeper updates automatically

CriticalUpdateInstall.title: Install security updates automatically
CriticalUpdateInstall.description: These are not regular security updates. An example is the OS X NTP Security Update 1.0 update.

ManagedDeferredInstallDelay.title: Update Delay
ManagedDeferredInstallDelay.description: The duration that software updates will be delayed.

SUDisableEVCheck.title: Disable Extended Validation check of TLS certificate.
SUDisableEVCheck.description: This option was needed during Mojave betas which required https.

forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.title: Force Update Delay
forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.description: Software updates will be delayed by the duration defined by ManagedDeferredInstallDelay.

restrict-software-update-require-admin-t.title: Restrict app installations to admin users
restrict-software-update-require-admin-t.description: This key has the same function as the key restrict-store-require-admin-to-install in the com.apple.appstore payload.

orderedItems.title: orderedItems
orderedItems.description: Add each Spotlight search item in the order you want them to be displayed in Spotlight. As these items are all contained in a single array, to manage any single item each individual Spotlight search category needs to be added below.  You may need to logout after installing the profile to verify the results.

enabled.title: enabled
enabled.description: Set this preference to 'false' to disable the applicable Spotlight search option.

com.apple.SubmitDiagInfo.title: Submit Diagnostic Information
com.apple.SubmitDiagInfo.description: Use this section to define settings for Submit Diagnostic Information

AutoSubmit.title: Automatically Submit Diagnostic Information
AutoSubmit.description: Configures the automatic submission of diagnostic information to Apple.

ExceptionsList.title: Exceptions
ExceptionsList.description: Bypass proxy settings for these Hosts & Domains.

FTPPort.title: FTP Proxy Port
FTPPort.description: The port on which to connect to the ftp proxy server.

FTPProxy.title: FTP Proxy Hostname
FTPProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the ftp proxy server.

FallBackAllowed.title: Allow Proxy PAC Fallback
FallBackAllowed.description: Enables fallback when set to 1. The default value is 1, except for managed devices whose default is 0.

GopherPort.title: Gopher Proxy Port
GopherPort.description: The port on which to connect to the gopher proxy server.

GopherProxy.title: Gopher Proxy Hostname
GopherProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the gopher proxy server.

HTTPPort.title: HTTP Proxy Port
HTTPPort.description: The port on which to connect to the http proxy server.

HTTPProxy.title: HTTP Proxy Hostname
HTTPProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the http proxy server.

HTTPSPort.title: HTTPS Proxy Port
HTTPSPort.description: The port on which to connect to the https proxy server.

HTTPSProxy.title: HTTPS Proxy Hostname
HTTPSProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the https proxy server.

ProxyAutoConfigEnable.title: Enable Automatic Proxy Configuration
ProxyAutoConfigEnable.description: Enable the use of a Proxy AutoConfig file.

ProxyAutoConfigURLString.title: Automatic Proxy Configuration URL
ProxyAutoConfigURLString.description: URL to the Automatic Proxy Configuration file.

ProxyCaptiveLoginAllowed.title: Allow Proxy Bypass for Captive Portal Logins
ProxyCaptiveLoginAllowed.description: Allow the device to bypass the proxy server to display the login page for captive networks.

RTSPPort.title: RTSP Proxy Port
RTSPPort.description: The port on which to connect to the rtsp proxy server.

RTSPProxy.title: RTSP Proxy Hostname
RTSPProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the rtsp proxy server.

SOCKSPortInteger.title: SOCKS Proxy Port
SOCKSPortInteger.description: The port on which to connect to the socks proxy server.

SOCKSProxy.title: SOCKS Proxy Hostname
SOCKSProxy.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the socks proxy server.

com.apple.TCC.configuration-profile-poli.title: Privacy Preferences Policy Control
com.apple.TCC.configuration-profile-poli.description: Configures Privacy Preferences Policy Control settings

Services.description: Keys are limited to the privacy service names listed below. Each key is an array of dictionaries describing the app or process to which access is given. In the case of conflicting specifications, the most restrictive setting (deny) will be used.

SystemPolicyAppData.title: SystemPolicyAppData
SystemPolicyAppData.description: Allows the application to access data of other apps.

AEReceiverCodeRequirement.title: AEReceiverCodeRequirement
AEReceiverCodeRequirement.description: The code requirement for the receiving binary. This code requirement is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.

AEReceiverIdentifier.title: AEReceiverIdentifier
AEReceiverIdentifier.description: The identifier of the process receiving an AppleEvent sent by the Identifier process. This identifier is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.

AEReceiverIdentifierType.title: AEReceiverIdentifierType
AEReceiverIdentifierType.description: The type of AEReceiverIdentifier value, either 'bundleID' or 'path'. This setting is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.

Allowed.title: Allowed
Allowed.description: If 'true', access is granted; otherwise, the process doesn't have access. The user isn't prompted and can't change this value.

Authorization.title: Authorization
Authorization.description:
The 'Authorization' key is an optional replacement for the 'Allowed' key. Every payload must specify either 'Authorization' or 'Allowed', but not both.
'Allow': Equivalent to a 'true' value for the 'Allowed' key.
'Deny': Equivalent to a 'false' value for the 'Allowed' key.
'AllowStandardUserToSetSystemService:' allows a standard (non-admin) user to configure the permissions for the specified app in the Privacy preferences for services that otherwise require admin authorization. 'AllowStandardUserToSetSystemService' is only valid for the 'ListenEvent' and 'ScreenCapture' services.
Available in macOS 11 and later.

CodeRequirement.title: CodeRequirement
CodeRequirement.description: Obtained via the command ''codesign -display -r -''.

Identifier.description: The bundle ID or installation path of the binary.

IdentifierType.title: IdentifierType
IdentifierType.description: The type of identifier value. Application bundles must be identified by bundle ID. Nonbundled binaries must be identified by installation path. Helper tools embedded within an application bundle automatically inherit the permissions of their enclosing app bundle.
