AddExtensionToNewPlainTextFiles.title: AddExtensionToNewPlainTextFiles
AddExtensionToNewPlainTextFiles.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable adding the ".txt" extension to plain text files.

CheckGrammarWithSpelling.title: CheckGrammarWithSpelling
CheckGrammarWithSpelling.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable grammar checking with spelling.

CheckSpellingWhileTyping.title: CheckSpellingWhileTyping
CheckSpellingWhileTyping.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable spell checking while typing.

CorrectSpellingAutomatically.title: CorrectSpellingAutomatically
CorrectSpellingAutomatically.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable automatic spelling correction.

DataDetectors.title: DataDetectors
DataDetectors.description: Set this preference to 'true' to forcibly enable data detectors. Data detectors can automatically detect date, time, and contact information, which can then be used to update a contact, create a new Calendar event, and more.

HeightInChars.title: HeightInChars
HeightInChars.description: By default, the Window Size height is 30 lines. Enable this setting to change this default window height.

IgnoreHTML.title: IgnoreHTML
IgnoreHTML.description: Set this preference to 'true' to display .html files as HTML code instead of formatted text when opening a file.

IgnoreRichText.title: IgnoreRichText
IgnoreRichText.description: Set this preference to 'true' to display .rtf files as RTF code instead of formatted text when opening a file.

NSDocumentSuppressTempVersionStoreWarnin.title: NSDocumentSuppressTempVersionStoreWarning
NSDocumentSuppressTempVersionStoreWarnin.description: Set this preference to 'false' to suppress TextEdit messages when closing documents saved on storage volumes that don't support Apple's permanent version storage. This will not inform users about being unable to access these older versions via Time Machine.

NSFixedPitchFont.title: Plain Text Font
NSFixedPitchFont.description:
Enter the name of the desired plain text font.  This defaults to Menlo.

String format: Find your desired font file in either /System/Library/Fonts or /Library/Fonts. Whatever the name of this font file is is exactly what needs to be entered for the font name. Additionally, if you desire to use a font typeset that is not the default - Plain, Regular, etc. - , you can specify this by adding the name of the typeset to end of the font name string with a hyphen inbetween.

Ex. AlBayan-Bold
Ex. AmericanTypewriter-Condensed
Ex. ArialMT

NSFixedPitchFontSize.title: Plain Text Font Size
NSFixedPitchFontSize.description: Enter the desired font size for plain text documents.

NSFont.title: Rich Text Font
NSFont.description:
Enter the name of the desired rich text font. This defaults to Helvetica.

String format: Find your desired font file in either /System/Library/Fonts or /Library/Fonts. Whatever the name of this font file is is exactly what needs to be entered for the font name. Additionally, if you desire to use a font typeset that is not the default - Plain, Regular, etc. - , you can specify this by adding the name of the typeset to end of the font name string with a hyphen inbetween.

Ex. AlBayan-Bold
Ex. AmericanTypewriter-Condensed
Ex. ArialMT

NSFontSize.title: Rich Text Font Size
NSFontSize.description: Enter the desired font size for rich text documents.

PlainTextEncoding.title: PlainTextEncoding
PlainTextEncoding.description: Set this preference to choose a specific encoding method for opening plain text files, rather than "Automatic".

PlainTextEncodingForWrite.title: PlainTextEncodingForWrite
PlainTextEncodingForWrite.description: Set this preference to choose a specific encoding method for saving plain text files, rather than "Automatic".

PreserveDocumentWhitespace.title: PreserveDocumentWhitespace
PreserveDocumentWhitespace.description: Set this preference to 'false' to not include code that preserves the white space in your document's formatted text.

RichText.title: Text Default File Format
RichText.description: Enable this preference to forcibly apply a default TextEdit file format. By default, TextEdit defaults to rich text - .rtf -, rather than plain text - .txt

ShowPageBreaks.title: ShowPageBreaks
ShowPageBreaks.description: Set this preference to 'true' to forcibly make text wrap to document margins, rather than window boundaries.

ShowRuler.title: ShowRuler
ShowRuler.description: Set this preference to 'false' to not show the ruler in rich text documents by default.

SmartCopyPaste.title: SmartCopyPaste
SmartCopyPaste.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable "smart" copy/paste.

SmartLinks.title: SmartLinks
SmartLinks.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable "smart" links.

SmartQuotes.title: SmartQuotes
SmartQuotes.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable "smart" quotes.

SmartSubstitutionsEnabledInRichTextOnly.title: SmartSubstitutionsEnabledInRichTextOnly
SmartSubstitutionsEnabledInRichTextOnly.description: Set this preference to 'true' to enable "smart" substitutions for quotes and dashes in rich text documents.  Takes effect for newly opened documents and after "Make Plain Text".

TextReplacement.title: TextReplacement
TextReplacement.description: Set this preference to 'false' to forcibly disable text replacement.

UseEmbeddedCSS.title: UseEmbeddedCSS
UseEmbeddedCSS.description:
Enable this setting for HTML Embedded CSS styling.

ex. UseEmbeddedCSS = true == "Embedded CSS"
ex. UseEmbeddedCSS = true & UseInlineCSS = false == "Embedded CSS"
ex. UseEmbeddedCSS = false & UseInlineCSS = false == "No CSS"

UseInlineCSS.title: UseInlineCSS
UseInlineCSS.description:
Enable this setting for HTML Inline CSS styling.

ex. UseInlineCSS = true == "Inline CSS"
ex. UseInlineCSS = true & UseEmbeddedCSS = false == "Inline CSS"
ex. UseInlineCSS = false & UseEmbeddedCSS = false == "No CSS"

UseTransitionalDocType.title: UseTransitionalDocType
UseTransitionalDocType.description:
Set this preference to 'false' to use the "Strict" HTML or XHTML document type, rather than "Transitional".

ex. UseTransiontalDocType = false & UseXHTMLDocType = false == "HTML Strict"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = false & UseXHTMLDocType = true == "XHTML Strict"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = true & UseXHTMLDocType = false == "HTML Transitional"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = true & UseXHTMLDocType = true == "XHTML Transitional"

UseXHTMLDocType.title: UseXHTMLDocType
UseXHTMLDocType.description:
Set this preference to 'false' to use the HTML, rather than the XHTML document type.

ex. UseTransiontalDocType = false & UseXHTMLDocType = false == "HTML Strict"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = false & UseXHTMLDocType = true == "XHTML Strict"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = true & UseXHTMLDocType = false == "HTML Transitional"
ex. UseTransiontalDocType = true & UseXHTMLDocType = true == "XHTML Transitional"

WidthInChars.title: WidthInChars
WidthInChars.description: By default, the Window Size width is 90 lines. Enable this setting to change this default window width.

author.title: Default Document Author
author.description: Enter a default author name for documents.

company.title: Default Document Organization / Company
company.description: Enter a default organization / company for documents.

copyright.title: Default Document Copyright
copyright.description: Enter a default copyright for documents.

AllowList.title: Allow List
AllowList.description: List of MAC addresses of AirPlay destinations that the device is restricted to. If this list is empty, the device can connect to any device.

Passwords.title: Passwords
Passwords.description: Sets passwords for known AirPlay destinations

Password.title: Password
Password.description: The password for the AirPlay destination

Whitelist.title: Allowlist
Whitelist.description: List of MAC addresses of AirPlay destinations that the device is restricted to. If this list is empty, the device can connect to any device.

com.apple.airplay.security.title: AirPlay Security
com.apple.airplay.security.description: Use the AirPlay Security payload to preconfigure access and security settings when connecting to Apple TV.

AccessType.title: Access
AccessType.description: Network requirement for devices that connect to Apple TV using airplay.

SecurityType.title: Security
SecurityType.description: Security requirement for for devices that connect to Apple TV using airplay.

ForceTLS.title: Force TLS
ForceTLS.description: Enable and force TLS for AirPrint connections

IPAddress.title: IP Address or Hostname
IPAddress.description: The AirPrint printer's IP address or hostname

Port.title: Port
Port.description: The AirPrint printer's listening port number

App.title: App
App.description: A dictionary containing information about the app

Identifier.title: Identifier
Identifier.description: The bundle identifier of the application.

Options.title: Options
Options.description: Settings enforced when in Single App Mode

UserEnabledOptions.title: User Enabled Options
UserEnabledOptions.description: Allow the user to change these settings when in Single App Mode

AssistiveTouch.title: Assistive Touch
AssistiveTouch.description: Allow user to enable Assistive Touch

InvertColors.title: Invert Colors
InvertColors.description: Allow user to enable Inverted Colors

VoiceOver.title: Voice Over
VoiceOver.description: Allow user to enable Voice Over

allowBookstoreErotica.title: Allow explicit sexual content in iBooks Store
allowBookstoreErotica.description: If set to false, the user will not be able to download media from Apple Books that has been tagged as erotica.

allowCamera.title: Allow Camera
allowCamera.description: If 'false', disables the camera, and its icon is removed from the Home screen. Users are unable to take photographs. This restriction is deprecated on unsupervised devices and will be supervised only in a future release.  Available in iOS 4 and later, and macOS 10.11 and later.

allowCloudPrivateRelay.title: Allow iCloud Private Relay
allowCloudPrivateRelay.description: If set to false, prevents the use of iCloud Private Relay.

allowDeviceNameModification.title: Allow modifying device name
allowDeviceNameModification.description: If set to false, prevents device name from being changed.

allowExplicitContent.title: Allow playback of explicit music, podcasts, and iTunes U
allowExplicitContent.description: When false, explicit music or video content purchased from the iTunes Store is hidden. Explicit content is marked as such by content providers, such as record labels, when sold through the iTunes Store. This key is deprecated on unsupervised devices.

allowListedAppBundleIDs.title: Allowed Apps
allowListedAppBundleIDs.description: When populated, prevents displaying or launching apps other than the listed ones. Disabled when using the Blocked Apps preference.

allowPasswordProximityRequests.title: Allow proximity based password sharing requests
allowPasswordProximityRequests.description: If set to false, a user's device will not request passwords from nearby devices.

allowRemoteAppPairing.title: Allow pairing with Remote app
allowRemoteAppPairing.description: If set to false, the Apple TV cannot be paired for use with the Remote app or Control Center widget.

blacklistedAppBundleIDs.title: Restrict App Usage - Denylist
blacklistedAppBundleIDs.description: If enabled, cannot use the allowlist to restrict app usage.

blockedAppBundleIDs.title: Blocked Apps
blockedAppBundleIDs.description: When populated, prevents displaying or launching listed apps. Disabled when using the Allowed Apps preference.

enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay.title: Deferred Software Updates Delay
enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay.description: Number of days the software updates will be hidden from the user.

forceAirPlayIncomingRequestsPairingPassw.title: Require passcode on first AirPlay pairing
forceAirPlayIncomingRequestsPairingPassw.description: It is recommended to use the AirPlay Security Payload.

forceAssistantProfanityFilter.title: Enable Siri profanity filter
forceAssistantProfanityFilter.description: When true, forces the use of the profanity filter assistant.

forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.title: Defer Software Updates
forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.description: If set to true, delays user visibility of Software Updates.

ratingApps.title: Allowed content ratings - Apps
ratingApps.description: This value defines the maximum level of app content that is allowed on the device. Not all integer values are used in each region. Apple's Configuration Profile documentation includes the values for the US, so you may need to do some sleuthing here.

ratingMovies.title: Allowed content ratings - Movies
ratingMovies.description: This value defines the maximum level of movie content that is allowed on the device. Not all integer values are used in each region. Apple's Configuration Profile documentation includes the values for the US, so you may need to do some sleuthing here.

ratingRegion.title: Ratings region
ratingRegion.description: This 2-letter key is used by profile tools to display the proper ratings for given region. It is not recognized or reported by the client.

ratingTVShows.title: Allowed content ratings - TV Shows
ratingTVShows.description: This value defines the maximum level of TV content that is allowed on the device. Not all integer values are used in each region. Apple's Configuration Profile documentation includes the values for the US, so you may need to do some sleuthing here.

whitelistedAppBundleIDs.title: Restrict App Usage - Allowlist
whitelistedAppBundleIDs.description: If enabled, cannot use the denylist to restrict app usage.

com.apple.applicationaccess.new.title: Parental Controls: Application Access
com.apple.applicationaccess.new.description: Configures Parental Controls: Application Access settings

familyControlsEnabled.title: Enable application access restrictions
familyControlsEnabled.description: Set to true to enable application access restrictions.

pathBlackList.title: Denylisted Application Folders
pathBlackList.description: The user can never launch applications in these folders.

pathWhiteList.title: Allowlisted Application Folders
pathWhiteList.description: The user can always launch applications in these folders.

whiteList.title: Allowlisted Applications by Code Signature
whiteList.description: List of code signatures for applications that are allowed to run.

appID.title: Code Requirement
appID.description: The designated requirement describing the code signature of this executable.

detachedSignature.title: Detached Signature
detachedSignature.description: The required signature for an unsigned binary

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Specifies whether this application information is to be included in the allowlist or not.

subApps.title: Sub Apps
subApps.description: For applications that include nested helper applications, describes the signatures of embedded applications.

restrict-store-mdm-install-softwareupdat.title: Restrict app installations to MDM-installed apps and software updates
restrict-store-mdm-install-softwareupdat.description: Restrict app installations to MDM-installed apps and software updates

restrict-store-require-admin-to-install.title: Require Admin To Install
restrict-store-require-admin-to-install.description: Restrict app installations to admin users

restrict-store-softwareupdate-only.title: Restrict app installations to software updates only
restrict-store-softwareupdate-only.description: Restrict app installations to software updates only

com.apple.asam.title: Autonomous Single App Mode
com.apple.asam.description: This payload grants Autonomous Single App Mode capabilities for specific applications

AllowedApplications.title: Allowed Applications
AllowedApplications.description: Array of dictionaries that specify applications that are to be granted access to Assessment APIs.

BundleIdentifier.title: Bundle Identifier
BundleIdentifier.description: The application's bundle identifier. BundleIdentifier must be unique. If two dictionaries contain the same BundleIdentifier but different TeamIdentifiers, this will be considered a hard error and the payload will not be installed.

com.apple.associated-domains.title: Associated Domains
com.apple.associated-domains.description: Use this section to define settings for Associated Domains to be used with features such as Extensible AppSSO, universal links and Password AutoFill.

Configuration.title: Configuration
Configuration.description: A dictionary that maps apps to their associated domains.

ApplicationIdentifier.title: ApplicationIdentifier
ApplicationIdentifier.description: The app identifier to associate the domains with.

AssociatedDomains.title: AssociatedDomains
AssociatedDomains.description:
The domains to be associated with the app. Each string is in the form of ''service:domain''. Domains should be fully qualified hostnames, like 'www.example.com'.
See Supporting Associated Domains for more information.

EnableDirectDownloads.title: EnableDirectDownloads
EnableDirectDownloads.description: If 'true', data for this domain should be downloaded directly instead of through a CDN. The entitlement value for this domain must be set to 'service:domain?mode=managed' or this value will be ignored. Available in macOS 11 and later.

CalDAVAccountDescription.title: Account Description
CalDAVAccountDescription.description: The display name of the account (e.g. "Company Calendar Account")

CalDAVHostName.title: Account Hostname
CalDAVHostName.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the CalDAV server.

CalDAVPort.title: Port Number
CalDAVPort.description: The port on which to connect to the CalDAV server.

CalDAVPrincipalURL.title: Principal URL
CalDAVPrincipalURL.description: The base URL to the user's calendar. In macOS this URL is required if the user doesn't provide a password, because auto-discovery of the service will fail and the account won't be created.

CalDAVUseSSL.title: Use SSL
CalDAVUseSSL.description: Enable Secure Socket Layer communication with CalDAV server

CalDAVUsername.title: Account Username
CalDAVUsername.description: The user name for the CalDAV account.

com.apple.carddav.account.title: Contacts
com.apple.carddav.account.description: Use the Contacts payload to provide account settings for connecting to a CardDAV-compliant contact server. If you omit the account information, users need to enter it manually when the profile is installed.

CardDAVAccountDescription.title: Account Description
CardDAVAccountDescription.description: The display name of the account (e.g. "Company Contacts Account")

CardDAVHostName.title: Account Hostname
CardDAVHostName.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the CardDAV server.

CardDAVPort.title: Port Number
CardDAVPort.description: The port on which to connect to the CardDAV server.

CardDAVPrincipalURL.title: Principal URL
CardDAVPrincipalURL.description: The Principal URL for the CardDAV account.

CardDAVUseSSL.title: Use SSL
CardDAVUseSSL.description: Enable Secure Socket Layer communication with CardDAV server

CommunicationServiceRules.title: Communication Service Rules
CommunicationServiceRules.description: The communication service handler rules for this account.

AudioCall.title: Bundle Identifier
AudioCall.description: Bundle identifier for the default application that handles audio calls made to contacts from this account

com.apple.cellular.title: Cellular
com.apple.cellular.description: Use this section to define custom APNs for cellular data access.

APNs.title: Data APN
APNs.description: List of Data APNs to configure

AllowedProtocolMask.title: Data APN supported IP versions
AllowedProtocolMask.description: Supported Internet Protocol versions for connections

AllowedProtocolMaskInDomesticRoaming.title: Data APN supported domestic roaming IP versions
AllowedProtocolMaskInDomesticRoaming.description: Supported Internet Protocol versions while domestic roaming.

AllowedProtocolMaskInRoaming.title: Data APN supported roaming IP versions
AllowedProtocolMaskInRoaming.description: Supported Internet Protocol versions while roaming.

AuthenticationType.title: Data APN authentication type
AuthenticationType.description: Authentication type to use for the connection.

DefaultProtocolMask.title: Data APN default IP versions
DefaultProtocolMask.description: Default Internet Protocol versions for connections. Set to the same value as AllowedProtocolMask.

Name.title: Data APN name
Name.description: The name of the data APN.

Password.title: Data APN password
Password.description: The password for the data APN account.

ProxyPort.title: Data APN proxy port
ProxyPort.description: The port number of the data APN proxy server.

ProxyServer.title: Data APN proxy server
ProxyServer.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the data APN proxy server.

Username.title: Data APN user name
Username.description: The user name for the data APN account.

AllowedProtocolMask.title: Default APN supported IP versions
AllowedProtocolMask.description: Supported Internet Protocol versions for connections

AuthenticationType.title: Default APN authentication type
AuthenticationType.description: Authentication type to use for the connection.

Name.title: Default APN name
Name.description: The name of the default APN.

Password.title: Default APN password
Password.description: The password for the default APN account.

Username.title: Default APN user name
Username.description: The user name for the default APN account.

com.apple.cellularprivatenetwork.managed.title: Cellular Private Network
com.apple.cellularprivatenetwork.managed.description: Cellular Private Network Settings and Device Configuration

CellularDataPreferred.title: CellularDataPreferred
CellularDataPreferred.description: Set to true if this private network should be preferred over wifi

DataSetName.title: DataSetName
DataSetName.description: Name for private network configuration dataset

EnableNRStandalone.title: EnableNRStandalone
EnableNRStandalone.description: Set to true if this private network is NR Standalone

Geofences.title: Geofences
Geofences.description: List of up to 1000 geofences for private networks. Geofencing is only used on iPhones.

GeofenceId.title: GeofenceId
GeofenceId.description: ID of geofence, must be unique amongst list

Latitude.title: Latitude
Latitude.description: Signed decimal value of latitude from -90 to 90

Longitude.title: Longitude
Longitude.description: Signed decimal value of longitude from -180 to 180

Radius.title: Radius
Radius.description: Specifies the radius of the geofence in meters. Should be set slightly greater than the private cellular network coverage area. Supported values 100 to 6500

VersionNumber.title: VersionNumber
VersionNumber.description: The version number of this dataset. Used to track updates

com.apple.conferenceroomdisplay.title: Conference Room Display
com.apple.conferenceroomdisplay.description: Use this section to place an Apple TV device into Conference Room Display mode.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: A custom message displayed on the screen in Conference Room Display mode.

AuthMethod.title: Authentication Method
AuthMethod.description: Allow the user to enter the password upon installation instead of being supplied in the payload

FullName.title: Full Name
FullName.description: The full name of the designated accounts.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: You can provide the password or choose to have the user provide it when he or she installs the profile.

UserName.title: Username
UserName.description: The UNIX user name for the accounts.

AirplayRecieverEnabled.title: Enable AirPlay Receiver
AirplayRecieverEnabled.description: Airplay Receiver allows you to send content from another Apple device to be displayed on the screen as it's being played from your other device.

CSUIDisable32BitWarnings.title: Hide 32-bit app compatibility alert
CSUIDisable32BitWarnings.description: Hides the one-time alert shown when opening a 32-bit application.

ID.title: Bundle ID
ID.description: The bundle ID of a widget.

Type.title: Entry Type
Type.description: Set to "bundleID" to use a widget's bundle ID as its ID.

whiteListEnabled.title: Enable dashboard widget allowlist
whiteListEnabled.description: Set to true to enable the widget white list items.

Declarations.title: Declarations
Declarations.description:
The set of declarations to apply. The items in this array are <data> (base64-encoded) representations
of the declaration JSON data.

locked.title: Lock desktop picture
locked.description: Prevents users from modifying the desktop picture selection.

override-picture-path.title: Desktop picture path
override-picture-path.description: The path of the file to use as the desktop picture.

DSDontWriteNetworkStores.title: Prevent .DS_Store file creation on network volumes
DSDontWriteNetworkStores.description: Prevent .DS_Store file creation when interacting with a remote file server using the Finder.

AppBundleIdentifier.title: App Bundle ID
AppBundleIdentifier.description: Bundle ID of the app containing the DNS proxy network extension.

DNSProxyUUID.title: DNS Proxy UUID
DNSProxyUUID.description: Global identifier of the proxy configuration in this payload. Used for processing DNS requests of managed apps with an identical attribute by the proxy.

ProviderBundleIdentifier.title: Provider Bundle ID
ProviderBundleIdentifier.description: Bundle ID of the DNS proxy network extension to use.

ProviderConfiguration.title: Provider Custom Configuration
ProviderConfiguration.description: A plist formatted dictionary of custom options.

DNSSettings.title: DNS Settings
DNSSettings.description: A dictionary that defines a configuration for an encrypted DNS server.

DNSProtocol.title: Protocol
DNSProtocol.description: The encrypted transport protocol used to communicate with the DNS server.

ServerAddresses.title: Server IP Addresses
ServerAddresses.description: An unordered list of DNS server IP address strings. These IP addresses can be a mixture of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

ServerName.title: Server Name
ServerName.description: The hostname of a DNS-over-TLS server used to validate the server certificate, as defined in RFC 7858. If no ServerAddresses are provided, the hostname will be used to determine the server addresses.

ServerURL.title: Server URL
ServerURL.description: The URI template of a DNS-over-HTTPS server, as defined in RFC 8484. This URL must use the https:// scheme, and the hostname or address in the URL will be used to validate the server certificate

SupplementalMatchDomains.title: Supplemental Match Domains
SupplementalMatchDomains.description: A list of domain strings used to determine which DNS queries will use the DNS server. If this array is not provided, all domains will use the DNS server. A single wildcard * prefix is supported, but is not required.

OnDemandRules.title: On Demand Rules
OnDemandRules.description: An array of rules defining the DNS settings. If rules are not present, the system always applies the DNS settings. These rules are identical to the OnDemandRules array in VPN payloads.

Action.title: Action
Action.description:
The action to take if this dictionary matches the current network. Options:
Connect: Apply DNS Settings when the dictionary matches.
Disconnect: Do not apply DNS Settings when the dictionary matches.
EvaluateConnection: Apply DNS Settings with per-domain exceptions when the dictionary matches.

ActionParameters.title: Action Parameters
ActionParameters.description: A dictionary that provides per-connection rules. This array is used only for settings where the Action value is EvaluateConnection.

DomainAction.title: Domain Action
DomainAction.description:
The DNS settings behavior for the specified domains. Options:
		NeverConnect: Do not use the DNS Settings for the specified domains.
		ConnectIfNeeded: Allow using the DNS Settings for the specified domains.

Domains.title: Domains
Domains.description: The domains for which this evaluation applies.

DNSDomainMatch.title: Domain Match
DNSDomainMatch.description: An array of domain names. This rule matches if any of the domain names in the specified list matches any domain in the device's search domains list. A single wildcard * prefix is supported, but is not required.

DNSServerAddressMatch.title: Server Address Match
DNSServerAddressMatch.description: An array of IP addresses. This rule matches if any of the network's specified DNS servers match any entry in the array. Matching with a single wildcard is supported.

InterfaceTypeMatch.title: Interface Type
InterfaceTypeMatch.description: An interface type. If specified, this rule matches only if the primary network interface hardware matches the specified type.

SSIDMatch.title: SSID Match
SSIDMatch.description: An array of SSIDs to match against the current network. If the network is not a Wi-Fi network or if the SSID does not appear in this array, the match fails. Omit this key and the corresponding array to match against any SSID.

URLStringProbe.title: URL String Probe
URLStringProbe.description: A URL to probe. If this URL is successfully fetched (returning a 200 HTTP status code) without redirection, this rule matches.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID pointing to an identity certificate payload. This identity will be used to authenticate the user to the DNS resolver.

ProhibitDisablement.title: Prohibit Disablement
ProhibitDisablement.description: If true, prohibits users from disabling DNS settings. This key is only available on supervised devices.

AllowDockFixupOverride.title: Allow DockFixup override
AllowDockFixupOverride.description: If true, use the file in /Library/Preferences/com.apple.dockfixup.plist when a new user or migrated user logs in. The format of this file currently has no documentation. This option has no effect for existing users.

autohide.title: Automatically hide and show the Dock
autohide.description: Set to true to automatically hide and show the dock.

autohide-immutable.title: Automatically hide and show the Dock checkbox disabled
autohide-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing the automatically hide and show the dock setting.

contents-immutable.title: Prevent modifying items in Dock
contents-immutable.description: Prevent user from removing any item from or adding any item to the dock.

largesize.title: Magnification
largesize.description: Largest magnification tile size in pixels.

launchanim.title: Animate opening applications
launchanim.description: Set to true to use launch animation.

launchanim-immutable.title: Animate opening applications checkbox disabled
launchanim-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing the animate opening applications setting.

magnification.title: Enable magnification
magnification.description: Set to true to turn on magnification.

magnify-immutable.title: Enable magnification checkbox disabled
magnify-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing the enable magnification setting.

magsize-immutable.title: Magnification slider disabled
magsize-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing magnification size.

mineffect.title: Minimize window effect
mineffect.description: Transition effect to use when minimizing applications to the Dock.

mineffect-immutable.title: Minimize window effect button disabled
mineffect-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing the minimization setting.

minimize-to-application.title: Minimize windows into application icon
minimize-to-application.description: Set to true to minimize windows into application icons.

minintoapp-immutable.title: Minimize windows into application icon Checkbox Disable
minintoapp-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing the minimize windows into application icon setting.

show-process-indicators.title: Show indicators for open applications
show-process-indicators.description: Set to true to show an indicator below the application icon when an application is running.

show-recents.title: Show recent applications in Dock
show-recents.description: Set to true to show recent applications in the Dock.

size-immutable.title: Size slider disabled
size-immutable.description: Prevent user from changing tile size.

static-apps.title: Static Apps
static-apps.description: Dock items in the Applications side that cannot be removed from the dock.

file-label.title: Display Name
file-label.description: Display name in the profile GUI of a dock item.

file-type.title: Type
file-type.description: The type of the tile expressed as a number.

tile-type.title: Type
tile-type.description: The type of the tile. Values may be file-tile, directory-tile, or url-tile. If you are unsure whether the file item is a file or a directory, set this key to file-tile.

static-only.title: Remove non-static apps and documents from Dock
static-only.description: Whether these settings will merge with the user's existing Dock settings.

static-others.title: Static Others
static-others.description: Dock items in the Documents side that cannot be removed from the dock.

displayas.title: Display As
displayas.description: Display directory as either a Folder or a Stack.

file-label.title: Display Name
file-label.description: Display name in the profile GUI of a dock item.

file-type.title: Type
file-type.description: The type of the tile expressed as a number.

home directory relative.title: Home Directory Relative
home directory relative.description: Path to item relative to the current user's home directory.

tile-type.title: Type
tile-type.description: The type of the tile. Values may be file-tile, directory-tile, or url-tile. If you are unsure whether the file item is a file or a directory, set this key to file-tile.

wvous-bl-corner.title: Bottom Left Hot Corner Action
wvous-bl-corner.description: Action to be taken when the pointer enters the bottom left corner of the screen

wvous-bl-modifier.title: Bottom Left Hot Corner Modifier
wvous-bl-modifier.description: Modifier keys required to activate the bottom left hot corner

wvous-br-corner.title: Bottom Right Hot Corner Action
wvous-br-corner.description: Action to be taken when the pointer enters the bottom right corner of the screen

wvous-br-modifier.title: Bottom Right Hot Corner Modifier
wvous-br-modifier.description: Modifier keys required to activate the bottom right hot corner

wvous-tl-corner.title: Top Left Hot Corner Action
wvous-tl-corner.description: Action to be taken when the pointer enters the top left corner of the screen

wvous-tl-modifier.title: Top Left Hot Corner Modifier
wvous-tl-modifier.description: Modifier keys required to activate the top left hot corner

wvous-tr-corner.title: Top Right Hot Corner Action
wvous-tr-corner.description: Action to be taken when the pointer enters the top right corner of the screen

wvous-tr-modifier.title: Top Right Hot Corner Modifier
wvous-tr-modifier.description: Modifier keys required to activate the top right hot corner

com.apple.domains.title: Domains
com.apple.domains.description: Use this section to define Domains settings.

CrossSiteTrackingPreventionRelaxedDomain.title: Safari Relaxed Cross Site Tracking Domains
CrossSiteTrackingPreventionRelaxedDomain.description: Up to 10 domains can be added for which Cross-Site Tracking Prevention will be relaxed. Domains should be listed as theacmeinc.com which includes any subdomains (without needing to use *theacmeinc.com)

EmailDomains.title: Unmarked Email Domains
EmailDomains.description: Mail messages that are addressed to domains not in the approved list are marked in red.

SafariPasswordAutoFillDomains.title: Safari Password Domains
SafariPasswordAutoFillDomains.description: User names and passwords entered in websites with Safari can be saved if the domain is listed.

WebDomains.title: Managed Safari Web Domains
WebDomains.description: Downloads from Safari will be considered managed documents if they originate from a managed domain.

Certificate.title: Identity Certificate
Certificate.description: X.509 certificate (.p12) for inclusion on device.

CertificateName.title: Certificate Name
CertificateName.description: Name or description of the certificate credential.

CommunicationServiceRules.title: Communication Service Rules
CommunicationServiceRules.description: The communication service handler rules for this account.

AudioCall.title: BundleIdentifier
AudioCall.description: Bundle identifier for the default application that handles audio calls made to contacts from this account

EmailAddress.title: Account email address
EmailAddress.description: The email address for the account (e.g. "john@company.com).

EnableCalendars.title: Enabled Services - Calendars
EnableCalendars.description: Enables/disables the Calendars service for this account.

EnableCalendarsUserOverridable.title: Account Modification - Calendars
EnableCalendarsUserOverridable.description: Enables/disables the users to modify the Calendars settings.

EnableContacts.title: Enabled Services - Contacts
EnableContacts.description: Enables/disables the Contacts service for this account.

EnableContactsUserOverridable.title: Account Modification - Contacts
EnableContactsUserOverridable.description: Enables/disables the users to modify the Contacts settings.

EnableMail.title: Enabled Services - Mail
EnableMail.description: Enables/disables the Mail service for this account.

EnableMailUserOverridable.title: Account Modification - Mail
EnableMailUserOverridable.description: Enables/disables the users to modify the Mail settings.

EnableNotes.title: Enabled Services - Notes
EnableNotes.description: Enables/disables the Notes service for this account.

EnableNotesUserOverridable.title: Account Modification - Notes
EnableNotesUserOverridable.description: Enables/disables the users to modify the Notes settings.

EnableReminders.title: Enabled Services - Reminders
EnableReminders.description: Enables/disables the Reminders service for this account.

EnableRemindersUserOverridable.title: Account Modification - Reminders
EnableRemindersUserOverridable.description: Enables/disables the users to modify the Reminders settings.

Host.title: Internal Exchange Host
Host.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the internal Exchange host.

MailNumberOfPastDaysToSync.title: Number of days to sync
MailNumberOfPastDaysToSync.description: The number of days since synchronization.

OAuth.title: Use OAuth
OAuth.description: Specifies whether the connection should use OAuth for authentication.

OverridePreviousPassword.title: Override previous password
OverridePreviousPassword.description: If true, a previously set EAS password is overriden with a new password in this payload.

Password.title: Account password
Password.description: The password of the user account.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Identity Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the certificate payload to use for the identity credential.

PreventAppSheet.title: Prevent App Sheet
PreventAppSheet.description: If set to true, this account will not be available for sending mail in any app other than the Apple Mail app.

PreventMove.title: Prevent Move
PreventMove.description: If set to true, messages may not be moved out of this email account into another account. Also prevents forwarding or replying from a different account than the message was originated from.

SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch.title: Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption per message
SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch.description: If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI.

SMIMEEnablePerMessageSwitch.title: Enable S/MIME Per Message Switch
SMIMEEnablePerMessageSwitch.description: If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch instead.

SMIMEEnabled.title: Enable S/MIME
SMIMEEnabled.description: If true, this account supports S/MIME.

SMIMEEncryptByDefault.title: Enable S/MIME Encryption
SMIMEEncryptByDefault.description: If set to true, S/MIME encryption is enabled by default.

SMIMEEncryptByDefaultUserOverrideable.title: Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption
SMIMEEncryptByDefaultUserOverrideable.description: If set to true, the user can toggle the encryption by default setting.

SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUID.title: S/MIME Encryption Certificate
SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to decrypt messages sent to this account.

SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUIDUserOverri.title: Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption Certificate
SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUIDUserOverri.description: If set to true, the user can select the S/MIME encryption identity and encryption is enabled.

SMIMEEncryptionEnabled.title: Enable S/MIME Encryption
SMIMEEncryptionEnabled.description: If set to true, S/MIME encryption is on by default for this account. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEncryptByDefault instead.

SMIMESigningCertificateUUID.title: S/MIME Signing Certificate
SMIMESigningCertificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to sign messages sent from this account.

SMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea.title: Allow user to select S/MIME Identity
SMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea.description: If set to true, the user can select the signing identity.

SMIMESigningEnabled.title: Enable S/MIME Signing
SMIMESigningEnabled.description: If set to true, S/MIME signing is enabled for this account.

SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.title: Allow user to toggle S/MIME Signing
SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.description: If set to true, the user can toggle S/MIME signing on or off in Settings.

SSL.title: Use SSL for Internal Exchange Host
SSL.description: Send all communication through Secure Socket Layer.

UserName.title: Account user name
UserName.description: The user name with the optional domain (e.g "user" or "domain\user").

VPNUUID.title: Per-App VPN Payload UUID
VPNUUID.description: UUID of a per-app VPN payload to tunnel this account communication through

disableMailRecentsSyncing.title: Exclude this account from address recents syncing
disableMailRecentsSyncing.description: If true, this account is excluded from address Recents syncing.

Departments.title: Departments
Departments.description: Shared: An array of dictionaries that define departments that are shown in the iOS login window.

DeviceGroups.title: Device Groups
DeviceGroups.description: Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the device groups to which the leader can assign devices. This key is not included in member payloads.

SerialNumbers.title: Device Group Serial Numbers
SerialNumbers.description: The strings containing the serial numbers of the devices in the group.

Groups.title: Groups
Groups.description:
Shared: An array of dictionaries that define groups that the user can select in the login window.
Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the groups that the user can control.
Member: An array of dictionaries that define the groups of which the user is a member.

LeaderPayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Leader Payload Certificate Anchor UUIDs
LeaderPayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: List of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize leader peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Leader certificates must have the common name prefix leader (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

MemberPayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Member Payload Certificate Anchor UUIDs
MemberPayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: List of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize group member peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Member certificates must have the common name prefix member (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

OrganizationUUID.title: Organization UUID
OrganizationUUID.description: All teacher and student devices that need to communicate with one another must have the same OrganizationUUID, particularly if they originated from different Device Enrollment Programs.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Payload Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: Used to perform client authentication between devices.

ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID.title: Resource Payload Certificate UUID
ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID.description: The UUID of an identity certificate payload that will be used to perform client authentication when fetching additional resources, such as, student images. If not specified the MDM client identity will be used.

ScreenObservationPermissionModificationA.title: Allow students to modify screen observation permissions
ScreenObservationPermissionModificationA.description: To allow students enrolled in managed classes to modify teacher permission for screen observation, set to 'true'.

UserIdentifier.title: User Identifier
UserIdentifier.description: A unique string that identifies the user of this device within the organization.

Users.title: Users
Users.description:
Shared: An array of dictionaries that define the users that are shown in the iOS login window.
Leader: An array of dictionaries that define users that are members of the leaderʼs groups.
Member: An array of a dictionaries that must contain the definition of the user specified in the UserIdentifier key.
With one-to-one member devices, this key should include only the device user and the leader but not other class members.

ImageURL.title: Image URL
ImageURL.description: URL pointing to a JPEG, PNG, or TIFF image of the user. Recommended either 256x256 or 512x512 resolution.

EmailAddress.title: Account email address
EmailAddress.description: The email address for the account (e.g. john@company.com).

ExternalHost.title: External Exchange Host
ExternalHost.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the external Exchange host.

ExternalPath.title: External server path
ExternalPath.description: The server path for the external Exchange host.

ExternalPort.title: External Exchange Host Port
ExternalPort.description: The port on which to connect to the external Exchange host.

ExternalSSL.title: Use SSL for External Exchange Host
ExternalSSL.description: Send all communication through Secure Socket Layer.

Host.title: Internal Exchange Host
Host.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the internal Exchange host.

IdentificationUUID.title: IdentificationUUID
IdentificationUUID.description: The UUID of the Identification Payload to use as the source for user values.

OAuth.title: Use OAuth
OAuth.description: Specifies whether the connection should use OAuth for authentication.

OAuthSignInURL.title: OAuth Sign-In URL
OAuthSignInURL.description: URL to load into a webview for authentication via OAuth when auto-discovery is not used.

Password.title: Account password
Password.description: The password of the user account.

Path.title: Internal server path
Path.description: The server path for the internal Exchange host.

Port.title: Internal Exchange Host Port
Port.description: The port on which to connect to the internal Exchange host.

SSL.title: Use SSL for Internal Exchange Host
SSL.description: Send all communication through Secure Socket Layer.

UserName.title: Account user name
UserName.description: The user name with the optional domain (e.g "user" or "domain\user").

com.apple.extensiblesso.title: Single Sign-On Extensions
com.apple.extensiblesso.description: Single Sign-On Extension settings. User-level payload support for macOS 11.x and later.

AuthenticationMethod.title: Authentication Method
AuthenticationMethod.description: Platform SSO authentication method supported and used by the configured SSO extension.

ExtensionData.title: Kerberos Extension Data
ExtensionData.description: Used by the Apple built-in Kerberos extension.

AppCookieSSOAllowList.title: App Cookie SSO Allow List
AppCookieSSOAllowList.description: Enable SSO through cookies for a specific application

AppPrefixAllowList.title: App Prefix Allow List
AppPrefixAllowList.description: Enable SSO for all apps with a specific bundle ID prefix

Enable_SSO_On_All_ManagedApps.title: Enable SSO on All Managed Apps

allowAutomaticLogin.title: Allow Automatic Login
allowAutomaticLogin.description: If false, passwords are not allowed to be saved to the keychain.

allowPasswordChange.title: Allow Password Change
allowPasswordChange.description: If false, disables password changes. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

allowPlatformSSOAuthFallback.title: Allow Platform SSO Authentication Fallback
allowPlatformSSOAuthFallback.description: If true, allows manual sign-ins as fallback.

browser_sso_disable_mfa.title: Disable Asking for MFA During Initial Bootstrapping

browser_sso_interaction_enabled.title: Allow Users to Sign in from Unknown Applications using the Safari Browser

cacheName.title: Cache Name
cacheName.description: The GSS name of the Kerberos cache to use. Rarely set by an administrator.

certificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
certificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of a PKINIT certificate.

credentialBundleIdACL.title: Credential Bundle ID ACL
credentialBundleIdACL.description: A list of bundle IDs allowed to access the ticket-granting ticket (TGT).

credentialUseMode.title: Credential Use Mode
credentialUseMode.description: This setting affects how the Kerberos Extension credential is used by other processes. Available in macOS 11 and later.

customUsernameLabel.title: Custom Username Label
customUsernameLabel.description: The custom user name label used in the Kerberos extension instead of "Username". For example, "Company ID". Available on macOS 11 and later.

delayUserSetup.title: Delay User Setup
delayUserSetup.description: If true, doesn't prompt the user to setup the Kerberos extension until either the administrator enables it with the app-sso tool or a Kerberos challenge is received. Available in macOS 11 and later.

disable_explicit_app_prompt_and_autologi.title: Disable OAuth2 Application Prompts and Autologin

domainRealmMapping.title: domainRealmMapping
domainRealmMapping.description: A custom domain-realm mapping for Kerberos. This is used when the DNS name of hosts do not match the realm name. Most administrators will not need to customize this.

Realm.title: Realm
Realm.description: The key should be the name of the realm, and the value is an array of DNS suffixes that map to the realm.

helpText.title: Help Text
helpText.description: The text to be displayed to the user at the bottom of the Kerberos login window. It can be used to display help information or disclaimer text. Available in iOS 14 and later and macOS 11 and later.

includeKerberosAppsInBundleIdACL.title: Include Kerberos Apps in Bundle ID ACL
includeKerberosAppsInBundleIdACL.description: If true, the Kerberos extension will allow standard Kerberos utilities such as TicketViewer and klist to access and use the credential. This is in addition to either includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL or credentialBundleIDACL, if any are specified.

includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL.title: Include Managed Apps in Bundle ID ACL
includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL.description: If true, the Kerberos extension will allow only managed apps to access and use the credential. This is in addition to the credentialBundleIDACL, if it is specified. Available in iOS 14 and later.

isDefaultRealm.title: Is Default Realm
isDefaultRealm.description: This property specifies it is the default realm if there is more than one Kerberos extension configuration.

monitorCredentialsCache.title: Monitor Credential Cache
monitorCredentialsCache.description: If false, the credential is requested on the next matching Kerberos challenge or network state change. If the credential is expired or missing, a new one will be created. Available in macOS 11 and later.

performKerberosOnly.title: Perform Kerberos Requests Only
performKerberosOnly.description: If true, the configured extension only handles Kerberos requests and does not check for or show the expiration of the password, does not check external password changes, does not sync passwords, and does not retrieve the user's home directory.

preferredKDCs.title: Preferred KDCs
preferredKDCs.description: Preferred Key Distribution Centers for Kerberos traffic when the servers cannot be discovered via DNS.

principalName.title: Principal Name
principalName.description: The principal (aka username) to use. You do not need to include the realm.

pwChangeURL.title: Password Change URL
pwChangeURL.description: This URL will launch in the user's default web browser when they initiate a password change. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwExpireOverride.title: Password Expiration Override
pwExpireOverride.description: The number of days that passwords can be used on this domain. For most domains, this can be calculated automatically. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwNotificationDays.title: Password Notification Days
pwNotificationDays.description: The number of days prior to password expiration when a notification of password expiration will be sent to the user. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqComplexity.title: Password Requirement Complexity
pwReqComplexity.description: If true, passwords must meet Active Directory's definition of "complex". Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqHistory.title: Password Requirement History
pwReqHistory.description: The number of prior passwords that cannot be re-used on this domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqLength.title: Password Requirement Length
pwReqLength.description: The minimum length of passwords on the domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqMinAge.title: Password Requirement Minimum Age
pwReqMinAge.description: The minimum age of passwords before they can be changed on this domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqText.title: Password Requirement Text
pwReqText.description: The text version of the domain's password requirements. Only for use if pwReqComplexity or pwReqLength aren't specified. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

replicationTime.title: Replication Time
replicationTime.description: The time, in seconds, required to replicate changes in the Active Directory domain. The Kerberos extension will use this when checking password age after a change. Available in macOS 11 and later.

requireTLSForLDAP.title: Require TLS for LDAP
requireTLSForLDAP.description: Require that LDAP connections use TLS. Available in macOS 11 and later.

requireUserPresence.title: Require User Presence
requireUserPresence.description: If true, requires the user to provide Touch ID, Face ID or their passcode to access the keychain entry.

siteCode.title: Site Code
siteCode.description: The name of the Active Directory site the Kerberos extension should use. Most administrators will never need to modify this value, as the Kerberos extension can normally find the site automatically.

syncLocalPassword.title: Sync Local Password
syncLocalPassword.description: If false, disables password sync. Note that this will not work if the user is logged in with a mobile account. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

usePlatformSSOTGT.title: Use Platform SSO TGT
usePlatformSSOTGT.description: If true, the configured SSO extension must use a ticket-granting ticket (TGT) from Platform SSO.

useSiteAutoDiscovery.title: Use Site Auto Discovery
useSiteAutoDiscovery.description: If false, the Kerberos extension doesn't automatically use LDAP and DNS to determine its AD site name.

ExtensionIdentifier.title: Extension Identifier
ExtensionIdentifier.description: The bundle identifier of the app extension that performs single sign-on (SSO) for the specified URLs. Enter com.apple.AppSSOKerberos.KerberosExtension to use Apple's Kerberos SSO extension.

Hosts.title: Hosts
Hosts.description: An array of host names or domain names that can be authenticated through the app extension. Required for Credential payloads. Ignored for Redirect payloads.

PlatformSSO.title: PlatformSSO
PlatformSSO.description: This is the dictionary used to configure PlatformSSO.

AccountDisplayName.title: AccountDisplayName
AccountDisplayName.description: The display name for the account in notifications and authentication requests.

AdditionalGroups.title: AdditionalGroups
AdditionalGroups.description: The list of groups that are created and do not have administrator access.

AdministratorGroups.title: AdministratorGroups
AdministratorGroups.description: The list of groups that are used for administrator access. Membership will be requested during authentication.

AuthenticationMethod.title: AuthenticationMethod
AuthenticationMethod.description: The Platform SSO authentication method to be used with the extension. Requires that the SSO Extension also support the method.

AuthorizationGroups.title: AuthorizationGroups
AuthorizationGroups.description: The pairing of Authorization Rights to group names. The Authorization Right will be updated to use the group when used.

Group.title: Group
Group.description: The group to use for the Authorization Right.

EnableAuthorization.title: EnableAuthorization
EnableAuthorization.description: Enables using identity provider accounts at authorization prompts. Requires 'UseSharedDeviceKeys' is true. The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

EnableCreateUserAtLogin.title: EnableCreateUserAtLogin
EnableCreateUserAtLogin.description: Enables creating new users at the login window with either Passwords or SmartCards. Requires 'UseSharedDeviceKeys' is true.

LoginFrequency.title: LoginFrequency
LoginFrequency.description: The frequency where a full login is required instead of a refresh. Default is 18 hours. Must be > 1 hour.

NewUserAuthorizationMode.title: NewUserAuthorizationMode
NewUserAuthorizationMode.description:
This setting affects the permissions for accounts created at login by Platform SSO. It is only used when the account is created. Use of the following:
* Standard
    The account will be a standard user.
* Admin
    The account will be added to the local administrators group.
* Groups
    The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

TokenToUserMapping.title: TokenToUserMapping
TokenToUserMapping.description: The attribute mapping used when creating new users or for authorization.

AccountName.title: AccountName
AccountName.description: The claim name to use for the user's account name.

FullName.title: FullName
FullName.description: The claim name to use for the user's full name.

UseSharedDeviceKeys.title: UseSharedDeviceKeys
UseSharedDeviceKeys.description: If set to true, Platform SSO will use the same signing and encryption keys for all users.

UserAuthorizationMode.title: UserAuthorizationMode
UserAuthorizationMode.description:
This setting affects the permissions after authentication by Platform SSO. It is applied each time user authenticates. Use of the following:
* Standard
    The account will be a standard user. It will be removed from the 'admin' group.
* Admin
    The account will be added to the local administrators group.
* Groups
    The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

Realm.title: Realm
Realm.description: The realm name for Credential payloads. This value should be properly capitalized. This key is ignored for Redirect payloads.

RegistrationToken.title: Registration Token
RegistrationToken.description: Platform SSO token for use in silent registration.

TeamIdentifier.title: Team Identifier
TeamIdentifier.description: The team identifier of the app extension. This key is required on macOS and ignored elsewhere.

URLs.title: URLs
URLs.description: The realm name for Credential payloads. This value should be properly capitalized. This key is ignored for Redirect payloads.

com.apple.familycontrols.contentfilter.title: Parental Controls: Web Content Filter
com.apple.familycontrols.contentfilter.description: Parental Controls: Web Content Filter settings

filterBlacklist.title: Content Filter Backlist
filterBlacklist.description: If specified and restrictWeb is true, an array of URLs of Websites never to be allowed.

filterWhitelist.title: Content Filter Allowlist
filterWhitelist.description: If specified and restrictWeb is true, an array of URLs designating the only allowed Websites.

restrictWeb.title: Limit access to websites
restrictWeb.description: Set to true to enable Web content filters.

siteWhitelist.title: Site Allowlist
siteWhitelist.description: If specified, this key contains an array of dictionaries that define additional allowed sites besides those in the automated list of allowed and unallowed sites, including disallowed adult sites.

useContentFilter.title: Use built in content filter
useContentFilter.description: Set to true to try to automatically filter content.

whitelistEnabled.title: Enable site allowlist
whitelistEnabled.description: Set to true to use the filterWhiteList and filterBlackList lists.

familyControlsEnabled.title: Enable Time Limits
familyControlsEnabled.description: Set to true to enable family control time limits

end.title: Curfew End Time
end.description: The end time for the curfew in 'hours:minutes:seconds' format.

start.title: Curfew Start Time
start.description: The start time for the curfew in 'hours:minutes:seconds' format.

end.title: Curfew End Time
end.description: The end time for the curfew in 'hours:minutes:seconds' format.

start.title: Curfew Start Time
start.description: The start time for the curfew in 'hours:minutes:seconds' format.

AllowManagedFileProvidersToRequestAttrib.title: Allow Managed File Providers to Request Attribution
AllowManagedFileProvidersToRequestAttrib.description: If true, enables file providers access to the path of the requesting process.

FXRemoveOldTrashItems.title: Remove Old Trash Items
FXRemoveOldTrashItems.description: Remove items from the Trash after 30 days

InterfaceLevel.title: Finder Interface Level
InterfaceLevel.description: Select if the standard (Full) or Simple Finder should be used

ProhibitBurn.title: Allow Burn Disc
ProhibitBurn.description: Writes permanent information to a CD or DVD. Disc burning restrictions require both Disc Burning and Finder payloads.

ProhibitConnectTo.title: Allow Connect to Server
ProhibitConnectTo.description: Opens a dialog box for finding servers on the network

ProhibitEject.title: Allow Eject
ProhibitEject.description: Ejects removable media and mountable volumes

ProhibitGoToFolder.title: Allow Go to Folder
ProhibitGoToFolder.description: Allows user to open files or folders by typing a pathname

ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop.title: Show External disks
ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop.description: Show external disks on the desktop

ShowHardDrivesOnDesktop.title: Show Hard disks
ShowHardDrivesOnDesktop.description: Show hard disks on the desktop

ShowMountedServersOnDesktop.title: Show Connected servers
ShowMountedServersOnDesktop.description: Show connected servers on the desktop

ShowRecentTags.title: Show Recent Tags
ShowRecentTags.description: Show the Recent Tags section in the Finder sidebar

ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop.title: Show Removable media (CDs, DVDs, etc.)
ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop.description: Show removable media on the desktop

WarnOnEmptyTrash.title: Show warning before emptying the Trash
WarnOnEmptyTrash.description: Warning message requiring user approval before emptying the Trash

com.apple.firstactiveethernet.managed.description: Use this section to define First Active Ethernet settings

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. If false, the authentication fails if the certificate isn't already trusted.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

GKFeatureMultiplayerGamingAllowed.description: Set to false to disable multiplayer gaming.

ShowMoreDownloadsDialogGB.description: If disabled, suppresses the prompt to download additional optional GarageBand content.

welcomeScreenShown.title: Suppress Welcome Screen

com.apple.google-oauth.description: Use this section to configure Google accounts. The user will be prompted to sign in afterward.

AccountDescription.title: Account Description
AccountDescription.description: Description of the account shown to the user

AccountName.title: Account Name
AccountName.description: Full user name of the Google account

CommunicationServiceRules.title: Communication Service Rules
CommunicationServiceRules.description: The communication service handler rules for this account

AudioCall.title: Bundle Identifier
AudioCall.description: Bundle identifier for the default application that handles audio calls made to contacts from this account

EmailAddress.title: Email Address
EmailAddress.description: Full Google/Gmail email address for the account

BKAlreadyDisplayedGDPRWelcomeExperience.title: Suppress Welcome to Apple Books Screen
BKAlreadyDisplayedGDPRWelcomeExperience.description: Suppresses the "Welcome to Apple Books" screen at launch. This payload should be used in conjunction with the "Suppress Empty Library" key.

BKAlreadyDisplayedUbiquity.title: Suppress Empty Library / Go to Store Screen
BKAlreadyDisplayedUbiquity.description: Suppresses the "There are no books in your library" screen. This payload should be used in conjunction with the "Suppress Welcome to Apple Books Screen" key

BKDisableBookStorePreferenceKey.title: Disable iBooks Store
BKDisableBookStorePreferenceKey.description: This payload also requires an iTunes payload with the "disableMusicStore" key set.

FFiMovieUpgradeFirstRun.title: FFiMovieUpgradeFirstRun
FFiMovieUpgradeFirstRun.description: Suppresses the popup to upgrade an iMovie library on first run.

LKWelcomeDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Welcome displayed
LKWelcomeDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Welcome screen on the selected versions of iMovie.

LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Whats New displayed
LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Whats New screen on the selected versions of iMovie.

disableShareLibraryInfo.title: Disable Library Info Sharing
disableShareLibraryInfo.description: Share details about your library with Apple.

dontAutomaticallySyncIPods.title: Prevent iPods, iPhones and iPads from syncing automatically

license-agreements.description: Agrees to the license agreement prompt when first opening iTunes

EA1510.description: Automatically accept the iTunes Software Licence Agreement on launch.

restrictExplicitBooks.title: Restrict Books with explicit sexual content

Ironwood Allowed.description: Set to false to disable dictation.

Profanity Allowed.title: Allow Profanity in Dictation
Profanity Allowed.description: Set to false to suppress profanity.

JabberAccountDescription.title: Account description
JabberAccountDescription.description: The display name for the account.

JabberAuthentication.title: Authentication Type
JabberAuthentication.description: The authentication method for the server.

JabberHostName.title: Hostname
JabberHostName.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the server.

JabberPort.title: Port
JabberPort.description: The port on which to connect to the server.

JabberUseSSL.title: Use SSL
JabberUseSSL.description: Enable Secure Socket Layer for this connection.

JabberUserName.title: Account name
JabberUserName.description: The chat name of the user.

LDAPAccountDescription.title: Account Description
LDAPAccountDescription.description: The display name of the account (e.g. 'Company LDAP Account')

LDAPAccountHostName.title: Account Hostname
LDAPAccountHostName.description: The LDAP Hostname or IP address

LDAPAccountPassword.title: Account Password
LDAPAccountPassword.description: The password for this LDAP account

LDAPAccountUseSSL.title: Use SSL
LDAPAccountUseSSL.description: Enable Secure Socket Layer for this connection

LDAPAccountUserName.title: Account Username
LDAPAccountUserName.description: The username for this LDAP account

LDAPSearchSettings.title: Search Settings
LDAPSearchSettings.description: Scope and search base for this LDAP server.

LDAPSearchSettingScope.title: Scope
LDAPSearchSettingScope.description: Defines what recursion to use in the search

LDAPSearchSettingSearchBase.title: Search Base
LDAPSearchSettingSearchBase.description: Conceptually, the path to the the node to start a search at

DontShowAdditionalContentDowload.title: Don't Show Additional Content Download
DontShowAdditionalContentDowload.description: Suppresses the popup to download additonal sound content on launch. Yes, in fact, 'Download' is spelled 'Dowload' in the preference key.

FeatureAvailable_ExpertAudio.title: Enable Additional Option: Audio
FeatureAvailable_ExpertAudio.description: Enables destructive audio editing, and advanced configuration options for audio editing experts.

FeatureAvailable_ExpertCS.title: Enable Additional Option: Control Surfaces
FeatureAvailable_ExpertCS.description: Allows experts to create new, and edit any functional detail of existing control surface systems.

FeatureAvailable_ExpertEditing.title: Enable Additional Option: Advanced Editing
FeatureAvailable_ExpertEditing.description: Enables advanced editing functionality, including: aliases, track reassignment, historic tuning scales, and the Tempo Interpreter.

FeatureAvailable_ExpertMIDI.title: Enable Additional Option: MIDI
FeatureAvailable_ExpertMIDI.description: Allows signal flow control and real-time processing of MIDI input and output streams in the Environment.

FeatureAvailable_ExpertScore.title: Enable Additional Option: Score
FeatureAvailable_ExpertScore.description: Enables the full feature set of the Score window for notation experts.

FeatureAvailable_Surround.title: Enable Additional Option: Surround
FeatureAvailable_Surround.description: Enables all features for surround audio productions, and requires a surround speaker setup for monitoring.

QuickHelpMode.title: Quick Help Mode
QuickHelpMode.description: Set to 0 to disable Quick Help Mode overlays.

RecentWhatsNewPanelVersion.title: Suppress What's New Prompt
RecentWhatsNewPanelVersion.description: So long as the integer value of this preference is set equal or higher to the value produced in the user-level plist after launching the app and acknowledging the "What's New" prompt, this will prevent the "What's New" prompt from appearing.

userLevel.title: Enable Show Advanced Tools
userLevel.description: Configures whether Show Advanced Tools is enabled.

AutoLaunchedApplicationDictionary-manage.title: Automatically launched items
AutoLaunchedApplicationDictionary-manage.description: Automatically launch these items at login.

AuthenticateAsLoginUserShortName.title: Authenticate with short name
AuthenticateAsLoginUserShortName.description: Authenticate to the URL with the current users short name. Required if URL is specified, but not for Path

Hide.title: Hide
Hide.description: If true, hide this item in the Users & Groups login items list.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: URL to mount in the form scheme://mount.point/Share

AdminHostInfo.title: Show additional information in the menu bar
AdminHostInfo.description: Cycle through the hostname, macOS version, and IP address when the menu bar is clicked.

AdminMayDisableMCX.title: Mac computer administrators may refresh content or disable management
AdminMayDisableMCX.description: Allows Mac administrators on the computer to refresh or disable the management features.

AllowList.title: Allowed Users or Groups
AllowList.description: User or group GUIDs of users that are allowed to log in. An asterisk '*' string specifies all users or groups.

AlwaysShowWorkgroupDialog.title: Always show workgroup dialog during log in
AlwaysShowWorkgroupDialog.description: If the workgroup has a specific dialog, that dialog is shown when users log in.

AutologinPassword.title: AutologinPassword
AutologinPassword.description: Optional user password when setting up auto login.  If this key does not exist, and a user name was specified, auto login will be set up the next time the specified user logs in to the client.

AutologinUsername.title: AutologinUsername
AutologinUsername.description: Sets up auto login with the specified short user name.

ChangePasswordDisabled.title: Allow user to change password
ChangePasswordDisabled.description: Enable or disable the "Change Password…" button in the Users & Groups preference pane.

CombineUserWorkgroups.title: Combine available workgroup settings
CombineUserWorkgroups.description: If users are part of a nested workgroup, all nested workgroup settings are enforced.

DenyList.title: Denied Users or Groups
DenyList.description: User or group GUIDs of users that cannot log in. This list takes priority over the list in the AllowList key.

DisableConsoleAccess.title: Enable >console login
DisableConsoleAccess.description: Allows users to use >console at the login window.

DisableFDEAutoLogin.title: Disable automatic login if FileVault is enabled
DisableFDEAutoLogin.description: Both the EFI Login and loginwindow password will be required to login.

DisableScreenLockImmediate.title: Disable the immediate Screen Lock function

EnableExternalAccounts.title: Enable external accounts
EnableExternalAccounts.description: Allows external accounts to log in.

FlattenUserWorkgroups.title: Ignore workgroup nesting
FlattenUserWorkgroups.description: If users are part of a nested workgroup, only the settings of the user's workgroup are enforced.

HiddenUsersList.title: Hidden Users List
HiddenUsersList.description: Hides users defined in the list from the login window under the Other button

LocalUserLoginEnabled.title: Local-only users may log in
LocalUserLoginEnabled.description: Permit only local users to log in. Network users won't be allowed to log in.

LocalUsersHaveWorkgroups.title: Local-only users use available workgroup settings
LocalUsersHaveWorkgroups.description: Local users are forced to use any available workgroup settings.

LogOutDisabledWhileLoggedIn.title: Disable the Log Out menu item while logged in

LoginwindowText.title: Banner
LoginwindowText.description: Enter a message that's displayed above the login prompt. You might use this to provide a warning about unauthorized use.

PowerOffDisabledWhileLoggedIn.title: Disable the Power Off menu item while logged in

RestartDisabledWhileLoggedIn.title: Disable the Restart menu item while logged in

RetriesUntilHint.title: Show password hints after failed attempts
RetriesUntilHint.description: Number of tries until password hint is shown (0 = disable password hints).

SHOWFULLNAME.title: Display login window as
SHOWFULLNAME.description: The display style and related options of the login prompt.

ShutDownDisabledWhileLoggedIn.title: Disable the Shut Down menu item while logged in

TALLogoutSavesState.title: Reopen windows when logging back in
TALLogoutSavesState.description: Reopens windows that were open at time of logout

UseComputerNameForComputerRecordName.title: Set Mac computer name to computer record name
UseComputerNameForComputerRecordName.description: Forces the name of the Mac to be set as the computer record name.

com.apple.login.mcx.DisableAutoLoginClie.title: Disable automatic login if FileVault is disabled
com.apple.login.mcx.DisableAutoLoginClie.description: A loginwindow password will be required to login.

showInputMenu.title: Show input menu in login window

ControllerCACertificateUUIDs.description: An array of UUIDs of payloads in this profile that contain certificates that will be used for controller certificate trustworthiness evaluation.

ControllerCertificateUUID.description: UUID of a payload in this profile that contains the certificate of the LOM controller. Configures the device to accept LOMDeviceRequestCommand.

DeviceCACertificateUUIDs.description: An array of UUIDs of payloads in this profile that contain certificates that will be used for device certificate trustworthiness evaluation.

DeviceCertificateUUID.description: UUID of a payload in this profile that contains the certificate of the LOM device. Configures the device to accept PowerON, PowerOFF, and Reset requests.

EmailAccountDescription.title: Account Description
EmailAccountDescription.description: The display name of the account (e.g. "Company Mail Account")

EmailAccountName.title: User Display Name
EmailAccountName.description: The display name of the user (e.g. "John Appleseed")

EmailAccountType.title: Account Type
EmailAccountType.description: The protocol for accessing the account

IdentificationUUID.title: IdentificationUUID
IdentificationUUID.description: The UUID of the Identification Payload to use as the source for the user email and username values.

IncomingMailServerAuthentication.title: Incoming Mail Server Authentification Type
IncomingMailServerAuthentication.description: The authentication method for the incoming mail server

IncomingMailServerHostName.title: Incoming Mail Server Hostname
IncomingMailServerHostName.description: Hostname or IP Address for incoming mail

IncomingMailServerIMAPPathPrefix.description: Path prefix for IMAP mail server

IncomingMailServerUsername.description: The username used to connect to the server for incoming mail

IncomingPassword.description: The password for the incoming mail server
