OutgoingMailServerAuthentication.description: The authentication method for the outgoing mail server

OutgoingMailServerHostName.description: Hostname or IP address for outgoing mail

OutgoingMailServerPortNumber.description: The port number for outgoing mail

OutgoingMailServerUseSSL.title: Outgoing Mail Server Use SSL
OutgoingMailServerUseSSL.description: Send outgoing mail through Secure Socket Layer

OutgoingMailServerUsername.title: Outgoing Mail Server Username
OutgoingMailServerUsername.description: The username used to connect to the server for outgoing mail

OutgoingPassword.title: Outgoing Mail Server Password
OutgoingPassword.description: The password for the outgoing mail server

OutgoingPasswordSameAsIncomingPassword.title: Outgoing Password Same As Incoming
OutgoingPasswordSameAsIncomingPassword.description: SMTP authentication uses the same password as POP/IMAP

PreventAppSheet.title: Use Only In Mail
PreventAppSheet.description: Send outgoing mail from this account only from Mail app

PreventMove.title: Allow user to move messages from this account
PreventMove.description: Messages can be moved out of this account into another.

SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to decrypt messages coming into this account.

SMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea.description: Allow the user to select the signing identity.

SMIMESigningEnabled.description: Support S/MIME signing for this account

SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.title: Enable S/MIME toggle
SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.description: Allow the user to toggle S/MIME signing on or off in Settings.

allowMailDrop.title: Allow Mail Drop
allowMailDrop.description: Allow Mail Drop for this account

disableMailRecentsSyncing.title: Allow recent addresses to be synced
disableMailRecentsSyncing.description: Include this account in recent address syncing

skipLogoutHook.description: Run any LogoutHook script in addition to the Logout script

FooterFontName.description: The font to use when printing a footer.

FooterFontSize.title: Footer Font Size
FooterFontSize.description: The font size to use when printing a footer.

PrintFooter.title: Footer
PrintFooter.description: If true, prints the page footer (including the user name and date).

PrintMACAddress.title: Print MAC Address
PrintMACAddress.description: If true, includes the MAC address.

RequireAdminToAddPrinters.title: Require Admin To Add Printers
RequireAdminToAddPrinters.description: If true, requires an administrator password to add printers.

RequireAdminToPrintLocally.title: Require Admin To Print Locally
RequireAdminToPrintLocally.description: If true, requires an administrator password to print locally.

ShowOnlyManagedPrinters.title: Show Only Managed Printers
ShowOnlyManagedPrinters.description: If true, shows only managed printers.

UserPrinterList.title: User Printer List
UserPrinterList.description: The printers available to a user.

com.apple.mdm.title: MDM
com.apple.mdm.description: Use this section to define mobile device management (MDM) settings.

AccessRights.title: Access Rights
AccessRights.description: Logical OR of access rights bit-flags. When 2 is specified 1 must be specified along. When 128 is specified 64 must be specified along. This property is ignored when ManagedAppleID is present.

AssignedManagedAppleID.title: Assigned Managed Apple ID
AssignedManagedAppleID.description: The Managed Apple ID pre-assigned to the authenticated user of a user-enrolled (non-supervised) device.

CheckInURL.title: Check-In URL
CheckInURL.description: URL used by the device for checking-in during installation. When omitted, ServerURL will be used for checking-in as well instead. Must be an HTTPS URL and may contain a port number.

CheckInURLPinningCertificateUUIDs.title: Check-In URL Pinning Certificate Identifiers
CheckInURLPinningCertificateUUIDs.description: An array of UUIDs of Certificate payloads in this profile. The certificates are used for evaluating trustworthiness of the Check-In URLs of MDM servers.

CheckOutWhenRemoved.title: Check-Out When Removed
CheckOutWhenRemoved.description: When enabled, the device will attempt to send a check-out message on removal of this profile.

EnrollmentMode.title: EnrollmentMode
EnrollmentMode.description: The enrollment mode for a user-enrolled (non-supervised) device.

IdentityCertificateUUID.title: Identity Certificate Identifier
IdentityCertificateUUID.description: UUID of a Certificate or SCEP payload in this profile, which will be used for the identity of the device.

ManagedAppleID.title: Managed Apple ID
ManagedAppleID.description: The Managed Apple ID of the user. Available in iOS 13.1 and later, and macOS 10.15 and later. This is only used with the profile-driven BYOD enrollment flow, and must not be present in the BYOD and ADDE account-driven enrollment flows. As of iOS 17 and macOS 14, profile-driven user enrollments are deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

PinningRevocationCheckRequired.title: Pinning Revocation Check Required
PinningRevocationCheckRequired.description: When enabled, verified positive responses are required in order to pass certificate revocation checks. Otherwise, failed attemps to reach the server may not fail checks.

PromptUserToAllowBootstrapTokenForAuthen.title: Prompt User to Allow Bootstrap Token for Authentication
PromptUserToAllowBootstrapTokenForAuthen.description: When enabled, notifies the user about needing to reboot into RecoveryOS and allowing the MDM to use the Bootstrap Token for authentication for certain operations (e.g. enabling some kernel extensions or software updates). When these operations are unnecessary for the MDM server to perform, this key can remain false.

RequiredAppIDForMDM.title: Required App ID for MDM on Unsupervised Device
RequiredAppIDForMDM.description: iTunesStoreID of a single app that the MDM service can require and push to a user-enrolled (non-supervised) device.

ServerCapabilities.title: Server Capabilities
ServerCapabilities.description: An array of unique capability identifiers.

ServerURL.title: Server URL
ServerURL.description: URL used by the device to contact and retrieve device management instructions. Must be an HTTPS URL and may contain a port number.

ServerURLPinningCertificateUUIDs.title: Server URL Pinning Certificate Identifiers
ServerURLPinningCertificateUUIDs.description: An array of UUIDs of Certificate payloads in this profile. The certificates are used for evaluating trustworthiness of the Connect URLs of MDM servers.

SignMessage.title: Sign Message
SignMessage.description: When enabled, messages coming from the device will bear the Mdm-Signature HTTP header.

Topic.title: Topic
Topic.description: The topic that MDM listens to for Push notifications. The topic must have the prefix 'com.apple.mgmt.'. Also, certificate used by the server to send notifications must contain this topic in its subject.

UseDevelopmentAPNS.title: Use Development Apns
UseDevelopmentAPNS.description: When enabled, the device will you development APNS servers instead of production ones. Must not be enabled when using Apple Push Notification Service certificate issued by the Apple Push Certificate Portal.

allowSimple.title: Allow simple passcode
allowSimple.description: Permits the use of repeating, ascending, and descending character sequences in passcodes. For example, "3333" or "DEFG".

changeAtNextAuth.title: Reset passcode at next login
changeAtNextAuth.description: Causes a password reset to occur the next time the user tries to authenticate.

customRegex.title: customRegex
customRegex.description:
Specifies a regular expression, and its description, used to enforce password compliance. Use the simpler passcode restrictions whenever possible, and rely on regular expression matching only when necessary. Mistakes in regular expressions can lead to frustrating user experiences, such as unsatisfiable passcode policies, or policy descriptions that don't match the enforced policy.
Available in macOS 14 and later.

passwordContentDescription.title: passwordContentDescription
passwordContentDescription.description: Contains a dictionary of keys for supported OS language IDs (for example, “en-US”), and whose values represent a localized description of the policy enforced by the regular expression. Use the special 'default' key can for languages that aren't contained in the dictionary.

passwordContentRegex.title: passwordContentRegex
passwordContentRegex.description: A regular expression string that they system matches against the password to determine whether it complies with a policy. The regular expression uses the ICU syntax (<https://unicode-org.github.io/icu/userguide/strings/regexp.html>). The string must not exceed 2048 characters in length.

forcePIN.title: Require passcode on device
forcePIN.description: Enforce the use of a passcode before using the device.

maxFailedAttempts.title: Maximum number of failed attempts
maxFailedAttempts.description: The number of failed passcode attempts that can be made before an iOS device is erased or a macOS device is locked.

maxGracePeriod.title: Maximum grace period for device lock
maxGracePeriod.description: How soon the device can be unlocked again after use, without reprompting again for the passcode. (0 = no grace period, which requires a passcode immediately). In macOS, this grace period value is translated to screen-saver settings.

maxInactivity.title: Maximum Auto-Lock
maxInactivity.description: If the device isn't used for the period of time you specify, it automatically locks. It can be set to lock after 1 to 15 minutes, or turned off with a value of 0. In macOS, this inactivity value is translated to screen-saver settings.

maxPINAgeInDays.title: Maximum passcode age
maxPINAgeInDays.description: Requires users to change their passcode at the specified interval. It can be set to between 1 and 730 days, or turned off with a value of 0.

minComplexChars.title: Minimum number of complex characters
minComplexChars.description: Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters the passcode must contain.

minLength.title: Minimum passcode length
minLength.description: Minimum number of characters a passcode can contain.

minutesUntilFailedLoginReset.title: Delay after failed login attempts
minutesUntilFailedLoginReset.description: The number of minutes before the login window reappears, after the maximum number of failed attempts is reached. This key requires setting maxFailedAttempts.

pinHistory.title: Passcode history
pinHistory.description: The device refuses a new passcode if it matches a previously used passcode. You can specify how many previous passcodes are remembered and compared. It can be set to between 1 and 50 passcodes, or turned off with a value of 0.

requireAlphanumeric.title: Require alphanumeric value
requireAlphanumeric.description: Requires that the passcode contain at least one letter and one number.

FFCheckedUpgrade.title: Upgrade Checked
FFCheckedUpgrade.description: Suppresses the popup to upgrade an Motion on first run.

LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.title: Whats New displayed
LKWhatsNewDisplayedForAppVersion.description: Suppress the Whats New screen on the selected versions of Motion.

ApplicationRules.title: Application Network Usage Rules
ApplicationRules.description: Specify how managed apps use cellular data networks

AllowCellularData.title: Allow Cellular Data
AllowCellularData.description: Allow cellular data over the network

AllowRoamingCellularData.title: Allow Data Roaming
AllowRoamingCellularData.description: Allow data roaming over the network

AppIdentifierMatches.title: Bundle Identifier Matches
AppIdentifierMatches.description: A list of managed app identifiers, as strings, that must follow the associated rules. If this key is missing, the rules will apply to all managed apps on the device.

SIMRules.title: Wi-Fi Assist Policy Rules
SIMRules.description: Specify the Wi-Fi assist policy to be used with specific SIM cards

com.apple.notificationsettings.title: Notifications
com.apple.notificationsettings.description: Configures Notification settings for iOS & macOS apps

AlertType.title: Alert Type
AlertType.description: The type of alert for notifications for this app. None/Banner/Alert

BadgesEnabled.title: Badges Enabled
BadgesEnabled.description: Whether badges are allowed for this app.

BundleIdentifier.title: App Bundle Identifier
BundleIdentifier.description: Bundle identifier of the target app

CriticalAlertEnabled.title: Enable Critical Alerts
CriticalAlertEnabled.description: Whether an app can mark notifications as 'critical', bypassing Do Not Disturb and ringer settings.

NotificationsEnabled.title: Enable Notifications
NotificationsEnabled.description: Whether notifications are allowed for this app.

ShowInLockScreen.title: Show on Lock Screen
ShowInLockScreen.description: Whether notifications can be shown on the lock screen.

ShowInNotificationCenter.title: Show in Notification Center
ShowInNotificationCenter.description: Whether notifications can be shown in notification center.

SoundsEnabled.title: Sounds Enabled
SoundsEnabled.description: Whether sounds are allowed for this app.

com.apple.osxserver.account.title: macOS Server Accounts
com.apple.osxserver.account.description: Use the macOS Server Accounts payload to specify macOS Server account information allowing an iOS device to use it as a document repository.

AccountDescription.title: Account Description
AccountDescription.description: The display name for the macOS Server Account.

ConfiguredAccounts.title: Documents Server Port
ConfiguredAccounts.description: The port on macOS Server over which the connection is established.

Port.title: Port Number
Port.description: The port on which to connect to the server.

Type.title: Account Type
Type.description: Must be com.apple.osxserver.documents (the Documents account type).

HostName.title: Hostname
HostName.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the server.

dontAllowLockMessageUI.title: Allow user to set lock message

homeSharingUIStatus.title: Home Sharing
homeSharingUIStatus.description: When Media Sharing is enabled, the computer starts a network listening service that shares the contents of the user’s music collection with other users in the same subnet.

legacySharingUIStatus.title: Legacy Sharing
legacySharingUIStatus.description: When Media Sharing is enabled, the computer starts a network listening service that shares the contents of the user’s music collection with other users in the same subnet.

mediaSharingUIStatus.title: Media Sharing
mediaSharingUIStatus.description: When Media Sharing is enabled, the computer starts a network listening service that shares the contents of the user’s music collection with other users in the same subnet.

com.apple.print.add.title: Printing: Toolbar of Add Printer Window
com.apple.print.add.description: Use this section to configure the toolbar of the Add Printer window under Printers and Scanners in System Preferences. The primary use case for this manifest is for prepopulating the toolbar with the 'Advanced' button.

TB Item Identifiers.title: Toolbar Items
TB Item Identifiers.description: The items to include in the toolbar and their order. The only items that can be added more than once are the Flexible Space and Space. Warning: configuring this property with no actual buttons (Default, IP, Windows, or Advanced) may lead to the display of no UI, and this condition may persist after removal of profile.

com.apple.profileRemovalPassword.title: Profile Removal
com.apple.profileRemovalPassword.description: Use this section to define settings for profile removal

ProxyCaptiveLoginAllowed.title: Allow Proxy Bypass for Captive Portal Logins
ProxyCaptiveLoginAllowed.description: Allow the device to bypass the proxy server to display the login page for captive networks.

ProxyPACURL.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPACURL.description: The URL of the PAC file that defines the proxy configuration.

ProxyPassword.title: Proxy Password
ProxyPassword.description: The password used to authenticate to the proxy server. This setting is only used if the ProxyType is set to Manual, and is ignored if the ProxyType is set to Automatic.

ProxyServer.title: Proxy Server
ProxyServer.description: The proxy server's network address. This is required if the ProxyType is set to Manual, and is ignored if the ProxyType is set to Automatic.

ProxyServerPort.title: Proxy Server Port
ProxyServerPort.description: The proxy server's port number. This is required if the ProxyType is set to Manual, and is ignored if the ProxyType is set to Automatic.

ProxyType.title: Proxy Type
ProxyType.description: Use Manual for proxies that require authentication.

ProxyUsername.title: Proxy Username
ProxyUsername.description: The user name used to authenticate to the proxy server. This setting is only used if the ProxyType is set to Manual, and is ignored if the ProxyType is set to Automatic.

DisablePythonAlert.title: Disable Python Deprecation Alert
DisablePythonAlert.description: Controls whether warnings are shown to the user when an app or process calls the macOS-bundled Python2 interpreter. This interpreter has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version of macOS.

com.apple.relay.managed.title: Relay
com.apple.relay.managed.description: Use this section to define settings for network relays.

ExcludedDomains.title: Excluded Domains
ExcludedDomains.description: A list of domain strings that should not be routed through the servers contained in Relays. Any connection that matches the domain exactly or is a subdomain of the listed domain will not use the relay server.

MatchDomains.title: Match Domains
MatchDomains.description: A list of domain strings used to determine which connection should be routed through the servers contained in Relays. Any connection that matches the domain exactly or is a subdomain of the listed domain will use the relay servers, unless they match an excluded domain. If no domains are listed, traffic to all domains, except those matching an excluded domain, will be routed to the relay servers.

RelayUUID.title: RelayUUID
RelayUUID.description: A globally-unique identifier for this relay configuration. This UUID is used to route managed apps through the servers contained in Relays.

Relays.title: Relays
Relays.description: An array of dictionaries that describes one or more relay servers that can be chained together.

AdditionalHTTPHeaderFields.title: Additional HTTP Header Fields
AdditionalHTTPHeaderFields.description: A dictionary of custom HTTP header keys and values to add to each request to the relay. The dictionary key name represents the HTTP header field name to use, and the dictionary value is the string to use as the HTTP header field value.

HTTP2RelayURL.title: HTTP/2 Relay URL
HTTP2RelayURL.description: The URL or URI template (such as defined in RFC 9298) of a relay server that is reachable using HTTP/2 and supports proxying TCP and UDP using the CONNECT method. Each relay must have at least one URL, for either HTTP/3 or HTTP/2, and may support both.

HTTP3RelayURL.title: HTTP/3 Relay URL
HTTP3RelayURL.description: The URL or URI template (such as defined in RFC 9298) of a relay server that is reachable using HTTP/3 and supports proxying TCP and UDP using the CONNECT method. Each relay must have at least one URL, for either HTTP/3 or HTTP/2, and may support both.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID pointing to an identity certificate payload. This identity will be used to authenticate the user to the relay server.

RawPublicKeys.title: Raw Public Keys
RawPublicKeys.description: An array of raw public keys used to authenticate the server during a TLS handshake. The server must use one of the keys in the handshake in order to authenticate. If no keys are specified, default TLS trust evaluation is used.

location.title: Screenshot Location
location.description: File system path (can start with ~) where screenshots will be saved.

askForPassword.title: Require password to unlock screen.
askForPassword.description: If true, the user will be prompted for a password when the screensaver is unlocked or stopped.

askForPasswordDelay.title: Require password delay
askForPasswordDelay.description: Number of seconds to delay before the password will be required to unlock or stop the screen saver (the "grace period"). A value of 2147483647 can be used to disable this requirement.

idleTime.title: Screensaver idle time
idleTime.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before screensaver activates. (0 = never activate).

loginWindowIdleTime.title: LoginWindow Screensaver idle time
loginWindowIdleTime.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before screensaver activates. (0 = never activate).

loginWindowModulePath.title: Screensaver path
loginWindowModulePath.description: A full path to the screen saver module to be used.

moduleName.title: Screensaver Module Name
moduleName.description: Name of the screensaver module to use.

idleTime.title: Screensaver idle time
idleTime.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before screensaver activates. (0 = never activate).

moduleName.title: Screensaver Module Name
moduleName.description: Name of the screensaver module to use.

modulePath.title: Screensaver path
modulePath.description: A full path to the screen saver module to be used.

com.apple.secondactiveethernet.managed.title: 802.1X Ethernet: Second Active
com.apple.secondactiveethernet.managed.description: Use this section to define Second Active Ethernet settings

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. If false, the authentication fails if the certificate isn't already trusted.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

com.apple.secondethernet.managed.title: 802.1X Ethernet: Second
com.apple.secondethernet.managed.description: Use this section to define Second Ethernet settings

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. If false, the authentication fails if the certificate isn't already trusted.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

DeviceKey.title: DeviceKey
DeviceKey.description: An optional string that will be included in help text if the user appears to have forgotten the password. Can be used by a site admin to look up the escrowed key for the particular machine. Replaces the RecordNumber key used in previous escrow mechanism. If missing, the device serial number will be used instead.

EncryptCertPayloadUUID.title: EncryptCertPayloadUUID
EncryptCertPayloadUUID.description: The UUID of a payload within the same profile that contains the certificate that will be used to encrypt the recovery key. The referenced payload must be of type com.apple.security.pkcs1.

Location.title: Location
Location.description: A short description of the location where the recovery key will be escrowed. This text will be inserted into the message the user sees when enabling FileVault.

EncryptCertPayloadUUID.title: Encryption Certificate Payload UUID
EncryptCertPayloadUUID.description: The UUID of a payload within the same profile that contains a certificate whose public key is used to encrypt the recovery key when it is sent to the redirected URL. The referenced payload must be of type com.apple.security.pkcs1.

RedirectURL.title: Redirect URL
RedirectURL.description: The URL to which FDE recovery keys should be sent instead of Apple. Must begin with https://.

com.apple.security.acme.title: ACME Certificate
com.apple.security.acme.description: Use this section to define settings to have an ACME server issue a client certificate.

AllowAllAppsAccess.title: Allow All Apps Access
AllowAllAppsAccess.description: If true, all apps have access to the private key.

Attest.title: Attest
Attest.description:
If 'true', the device provides attestations describing the device and the generated key to the ACME server. The server can use the attestations as strong evidence that the key is bound to the device, and that the device has properties listed in the attestation. The server can use that as part of a trust score to decide whether to issue the requested certificate.
When 'Attest' is 'true', 'HardwareBound' must also be 'true'.

ClientIdentifier.title: Client identifier
ClientIdentifier.description: A unique string identifying a specific device. The server may use this as a nonce to prevent issuing multiple certificates. This identifier also indicates to the ACME server that the device has access to a valid client identifier issued by the enterprise infrastructure. This can help the ACME server determine whether to trust the device. Though this is a relatively weak indication because of the risk that an attacker can intercept the client identifier.

DirectoryURL.title: ACME directory URL
DirectoryURL.description: The directory URL of the ACME server. The URL must use the https scheme.

ExtendedKeyUsage.title: Extended Key Usage
ExtendedKeyUsage.description:
The value is an array of strings. Each string is an OID in dotted notation. For instance, [”1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2”, “1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.4”] indicates client authentication and email protection.
The device requests this field for the certificate that the ACME server issues. The ACME server may override or ignore this field in the certificate it issues.

HardwareBound.title: Hardware Bound
HardwareBound.description:
If 'false', the private key isn't bound to the device.
If 'true', the private key is bound to the device. The Secure Enclave generates the key pair, and the private key is cryptographically entangled with a system key. This prevents the system from exporting the private key.
If 'true', 'KeyType' must be 'ECSECPrimeRandom' and 'KeySize' must be 256 or 384.

KeyIsExtractable.title: Key Is Extractable
KeyIsExtractable.description: Whether the private key of the identity obtained via SCEP should be tagged as "non-extractable" in the keychain.

KeySize.title: Key Size
KeySize.description: The valid values for 'KeySize' depend on the values of 'KeyType' and 'HardwareBound'. See those keys for specific requirements.

KeyType.title: Key Type
KeyType.description:
The type of key pair to generate.
* 'RSA': Specifies an RSA key pair. RSA key pairs must have a KeySize in the range [1024..4096] inclusive and a multiple of 8, and 'HardwareBound' must be false.
* 'ECSECPrimeRandom': Specifies a key pair on the P-192, P-256, P-384 or P-521 curves as defined in FIPS Pub 186-4. KeySize defines the particular curve, which must be 192, 256, 384 or 521. Hardware bound keys only support values of 256 and 384. Note that the key size is 521, not 512, even though the other key sizes are multiples of 64.

Subject.title: Subject
Subject.description:
The device requests this subject for the certificate that the ACME server issues. The ACME server may override or ignore this field in the certificate it issues.
The representation of a X.500 name represented as an array of OID and value. For example, /C=US/O=Apple Inc./CN=foo/1.2.5.3=bar corresponds to:
[ [ [”C”, “US”] ], [ [”O”, “Apple Inc.”] ], ..., [ [ “1.2.5.3”, “bar” ] ] ]
Dotted numbers can represent OIDs , with shortcuts for country (C), locality (L), state (ST), organization (O), organizational unit (OU), and common name (CN).

SubjectAltName.title: Subject Alt Name
SubjectAltName.description: The Subject Alt Name that the device requests for the certificate that the ACME server issues. The ACME server may override or ignore this field in the certificate it issues.

UsageFlags.title: Key Usage
UsageFlags.description:
This value is a bit field.
* Bit '0x01' indicates digital signature.
* Bit '0x10' indicates key agreement.
The device requests this key for the certificate that the ACME server issues. The ACME server may override or ignore this field in the certificate it issues.

DisabledForCerts.title: Disabled Certificates
DisabledForCerts.description: A list of certificate hashes for which certificate transparency is disabled.

DisabledForDomains.title: Disabled Domains
DisabledForDomains.description: List of domains where certificate transparency is disabled.

AllowSigned.title: Allow Incoming Connections to macOS-Bundled Software

AllowSignedApp.title: Allow Incoming Connections to Downloaded Signed Apps

Applications.title: Applications
Applications.description: Add applications to either allow or block them from connecting to your network and the Internet.

Allowed.title: Allowed
Allowed.description: Specifies whether or not incoming connections are allowed.

BlockAllIncoming.title: Block All Incoming Connections
BlockAllIncoming.description: Blocks all incoming connections except those required for basic Internet services, such as DHCP, Bonjour and IPSec.

EnableFirewall.title: Enable Firewall
EnableFirewall.description: Enables the firewall on managed Mac computers.

EnableStealthMode.title: Enable Stealth Mode
EnableStealthMode.description: Don't respond to or acknowledge attempts to access this computer from the network by test applications using ICMP, such as Ping.

com.apple.security.pem.title: Certificate PEM
com.apple.security.pem.description: Use this section to define settings for a PEM certificate.

PayloadCertificateFileName.title: Certificate Name
PayloadCertificateFileName.description: Name or description of the certificate credential.

PayloadContent.title: Certificate
PayloadContent.description: X.509 certificate (.pem, .cer, .crt, etc) for inclusion on device.

com.apple.security.pkcs1.title: Certificate PKCS1
com.apple.security.pkcs1.description: Use this section to define settings for a pkcs1 certificate.

PayloadCertificateFileName.title: Certificate Name
PayloadCertificateFileName.description: Name or description of the certificate credential.

PayloadContent.title: Certificate or Identity Data
PayloadContent.description: X.509 certificate (.cer, .crt, etc) for inclusion on device.

com.apple.security.pkcs12.title: Certificate PKCS12
com.apple.security.pkcs12.description: Use this section to define settings for a pkcs12 certificate.

AllowAllAppsAccess.title: Allow Private Key Access to All Apps
AllowAllAppsAccess.description: Allows all apps on the device to access the private key of this certificate

KeyIsExtractable.title: Key is Extractable
KeyIsExtractable.description: Allows exporting the private key from the keychain

PayloadCertificateFileName.title: Certificate Name
PayloadCertificateFileName.description: Name or description of the certificate credential.

PayloadContent.title: Certificate or Identity Data
PayloadContent.description: X.509 certificate (.p12) for inclusion on device.

PayloadCertificateFileName.title: Certificate Name
PayloadCertificateFileName.description: Name or description of the certificate credential.

PayloadContent.title: Root Certificate
PayloadContent.description: X.509 Root certificate (.cer, .crt, etc) for inclusion on device.

com.apple.security.scep.title: SCEP
com.apple.security.scep.description: Use this section to define settings for configuration access to SCEP servers.

PayloadContent.title: Payload Content
PayloadContent.description: This dictionary contains the payload contents

AllowAllAppsAccess.title: Allow access to all apps
AllowAllAppsAccess.description: Allow all apps to access the certificate in the keychain

CAFingerprint.title: Fingerprint
CAFingerprint.description: The fingerprint (hex string) of the Certificate Authority certificate.

CertificateRenewalTimeInterval.title: Certificate Expiration Notification
CertificateRenewalTimeInterval.description: The number of days before the certificate expires at which to start showing the expiration notification

Challenge.title: Challenge
Challenge.description: Used as the pre-shared secret for automatic enrollment.

Key Usage.title: Key Usage
Key Usage.description:
A bitmask indicating the use of the key.
• 1 - signing
• 4 - encryption
• 5 - signing and encryption

KeyIsExtractable.title: Key is Extractable
KeyIsExtractable.description: Allow / restrict exporting the private key from the keychain.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Any string that is understood by the SCEP server. For example, it could be a domain name like example.org. If a certificate authority has multiple CA certificates this field can be used to distinguish which is required.

Retries.title: Retries
Retries.description: The number of times the device should retry if the server sends a PENDING response.

RetryDelay.title: Retry Delay
RetryDelay.description: The number of seconds to wait between subsequent retries. The first retry is attempted without this delay.

Subject.title: Subject
Subject.description: The representation of a X.500 name represented as an array of OID and value. OIDs can be represented as dotted numbers, with shortcuts for country (C), locality (L), state (ST), organization (O), organizational unit (OU), and common name (CN).

SubjectAltName.title: Subject Alt Name
SubjectAltName.description: Specifies the Subject Alt Name for the certificate.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: The base URL for the SCEP server

UserPairing.title: User Pairing
UserPairing.description: If false, users don't get the pairing dialog, although existing pairings still work.

allowSmartCard.title: Allow SmartCard
allowSmartCard.description: If false, disables the SmartCard for logins, authorizations, and screen saver unlocking. It is still allowed for other functions, such as signing emails and accessing the web.

allowUnmappedUsers.title: Allow Unmapped Users
allowUnmappedUsers.description: If set to integer 1, allows users who aren't paired with a smart card to log in with password.

checkCertificateTrust.title: Certificate Trust Validation
checkCertificateTrust.description: Require unexpired, system trusted certificates for smart cards to work.

enforceSmartCard.title: Require SmartCard
enforceSmartCard.description: If true, a user can only log in or authenticate with a SmartCard.

oneCardPerUser.title: Restrict One Card Per User
oneCardPerUser.description: If true, a user can pair with only one SmartCard, although existing pairings are allowed if already set up.

tokenRemovalAction.title: Enable Screen Saver on Removal
tokenRemovalAction.description: If enabled, enables the screen saver when the SmartCard is removed.

com.apple.servicemanagement.title: Service Management - Managed Login Items
com.apple.servicemanagement.description: Control the user experience for ServiceManagement login items (including launchd agents and daemons) in Login Items Settings.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: An optional description of the rule.

RuleType.title: Rule Type
RuleType.description: The type of comparison to make.

RuleValue.title: Rule Value
RuleValue.description: The value to compare with each login item's value, to determine a match to this rule.

TeamIdentifier.title: Team Identifier
TeamIdentifier.description: An additional constraint to limit the scope of the rule that is tested after matching the RuleType/RuleValue.

AssetTagInformation.title: Asset tag
AssetTagInformation.description: Displays the asset tag information in the Login window and on the Lock screen.

IfLostReturnToMessage.title: "If lost, return to"
IfLostReturnToMessage.description: Displays a name, address, or phone number on the Login window and Lock screen. Deprecated. Use LockScreenFootnote instead.

LockScreenFootnote.title: Lock Screen Footnote
LockScreenFootnote.description: Displays a name, address, or phone number on the Login window and Lock screen.

DiscoverableMode.title: Discoverability
DiscoverableMode.description: Configure the AirDrop option "Allow me to be discovered by:"

AppIdentifierMatches.title: App Identifiers
AppIdentifierMatches.description: List of app identifiers that are allowed to use this login

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Identity Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of an identity certificate payload for Kerberos credential renewal without user interaction.

PrincipalName.title: Kerberos Principal Name
PrincipalName.description: The Kerberos principal name. The user will be prompted for one during profile installation if not provided.

URLPrefixMatches.title: URLs Prefix Matches
URLPrefixMatches.description: List of URLs prefixes that must be matched to use this account for Kerberos authentication over HTTP. Note that the URL postfixes must match as well.

com.apple.subscribedcalendar.account.title: Subscribed Calendars
com.apple.subscribedcalendar.account.description: Use this section to define settings for subscribed calendar account.

SubCalAccountDescription.title: Description
SubCalAccountDescription.description: The description of the calendar subscription

SubCalAccountHostName.title: URL
SubCalAccountHostName.description: The URL of the calendar file

SubCalAccountUseSSL.title: Use SSL
SubCalAccountUseSSL.description: Use Secure Socket Layer for this subscription

AllowNonAdminUserApprovals.title: Allow non-admin users to approve kernel extensions
AllowNonAdminUserApprovals.description: Non-admin users can approve kernel extensions not explicitly allowed by configuration profiles.

AllowUserOverrides.title: Allow users to approve kernel extensions
AllowUserOverrides.description: Users can approve kernel extensions not explicitly allowed by configuration profiles.

AllowedKernelExtensions.title: Allowed Kernel Extensions
AllowedKernelExtensions.description: Bundle identifier and team identifier of kernel extensions that will be allowed. Use an empty team identifier for unsigned legacy kernel extensions.

AllowedTeamIdentifiers.title: Allowed Team Identifiers
AllowedTeamIdentifiers.description: List of team identifiers that define which validly signed kernel extensions will be allowed to load.

com.apple.system-extension-policy.title: System Extension Policy
com.apple.system-extension-policy.description: Use this section to define policy for system extensions.

AllowUserOverrides.title: Allow users to approve system extensions
AllowUserOverrides.description: Set this property to false to prevent users from approving system extensions not explicitly allowed by configuration profiles.

AllowedSystemExtensionTypes.title: Allowed System Extension Types
AllowedSystemExtensionTypes.description: Dictionary of developer teams and their allowed system extension types. Entries use the team identifier as the key and an array of the allowed extension type strings as the associated value.

AllowedSystemExtensions.title: Allowed System Extensions
AllowedSystemExtensions.description: Dictionary of system extensions that will be allowed. Extensions are represented in the dictionary using a team identifier string as key and an array of allowed extension bundle identifier strings as the associated value.

AllowedTeamIdentifiers.title: Allowed Team Identifiers
AllowedTeamIdentifiers.description: List of team identifiers that define which validly signed system extensions will be allowed to load.

RemovableSystemExtensions.title: Removable System Extensions
RemovableSystemExtensions.description: Dictionary of system extensions that can be removed by their own app without requiring an admin password. Extensions are represented in the dictionary using a team identifier string as key and an array of removable extension bundle identifier strings as the associated value.

Enable-Private-Data.title: Allow private data system-wide in unified logs
Enable-Private-Data.description: Enables private data logging for the entire system

CustomBehavior.title: Custom Paths
CustomBehavior.description: Custom Paths to be migrated from source system

Context.title: Context
Context.description: The context to which custom paths apply.

Paths.title: Paths
Paths.description: The custom paths to be migrated from a source system to a target system.

SourcePath.title: Source Path
SourcePath.description: The path to the migrating file or directory on the source system.

SourcePathInUserHome.title: Source Path In User Home
SourcePathInUserHome.description: If the source path is located within a user home directory.

TargetPath.title: Target Path
TargetPath.description: The path to the destination file or directory on the target system.

TargetPathInUserHome.title: Target Path In User Home
TargetPathInUserHome.description: If the target path is located within a user home directory.

AllowIdentifiedDevelopers.title: Allow Identified Developers
AllowIdentifiedDevelopers.description: If the key is present and has a value of YES, Gatekeeper's "Mac App Store and identified developers” option is chosen. If the key is present and has a value of NO, Gatekeeper's "Mac App Store” option is chosen. If EnableAssessment is not true, this key has no effect.

EnableAssessment.title: Enable Gatekeeper
EnableAssessment.description: If the key is present and has a value of YES, Gatekeeper is enabled. If the key is present and has a value of NO, Gatekeeper is disabled.

DisableOverride.title: Disable contextual menu override of Gatekeeper
DisableOverride.description: If YES, the Finder's contextual menu item will be disabled.

com.apple.systempreferences.title: System Preferences
com.apple.systempreferences.description: Use this section to define enabled or disabled Preference Panes in System Preferences.

AttentionPrefBundleIDs.title: Attention Preference Pane Bundle IDs
AttentionPrefBundleIDs.description: Not documented by Apple, but by entering 0 for individual System Preference pane bundle IDs, or by adding this preference and leaving the dictionary blank, it is possible to suppress the alert icon from appearing on the System Preferences app (ex. when software updates are available).

DisabledPreferencePanes.title: Disabled Preference Panes
DisabledPreferencePanes.description: Disabled Preference Panes within the System Preferences application.

DisabledSettingsExtensions.title: Disabled Settings Extensions
DisabledSettingsExtensions.description: System settings extensions that will be disabled. All other extensions will be enabled. When the key is specified, Disabled Preference Panes and Enabled Preference Panes are ignored. Disabling a system extension will disable all of the sections it provides.

EnabledPreferencePanes.title: Enabled Preference Panes
EnabledPreferencePanes.description: Allowed Preference Panes within the System Preferences application.

HiddenPreferencePanes.title: Hidden Preference Panes
HiddenPreferencePanes.description: Hidden Preference Panes within the System Preferences application.

com.apple.systemuiserver.title: Allowed Media and Menu Bar Extras
com.apple.systemuiserver.description: Allowed media management and menu bar extras settings

logout-eject.title: Eject on logout
logout-eject.description: Volumes to eject when the user logs out.

harddisk-external.title: External Disk
harddisk-external.description: This key is the default for media types that donʼt fall into other categories. Like internally installed SD-Cards and USB flash drives.

menuExtras.title: Menu Extras
menuExtras.description: List of menu extras to combine with the user's menu bar

mount-controls.title: Volume Mount Controls
mount-controls.description: Media type dictionary to control volume mounting.

harddisk-external.title: External Disk
harddisk-external.description: This key is the default for media types that donʼt fall into other categories. Like internally installed SD-Cards and USB flash drives.

unmount-controls.title: Volume Unmount Controls
unmount-controls.description: Media type dictionary to control volume unmounting.

harddisk-external.title: External Disk
harddisk-external.description: This key is the default for media types that donʼt fall into other categories. Like internally installed SD-Cards and USB flash drives.

com.apple.thirdactiveethernet.managed.title: 802.1X Ethernet: Third Active
com.apple.thirdactiveethernet.managed.description: Use this section to define Third Active Ethernet settings

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. If false, the authentication fails if the certificate isn't already trusted.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

com.apple.thirdethernet.managed.title: 802.1X Ethernet: Third
com.apple.thirdethernet.managed.description: Use this section to define Third Ethernet settings

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. If false, the authentication fails if the certificate isn't already trusted.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

TMAutomaticTimeOnlyEnabled.title: Enable automatic time synchronization
TMAutomaticTimeOnlyEnabled.description: If enabled, ensures the uniformity of time stamps for information systems with multiple system clocks and systems connected over a network.

AllowedRemotes.title: Allowed Remotes
AllowedRemotes.description: List of permitted iOS remote devices restricted on this device.

AllowedTVs.title: Allowed TVs
AllowedTVs.description: List of permitted tvOS remote devices restricted on this device.

closeViewFarPoint.title: Minimum Zoom
closeViewFarPoint.description: The minimal zoom magnification that can be set in the Zoom options in an integer value between 1 and 40

closeViewHotkeysEnabled.title: Enable Zoom via Keyboard
closeViewHotkeysEnabled.description: Turns on "Use keyboard shortcuts to zoom" in the zoom options

closeViewNearPoint.title: Maximum Zoom
closeViewNearPoint.description: The maximal zoom magnification that can be set in the Zoom options in an integer value between 1 and 40

closeViewScrollWheelToggle.title: Enable Zoom via ScrollWheel
closeViewScrollWheelToggle.description: Turns on "Use scroll gesture with modifier keys to zoom" in the zoom options

closeViewShowPreview.title: Show preview rectangle when zoomed out
closeViewShowPreview.description: Turns on "Show preview rectangle" in the Zoom options

closeViewSmoothImages.title: Smooth images
closeViewSmoothImages.description: Turns on "Smooth images" in the Zoom options

contrast.title: Display Contrast
contrast.description: The contrast value in the Display options.

flashScreen.title: Flash screen on alert sound
flashScreen.description: Turns on "Flash the screen when an alert sound occurs" in the Audio options

grayscale.title: Use Grayscale
grayscale.description: Turns on "Use grayscale" in the Display options

mouseDriver.title: Enable Mouse Keys
mouseDriver.description: Turns on "Enable Mouse Keys" in the Pointer Control options. Mouse Keys allows the mouse pointer to be controlled using the keyboard number pad

mouseDriverCursorSize.title: Cursor Size
mouseDriverCursorSize.description: The size of the mouse cursor in a decimal value between 1 and 4, where 1 is normal and 4 is the maximum

mouseDriverIgnoreTrackpad.title: Ignore built-in trackpad
mouseDriverIgnoreTrackpad.description: Turns on "Ignore built-in trackpad when mouse or wireless trackpad is present" in the Mouse & Trackpad options

mouseDriverInitialDelay.title: Initial delay
mouseDriverInitialDelay.description: The initial delay before moving the mouse cursor with Mouse Keys in a decimal value representing seconds

mouseDriverMaxSpeed.title: Maximum speed
mouseDriverMaxSpeed.description: The maximum speed for the cursor when using Mouse Keys in an integer value between 1 and 32, where 1 is the slowest and 32 is the fastest

slowKey.title: Enable Slow Keys
slowKey.description: Turns on "Slow Keys" in the Keyboard options. Slow keys adjusts the amount of time between when a key is pressed and when it is activated

slowKeyBeepOn.title: Use click key sounds
slowKeyBeepOn.description: Turns on "Use click key sounds" for Slow Keys in the Keyboard options

slowKeyDelay.title: Acceptance delay
slowKeyDelay.description: The acceptance delay for Slow Keys in miliseconds

stereoAsMono.title: Play stereo audio as mono
stereoAsMono.description: Turns on "Play stereo audio as mono" in the Audio options

stickyKey.title: Enable Sticky Keys
stickyKey.description: Turns on "Sticky Keys" in the Keyboard options. Sticky keys allows modifier keys to be set without having to hold the key down

stickyKeyBeepOnModifier.title: Beep when a modifier key is set
stickyKeyBeepOnModifier.description: Turns on "Beep when a modifier key is set" for Sticky Keys in Keyboard options

stickyKeyShowWindow.title: Display pressed keys on screen
stickyKeyShowWindow.description: Turns on "Display pressed keys on screen" for Sticky Keys in Keyboard options

voiceOverOnOffKey.title: Enable VoiceOver
voiceOverOnOffKey.description: VoiceOver provides spoken and brailled descriptions of items on the computer screen and provides control of the computer through the user of the keyboard

whiteOnBlack.title: Invert colors
whiteOnBlack.description: Turns on "Invert colors" in Display options

com.apple.webClip.managed.title: Web Clips
com.apple.webClip.managed.description: Use this section to define web clips

FullScreen.title: Full Screen
FullScreen.description: Opens the URL as a web app without a browser

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: The icon to use for the Web Clip

IgnoreManifestScope.title: Ignore Manifest Scope
IgnoreManifestScope.description: If true, a full screen web clip will not show the Safari UI when navigating to URLs other than the web clip's own.

IsRemovable.title: Removable
IsRemovable.description: Whether the Web Clip can be removed by users

Label.title: Label
Label.description: The name of the Web Clip

Precomposed.title: Precomposed Icon
Precomposed.description: Prevents the iOS device from adding a shine to the image

TargetApplicationBundleIdentifier.title: Target Application Bundle Identifier
TargetApplicationBundleIdentifier.description: Bundle identifier of the application that opens this web clip's URL.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: The URL of the web clip.

AllowListBookmarks.title: Allow List Bookmarks
AllowListBookmarks.description: If present, these URLs are added to the browser's bookmarks, and the user is not allowed to visit any sites other than these. The number of these URLs should be limited to about 500.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: URL of the allow list bookmark.

AutoFilterEnabled.title: Limit adult content automatically
AutoFilterEnabled.description:
Optional. If true, automatic filtering is enabled. This function evaluates each web page as it is loaded and attempts to identify and block content not suitable for children.

The search algorithm is complex and may vary from release to release, but it is basically looking for adult language, i.e. swearing and sexually explicit language. The default value is false.

ContentFilterUUID.title: Content Filter UUID
ContentFilterUUID.description: Global identifier of the content filter configuration in this payload. Used for processing network traffic of managed apps with an identical attribute by the filter.

FilterDataProviderBundleIdentifier.title: Filter Data Provider System Extension Bundle ID
FilterDataProviderBundleIdentifier.description: The bundle identifier string of the Filter Data Provider System Extension. This string identifies the Filter Data Provider when the filter starts running.

FilterDataProviderDesignatedRequirement.title: Filter Data Provider Designated Requirement
FilterDataProviderDesignatedRequirement.description: The designated requirement string that is embedded in the code signature of the Filter Data Provider System Extension. This string identifies the Filter Data Provider when the filter starts running.

FilterPacketProviderBundleIdentifier.title: Filter Packet Provider Bundle ID
FilterPacketProviderBundleIdentifier.description: The bundle identifier string of the Filter Packet Provider System Extension. This string identifies the Filter Packet Provider when the filter starts running.

FilterPacketProviderDesignatedRequiremen.title: Filter Packet Provider Designated Requirement
FilterPacketProviderDesignatedRequiremen.description: The designated requirement string that is embedded in the code signature of the Filter Packet Provider System Extension. This string identifies the Filter Packet Provider when the filter starts running.

Organization.title: Organization
Organization.description: An Organization string that will be passed to the 3rd party plugin.

UserDefinedName.title: Filter Configuration Display Name
UserDefinedName.description: A string which will be displayed for this filtering configuration.

VendorConfig.title: Vendor Configuration
VendorConfig.description: Custom key/value pairs for the filtering service plugin

WhitelistedBookmarks.title: Allowlisted Bookmarks
WhitelistedBookmarks.description: If present, these URLs are added to the browser's bookmarks, and the user is not allowed to visit any sites other than these. The number of these URLs should be limited to about 500.

com.apple.wifi.managed.title: Wi-Fi
com.apple.wifi.managed.description: Use this section to define Wi-Fi settings

AutoJoin.title: Auto Join
AutoJoin.description: Automatically join the network without notifying users.

CaptiveBypass.title: Disable Captive Network Detection
CaptiveBypass.description: Users won't have an opportunity to join networks that require agreements or other information prior to network access.

DisableAssociationMACRandomization.title: Disable MAC Address Randomization
DisableAssociationMACRandomization.description: If true, disables MAC address randomization for that Wi-Fi network while associated with the network. This also shows a privacy warning in Settings indicating that the network has reduced privacy protections.

DisplayedOperatorName.title: Provider Display Name
DisplayedOperatorName.description: Display name of the Passpoint service provider.

DomainName.title: Domain Name
DomainName.description: Domain name of the Passpoint service provider.

EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.title: Provision PAC Anonymously
EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.description: If set, provisions the device anonymously. Note that there are known man-in-the-middle attacks for anonymous provisioning.

EAPFASTUsePAC.title: Use PAC
EAPFASTUsePAC.description: If set, the device will use an existing PAC if it's present. Otherwise the server must present its identity using a certificate.

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user.

TLSCertificateIsRequired.title: TLSCertificateIsRequired
TLSCertificateIsRequired.description:
If 'true', allows for two-factor authentication for EAP-TTLS, PEAP, or EAP-FAST. If 'false', allows for zero-factor authentication for EAP-TLS.
If you don't specify a value, the default is 'true' for EAP-TLS, and 'false' for other EAP types.

TLSTrustedCertificates.title: TLS Trusted Certificates
TLSTrustedCertificates.description: An array of trusted certificates. Each entry in the array must contain certificate data that represents an anchor certificate used for verifying the server certificate.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

UserName.title: Username
UserName.description: Username. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login.

UserPassword.title: Password
UserPassword.description: Password. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login.

EnableIPv6.title: Enable IPv6
EnableIPv6.description: If 'true', enables IPv6 on this interface.

EncryptionType.title: Encryption Type
EncryptionType.description: Wireless network encryption to use when connecting. The None value is available in iOS 5.0 and later and the WPA2 value is available in iOS 8.0 and later

HIDDEN_NETWORK.title: Hidden Network
HIDDEN_NETWORK.description: Specify whether the network that the device connects to is broadcasting its identity.

IsHotspot.title: Is Hotspot
IsHotspot.description: If the network should be treated as a Legacy Hotspot or Passpoint network.

NAIRealmNames.title: Realm Names
NAIRealmNames.description: Enter the known NAI realm names.

PFC_InterfaceSelector.title: Network Interface
PFC_InterfaceSelector.description: Type of network interface on the device.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: Specifies the password for the access point.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the certificate payload containing an identity used as the client credential.

ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.title: Proxy PAC Fallback
ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.description: Enable to allow direct connection if PAC is unreachable

ProxyPACURL.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPACURL.description: URL used to receive proxy settings. If no URL is specified, the device uses the web proxy autodiscovery protocol (WPAD) to discover proxies

ProxyPassword.title: Proxy Password
ProxyPassword.description: The password for the manual proxy connection.

ProxyServer.title: Proxy Server
ProxyServer.description: The hostname of the proxy server.

ProxyServerPort.title: Proxy Server Port
ProxyServerPort.description: The port used to connect to the proxy server.

ProxyType.title: Proxy Type
ProxyType.description: The type of proxy configuration to use for this wireless connection.

ProxyUsername.title: Proxy Username
ProxyUsername.description: The user name for the manual proxy connection.

QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.title: Allow List App Identifiers
QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.description: Add specific apps to an allow list for QoS marking.

QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.title: QoS marking for audio/video calls
QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.description: Enable QoS for WiFi Calling, FaceTime, SMS, etc.

QoSMarkingEnabled.title: Allow QoS marking
QoSMarkingEnabled.description: Enable any kind of QoS marking.

QoSMarkingWhitelistedAppIdentifiers.title: Allowlisted App Identifiers
QoSMarkingWhitelistedAppIdentifiers.description: Add specific apps to an allow list for QoS marking.

RoamingConsortiumOIs.title: Roaming OIs
RoamingConsortiumOIs.description: Enter a series of digits corresponding to one of the service provider's Passpoint network.

SSID_STR.title: Service Set Identifier (SSID)
SSID_STR.description: Displayed name of the wireless network

ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.title: Connect to roaming partner Passpoint networks
ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.description: Specify whether to connect to additional Passpoint networks pre-approved by the service provider.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

TLSCertificateRequired.title: Certificate Required
TLSCertificateRequired.description: If set, force a non-default authentication method. (if YES, uses certificate from PayloadCertificateUUID).

fsnameservers.title: File system name servers
fsnameservers.description: The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of each Xsan file server.

sanName.title: Xsan name
sanName.description: The name of the Xsan network.

sharedSecret.title: Authentication secret
sharedSecret.description: The secret credential used to join the Xsan network.

AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.title: Allow Shift Right to Indent Whitespace Only Lines
AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.description: By default, the "Shift Right" command on the Text menu will not add indentation to lines that are empty or consist entirely of white space. If you would prefer to indent every line, regardless of its whitespace-only nature, set this preference to 'true'.

AllowVolumeMountDuringStateRestore.title: Allow Volume Mount During State Restore
AllowVolumeMountDuringStateRestore.description: BBEdit provides control over whether documents on remote servers - FTP/SFTP - or unmounted volumes are opened when automatically reopening documents at application startup. You can modify its behavior by setting this to 'true'.

AlwaysUseSystemAppearanceForTitleBar.title: AlwaysUseSystemAppearanceForTitleBar
AlwaysUseSystemAppearanceForTitleBar.description: BBEdit will use a light or dark (system-defined) appearance for the window title bar, appropriate to the color scheme. If you would prefer that BBEdit always use the system standard - light - appearance, set this preference to 'true'.

AskForUnguessableFileEncoding.title: AskForUnguessableFileEncoding
AskForUnguessableFileEncoding.description: Ordinarily, BBEdit will only ask you to choose a file's encoding when it can't otherwise figure out what the encoding is, and your "if the file's encoding can't be guessed" preference is a UTF-8 or UTF-16 variant. This should be fine for general use, but if for some reason you always want BBEdit to ask you when it can't guess a file's encoding, even if your preference would do the job, you can set this to 'true'.

AskXcodeForOpenFileByName.title: Ask XCode to Open File by Name
AskXcodeForOpenFileByName.description: If Xcode is running, Open Selection and Open File by Name will ask it for a path to the file name; if something useful comes back, BBEdit will open it. If for some reason you are using Xcode but don't want BBEdit to do this, you can turn it off by setting this to 'false'.

AutoRevealSelectedDocumentInProjectList.title: AutoRevealSelectedDocumentInProjectList
AutoRevealSelectedDocumentInProjectList.description: BBEdit will not automatically reveal documents in the project list when you select them;  View => Reveal in Project List works for this purpose. If you want automatic revealing, set to this to 'true'

AutoSaveIntervalInMinutes_v2.title: AutoSave Interval
AutoSaveIntervalInMinutes_v2.description: If document auto-save for crash recovery is on, this preference will define the default save time interval.

BRIEFStateTimeout.title: Brief State Timeout
BRIEFStateTimeout.description: The progressive (BRIEF compatible) behavior of the Home and End keys operates within a specific time period; if you wait longer than that, the behavior state resets. The factory default timeout period is ten seconds.

BalanceIncludesDelimiters.title: Balance Includes Delimiters
BalanceIncludesDelimiters.description: By default, the "Balance" command (or double-clicking on a delimiter to balance) does not include the delimiters in the resulting selection. If you would like for it to do so, set this preference to 'true'.

CloseOFBNWindowAfterOpeningSelection.title: CloseOFBNWindowAfterOpeningSelection
CloseOFBNWindowAfterOpeningSelection.description: By default, the "Open File by Name" window stays open when you click the "Open" button. However, if you would prefer for it to act more like a modal dialog, set this to 'true'.

CommentWholeLineWithInsertionPoint.title: Comment Whole Line with Insertion Point
CommentWholeLineWithInsertionPoint.description: When using the Un/Comment command, if nothing is selected, BBEdit will use the line comment delimiter to comment (or uncomment) the entire line. If you would prefer that BBEdit insert the line-comment delimiter at the insertion point instead, set this preference to 'false'.

CounterpartSiblingSearchNames.title: CounterpartSiblingSearchNames
CounterpartSiblingSearchNames.description:
When the active document is either a source or a header file, the "Open Counterpart" command will now search the siblings of this file's parent for eligible counterparts. By default, BBEdit will only search in such folders if their names match one of the following patterns (including wildcards): `inc*`, `source`, `src`, or `*priv*`. If you wish to add additional qualifying names, you may do so by setting "CounterpartSiblingSearchNames" to contain a comma-delimited list of folder name patterns.

Any whitespace surrounding the provided names will be stripped.

DefaultLanguageNameForNewDocuments.title: Default Language for New Documents
DefaultLanguageNameForNewDocuments.description: If you like, you can set the default language for new untitled documents.

Diff_IgnoreRCSKeywords.title: Ignore RCS Keywords
Diff_IgnoreRCSKeywords.description: When comparing text files, BBEdit will canonicalize RCS keywords to their unexpanded state, so that the values of RCS keywords are not significant to the differences calculations. If you wish, you can disable this, so that any chance in the RCS keywords on a line will cause the line to appear in the differences.

DisableCtagsScanOnRemoteVolumes.title: Disable Ctags Scan on Remote Volumes
DisableCtagsScanOnRemoteVolumes.description:
When editing files that are on remote file servers - AFP, NFS, SMB, etc. -, BBEdit will not look for directory-relative ctags data files. This is a particular performance win when the file is located on a volume mounted via MacFUSE/SSH or similar, or if the file server is over a slow or high-latency link.

To enable scanning for tags files on remote volumes, set this to 'false'.

DisablePassiveFTP.title: Disable Passive FTP
DisablePassiveFTP.description:
Settings are available for disabling passive FTP, in order to deal with hosts that misbehave when sent the PASV command.

Passive FTP can be disabled per host, per domain, or globally.

Editor_AlwaysOpenQuickFind.title: Always Open Quick Find
Editor_AlwaysOpenQuickFind.description: The Live Search bar is not visible by default, but appears when you choose "Live Search" from the Search menu. If you would like the Live Search bar to be visible in each new document that you create or open, set this to 'true'.

Editor_AutoWordCountSizeThreshold.title: Auto Word Count Size Threshold
Editor_AutoWordCountSizeThreshold.description: Automatic word counting is disabled for documents over a set size threshold, in order to avoid needless delays when working on very large documents. The factory default is 16M characters - 16777216 -, but you may change this limit. Setting to 0 disables the limit check entirely.

Editor_ControlArrowCamelCase.title: Control Arrow Camel Case
Editor_ControlArrowCamelCase.description:
BBEdit supports "camel case" navigation: press Control-left-arrow or Control-right-arrow to jump to the next (or previous) transition from lower-case to upper-case characters (or a word boundary, whichever comes first).

Note that this use of Control-left-arrow and Control-right-arrow replaces the pre-8.5 behavior of using these key combinations to scroll horizontally. If you prefer the old behavior, set these this preference to 'false'.

Editor_ControlArrowHScroll.title: Control Arrow Horizontal Scroll
Editor_ControlArrowHScroll.description:
BBEdit supports "camel case" navigation: press Control-left-arrow or Control-right-arrow to jump to the next (or previous) transition from lower-case to upper-case characters (or a word boundary, whichever comes first).

Note that this use of Control-left-arrow and Control-right-arrow replaces the pre-8.5 behavior of using these key combinations to scroll horizontally. If you prefer the old behavior, set these this preference to 'true'.

Editor_DeleteIndentationWhitespaceToTabS.title: Delete Indentation Whitespace to Tab Stop
Editor_DeleteIndentationWhitespaceToTabS.description: When you backspace from the insertion point, BBEdit will delete a tab stop's worth of spaces if there are only spaces (and tabs) between the insertion point and the start of the line on which you're editing. This may be disabled by setting this preference to 'false'.

Editor_SpellCheckLengthLimit.title: Spell Check Length Limit
Editor_SpellCheckLengthLimit.description: Since "Find All Misspelled Words" is pretty much pointless on files over a certain size, the maximum amount of text checked by this command is limited to 1M - 1024 squared - characters. This may be adjusted. Setting to 0 supresses the limit altogether.

EnableAutoSave_v2.title: Enable AutoSave
EnableAutoSave_v2.description: Document auto-save for crash recovery is on by default, to change this set this to 'false'.

EnableSSHCompression.title: Enable SSH Compression
EnableSSHCompression.description: Some servers don't work correctly when SSH compression is enabled. To work around this, SSH compression can be disabled per host, per domain, or globally.

FTPShowParentDir.title: Show FTP Parent Directories
FTPShowParentDir.description: On FTP servers, when using 'Show items starting with ".",' the FTP server may return the `.` and `..` items as part of the listing. This is normal, but if you don't want to see these items, you can hide them.

FindAndReplaceHistorySize.title: Find & Replace History Size
FindAndReplaceHistorySize.description: By default, BBEdit will remember the 16 most recent search and replace strings/patterns for the popup menu in the Find and Multi-File Search windows. Setting the history to zero makes it infinite.

FindDialog_UsesFindScrap.title: Use Find Scrap
FindDialog_UsesFindScrap.description:
Like many Mac OS X applications, BBEdit supports the "Find Scrap", a feature of the OS that enables sharing of the "search for" string between applications. Some applications put inappropriate content - such as Web search strings - on the Find Scrap, which can cause the "search for" string in BBEdit's Find dialog to be replaced when you didn't expect it.

To tell BBEdit not to import the Find Scrap into its Find window, nor to export the "search for" string to the Find Scrap, set this to 'false'.

FixedWidthFontSmoothingThreshold.title: Fixed Width Font Smoothing Threshold
FixedWidthFontSmoothingThreshold.description: Whether or not BBEdit uses text smoothing - antialiasing - may be adjusted separately for fixed-width and for proportional fonts. The factory default smoothing thresholds are 8pt for fixed width fonts, and 4pt for proportional fonts, respectively.

FlashBalancePointsWhenNavigating.title: Flash Balance Points When Navigating
FlashBalancePointsWhenNavigating.description: When you use the right-arrow key to navigate over a closing delimiter (right paren/brace/bracket/curly quote), the opening delimiter will be briefly highlighted. If you wish to turn this off, set this preference to 'false'.

FontSmoothingThreshold.title: Font Smoothing Threshold
FontSmoothingThreshold.description: Whether or not BBEdit uses text smoothing - antialiasing - may be adjusted separately for fixed-width and for proportional fonts. Font sizes above the specified FixedWidthFontSmoothingThreshold are smoothed; font sizes below the threshold are not.

FullScreenWidthThreshold.title: Full Screen Width Threshold
FullScreenWidthThreshold.description:
