The policy specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (such as "*.example.com") to be treated as secure contexts. The intent is to allow organizations to set up a staging server for internal web development, so that their developers can test out features requiring secure contexts without having to deploy TLS on the staging server.

Setting a list of URLs in this policy has the same effect as setting the command-line flag '--unsafely-treat-insecure-origin-as-secure' to a comma-separated list of the same URLs. If the policy is set, it will override the command-line flag.

For more information on secure contexts, see https://www.w3.org/TR/secure-contexts/

PasswordLeakDetectionEnabled.title: Enable password leak detection
PasswordLeakDetectionEnabled.description: This policy can be used to force enable or force disable credential leak checking in Brave Browser.

PasswordManagerEnabled.title: Enable saving passwords to the password manager
PasswordManagerEnabled.description: If this setting is enabled, users can have Brave Browser memorize passwords and provide them automatically the next time they log in to a site.

PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.title: Configure the change password URL.
PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.description:
Configure the change password URL (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only). Password protection service will send users to this URL to change their password after seeing a warning in the browser.
In order for Brave Browser to correctly capture the new password fingerprint on this change password page, please make sure your change password page follows the guidelines on https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/create-amazing-password-forms.

PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.title: Configure the list of enterprise login URLs where password protection service should capture fingerprint of password.
PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.description:
Configure the list of enterprise login URLs (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only). Fingerprint of password will be captured on these URLs and used for password reuse detection.
In order for Brave Browser to correctly capture password fingerprints, please make sure your login pages follow the guidelines on https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/create-amazing-password-forms.

PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.title: Password protection warning trigger
PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.description: Allows you to control the triggering of passwore protection warning. Password protection alerts users when they reuse their protected password on potentially suspicious sites.

PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.title: Payment Method Query
PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to check if the user has payment methods saved.

PluginsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PluginsBlockedForUrls.title: Block the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PolicyAtomicGroupsEnabled.title: Enable Policy Atomic Groups
PolicyAtomicGroupsEnabled.description: Enables the concept of policy atomic groups.

PolicyDictionaryMultipleSourceMergeList.title: Allow merging dictionary policies from different sources
PolicyDictionaryMultipleSourceMergeList.description: Allows the selected policies to be merged when they come from different sources, with the same scopes and level. Entered strings must match a Brave Browser policy / key name that uses a dictionary for its data type.

PolicyListMultipleSourceMergeList.title: Allow merging list policies from different sources
PolicyListMultipleSourceMergeList.description: Allows the selected policies to be merged when they come from different sources, with the same scopes and level. Entered strings must match a Brave Browser policy / key name that use an array (list) of strings for its data type.

PolicyRefreshRate.title: Policy Refresh Rate
PolicyRefreshRate.description: Refresh rate for user policy. Specifies the period in milliseconds at which the device management service is queried for user policy information. Setting this policy overrides the default value of 3 hours. Valid values for this policy are in the range from 1800000 (30 minutes) to 86400000 (1 day).

PopupsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow popups on these sites
PopupsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to open popups.

PopupsBlockedForUrls.title: Block popups on these sites
PopupsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to open popups.

PrintHeaderFooter.title: Print Headers & Footers
PrintHeaderFooter.description: Force 'headers and footers' to be on or off in the printing dialog.

PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.title: Use System Default Printer as Default
PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.description: Causes Brave Browser to use the system default printer as the default choice in Print Preview instead of the most recently used printer.

PrinterPaperSizeDefault.title: Default printer paper size
PrinterPaperSizeDefault.description: Overrides default printing page size. If 'custom' is provided, custom size width and height keys must also be included.

PrinterTypeDenyList.title: Printer Type Deny List
PrinterTypeDenyList.description: The printers of types placed on the deny list will be disabled from being discovered or having their capabilities fetched.

PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.title: Background graphics printing mode
PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.description: Restricts background graphics printing mode. Unset policy is treated as no restriction.

PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.title: Default background graphics printing mode
PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.description: Overrides default background graphics printing mode.

PrintingEnabled.title: Enable printing
PrintingEnabled.description: Enables printing in Brave Browser and prevents users from changing this setting.

PrivacySandboxAdMeasurementEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Ad Measurement Enabled
PrivacySandboxAdMeasurementEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Ad measurement setting can be disabled for your users.

PrivacySandboxAdTopicsEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Ad Topics Enabled
PrivacySandboxAdTopicsEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Ad measurement setting can be disabled for your users.

PrivacySandboxPromptEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Prompt Enabled
PrivacySandboxPromptEnabled.description: A policy to control whether your users see the Privacy Sandbox prompt.

PrivacySandboxSiteEnabledAdsEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Site Enabled Ads Enabled
PrivacySandboxSiteEnabledAdsEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Site-suggested ads setting can be disabled for your users.

ProfilePickerOnStartupAvailability.title: Profile picker availabily on startup
ProfilePickerOnStartupAvailability.description: Specifies whether the profile picker is enabled, disabled or forced at the browser startup. By default the profile picker is not shown if the browser starts in guest or incognito mode, a profile directory and/or urls are specified by command line, an app is explicitly requested to open, the browser was launched by a native notification, there is only one profile available or the policy ForceBrowserSignin is set to true.

PromotionalTabsEnabled.title: Enable showing full-tab promotional content
PromotionalTabsEnabled.description: Allows you to control the presentation of full-tab promotional and/or educational content in Brave Browser.

PromptForDownloadLocation.title: Ask where to save each file before downloading
PromptForDownloadLocation.description:
If the policy is enabled, the user will be asked where to save each file before downloading.
If the policy is disabled, downloads will start immediately, and the user will not be asked where to save the file.
If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting.

ProxyBypassList.title: Comma-separated list of proxy bypass rules
ProxyBypassList.description: Brave Browser will bypass any proxy for the list of hosts given here.

ProxyMode.title: Choose how to specify proxy server settings
ProxyMode.description: Allows you to specify the proxy server used by Brave Browser and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxyPacUrl.title: URL to a proxy .pac file
ProxyPacUrl.description: You can specify a URL to a proxy .pac file here.

ProxyServer.title: Address or URL of proxy server
ProxyServer.description: You can specify the URL of the proxy server here.

ProxyServerMode.title: Proxy server settings
ProxyServerMode.description:
This policy is deprecated, use ProxyMode instead.

Allows you to specify the proxy server used by Brave Browser and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxySettings.title: Proxy Settings
ProxySettings.description:
Configures the proxy settings for Brave Browser. These proxy settings will be available for ARC-apps too.

If you enable this setting, Brave Browser and ARC-apps ignore all proxy-related options specified from the command line.

ProxyBypassList.title: Proxy Bypass List
ProxyBypassList.description: Defines a comma-separated list of hosts for which Brave Browser bypasses any proxy.

ProxyMode.title: Proxy Mode
ProxyMode.description: Specifies the proxy server Brave Browser uses and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxyPacMandatory.title: Proxy PAC Mandatory
ProxyPacMandatory.description: Prevents the network stack from falling back to direct connections with invalid or unavailable PAC script.

ProxyPacUrl.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPacUrl.description: Specifies the URL for a proxy auto-config (PAC) file.

ProxyServer.title: Proxy Server URL
ProxyServer.description: Specifies the URL of the proxy server

QuicAllowed.title: Allow QUIC protocol
QuicAllowed.description:
If this policy is set to true or not set usage of QUIC protocol in Brave Browser is allowed.
If this policy is set to false usage of QUIC protocol is disallowed.

RegisteredProtocolHandlers.title: Register protocol handlers
RegisteredProtocolHandlers.description: Allows you to register a list of protocol handlers. This can only be a recommended policy. The property |protocol| should be set to the scheme such as 'mailto' and the property |url| should be set to the URL pattern of the application that handles the scheme. The pattern can include a '%s', which if present will be replaced by the handled URL.

RelaunchNotification.title: Notify a user that a browser relaunch is recommended or required
RelaunchNotification.description: Notify users that Brave Browser must be relaunched to apply a pending update.

RelaunchNotificationPeriod.title: Update time period
RelaunchNotificationPeriod.description: Allows you to set the time period, in milliseconds, over which users are notified that Brave Browser must be relaunched or that a Brave Browser OS device must be restarted to apply a pending update.

RemoteAccessHostAllowClientPairing.title: Enable or disable PIN-less authentication for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostAllowClientPairing.description: If this setting is enabled or not configured, then users can opt to pair clients and hosts at connection time, eliminating the need to enter a PIN every time.

RemoteAccessHostAllowFileTransfer.title: Allow remote access file transfer
RemoteAccessHostAllowFileTransfer.description: Controls the ability of a user connected to a remote access host to transfer files between the client and the host. This does not apply to remote assistance connections, which do not support file transfer.

RemoteAccessHostAllowGnubbyAuth.title: Allow gnubby authentication for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostAllowGnubbyAuth.description: If this setting is enabled, then gnubby authentication requests will be proxied across a remote host connection.

RemoteAccessHostAllowRelayedConnection.title: Enable the use of relay servers by the remote access host
RemoteAccessHostAllowRelayedConnection.description: Enables usage of relay servers when remote clients are trying to establish a connection to this machine.

RemoteAccessHostClientDomain.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access clients
RemoteAccessHostClientDomain.description: Configure the required domain name for remote access clients. This policy is deprecated. Please use RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList instead.

RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access clients
RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList.description: Configures the required client domain names that will be imposed on remote access clients and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostDomain.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostDomain.description: Configure the required domain name for remote access hosts. This policy is deprecated. Please use RemoteAccessHostDomainList instead.

RemoteAccessHostDomainList.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostDomainList.description: Configures the required host domain names that will be imposed on remote access hosts and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal.title: Enable firewall traversal from remote access host
RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal.description: Enables usage of STUN servers when remote clients are trying to establish a connection to this machine.

RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername.title: Require that the name of the local user and the remote access host owner match
RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername.description: If this setting is enabled, then the remote access host compares the name of the local user (that the host is associated with) and the name of the Google account registered as the host owner (i.e. "johndoe" if the host is owned by "johndoe@example.com" Google account).  The remote access host will not start if the name of the host owner is different from the name of the local user that the host is associated with.  RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername policy should be used together with RemoteAccessHostDomain to also enforce that the Google account of the host owner is associated with a specific domain (i.e. "example.com").

RemoteAccessHostRequireCurtain.title: Enable curtaining of remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostRequireCurtain.description: Enables curtaining of remote access hosts while a connection is in progress.

RemoteAccessHostTalkGadgetPrefix.title: Configure the TalkGadget prefix for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostTalkGadgetPrefix.description: Configures the TalkGadget prefix that will be used by remote access hosts and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.title: URL where remote access clients should obtain their authentication token
RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.description: If this policy is set, the remote access host will require authenticating clients to obtain an authentication token from this URL in order to connect. Must be used in conjunction with RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.

RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationCertifica.title: Client certificate for connecting to RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl
RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationCertifica.description: If this policy is set, the host will use a client certificate with the given issuer CN to authenticate to RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl. Set it to "*" to use any available client certificate.

RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.title: URL for validating remote access client authentication token
RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.description: If this policy is set, the remote access host will use this URL to validate authentication tokens from remote access clients, in order to accept connections. Must be used in conjunction with RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.

RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange.title: Restrict the UDP port range used by the remote access host
RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange.description: Restricts the UDP port range used by the remote access host in this machine.

RestoreOnStartup.title: Action on startup
RestoreOnStartup.description: Allows you to specify the behavior on startup.

RestoreOnStartupURLs.title: URLs to open on startup
RestoreOnStartupURLs.description: If 'Open a list of URLs' is selected as the startup action, this allows you to specify the list of URLs that are opened. If left not set no URL will be opened on start up.

RestrictSigninToPattern.title: Restrict which users are allowed to sign in to Brave Browser
RestrictSigninToPattern.description: Contains a regular expression which is used to determine which users can sign in to Brave Browser.

RunAllFlashInAllowMode.title: Extend Flash content setting to all content
RunAllFlashInAllowMode.description: If you enable this setting, all Flash content embedded on websites that have been set to allow Flash in content settings -- either by the user or by enterprise policy -- will be run, including content from other origins or small content.

SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.title: Allow proceeding from the SSL warning page
SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.description:
Brave Browser shows a warning page when users navigate to sites that have SSL errors. By default or when this policy is set to true, users are allowed to click through these warning pages.
Setting this policy to false disallows users to click through any warning page.

SSLVersionMin.title: Minimum SSL version enabled
SSLVersionMin.description: If this policy is not configured then Brave Browser uses a default minimum version which is TLS 1.0.

SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.title: Automatic Update Install Prompt
SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.description: Controls the automatic update install prompt. When enabled, presents users with the option to allow automatic download and install of available updates. If disabled, disallows automatic updates and requires manual installation every time.

SUAutomaticallyUpdate.title: Enable Automatic Silent Updates
SUAutomaticallyUpdate.description: Controls automatic silent updates. If enabled, users will not be informed about updates and updates will be silently installed when the app quits.

SUFeedURL.title: Sparkle Feed URL
SUFeedURL.description: Setting this to a non-existent URL will disable the ability for users to manually check for updates. Useful when you intend to use your own software distribution mechanism to deploy updates.

SUScheduledCheckInterval.title: Automatic Update Check Interval
SUScheduledCheckInterval.description: Controls the automatic update check interval. The default is 1 day (86400 seconds). Setting to 0 disables updates.

SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains.title: Configure the list of domains on which Safe Browsing will not trigger warnings.
SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains.description:
Configure the list of domains which Safe Browsing will trust. This means:
Safe Browsing will not check for dangerous resources (e.g. phishing, malware, or unwanted software) if their URLs match these domains.
Safe Browsing's download protection service will not check downloads hosted on these domains.
Safe Browsing's password protection service will not check for password reuse if the page URL matches these domains.

SafeBrowsingEnabled.title: Enable Safe Browsing
SafeBrowsingEnabled.description: Enables Brave Browser's Safe Browsing feature and prevents users from changing this setting.

SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled.title: Enable Safe Browsing Extended Reporting
SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled.description: Enables Brave Browser's Safe Browsing Extended Reporting and prevents users from changing this setting.

SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowe.title: Allow users to opt in to Safe Browsing extended reporting
SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowe.description: This setting is deprecated, use SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled instead. Enabling or disabling SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled is equivalent to setting SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowed to False.

SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel.title: Safe Browsing protection level
SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel.description: Allows you to control whether Brave Browser's Safe Browsing feature is enabled and the mode it operates in. Safe Browsing 'enhanced' mode provides better security, but requires sharing more browsing information with Google.

SafeBrowsingWhitelistDomains.title: Configure the list of domains on which Safe Browsing will not trigger warnings.
SafeBrowsingWhitelistDomains.description:
Configure the list of domains which Safe Browsing will trust. This means:
Safe Browsing will not check for dangerous resources (e.g. phishing, malware, or unwanted software) if their URLs match these domains.
Safe Browsing's download protection service will not check downloads hosted on these domains.
Safe Browsing's password protection service will not check for password reuse if the page URL matches these domains.

SafeSitesFilterBehavior.title: Control SafeSites adult content filtering.
SafeSitesFilterBehavior.description:
This policy controls the application of the SafeSites URL filter.
This filter uses the Google Safe Search API to classify URLs as pornographic or not.

SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.title: Disable saving browser history
SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.description: Disables saving browser history in Brave Browser and prevents users from changing this setting.

ScreenCaptureAllowed.title: Screen Capture
ScreenCaptureAllowed.description: If enabled or not configured (default), a Web page can use screen-share APIs (e.g., getDisplayMedia() or the Desktop Capture extension API) to prompt the user to select a tab, window or desktop to capture.

ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.title: Enable scroll to text fragment
ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.description: This feature allows for hyperlinks and address bar URL navigations to target specific text within a web page, which will be scrolled to once the loading of the web page is complete.

SearchSuggestEnabled.title: Enable search suggestions
SearchSuggestEnabled.description: Enables search suggestions in Brave Browser's omnibox and prevents users from changing this setting.

SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.title: URLs/domains automatically permitted direct Security Key attestation
SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.description: Specifies URLs and domains for which no prompt will be shown when attestation certificates from Security Keys are requested. Additionally, a signal will be sent to the Security Key indicating that individual attestation may be used. Without this, users will be prompted in Chromium 65+ when sites request attestation of Security Keys.

SharedClipboardEnabled.title: Enable Shared Clipboard
SharedClipboardEnabled.description: Enables the Shared Clipboard feature which allows users to send text between Brave Browser Desktops and an Android device when Sync is enabled and the user is Signed-in.

ShowAppsShortcutInBookmarkBar.title: Show the apps shortcut in the bookmark bar
ShowAppsShortcutInBookmarkBar.description: Enables or disables the apps shortcut in the bookmark bar.

ShowCastIconInToolbar.title: Show the Google Cast toolbar icon
ShowCastIconInToolbar.description: If this policy is set to true, the Cast toolbar icon will always be shown on the toolbar or the overflow menu, and users will not be able to remove it.

ShowFullUrlsInAddressBar.title: Show Full URLs
ShowFullUrlsInAddressBar.description: This feature enables display of the full URL in the address bar. If this policy is set to True, then the full URL will be shown in the address bar, including schemes and subdomains. If this policy is set to False, then the default URL display will apply.

ShowHomeButton.title: Show Home button on toolbar
ShowHomeButton.description: Shows the Home button on Brave Browser's toolbar.

SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.title: Enabled Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG) support
SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.description: Enable support for Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG).

SigninAllowed.title: Allow sign in
SigninAllowed.description:
This policy is deprecated, consider using BrowserSignin instead.

Allows the user to sign in to Brave Browser.

SigninInterceptionEnabled.title: Enable signin interception
SigninInterceptionEnabled.description: This settings enables or disables signin interception. When this policy not set or is set to True, the signin interception dialog triggers when a Google account is added on the web, and the user may benefit from moving this account to another (new or existing) profile. When this is set to False, the signin interception dialog does not trigger.

SitePerProcess.title: Enable Site Isolation for every site
SitePerProcess.description: You might want to look at the IsolateOrigins policy setting to get the best of both worlds, isolation and limited impact for users, by using IsolateOrigins with a list of the sites you want to isolate. This setting, SitePerProcess, isolates all sites. If the policy is enabled, each site will run in its own process. If the policy is disabled, no explicit Site Isolation will happen and field trials of IsolateOrigins and SitePerProcess will be disabled. Users will still be able to enable SitePerProcess manually. If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting. On Brave Browser OS, it is recommended to also set the DeviceLoginScreenSitePerProcess device policy to the same value. If the values specified by the two policies don't match, a delay may be incurred when entering a user session while the value specified by user policy is being applied.

SpellCheckServiceEnabled.title: Enable or disable spell checking web service
SpellCheckServiceEnabled.description: Brave Browser can use a Google web service to help resolve spelling errors. If this setting is enabled, then this service is always used. If this setting is disabled, then this service is never used.

SpellcheckEnabled.title: Enable spellcheck
SpellcheckEnabled.description: If this policy is not set or enabled, the user is allowed to use spellcheck.

StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.title: Stricter Mixed Content Treatment
StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.description: This policy controls the treatment for mixed content (HTTP content in HTTPS sites) in the browser. If the policy is set to true or unset, audio and video mixed content will be autoupgraded to HTTPS (i.e. the URL will be rewritten as HTTPS, without a fallback if the resource is not available over HTTPS) and a 'Not Secure' warning will be shown in the URL bar for image mixed content. If the policy is set to false, autoupgrades will be disabled for audio and video, and no warning will be shown for images. This policy does not affect other types of mixed content other than audio, video, and images. This policy will no longer take effect starting in Chromium 84.

SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.title: Suppress the unsupported OS warning
SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.description: Suppresses the warning that appears when Brave Browser is running on a computer or operating system that is no longer supported.

SyncDisabled.title: Disable synchronization of data with Google
SyncDisabled.description: Disables data synchronization in Brave Browser using Google-hosted synchronization services and prevents users from changing this setting.

SyncTypesListDisabled.title: Sync types to disable
SyncTypesListDisabled.description: If this policy is set, all specified data types will be excluded from synchronization both for Google Sync as well as for roaming profile synchronization.

TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.title: Enable TLS 1.3 hardening for local anchors
TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.description: Enable a TLS 1.3 security feature for local trust anchors. This policy controls a security feature in TLS 1.3 which protects connections against downgrade attacks. It is backwards-compatible and will not affect connections to compliant TLS 1.2 servers or proxies. However, older versions of some TLS-intercepting proxies have an implementation flaw which causes them to be incompatible.

TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.title: Do not set window.opener for links targeting _blank
TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.description: Setting the policy to Disabled allows popups targeting _blank to access (via JavaScript) the page that requested to open the popup. Setting the policy to Enabled or leaving it unset causes the window.opener property to be set to null unless the anchor specifies rel="opener".

TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.title: Enable ending processes in Task Manager
TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.description: If set to false, the 'End process' button is disabled in the Task Manager.

ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.title: Third Party Storage Partitioning Blocked For Origins
ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify top-level (the url in the tab's address bar) origins which block third-party storage partitioning (partitioning of cross-origin iframe storage). If this policy is left not set or a top-level origin doesn't match then the value from DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSetting will be used.

TorDisabled.title: Disable Tor
TorDisabled.description: false = Tor Enabled; true = Tor Disabled

TotalMemoryLimitMb.title: Total Memory Limit
TotalMemoryLimitMb.description: Configures the amount of memory that a single Brave Browser instance can use before tabs start being discarded (I.E. the memory used by the tab will be freed and the tab will have to be reloaded when switched to) to save memory. The minimum allowed value is 1024.

TranslateEnabled.title: Enable Translate
TranslateEnabled.description: Enables the integrated Google Translate service on Brave Browser.

URLAllowlist.title: Allow access to a list of URLs
URLAllowlist.description: Allows access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to the URL block list. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLBlacklist.title: URL Blacklist
URLBlacklist.description: This policy prevents the user from loading web pages from blacklisted URLs. The denylist provides a list of URL patterns that specify which URLs will be denied. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLBlocklist.title: URL Blocklist
URLBlocklist.description: This policy prevents the user from loading web pages from blocked URLs. The blocklist provides a list of URL patterns that specify which URLs will be denied. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLWhitelist.title: Allow access to a list of URLs
URLWhitelist.description: Allows access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to the URL denylist. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

UnsafelyTreatInsecureOriginAsSecure.title: Origins or hostname patterns for which restrictions on insecure origins should not apply
UnsafelyTreatInsecureOriginAsSecure.description:
Deprecated in M69. Use OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOrigin instead.

The policy specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (such as "*.example.com") for which security restrictions on insecure origins will not apply.

UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled.title: Enable URL-keyed anonymized data collection
UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled.description: Enable URL-keyed anonymized data collection in Brave Browser and prevents users from changing this setting.

UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.title: Enable user agent client hints
UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.description: When enabled the User-Agent Client Hints feature sends granular request headers providing information about the user browser and environment.

UserDataDir.title: Set user data directory
UserDataDir.description: Configures the directory that Brave Browser will use for storing user data. See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used.

UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.title: User data snapshot retention limit
UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.description: Limits the number of user data snapshots retained for use in case of emergency rollback. If this policy is not set, the default value of 3 is used. If the policy is set to 0, no snapshots will be taken.

UserFeedbackAllowed.title: Allow user feedback
UserFeedbackAllowed.description: Allow user feedback. If the policy is set to false, users can not send feedback to Google.

VideoCaptureAllowed.title: Allow or deny video capture
VideoCaptureAllowed.description:
If enabled or not configured (default), the user will be prompted for
video capture access except for URLs configured in the
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls list which will be granted access without prompting.

VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.title: URLs that will be granted access to video capture devices without prompt
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.description:
Patterns in this list will be matched against the security
origin of the requesting URL.  If a match is found, access to audio
capture devices will be granted without prompt.

WPADQuickCheckEnabled.title: Enable WPAD optimization
WPADQuickCheckEnabled.description: Allows to turn off WPAD (Web Proxy Auto-Discovery) optimization in Brave Browser.

WebAppInstallForceList.title: WebApp Force Install List
WebAppInstallForceList.description: Specifies a list of websites that are installed silently, without user interaction, and which cannot be uninstalled nor disabled by the user.

WebComponentsV0Enabled.title: Re-enable Web Components v0 API until M84
WebComponentsV0Enabled.description: The Web Components v0 APIs (Shadow DOM v0, Custom Elements v0, and HTML Imports) were deprecated in 2018, and have been disabled by default starting in M80. This policy allows these features to be selectively re-enabled until M84.

WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.title: Allow WebDriver to Override Incompatible Policies
WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.description: This policy allows users of the WebDriver feature to override policies which can interfere with its operation.

WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.title: Allow legacy TLS/DTLS downgrade in WebRTC
WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.description: f enabled, WebRTC peer connections can downgrade to obsolete versions of the TLS/DTLS (DTLS 1.0, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1) protocols. When this policy is disabled or not set, these TLS/DTLS versions are disabled.

WebRtcEventLogCollectionAllowed.title: Allow collection of WebRTC event logs from Google services
WebRtcEventLogCollectionAllowed.description: If the policy is set to true, Brave Browser is allowed to collect WebRTC event logs from Google services (e.g. Google Meet), and upload those logs to Google.

WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.title: Allowed WebRTC local IP URLs
WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.description: Patterns in this list will be matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If a match is found or chrome://flags/#enable-webrtc-hide-local-ips-with-mdns is Disabled, the local IP addresses are shown in WebRTC ICE candidates. Otherwise, local IP addresses are concealed with mDNS hostnames.

WebRtcUdpPortRange.title: Restrict the range of local UDP ports used by WebRTC
WebRtcUdpPortRange.description: If the policy is set, the UDP port range used by WebRTC is restricted to the specified port interval (endpoints included).

WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.title: Automatically grant permission to these sites to connect to USB devices with the given vendor and product IDs
WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of urls that specify which sites will automatically be granted permission to access a USB device with the given vendor and product IDs.

WebUsbAskForUrls.title: Allow WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbAskForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to ask the user to grant them access to a USB device.

WebUsbBlockedForUrls.title: Block WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are prevented from asking the user to grant them access to a USB device.

AutoUpdateRollOutBucketIndex.title: AutoUpdateRollOutBucketIndex
AutoUpdateRollOutBucketIndex.description: Used to configure the Updates rollout period.

AutoUpdateState.title: AutoUpdateState
AutoUpdateState.description: Used to configure Citrix Receiver Updates state.

LegacyPublishedContentEnabled.title: LegacyPublishedContentEnabled
LegacyPublishedContentEnabled.description: Allows the use of non-HTTP(S) URLs

NetDisruptBrightness.title: NetDisruptBrightness
NetDisruptBrightness.description: Configures the greyscale brightness used for an inactive session. 100 = transparent, 0 = black

SSLCertificateRevocationCheckPolicy.title: SSLCertificateRevocationCheckPolicy
SSLCertificateRevocationCheckPolicy.description: This setting governs how a given trusted root certificate authority is treated during an attempt to open a remote session through SSL. When you enable this setting, the client checks whether or not the server's certificate is revoked.

SecurityAllowedTLSVersions.title: SecurityAllowedTLSVersions
SecurityAllowedTLSVersions.description: This setting specifies the TLS protocol versions that should be accepted during protocol negotiation. This information is represented as an array and any combination of the possible values is supported. When this setting is not configured, the values TLS10, TLS11 and TLS12 are used as the default values.

SecurityComplianceMode.title: SecurityComplianceMode
SecurityComplianceMode.description: Sets the security compliance mode for the policy. If you don't configure SecurityComplianceMode, FIPS is used as the default value.

ccid.title: CustomerID with Checksum (CCID)
ccid.description: The CCID licenses the CrowdStrike Falcon sensor to your customer ID.

groupingTags.title: Grouping Tags
groupingTags.description: Grouping Tags are an optional way to add text-based attributes that can be filtered on in Host Groups management. Multiple Grouping Tags can be added, separated by commas. Do not include spaces. See Documentation > Host and Host Group Management > Using Grouping Tags for more information.

provisioningToken.title: Provisioning Token
provisioningToken.description: Installation Tokens are an optional way to require additional, revocable tokens (passwords) as a security measure when licensing a sensor to your CID. See Documentation > Host and Host Group Management > Protecting your CID with installation tokens for more information. Installation Tokens are disabled by default.

allowAutomaticUpdates.title: Enable automatic updates
allowAutomaticUpdates.description: Setting this to true, automatic updates will be enabled

checkForUpdates.title: Check for new versions of installed plugins
checkForUpdates.description: Setting this to true, FxFactory will check for the latest versions of installed plugins

warnAboutMissingComponents.title: Notify when required components are missing
warnAboutMissingComponents.description: Setting this to true, FxFactory will send a notification when any components required for normal operation are missing from the system

warnAboutUnsupportedHost.title: Notify when products cannot be loaded by current application
warnAboutUnsupportedHost.description: Setting this to true, FxFactory will send a notification if any products cannot be loaded by the current application due to a compatibility issue

warnAboutUpdates.title: Notify when a new version of FxFactory is available
warnAboutUpdates.description: Setting this to true, FxFactory will send a notification when a new version is available, while using any application that loads FxFactory

warnAboutUpdatesToOtherSoftware.title: Notify when critical updates to other software are available
warnAboutUpdatesToOtherSoftware.description: Setting this to true, FxFactory will send a notification when it finds outdated software on your system that may interfere with the operation of its products

cache_file.title: Cache File
cache_file.description: Absolute path to a cache file of Active Directory results.

common_ad_connected.title: Common AD Connected
common_ad_connected.description: A common group that computers are put in when the inventory script actively connects to Active Directory.

common_group.title: Common Group
common_group.description: A common group to put all computers in.

group_prefix.title: Group Prefix
group_prefix.description: Group prefix used to filter groups from Active Directory.

ldap_host.title: LDAP Host
ldap_host.description: LDAP server to connect to for inventory purposes.

ldap_pw.title: LDAP Password
ldap_pw.description: Password to use to connect to LDAP.

ldap_user.title: LDAP User
ldap_user.description: User name to use to connect to LDAP.

ansible_playbook.title: Ansible Playbook
ansible_playbook.description: File name of the primary Ansible playbook to run relative to your <Destination> directory.

ansible_pull_exe.title: Ansible Pull
ansible_pull_exe.description: Absolute path to a different ansible-pull binary installed on the local machine.

branch.title: Branch
branch.description: Git branch to check out from your Git repository.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: Absolute path on the local machine to check out your Git repository.

git_repository.title: Git Repository
git_repository.description: URL of the repository that contains your Ansible playbooks.

inventory_script.title: Inventory Script
inventory_script.description: Relative or absolute path to an ansible inventory script.

log_dir.title: Log Directory
log_dir.description: Absolute path of where to store log files from runs.

skip_tags.title: Skip Tags
skip_tags.description: Run the Ansible playbook on all tags except the provided comma separated list.

ssh_key.title: SSH Key
ssh_key.description: Absolute path to a SSH key with permission to access your Git repository.

ssh_stricthostkeychecking.title: Strict Host Key Checking
ssh_stricthostkeychecking.description: Whether or not to use strict host key checking when running Git commands.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Limit the Ansible playbook run to a comma separated list of tags.

wait_interval.title: Wait Interval
wait_interval.description: The number of seconds to wait in between ansible-pull runs.

json-url.title: JSON Preference File Location
json-url.description: When configuring Nudge using a JSON-formatted preferences file located outside of the default location, set this key to the custom location using either a remote (https://) or a local (file://) URL, and leave other keys in this payload unset. Leave this key unset when configuring Nudge using the other keys in this payload.

osVersionRequirements.title: OS Version Requirements
osVersionRequirements.description:
The required components necessary to enforce an Operating System version through Nudge.

Specify one array to enforce a single Operating System version across all machines or specify multiple arrays for specific enforcements.

aboutUpdateURL.title: About Update URL
aboutUpdateURL.description: A single URL, enabling the More Info button URL path. Ignored when About Update URLs (in plural) is also present.

requiredInstallationDate.title: Required Installation Date
requiredInstallationDate.description: The required installation date for Nudge to enforce the required operating system version. You must follow a standard date string as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ - Example: "2021-01-31T00:00:00Z"

targetedOSVersions.title: Targeted OS Versions
targetedOSVersions.description: The versions of macOS that require a security update. You can specify single version or multiple versions.

allowedDeferralsUntilForcedSecondaryQuit.title: Allowed Deferrals until Forced Secondary Quit Button

updateElements.title: Update Elements
updateElements.description: A list of dictionaries, enabling further customization to the Nudge UI

_language.title: Language
_language.description: The targeted language locale for the user interface.

actionButtonText.title: Action Button Text
actionButtonText.description: Modifies the actionButton, also known as the 'Update Device' button.

customDeferralButtonText.title: Custom Deferral Button Text
customDeferralButtonText.description: Modifies the customDeferralButtonText, also known as the "Custom" button.

customDeferralDropdownText.title: Custom Deferral Dropdown Text
customDeferralDropdownText.description: Modifies the customDeferralDropdownText, also known as the "Defer" button.

informationButtonText.title: Information Button Text
informationButtonText.description: Modifies the informationButton, also known as the 'More Info' button.

mainContentHeader.title: Main Content Header
mainContentHeader.description: Modifies the mainContentHeader. This is the 'Your device will restart during this update' text.

mainContentNote.title: Main Content Note
mainContentNote.description: Modifies the mainContentNote. This is the 'Important Notes' text.

mainContentSubHeader.title: Main Content Sub Header
mainContentSubHeader.description: Modifies the mainContentSubHeader. This is the 'Updates can take around 30 minutes to complete' text.

mainContentText.title: Main Content Text
mainContentText.description:
Modifies the mainContentText. This is the 'A fully up-to-date device is required to ensure that IT can your accurately protect your device.

If you do not update your device, you may lose access to some items necessary for your day-to-day tasks.

To begin the update, simply click on the button below and follow the provided steps.' text.

mainHeader.title: Main Header
mainHeader.description: Modifies the mainHeader. This is the 'Your device requires a security update' text.

oneDayDeferralButtonText.title: One Day Deferral Button Text
oneDayDeferralButtonText.description: Modifies the oneDayDeferralButtonText, also known as the "One Day" button.

oneHourDeferralButtonText.title: One Hour Deferral Button Text
oneHourDeferralButtonText.description: Modifies the oneHourDeferralButtonText, also known as the "One Hour" button.

primaryQuitButtonText.title: Primary Quit Button Text
primaryQuitButtonText.description: Modifies the primaryQuitButton, also known as the 'Later' button.

secondaryQuitButtonText.title: Secondary Quit Button Text
secondaryQuitButtonText.description: Modifies the secondaryQuitButton, also known as the 'I understand' button.

subHeader.title: Sub Header
subHeader.description: Modifies the subHeader. This is the 'A friendly reminder from your local IT team' text.

DeferButtonLabel.title: Defer Button Label
DeferButtonLabel.description: The label of the defer button.

DeferralPeriod.title: Deferral Period
DeferralPeriod.description: Number of seconds between when the user clicks "Defer" and the next prompt appears.

DiagnosticLog.title: Enable Diagnostic Log
DiagnosticLog.description: Whether to write to a persistent log file at /var/log/install-or-defer.log.

DisablePostInstallAlert.title: Disable Post-Install Alert
DisablePostInstallAlert.description: Whether to suppress the persistent alert to run updates.

HardRestartDelay.title: Hard Restart Delay
HardRestartDelay.description: Number of seconds to wait between attempting a soft restart and forcing a restart.

InstallButtonLabel.title: Install Button Label
InstallButtonLabel.description: The label of the install button.

ManualUpdates.title: Manual Updates
ManualUpdates.description: Whether to prompt users to run updates manually via System Preferences.

MaxDeferralTime.title: Maximum Deferral Time
MaxDeferralTime.description: Number of seconds between the first script run and the updates being enforced.

MessagingLogo.title: Messaging Logo
MessagingLogo.description: File path to a logo that will be used in messaging.

PromptTimeout.title: Prompt Timeout
PromptTimeout.description: Number of seconds to wait before timing out the Install or Defer prompt.

SkipDeferral.title: Skip Deferral
SkipDeferral.description: Whether to bypass deferral time entirely and skip straight to update enforcement.

SupportContact.title: Support Contact
SupportContact.description: Contact information for technical support included in messaging alerts.

UpdateDelay.title: Update Delay
UpdateDelay.description: Number of seconds to wait between displaying the "install updates" message and applying updates, then attempting a soft restart.

WorkdayEndHour.title: Workday End Hour
WorkdayEndHour.description: The hour that a workday ends in your organization.

WorkdayStartHour.title: Workday Start Hour
WorkdayStartHour.description: The hour that a workday starts in your organization.

BasicAuth.title: BasicAuth
BasicAuth.description: Whether to use basic authentication on your server.

CACert.title: CACert
CACert.description: Path to your sal certificate. Curl on 10.13 requires this for self-signed certificates or uploading the report data will fail.

GetGrains.title: GetGrains
GetGrains.description: Collect Salt grains and upload them to Sal.

GetOhai.title: GetOhai
GetOhai.description: Collect Ohai attributes and upload them to Sal.

SSLClientCertificate.title: SSLClientCertificate
SSLClientCertificate.description: Absolute path to the SSL client certificate to use with mutual TLS when connecting to the sal server in PEM format.

SSLClientKey.title: SSLClientKey
SSLClientKey.description: Full path to your sal SSL client key file for mutual TLS

SkipFacts.title: SkipFacts
SkipFacts.description: It is possible to not upload all the data produced by Facter. You may have facts that are duplicates of other information Sal collects, or you don't wish to upload them for security reasons.

SyncScripts.title: SyncScripts
SyncScripts.description: Download the scripts needed to run for your plugins from the server.

AbusiveExperienceInterventionEnforce.title: Abusive Experience Intervention Enforce
AbusiveExperienceInterventionEnforce.description: Allows you to set whether sites with abusive experiences should be prevented from opening new windows or tabs.

AccessibilityImageLabelsEnabled.title: Allow accessibility descriptions for Google images
AccessibilityImageLabelsEnabled.description: Enable Get Image Descriptions from Google. Enables visually-impaired screen reader users to get descriptions of unlabeled images on the web.

AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.title: Ads setting for sites with intrusive ads
AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.description: Allows you to set whether ads should be blocked on sites with intrusive ads.

AdvancedProtectionAllowed.title: Enable Advanced Protection
AdvancedProtectionAllowed.description: Enable additional protections for users enrolled in the Advanced Protection program.

AdvancedProtectionDeepScanningEnabled.title: Advanced Protection Deep Scanning
AdvancedProtectionDeepScanningEnabled.description: This policy controls whether users enrolled in the Advanced Protection program are allowed to send their downloads to Google for malware scanning. If set to True or not set, enrolled users will be be prompted to send their files to Google for deep scanning. If the user selects 'Scan', their download will be sent to Google. If set to False, users will not be prompted and their downloads will not be sent to Google.

AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.title: Cross-origin HTTP Basic Auth prompts
AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.description: Controls whether third-party sub-content on a page is allowed to pop-up an HTTP Basic Auth dialog box.

AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.title: Enable deleting browser and download history
AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.description: Enables deleting browser history and download history in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

AllowDinosaurEasterEgg.title: Allow Dinosaur Easter Egg Game
AllowDinosaurEasterEgg.description: Allow users to play dinosaur easter egg game when device is offline.

AllowFileSelectionDialogs.title: Allow invocation of file selection dialogs
AllowFileSelectionDialogs.description: Allows access to local files on the machine by allowing Google Chrome to display file selection dialogs.

AllowOutdatedPlugins.title: Allow running plugins that are outdated
AllowOutdatedPlugins.description: If you enable this setting, outdated plugins are used as normal plugins.

AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.title: Allow a page to show popups during its unloading
AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.description: This policy allows an admin to specify that a page may show popups during its unloading.

AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.title: Allows a page to perform synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal.
AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.description: This policy allows an admin to specify that a page may send synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal.

AllowedDomainsForApps.title: Define domains allowed to access G Suite
AllowedDomainsForApps.description: Enables Google Chrome's restricted log in feature in G Suite and prevents users from changing this setting.

AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.title: Enable alternate error pages
AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.description: Enables the use of alternate error pages that are built into Google Chrome (such as 'page not found') and prevents users from changing this setting.

AlternativeBrowserParameters.title: Alternative Browser Parameters
AlternativeBrowserParameters.description: This policy controls command-line parameters to launch to the alternative browser.

AlternativeBrowserPath.title: Alternative Browser Path
AlternativeBrowserPath.description: This policy controls which command to use to open URLs in an alternative browser.

AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.title: Always Open PDF files externally
AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.description: Disables the internal PDF viewer in Google Chrome. Instead it treats it as download and allows the user to open PDF files with the default application.

AmbientAuthenticationInPrivateModesEnabl.title: Ambient Authentication
AmbientAuthenticationInPrivateModesEnabl.description: Configuring this policy will allow/disallow ambient authenticaiton for Incognito and Guest profiles in Google Chrome.

AppCacheForceEnabled.title: Force Enable App Cache
AppCacheForceEnabled.description: Allows the AppCache feature to be re-enabled even if it is off by default.

AudioCaptureAllowed.title: Allow or deny audio capture
AudioCaptureAllowed.description: If enabled or not configured (default), the user will be prompted for audio capture access except for URLs configured in the AudioCaptureAllowedUrls list which will be granted access without prompting.

AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.title: URLs that will be granted access to audio capture devices without prompt
AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.description:
Patterns in this list will be matched against the security
origin of the requesting URL.  If a match is found, access to audio
capture devices will be granted without prompt.

AudioSandboxEnabled.title: Enable the audio sandbox
AudioSandboxEnabled.description: Allow the audio sandbox to run. If this policy is enabled, the audio process will run sandboxed. If this policy is disabled, the audio process will run unsandboxed and the WebRTC audio-processing module will run in the renderer process. This leaves users open to security risks related to running the audio subsystem unsandboxed.

AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.title: Kerberos delegation server allowlist
AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.description: Servers that Google Chrome may delegate to.

AuthNegotiateDelegateByKdcPolicy.title: Kerberos delegation KDC policy
AuthNegotiateDelegateByKdcPolicy.description: Use KDC policy to delegate credentials. Controls whether approval by KDC policy is respected to decide whether to delegate Kerberos tickets.

AuthNegotiateDelegateWhitelist.title: Kerberos delegation server whitelist
AuthNegotiateDelegateWhitelist.description: Servers that Google Chrome may delegate to.

AuthSchemes.title: Supported authentication schemes
AuthSchemes.description: Specifies which HTTP authentication schemes are supported by Google Chrome. Possible values are 'basic', 'digest', 'ntlm' and 'negotiate'. Separate multiple values with commas.

AuthServerAllowlist.title: Authentication server allowlist
AuthServerAllowlist.description: Specifies which servers should be allowed for integrated authentication. Integrated authentication is only enabled when Google Chrome receives an authentication challenge from a proxy or from a server which is in this permitted list.

AuthServerWhitelist.title: Authentication server whitelist
AuthServerWhitelist.description: Specifies which servers should be whitelisted for integrated authentication. Integrated authentication is only enabled when Google Chrome receives an authentication challenge from a proxy or from a server which is in this permitted list.

AutoFillEnabled.title: Enable AutoFill
AutoFillEnabled.description: Enable AutoFill. This policy is deprecated in M70, please use AutofillAddressEnabled and AutofillCreditCardEnabled instead.

AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.title: Allow protocols to auto launch external applications
AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.description: Define a list of protocols that can launch an external application from listed origins without prompting the user. If this policy is set, a protocol will only be permitted to launch an external application without prompting by policy if the protocol is listed, and the origin of the site trying to launch the protocol matches one of the origin patterns in that protocol's allowed_origins list.

allowed_origins.title: Allowed Origins
allowed_origins.description: A list of allowed origin patterns for the specified protocol.

AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.title: Allowed URLs for auto open filetypes
AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.description: URLs where AutoOpenFileTypes can apply. List of URLs specifying which urls AutoOpenFileTypes will apply to. This policy has no impact on automatically open values set by users.

AutoOpenFileTypes.title: Allow file extensions to auto open
AutoOpenFileTypes.description: List of file types that should be automatically opened on download.

AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.title: Automatically select client certificates for these sites
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.description: Allows you to specify a list of url patterns that specify sites for which Google Chrome should automatically select a client certificate, if the site requests a certificate.

AutofillAddressEnabled.title: Enable AutoFill for addresses
AutofillAddressEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome's AutoFill feature and allows users to auto complete address information in web forms using previously stored information.

AutofillCreditCardEnabled.title: Enable AutoFill for credit cards
AutofillCreditCardEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome's AutoFill feature and allows users to auto complete credit card information in web forms using previously stored information.

AutoplayAllowed.title: Allow media autoplay
AutoplayAllowed.description: Allows you to control if videos can play automatically (without user consent) with audio content in Google Chrome.

AutoplayAllowlist.title: Allow media autoplay on an allow list of URL patterns
AutoplayAllowlist.description: Controls the allow list of URL patterns that autoplay will always be enabled on.

AutoplayWhitelist.title: Allow media autoplay on a whitelist of URL patterns
AutoplayWhitelist.description: Controls the whitelist of URL patterns that autoplay will always be enabled on.

BasicAuthOverHttpEnabled.title: Allow Basic authentication for HTTP
BasicAuthOverHttpEnabled.description: Setting the policy to Enabled or leaving it unset will allow Basic authentication challenges received over non-secure HTTP. Setting the policy to Disabled forbids non-secure HTTP requests from using the Basic authentication scheme; only secure HTTPS is allowed.

BlockExternalExtensions.title: Block external extensions
BlockExternalExtensions.description: Blocks external extensions from being installed.

BlockThirdPartyCookies.title: Block third party cookies
BlockThirdPartyCookies.description: Enabling this setting prevents cookies from being set by web page elements that are not from the domain that is in the browser's address bar.

BookmarkBarEnabled.title: Enable Bookmark Bar
BookmarkBarEnabled.description: If you enable this setting, Google Chrome will show a bookmark bar.

BrowserAddPersonEnabled.title: Enable add person in user manager
BrowserAddPersonEnabled.description: If this policy is set to true or not configured, Google Chrome will allow Add Person from the user manager.

BrowserGuestModeEnabled.title: Enable guest mode in browser
BrowserGuestModeEnabled.description: If this policy is set to true or not configured, Google Chrome will enable guest logins. Guest logins are Google Chrome profiles where all windows are in incognito mode.

BrowserGuestModeEnforced.title: Force guest mode in browser
BrowserGuestModeEnforced.description: If this policy is set to enabled, Google Chrome will enforce guest sessions and prevents profile logins. Guest logins are Google Chrome profiles where all windows are in incognito mode.

BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.title: Allow queries to a Google time service
BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.description: Setting this policy to false stops Google Chrome from occasionally sending queries to a Google server to retrieve an accurate timestamp. These queries will be enabled if this policy is set to True or is not set.

BrowserSignin.title: Browser Signin
BrowserSignin.description: This policy controls the sign-in behavior of the browser. It allows you to specify if the user can sign in to Google Chrome with their account and use account related services like Chrome sync.

BrowserSwitcherDelay.title: Browser Switcher Delay
BrowserSwitcherDelay.description: This policy controls how long to wait before launching an alternative browser, in milliseconds. When this policy is set to a number, Chrome shows a message for that many milliseconds, and then opens the alternative browser.

BrowserSwitcherEnabled.title: Browser Switcher Enabled
BrowserSwitcherEnabled.description: This policy controls whether to enable Legacy Browser Support. When this policy is set to true, Chrome will attempt to launch some URLs in an alternate browser.

BrowserSwitcherExternalGreylistUrl.title: Browser Switcher External Greylist URL
BrowserSwitcherExternalGreylistUrl.description: This policy is a URL, that points to an XML file in the same format as Internet Explorer's SiteList policy. This loads rules from an XML file, without sharing those rules with Internet Explorer.

BrowserSwitcherExternalSitelistUrl.title: Browser Switcher External Sitelist URL
BrowserSwitcherExternalSitelistUrl.description: This policy is a URL, that points to an XML file in the same format as Internet Explorer's SiteList policy. This loads rules from an XML file, without sharing those rules with Internet Explorer.

BrowserSwitcherKeepLastChromeTab.title: Keep Chrome open when the last tab switches to another browser
BrowserSwitcherKeepLastChromeTab.description: This policy controls whether to close Chrome completely when the last tab would switch to another browser.

BrowserSwitcherUrlGreylist.title: Browser Switcher URL Greylist
BrowserSwitcherUrlGreylist.description: This policy controls the list of websites that will never cause a browser switch.

BrowserSwitcherUrlList.title: Browser Switcher URL List
BrowserSwitcherUrlList.description: This policy controls the list of websites to open in an alternative browser.

BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.title: Use built-in DNS client
BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.description: Controls whether the built-in DNS client is used in Google Chrome.

BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.title: Use built-in certificate verifier
BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.description: Determines whether the built-in certificate verifier will be used to verify server certificates. When this setting is enabled, Google Chrome will perform verification of server certificates using the built-in certificate verifier. When this setting is disabled, Google Chrome will perform verification of server certificates using the legacy certificate verifier provided by the platform. When this setting is not set, the built-in or the legacy certificate verifier may be used.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of Legacy Certificate Authorities
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of Legacy Certificate Authorities.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of URLs
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements to the listed URLs. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

ClickToCallEnabled.title: Enable Click to Call
ClickToCallEnabled.description: Enable the Click to Call Feature.

CloudExtensionRequestEnabled.title: Enable Cloud Extension Install Requests
CloudExtensionRequestEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome extension installation requests. When the policy CloudReportingEnabled is left unset or set to disabled, this policy will be ignored, extension installation requests are not created or uploaded. When this policy is left unset or set to disabled, extension installation requests are not created or uploaded. When this policy is set to enabled, extension installation requests are created and uploaded to Google Admin console.

CloudManagementEnrollmentMandatory.title: Make cloud managment enrollment mandatory
CloudManagementEnrollmentMandatory.description: If this policy is set to True, cloud management enrollment is mandatory and blocks Chrome launch process if failed.

CloudManagementEnrollmentToken.title: Cloud Management Enrollment Token
CloudManagementEnrollmentToken.description: If this policy is set, Google Chrome will try to register itself and apply associated cloud policy for all profiles.

CloudPolicyOverridesPlatformPolicy.title: Cloud Policy Overrides Platform Policy
CloudPolicyOverridesPlatformPolicy.description: If the policy is set to true, cloud policy takes precedence if it conflicts with platform policy. If the policy is set to false or not configured, platform policy takes precedence if it conflicts with cloud policy.

CloudPrintProxyEnabled.title: Enable Google Cloud Print proxy
CloudPrintProxyEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome to act as a proxy between Google Cloud Print and legacy printers connected to the machine.

CloudPrintSubmitEnabled.title: Enable submission of documents to Google Cloud Print
CloudPrintSubmitEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome to submit documents to Google Cloud Print for printing.  NOTE: This only affects Google Cloud Print support in Google Chrome.  It does not prevent users from submitting print jobs on web sites.

CloudReportingEnabled.title: Enable Cloud Reporting
CloudReportingEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome cloud reporting. When this policy is left unset or set to False, there is no data collected or uploaded. When this policy is set to True, the data is collected and uploaded to Google Admin console.

CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.title: Command Line Flag Security Warnings Enabled
CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.description: If disabled, prevents security warnings from appearing when Chrome is launched with some potentially dangerous command-line flags.

ComponentUpdatesEnabled.title: Enable component updates in Google Chrome
ComponentUpdatesEnabled.description: Enables component updates for all components in Google Chrome when not set or set to True.

CookiesAllowedForUrls.title: Allow cookies on these sites
CookiesAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to set cookies.

CookiesBlockedForUrls.title: Block cookies on these sites
CookiesBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to set cookies.

CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.title: Limit cookies from matching URLs to the current session
CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.description: Cookies set by pages matching these URL patterns will be limited to the current session, i.e. they will be deleted when the browser exits.

CorsLegacyModeEnabled.title: Enable Cross-Origin Resource Sharing legacy mode
CorsLegacyModeEnabled.description: Use the legacy CORS implementation rather than new CORS.

CorsMitigationList.title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing mitigation list
CorsMitigationList.description: Enable CORS check mitigations in the new CORS implementation, allowing Extensions to keep compatible behavior, and allowing Google Chrome to send specified headers without CORS checks.

DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.title: DNS Interception Checks
DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.description: This policy configures a local switch that can be used to disable DNS interception checks. The checks attempt to discover whether the browser is behind a proxy that redirects unknown host names.

DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.title: Set Google Chrome as Default Browser
DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.description: Configures the default browser checks in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing them.

DefaultCookiesSetting.title: Default cookies setting
DefaultCookiesSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to set local data. Setting local data can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

DefaultDownloadDirectory.title: Set default download directory
DefaultDownloadDirectory.description:
Configures the default directory that Google Chrome will use for downloading files. This policy is not mandatory, so the user will be able to change the directory.

See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used.

DefaultGeolocationSetting.title: Default geolocation setting
DefaultGeolocationSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to track the users' physical location. Tracking the users' physical location can be allowed by default, denied by default or the user can be asked every time a website requests the physical location.

DefaultImagesSetting.title: Default images setting
DefaultImagesSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to display images. Displaying images can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

DefaultInsecureContentSetting.title: Default insecure content setting
DefaultInsecureContentSetting.description: Control use of insecure content exceptions. Allows you to set whether users can add exceptions to allow mixed content for specific sites. If this policy is left not set, users will be allowed to add exceptions to allow blockable mixed content and disable autoupgrades for optionally blockable mixed content.

DefaultJavaScriptSetting.title: Default JavaScript setting
DefaultJavaScriptSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to run JavaScript. Running JavaScript can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

DefaultMediaStreamSetting.title: Default mediastream setting
DefaultMediaStreamSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to get access to media capture devices. Access to media capture devices can be allowed by default, or the user can be asked every time a website wants to get access to media capture devices. - Documentation doesn't indicate when this was deprecated, but AudioCaptureAllowed was added in M25, so making an assumption.

DefaultNotificationsSetting.title: Default notification setting
DefaultNotificationsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to display desktop notifications. Displaying desktop notifications can be allowed by default, denied by default or the user can be asked every time a website wants to show desktop notifications.

DefaultPluginsSetting.title: Default Flash setting
DefaultPluginsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to automatically run the Flash plugin. Automatically running the Flash plugin can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

DefaultPopupsSetting.title: Default popups setting
DefaultPopupsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to show pop-ups. Showing popups can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

DefaultPrinterSelection.title: Default printer selection rules
DefaultPrinterSelection.description: Overrides Google Chrome default printer selection rules.

DefaultSearchProviderAlternateURLs.title: List of alternate URLs for the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderAlternateURLs.description: Specifies a list of alternate URLs that can be used to extract search terms from the search engine. The URLs should contain the string '{searchTerms}', which will be used to extract the search terms.

DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.title: Enable default search provider on context menu
DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.description: Allow default search provider context menu search access.

DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.title: Enable the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.description: Enables the use of a default search provider.

DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.title: Default search provider encodings
DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.description: Specifies the character encodings supported by the search provider. Encodings are code page names like UTF-8, GB2312, and ISO-8859-1. They are tried in the order provided.

DefaultSearchProviderIconURL.title: Default search provider icon
DefaultSearchProviderIconURL.description: Specifies the favorite icon URL of the default search provider.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.title: Parameter providing search-by-image feature for the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used to provide image search. Search requests will be sent using the GET method. If the DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams policy is set then image search requests will use the POST method instead.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.title: Parameters for image URL which uses POST
DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.description: Specifies the parameters used when doing image search with POST. It consists of comma-separated name/value pairs. If a value is a template parameter, like {imageThumbnail} in above example, it will be replaced with real image thumbnail data.

DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.title: Default search provider keyword
DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.description: Specifies the keyword, which is the shortcut used in the omnibox to trigger the search for this provider.

DefaultSearchProviderName.title: Default search provider name
DefaultSearchProviderName.description: Specifies the name of the default search provider. If left empty or not set, the host name specified by the search URL will be used.

DefaultSearchProviderNewTabURL.title: Default search provider new tab page URL
DefaultSearchProviderNewTabURL.description: Specifies the URL that a search engine uses to provide a new tab page.

DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.title: Default search provider search URL
DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used when doing a default search. The URL should contain the string '{searchTerms}', which will be replaced at query time by the terms the user is searching for.

DefaultSearchProviderSearchURLPostParams.title: Parameters for search URL which uses POST
DefaultSearchProviderSearchURLPostParams.description: Specifies the parameters used when searching a URL with POST. It consists of comma-separated name/value pairs. If a value is a template parameter, like {searchTerms} in above example, it will be replaced with real search terms data.

DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.title: Default search provider suggest URL
DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used to provide search suggestions. The URL should contain the string '{searchTerms}', which will be replaced at query time by the text the user has entered so far.

DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURLPostParam.title: Parameters for suggest URL which uses POST
DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURLPostParam.description: Specifies the parameters used when doing suggestion search with POST. It consists of comma-separated name/value pairs. If a value is a template parameter, like {searchTerms} in above example, it will be replaced with real search terms data.

DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSett.title: Default Third Party Storage Partitioning Setting
DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSett.description: Third-party storage partitioning is on by default for some users as of M113, but can be disabled via Chrome flag. If this policy is set to AllowPartitioning or unset, third-party storage partitioning may be enabled. If this policy is set to BlockPartitioning, third-party storage partitioning cannot be enabled.

DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.title: Control use of the Web Bluetooth API
DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to get access to nearby Bluetooth devices. Access can be completely blocked, or the user can be asked every time a website wants to get access to nearby Bluetooth devices.

DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.title: Control use of the WebUSB API
DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to get access to connected USB devices. Access can be completely blocked, or the user can be asked every time a website wants to get access to connected USB devices.

DeveloperToolsAvailability.title: Control where Developer Tools can be used
DeveloperToolsAvailability.description: Allows you to control where Developer Tools can be used.

DeveloperToolsDisabled.title: Control where Developer Tools can be used
DeveloperToolsDisabled.description: Disables the Developer Tools and the JavaScript console. This policy is deprecated in M68, please use DeveloperToolsAvailability instead.

Disable3DAPIs.title: Disable support for 3D graphics APIs
Disable3DAPIs.description: Enabling this setting prevents web pages from accessing the graphics processing unit (GPU). Specifically, web pages can not access the WebGL API and plugins can not use the Pepper 3D API.

DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.title: Disable CNAME lookup when negotiating Kerberos authentication
DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN is based on the canonical DNS name or the original name entered.

DisablePrintPreview.title: Disable Print Preview
DisablePrintPreview.description: Show the system print dialog instead of print preview.

DisableSafeBrowsingProceedAnyway.title: Disable proceeding from the Safe Browsing warning page
