DisableSafeBrowsingProceedAnyway.description: The Safe Browsing service shows a warning page when users navigate to sites that are flagged as potentially malicious. Enabling this setting prevents users from proceeding anyway from the warning page to the malicious site.

DisableScreenshots.title: Disable taking screenshots
DisableScreenshots.description: If enabled, screenshots cannot be taken using keyboard shortcuts or extension APIs.

DisabledPlugins.title: Disabled Plugins
DisabledPlugins.description:
This policy is deprecated. Please use the DefaultPluginsSetting to control the avalability of the Flash plugin and AlwaysOpenPdfExternally to control whether the integrated PDF viewer should be used for opening PDF files.

Specifies a list of plugins that are disabled in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

DisabledPluginsExceptions.title: Disabled Plugins Exceptions
DisabledPluginsExceptions.description:
This policy is deprecated. Please use the DefaultPluginsSetting to control the avalability of the Flash plugin and AlwaysOpenPdfExternally to control whether the integrated PDF viewer should be used for opening PDF files.

Specifies a list of plugins that user can enable or disable in Google Chrome.

DisabledSchemes.title: Disabled URL Protocol Schemes
DisabledSchemes.description:
This policy is deprecated, please use URLBlocklist instead.

Disables the listed protocol schemes in Google Chrome.

DiskCacheDir.title: Set disk cache directory
DiskCacheDir.description: Configures the directory that Google Chrome will use for storing cached files on the disk. See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used. To avoid data loss or other unexpected errors this policy should not be set to a volume's root directory or to a directory used for other purposes, because Google Chrome manages its contents

DiskCacheSize.title: Set disk cache size
DiskCacheSize.description: Configures the cache size that Google Chrome will use for storing cached files on the disk. The value specified in this policy is not a hard boundary but rather a suggestion to the caching system, any value below a few megabytes is too small and will be rounded up to a sane minimum. If the value of this policy is 0, the default cache size will be used but the user will not be able to change it.

DnsOverHttpsTemplates.title: DNS-over-HTTPS mode
DnsOverHttpsTemplates.description: Specify URI template of desired DNS-over-HTTPS resolver. To specify multiple DNS-over-HTTPS resolvers, separate the corresponding URI templates with spaces.

DownloadDirectory.title: Set download directory
DownloadDirectory.description:
Configures the directory that Google Chrome will use for downloading files. If you set this policy, Google Chrome will use the provided directory regardless whether the user has specified one or enabled the flag to be prompted for download location every time. If this policy is left not set the default download directory will be used and the user will be able to change it.

See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used.

DownloadRestrictions.title: Download restrictions
DownloadRestrictions.description: Configures the type of downloads that Google Chrome will completely block, without letting users override the security decision.

EditBookmarksEnabled.title: Enable or disable bookmark editing
EditBookmarksEnabled.description: If you enable this setting, bookmarks can be added, removed or modified. This is the default also when this policy is not set.

EnableAuthNegotiatePort.title: Include non-standard port in Kerberos SPN
EnableAuthNegotiatePort.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN should include a non-standard port.

EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.title: Enable deprecated web platform features for a limited time
EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.description:
ExampleDeprecatedFeature_EffectiveUntil20080902 - Enable ExampleDeprecatedFeature API through 2008/09/02
Specify a list of deprecated web platform features to re-enable temporarily.

EnableExperimentalPolicies.title: Enable experimental policies
EnableExperimentalPolicies.description: Allows Google Chrome to load experimental policies.

EnableMediaRouter.title: Enable Google Cast
EnableMediaRouter.description: If this policy is set to true or is not set, Google Cast will be enabled, and users will be able to launch it from the app menu, page context menus, media controls on Cast-enabled websites, and (if shown) the Cast toolbar icon.

EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.title: Whether online OCSP/CRL checks are performed
EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.description: In light of the fact that soft-fail, online revocation checks provide no effective security benefit, they are disabled by default in Google Chrome version 19 and later. By setting this policy to true, the previous behavior is restored and online OCSP/CRL checks will be performed.

EnabledPlugins.title: Enabled Plugins
EnabledPlugins.description:
This policy is deprecated. Please use the DefaultPluginsSetting to control the avalability of the Flash plugin and AlwaysOpenPdfExternally to control whether the integrated PDF viewer should be used for opening PDF files.

Specifies a list of plugins that are enabled in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.title: Enable Managed Extensions to use the Enterprise Hardware API
EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.description: When this policy is set to enabled, extensions installed by enterprise policy are allowed to use the Enterprise Hardware Platform API.

EnterpriseRealTimeUrlCheckMode.title: Check Safe Browsing status of URLs in real time
EnterpriseRealTimeUrlCheckMode.description: This policy controls checking URLs in real time to identify unsafe URLs. If this policy is left not set or set to ‘Disabled', the consumer Safe Browsing checks will be applied. If this policy is set to ‘Enabled', URLs will be sent to be scanned in real time under enterprise ToS. It will result in Chrome sending URLs to Google Cloud or third parties of your choosing to check them in real time. The consumer version of Safe Browsing real time lookup will be switched off.

ExtensionAllowInsecureUpdates.title: Allow insecure extension updates
ExtensionAllowInsecureUpdates.description: Allow insecure algorithms in integrity checks on extension updates and installs.

ExtensionAllowedTypes.title: Types of extensions/apps that are allowed to be installed
ExtensionAllowedTypes.description: Controls which app/extension types are allowed to be installed and limits runtime access.

ExtensionInstallAllowlist.title: Extension ID Allowlist
ExtensionInstallAllowlist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions are not subject to the blocklist.

ExtensionInstallBlacklist.title: Extension ID Blacklist
ExtensionInstallBlacklist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions the users can NOT install. Extensions already installed will be disabled if denied, without a way for the user to enable them. Once an extension is disabled due to the blacklist being removed, it will automatically get re-enabled. Enter * to deny all extensions.

ExtensionInstallBlocklist.title: Extension ID Blocklist
ExtensionInstallBlocklist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions the users can NOT install. Extensions already installed will be disabled if denied, without a way for the user to enable them. Once an extension is disabled due to the blocklist being removed, it will automatically get re-enabled. Enter * to deny all extensions.

ExtensionInstallForcelist.title: Extension/App IDs and update URLs to be silently installed
ExtensionInstallForcelist.description: Specifies a list of apps and extensions that are installed silently, without user interaction, and which cannot be uninstalled nor disabled by the user. All permissions requested by the apps/extensions are granted implicitly, without user interaction, including any additional permissions requested by future versions of the app/extension. Furthermore, permissions are granted for the enterprise.deviceAttributes and enterprise.platformKeys extension APIs. (These two APIs are not available to apps/extensions that are not force-installed.)

ExtensionInstallSources.title: URL patterns to allow extension, app, and user script installs from
ExtensionInstallSources.description: Allows you to specify which URLs are allowed to install extensions, apps, and themes.

ExtensionInstallWhitelist.title: Extension ID Whitelist
ExtensionInstallWhitelist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions are not subject to the blacklist.

ExtensionManifestV2Availability.title: ExtensionManifestV2Availability
ExtensionManifestV2Availability.description: Control if Manifest v2 extensions can be used by browser.

ExtensionSettings.title: Extension management settings
ExtensionSettings.description: Configures extension management settings for Google Chrome. A default configuration can be set for the special ID "*"

allowed_types.title: allowed_types
allowed_types.description: This setting whitelists the allowed types of extension/apps that can be installed in Google Chrome.

blocked_install_message.title: blocked_install_message
blocked_install_message.description: This maps to a string specifying the error message to display to users if they're blocked from installing an extension.

blocked_permissions.title: blocked_permissions
blocked_permissions.description: Maps to a list of strings indicating the blocked API permissions for the extension.

install_sources.title: install_sources
install_sources.description: Each item in this list is an extension-style match pattern.

installation_mode.title: installation_mode
installation_mode.description: Maps to a string indicating the installation mode for the extension.

runtime_allowed_hosts.title: runtime_allowed_hosts
runtime_allowed_hosts.description: Maps to a list of strings representing hosts that an extension can interact with regardless of whether they are listed in "runtime_blocked_hosts".

runtime_blocked_hosts.title: runtime_blocked_hosts
runtime_blocked_hosts.description: Maps to a list of strings representing hosts whose webpages the extension will be blocked from modifying.

update_url.title: update_url
update_url.description: Maps to a string indicating where Chrome can download a force_installed or normal_installed extension.

ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.title: Display "Always open" checkbox in external protocol dialog
ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.description: Show an "Always open" checkbox in external protocol dialog.

ForceBrowserSignin.title: Enable force sign in for Google Chrome
ForceBrowserSignin.description: If this policy is set to true, user has to sign in to Google Chrome with their profile before using the browser. And the default value of BrowserGuestModeEnabled will be set to false. Note that existing unsigned profiles will be locked and inaccessible after enabling this policy. For more information, see help center article. This policy is deprecated, consider using BrowserSignin instead.

ForceEphemeralProfiles.title: Ephemeral profile
ForceEphemeralProfiles.description: If set to enabled this policy forces the profile to be switched to ephemeral mode. If this policy is specified as an OS policy (e.g. GPO on Windows) it will apply to every profile on the system; if the policy is set as a Cloud policy it will apply only to a profile signed in with a managed account.

ForceGoogleSafeSearch.title: Force Google SafeSearch
ForceGoogleSafeSearch.description: Forces queries in Google Web Search to be done with SafeSearch set to active and prevents users from changing this setting.

ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.title: Force Legacy Default Referrer
ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.description: This enterprise policy is for short-term adaptation and will be removed in M82.

ForceSafeSearch.title: Force SafeSearch
ForceSafeSearch.description: This policy is deprecated, please use ForceGoogleSafeSearch and ForceYouTubeRestrict instead. This policy is ignored if either the ForceGoogleSafeSearch, the ForceYouTubeRestrict or the (deprecated) ForceYouTubeSafetyMode policies are set.

ForceYouTubeRestrict.title: Force minimum YouTube Restricted Mode
ForceYouTubeRestrict.description: Enforces a minimum Restricted Mode on YouTube and prevents users from picking a less restricted mode.

ForceYouTubeSafetyMode.title: Force YouTube Safety Mode
ForceYouTubeSafetyMode.description:
This policy is deprecated. Consider using ForceYouTubeRestrict, which overrides this policy and allows more fine-grained tuning.

Forces YouTube Moderate Restricted Mode and prevents users from changing this setting.

GloballyScopeHTTPAuthCacheEnabled.title: Enable globally scoped HTTP auth cache
GloballyScopeHTTPAuthCacheEnabled.description: This policy configures a single global per profile cache with HTTP server authentication credentials.

HSTSPolicyBypassList.title: HSTS Policy Bypass List
HSTSPolicyBypassList.description: List of names that will bypass the HSTS policy check. Hostnames specified in this list will be exempt from the HSTS policy check that could potentially upgrade requests from http to https.

HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.title: Use hardware acceleration when available
HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.description: If this policy is set to true or left unset, hardware acceleration will be enabled unless a certain GPU feature is blacklisted.

HideWebStoreIcon.title: Hide the web store from the New Tab Page and app launcher
HideWebStoreIcon.description: Hide the Chrome Web Store app and footer link from the New Tab Page and Google Chrome OS app launcher.

HomepageIsNewTabPage.title: Use New Tab Page as homepage
HomepageIsNewTabPage.description: Configures the type of the default home page in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing home page preferences. The home page can either be set to a URL you specify or set to the New Tab Page.

HomepageLocation.title: Home page URL
HomepageLocation.description: Configures the default home page URL in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing it.

Http09OnNonDefaultPortsEnabled.title: Enable HTTP/0.9 support on non-default ports
Http09OnNonDefaultPortsEnabled.description: This policy enables HTTP/0.9 on ports other than 80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS.

ImagesAllowedForUrls.title: Allow images on these sites
ImagesAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to display images.

ImagesBlockedForUrls.title: Block images on these sites
ImagesBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to display images.

ImportAutofillFormData.title: Import autofill form data from default browser on first run
ImportAutofillFormData.description: This policy forces the autofill form data to be imported from the previous default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportBookmarks.title: Import bookmarks from default browser on first run
ImportBookmarks.description: This policy forces bookmarks to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportHistory.title: Import browsing history from default browser on first run
ImportHistory.description: This policy forces the browsing history to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportHomepage.title: Import of homepage from default browser on first run
ImportHomepage.description: This policy forces the home page to be imported from the current default browser if enabled.

ImportSavedPasswords.title: Import saved passwords from default browser on first run
ImportSavedPasswords.description: This policy forces the saved passwords to be imported from the previous default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportSearchEngine.title: Import search engines from default browser on first run
ImportSearchEngine.description: This policy forces search engines to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

IncognitoEnabled.title: Enable Incognito
IncognitoEnabled.description:
This policy is deprecated. Please, use IncognitoModeAvailability instead. Enables Incognito mode in Google Chrome.

If this setting is enabled or not configured, users can open web pages in incognito mode.

IncognitoModeAvailability.title: Incognito mode availability
IncognitoModeAvailability.description: Specifies whether the user may open pages in Incognito mode in Google Chrome.

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.title: Allow insecure content on these sites
InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to display blockable (i.e. active) mixed content (i.e. HTTP content on HTTPS sites) and for which optionally blockable mixed content upgrades will be disabled.

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.title: Block insecure content on these sites
InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to display blockable (i.e. active) mixed content (i.e. HTTP content on HTTPS sites), and for which optionally blockable (i.e. passive) mixed content will be upgraded.

IntensiveWakeUpThrottlingEnabled.title: Enable Intensive Wake Up Throttling
IntensiveWakeUpThrottlingEnabled.description: When enabled, the IntensiveWakeUpThrottling feature causes JavaScript timers in background tabs to be aggressively throttled and coalesced, running no more than once per minute after a page has been backgrounded for 5 minutes or more.

IsolateOrigins.title: Enable Site Isolation for specified origins
IsolateOrigins.description: If the policy is enabled, each of the named origins in a comma-separated list will run in its own process. This will also isolate origins named by subdomains; e.g. specifying https://example.com/ will also cause https://foo.example.com/ to be isolated as part of the https://example.com/ site. If the policy is disabled, no explicit Site Isolation will happen and field trials of IsolateOrigins and SitePerProcess will be disabled. Users will still be able to enable IsolateOrigins manually. If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting. On Google Chrome OS, it is recommended to also set the DeviceLoginScreenIsolateOrigins device policy to the same value. If the values specified by the two policies don't match, a delay may be incurred when entering a user session while the value specified by user policy is being applied.

JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.title: Allow JavaScript on these sites
JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run JavaScript.

JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.title: Block JavaScript on these sites
JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run JavaScript.

JavascriptEnabled.title: Javascript Enabled
JavascriptEnabled.description:
This policy is deprecated, please use DefaultJavaScriptSetting instead.

Can be used to disabled JavaScript in Google Chrome.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.title: Enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.description: Allows you to revert all cookies to legacy SameSite behavior.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.title: Enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior for list of domains
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.description: Cookies set for domains matching these patterns will revert to legacy SameSite behavior. For cookies on domains not covered by the patterns specified here, or for all cookies if this policy is not set, the global default value will be used either from the LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled policy, if it is set, or the user's personal configuration otherwise.

LocalDiscoveryEnabled.title: Enable chrome://devices
LocalDiscoveryEnabled.description: This policy controls access to controllable features in the local discovery UI (chrome://devices) which shows discoverable devices near the user as well as cloud devices registered to them. On all operating systems except for Google Chrome OS, the local discovery UI also allows users to add classic printers connected to their computers to Google Cloud Print.

LookalikeWarningAllowlistDomains.title: Suppress lookalike domain warnings on domains
LookalikeWarningAllowlistDomains.description: This policy prevents the display of lookalike URL warnings on the sites listed. These warnings are typically shown on sites that Google Chrome believes might be trying to spoof another site the user is familiar with. If the policy is enabled and set to one or more domains, no lookalike warnings pages will be shown when the user visits pages on that domain. If the policy is disabled, not set, or set to an empty list, warnings may appear on any site the user visits.

MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollmentTok.title: The enrollment token of cloud policy on desktop
MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollmentTok.description: The enrollment token of cloud policy on desktop. This policy is deprecated in M72. Please use CloudManagementEnrollmentToken instead.

ManagedBookmarks.title: Managed Bookmarks
ManagedBookmarks.description: Configures a list of managed bookmarks.

MaxConnectionsPerProxy.title: Maximal number of concurrent connections to the proxy server
MaxConnectionsPerProxy.description: Specifies the maximal number of simultaneous connections to the proxy server.

MaxInvalidationFetchDelay.title: Maximum fetch delay after a policy invalidation
MaxInvalidationFetchDelay.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds between receiving a policy invalidation and fetching the new policy from the device management service.

MediaRecommendationsEnabled.title: Enable Media Recommendations
MediaRecommendationsEnabled.description: By default the browser will show media recommendations that are personalized to the user. Setting this policy to Disabled will result in these recommendations being hidden from the user. Setting this policy to Enabled or leaving it unset will result in the media recommendations being shown to the user.

MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.title: Allow Google Cast to connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses.
MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.description: If this policy is set to true, Google Cast will connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses, not just RFC1918/RFC4913 private addresses.

MetricsReportingEnabled.title: Enable reporting of usage and crash-related data
MetricsReportingEnabled.description: Enables anonymous reporting of usage and crash-related data about Google Chrome to Google and prevents users from changing this setting.

NTPCardsVisible.title: Show cards on the New Tab Page
NTPCardsVisible.description:
This policy controls the visibility of cards on the New Tab Page. Cards surface entry points to launch common user journeys based on the user's browsing behavior.

If the policy is set to Enabled, the New Tab Page will show cards if content is available.

If the policy is set to Disabled, the New Tab Page won't show cards.

NTPCustomBackgroundEnabled.title: Allow New Tab page background customization
NTPCustomBackgroundEnabled.description: Allow users to customize the background on the New Tab page

NativeMessagingAllowlist.title: Native Messaging Host Allowlist
NativeMessagingAllowlist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts are not subject to the block list. A block list value of * means all native messaging hosts are denied and only native messaging hosts listed in the allow list will be loaded.

NativeMessagingBlacklist.title: Native Messaging Host Blacklist
NativeMessagingBlacklist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts that should not be loaded. A blacklist value of '*' means all native messaging hosts are denied unless they are explicitly listed in the allowlist.

NativeMessagingBlocklist.title: Native Messaging Host Blocklist
NativeMessagingBlocklist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts that should not be loaded. A block list value of '*' means all native messaging hosts are denied unless they are explicitly listed in the allow list.

NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.title: Allow user-level Native Messaging hosts (installed without admin permissions)
NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.description: Enables user-level installation of Native Messaging hosts.

NativeMessagingWhitelist.title: Native Messaging Host Whitelist
NativeMessagingWhitelist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts are not subject to the blacklist. A blacklist value of * means all native messaging hosts are denied and only native messaging hosts listed in the whitelist will be loaded.

NetworkPredictionOptions.title: Enable network prediction
NetworkPredictionOptions.description:
(Deprecated in 50, removed in 52. After 52, if value 1 is set, it will be treated as 0 - predict network actions on any network connection.)
Enables network prediction in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

NewTabPageLocation.title: New Tab page URL
NewTabPageLocation.description: Configures the default New Tab page URL and prevents users from changing it.

NotificationsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow notifications on these sites
NotificationsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to display notifications.

NotificationsBlockedForUrls.title: Block notifications on these sites
NotificationsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to display notifications.

OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.title: Origins or hostname patterns to be treated as secure context.
OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.description:
The policy specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (such as "*.example.com") to be treated as secure contexts. The intent is to allow organizations to set up a staging server for internal web development, so that their developers can test out features requiring secure contexts without having to deploy TLS on the staging server.

Setting a list of URLs in this policy has the same effect as setting the command-line flag '--unsafely-treat-insecure-origin-as-secure' to a comma-separated list of the same URLs. If the policy is set, it will override the command-line flag.

For more information on secure contexts, see https://www.w3.org/TR/secure-contexts/

PasswordLeakDetectionEnabled.title: Enable password leak detection
PasswordLeakDetectionEnabled.description: This policy can be used to force enable or force disable credential leak checking in Google Chrome.

PasswordManagerEnabled.title: Enable saving passwords to the password manager
PasswordManagerEnabled.description: If this setting is enabled, users can have Google Chrome memorize passwords and provide them automatically the next time they log in to a site.

PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.title: Configure the change password URL.
PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.description:
Configure the change password URL (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only). Password protection service will send users to this URL to change their password after seeing a warning in the browser.
In order for Google Chrome to correctly capture the new password fingerprint on this change password page, please make sure your change password page follows the guidelines on https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/create-amazing-password-forms.

PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.title: Configure the list of enterprise login URLs where password protection service should capture fingerprint of password.
PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.description:
Configure the list of enterprise login URLs (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only). Fingerprint of password will be captured on these URLs and used for password reuse detection.
In order for Google Chrome to correctly capture password fingerprints, please make sure your login pages follow the guidelines on https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/create-amazing-password-forms.

PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.title: Password protection warning trigger
PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.description: Allows you to control the triggering of passwore protection warning. Password protection alerts users when they reuse their protected password on potentially suspicious sites.

PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.title: Payment Method Query
PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to check if the user has payment methods saved.

PluginsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PluginsBlockedForUrls.title: Block the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PolicyAtomicGroupsEnabled.title: Enable Policy Atomic Groups
PolicyAtomicGroupsEnabled.description: Enables the concept of policy atomic groups.

PolicyDictionaryMultipleSourceMergeList.title: Allow merging dictionary policies from different sources
PolicyDictionaryMultipleSourceMergeList.description: Allows the selected policies to be merged when they come from different sources, with the same scopes and level. Entered strings must match a Chrome policy / key name that uses a dictionary for its data type.

PolicyListMultipleSourceMergeList.title: Allow merging list policies from different sources
PolicyListMultipleSourceMergeList.description: Allows the selected policies to be merged when they come from different sources, with the same scopes and level. Entered strings must match a Chrome policy / key name that use an array (list) of strings for its data type.

PolicyRefreshRate.title: Policy Refresh Rate
PolicyRefreshRate.description: Refresh rate for user policy. Specifies the period in milliseconds at which the device management service is queried for user policy information. Setting this policy overrides the default value of 3 hours. Valid values for this policy are in the range from 1800000 (30 minutes) to 86400000 (1 day).

PopupsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow popups on these sites
PopupsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to open popups.

PopupsBlockedForUrls.title: Block popups on these sites
PopupsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to open popups.

PrintHeaderFooter.title: Print Headers & Footers
PrintHeaderFooter.description: Force 'headers and footers' to be on or off in the printing dialog.

PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.title: Use System Default Printer as Default
PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.description: Causes Google Chrome to use the system default printer as the default choice in Print Preview instead of the most recently used printer.

PrinterPaperSizeDefault.title: Default printer paper size
PrinterPaperSizeDefault.description: Overrides default printing page size. If 'custom' is provided, custom size width and height keys must also be included.

PrinterTypeDenyList.title: Printer Type Deny List
PrinterTypeDenyList.description: The printers of types placed on the deny list will be disabled from being discovered or having their capabilities fetched.

PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.title: Background graphics printing mode
PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.description: Restricts background graphics printing mode. Unset policy is treated as no restriction.

PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.title: Default background graphics printing mode
PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.description: Overrides default background graphics printing mode.

PrintingEnabled.title: Enable printing
PrintingEnabled.description: Enables printing in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

PrivacySandboxAdMeasurementEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Ad Measurement Enabled
PrivacySandboxAdMeasurementEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Ad measurement setting can be disabled for your users.

PrivacySandboxAdTopicsEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Ad Topics Enabled
PrivacySandboxAdTopicsEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Ad measurement setting can be disabled for your users.

PrivacySandboxPromptEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Prompt Enabled
PrivacySandboxPromptEnabled.description: A policy to control whether your users see the Privacy Sandbox prompt.

PrivacySandboxSiteEnabledAdsEnabled.title: Privacy Sandbox Site Enabled Ads Enabled
PrivacySandboxSiteEnabledAdsEnabled.description: A policy to control whether the Privacy Sandbox Site-suggested ads setting can be disabled for your users.

ProfilePickerOnStartupAvailability.title: Profile picker availabily on startup
ProfilePickerOnStartupAvailability.description: Specifies whether the profile picker is enabled, disabled or forced at the browser startup. By default the profile picker is not shown if the browser starts in guest or incognito mode, a profile directory and/or urls are specified by command line, an app is explicitly requested to open, the browser was launched by a native notification, there is only one profile available or the policy ForceBrowserSignin is set to true.

PromotionalTabsEnabled.title: Enable showing full-tab promotional content
PromotionalTabsEnabled.description: Allows you to control the presentation of full-tab promotional and/or educational content in Google Chrome.

PromptForDownloadLocation.title: Ask where to save each file before downloading
PromptForDownloadLocation.description:
If the policy is enabled, the user will be asked where to save each file before downloading.
If the policy is disabled, downloads will start immediately, and the user will not be asked where to save the file.
If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting.

ProxyBypassList.title: Comma-separated list of proxy bypass rules
ProxyBypassList.description: Google Chrome will bypass any proxy for the list of hosts given here.

ProxyMode.title: Choose how to specify proxy server settings
ProxyMode.description: Allows you to specify the proxy server used by Google Chrome and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxyPacUrl.title: URL to a proxy .pac file
ProxyPacUrl.description: You can specify a URL to a proxy .pac file here.

ProxyServer.title: Address or URL of proxy server
ProxyServer.description: You can specify the URL of the proxy server here.

ProxyServerMode.title: Proxy server settings
ProxyServerMode.description:
This policy is deprecated, use ProxyMode instead.

Allows you to specify the proxy server used by Google Chrome and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxySettings.title: Proxy Settings
ProxySettings.description:
Configures the proxy settings for Google Chrome. These proxy settings will be available for ARC-apps too.

If you enable this setting, Google Chrome and ARC-apps ignore all proxy-related options specified from the command line.

ProxyBypassList.title: Proxy Bypass List
ProxyBypassList.description: Defines a comma-separated list of hosts for which Google Chrome bypasses any proxy.

ProxyMode.title: Proxy Mode
ProxyMode.description: Specifies the proxy server Google Chrome uses and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxyPacMandatory.title: Proxy PAC Mandatory
ProxyPacMandatory.description: Prevents the network stack from falling back to direct connections with invalid or unavailable PAC script.

ProxyPacUrl.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPacUrl.description: Specifies the URL for a proxy auto-config (PAC) file.

ProxyServer.title: Proxy Server URL
ProxyServer.description: Specifies the URL of the proxy server

QuicAllowed.title: Allow QUIC protocol
QuicAllowed.description:
If this policy is set to true or not set usage of QUIC protocol in Google Chrome is allowed.
If this policy is set to false usage of QUIC protocol is disallowed.

RegisteredProtocolHandlers.title: Register protocol handlers
RegisteredProtocolHandlers.description: Allows you to register a list of protocol handlers. This can only be a recommended policy. The property |protocol| should be set to the scheme such as 'mailto' and the property |url| should be set to the URL pattern of the application that handles the scheme. The pattern can include a '%s', which if present will be replaced by the handled URL.

RelaunchNotification.title: Notify a user that a browser relaunch is recommended or required
RelaunchNotification.description: Notify users that Google Chrome must be relaunched to apply a pending update.

RelaunchNotificationPeriod.title: Update time period
RelaunchNotificationPeriod.description: Allows you to set the time period, in milliseconds, over which users are notified that Google Chrome must be relaunched or that a Google Chrome OS device must be restarted to apply a pending update.

RemoteAccessHostAllowClientPairing.title: Enable or disable PIN-less authentication for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostAllowClientPairing.description: If this setting is enabled or not configured, then users can opt to pair clients and hosts at connection time, eliminating the need to enter a PIN every time.

RemoteAccessHostAllowFileTransfer.title: Allow remote access file transfer
RemoteAccessHostAllowFileTransfer.description: Controls the ability of a user connected to a remote access host to transfer files between the client and the host. This does not apply to remote assistance connections, which do not support file transfer.

RemoteAccessHostAllowGnubbyAuth.title: Allow gnubby authentication for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostAllowGnubbyAuth.description: If this setting is enabled, then gnubby authentication requests will be proxied across a remote host connection.

RemoteAccessHostAllowRelayedConnection.title: Enable the use of relay servers by the remote access host
RemoteAccessHostAllowRelayedConnection.description: Enables usage of relay servers when remote clients are trying to establish a connection to this machine.

RemoteAccessHostClientDomain.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access clients
RemoteAccessHostClientDomain.description: Configure the required domain name for remote access clients. This policy is deprecated. Please use RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList instead.

RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access clients
RemoteAccessHostClientDomainList.description: Configures the required client domain names that will be imposed on remote access clients and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostDomain.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostDomain.description: Configure the required domain name for remote access hosts. This policy is deprecated. Please use RemoteAccessHostDomainList instead.

RemoteAccessHostDomainList.title: Configure the required domain names for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostDomainList.description: Configures the required host domain names that will be imposed on remote access hosts and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal.title: Enable firewall traversal from remote access host
RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal.description: Enables usage of STUN servers when remote clients are trying to establish a connection to this machine.

RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername.title: Require that the name of the local user and the remote access host owner match
RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername.description: If this setting is enabled, then the remote access host compares the name of the local user (that the host is associated with) and the name of the Google account registered as the host owner (i.e. "johndoe" if the host is owned by "johndoe@example.com" Google account).  The remote access host will not start if the name of the host owner is different from the name of the local user that the host is associated with.  RemoteAccessHostMatchUsername policy should be used together with RemoteAccessHostDomain to also enforce that the Google account of the host owner is associated with a specific domain (i.e. "example.com").

RemoteAccessHostRequireCurtain.title: Enable curtaining of remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostRequireCurtain.description: Enables curtaining of remote access hosts while a connection is in progress.

RemoteAccessHostTalkGadgetPrefix.title: Configure the TalkGadget prefix for remote access hosts
RemoteAccessHostTalkGadgetPrefix.description: Configures the TalkGadget prefix that will be used by remote access hosts and prevents users from changing it.

RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.title: URL where remote access clients should obtain their authentication token
RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.description: If this policy is set, the remote access host will require authenticating clients to obtain an authentication token from this URL in order to connect. Must be used in conjunction with RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.

RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationCertifica.title: Client certificate for connecting to RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl
RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationCertifica.description: If this policy is set, the host will use a client certificate with the given issuer CN to authenticate to RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl. Set it to "*" to use any available client certificate.

RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.title: URL for validating remote access client authentication token
RemoteAccessHostTokenValidationUrl.description: If this policy is set, the remote access host will use this URL to validate authentication tokens from remote access clients, in order to accept connections. Must be used in conjunction with RemoteAccessHostTokenUrl.

RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange.title: Restrict the UDP port range used by the remote access host
RemoteAccessHostUdpPortRange.description: Restricts the UDP port range used by the remote access host in this machine.

RestoreOnStartup.title: Action on startup
RestoreOnStartup.description: Allows you to specify the behavior on startup.

RestoreOnStartupURLs.title: URLs to open on startup
RestoreOnStartupURLs.description: If 'Open a list of URLs' is selected as the startup action, this allows you to specify the list of URLs that are opened. If left not set no URL will be opened on start up.

RestrictSigninToPattern.title: Restrict which users are allowed to sign in to Google Chrome
RestrictSigninToPattern.description: Contains a regular expression which is used to determine which users can sign in to Google Chrome.

RunAllFlashInAllowMode.title: Extend Flash content setting to all content
RunAllFlashInAllowMode.description: If you enable this setting, all Flash content embedded on websites that have been set to allow Flash in content settings -- either by the user or by enterprise policy -- will be run, including content from other origins or small content.

SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.title: Allow proceeding from the SSL warning page
SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.description:
Chrome shows a warning page when users navigate to sites that have SSL errors. By default or when this policy is set to true, users are allowed to click through these warning pages.
Setting this policy to false disallows users to click through any warning page.

SSLVersionMin.title: Minimum SSL version enabled
SSLVersionMin.description: If this policy is not configured then Google Chrome uses a default minimum version which is TLS 1.0.

SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains.title: Configure the list of domains on which Safe Browsing will not trigger warnings.
SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains.description:
Configure the list of domains which Safe Browsing will trust. This means:
Safe Browsing will not check for dangerous resources (e.g. phishing, malware, or unwanted software) if their URLs match these domains.
Safe Browsing's download protection service will not check downloads hosted on these domains.
Safe Browsing's password protection service will not check for password reuse if the page URL matches these domains.

SafeBrowsingEnabled.title: Enable Safe Browsing
SafeBrowsingEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome's Safe Browsing feature and prevents users from changing this setting.

SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled.title: Enable Safe Browsing Extended Reporting
SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled.description: Enables Google Chrome's Safe Browsing Extended Reporting and prevents users from changing this setting.

SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowe.title: Allow users to opt in to Safe Browsing extended reporting
SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowe.description: This setting is deprecated, use SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled instead. Enabling or disabling SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled is equivalent to setting SafeBrowsingExtendedReportingOptInAllowed to False.

SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel.title: Safe Browsing protection level
SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel.description: Allows you to control whether Google Chrome's Safe Browsing feature is enabled and the mode it operates in. Safe Browsing 'enhanced' mode provides better security, but requires sharing more browsing information with Google.

SafeBrowsingWhitelistDomains.title: Configure the list of domains on which Safe Browsing will not trigger warnings.
SafeBrowsingWhitelistDomains.description:
Configure the list of domains which Safe Browsing will trust. This means:
Safe Browsing will not check for dangerous resources (e.g. phishing, malware, or unwanted software) if their URLs match these domains.
Safe Browsing's download protection service will not check downloads hosted on these domains.
Safe Browsing's password protection service will not check for password reuse if the page URL matches these domains.

SafeSitesFilterBehavior.title: Control SafeSites adult content filtering.
SafeSitesFilterBehavior.description:
This policy controls the application of the SafeSites URL filter.
This filter uses the Google Safe Search API to classify URLs as pornographic or not.

SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.title: Disable saving browser history
SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.description: Disables saving browser history in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

ScreenCaptureAllowed.title: Screen Capture
ScreenCaptureAllowed.description: If enabled or not configured (default), a Web page can use screen-share APIs (e.g., getDisplayMedia() or the Desktop Capture extension API) to prompt the user to select a tab, window or desktop to capture.

ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.title: Enable scroll to text fragment
ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.description: This feature allows for hyperlinks and address bar URL navigations to target specific text within a web page, which will be scrolled to once the loading of the web page is complete.

SearchSuggestEnabled.title: Enable search suggestions
SearchSuggestEnabled.description: Enables search suggestions in Google Chrome's omnibox and prevents users from changing this setting.

SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.title: URLs/domains automatically permitted direct Security Key attestation
SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.description: Specifies URLs and domains for which no prompt will be shown when attestation certificates from Security Keys are requested. Additionally, a signal will be sent to the Security Key indicating that individual attestation may be used. Without this, users will be prompted in Chrome 65+ when sites request attestation of Security Keys.

SharedClipboardEnabled.title: Enable Shared Clipboard
SharedClipboardEnabled.description: Enables the Shared Clipboard feature which allows users to send text between Chrome Desktops and an Android device when Sync is enabled and the user is Signed-in.

ShowAppsShortcutInBookmarkBar.title: Show the apps shortcut in the bookmark bar
ShowAppsShortcutInBookmarkBar.description: Enables or disables the apps shortcut in the bookmark bar.

ShowCastIconInToolbar.title: Show the Google Cast toolbar icon
ShowCastIconInToolbar.description: If this policy is set to true, the Cast toolbar icon will always be shown on the toolbar or the overflow menu, and users will not be able to remove it.

ShowFullUrlsInAddressBar.title: Show Full URLs
ShowFullUrlsInAddressBar.description: This feature enables display of the full URL in the address bar. If this policy is set to True, then the full URL will be shown in the address bar, including schemes and subdomains. If this policy is set to False, then the default URL display will apply.

ShowHomeButton.title: Show Home button on toolbar
ShowHomeButton.description: Shows the Home button on Google Chrome's toolbar.

SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.title: Enabled Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG) support
SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.description: Enable support for Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG).

SigninAllowed.title: Allow sign in
SigninAllowed.description:
This policy is deprecated, consider using BrowserSignin instead.

Allows the user to sign in to Google Chrome.

SigninInterceptionEnabled.title: Enable signin interception
SigninInterceptionEnabled.description: This settings enables or disables signin interception. When this policy not set or is set to True, the signin interception dialog triggers when a Google account is added on the web, and the user may benefit from moving this account to another (new or existing) profile. When this is set to False, the signin interception dialog does not trigger.

SitePerProcess.title: Enable Site Isolation for every site
SitePerProcess.description: You might want to look at the IsolateOrigins policy setting to get the best of both worlds, isolation and limited impact for users, by using IsolateOrigins with a list of the sites you want to isolate. This setting, SitePerProcess, isolates all sites. If the policy is enabled, each site will run in its own process. If the policy is disabled, no explicit Site Isolation will happen and field trials of IsolateOrigins and SitePerProcess will be disabled. Users will still be able to enable SitePerProcess manually. If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting. On Google Chrome OS, it is recommended to also set the DeviceLoginScreenSitePerProcess device policy to the same value. If the values specified by the two policies don't match, a delay may be incurred when entering a user session while the value specified by user policy is being applied.

SpellCheckServiceEnabled.title: Enable or disable spell checking web service
SpellCheckServiceEnabled.description: Google Chrome can use a Google web service to help resolve spelling errors. If this setting is enabled, then this service is always used. If this setting is disabled, then this service is never used.

SpellcheckEnabled.title: Enable spellcheck
SpellcheckEnabled.description: If this policy is not set or enabled, the user is allowed to use spellcheck.

StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.title: Stricter Mixed Content Treatment
StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.description: This policy controls the treatment for mixed content (HTTP content in HTTPS sites) in the browser. If the policy is set to true or unset, audio and video mixed content will be autoupgraded to HTTPS (i.e. the URL will be rewritten as HTTPS, without a fallback if the resource is not available over HTTPS) and a 'Not Secure' warning will be shown in the URL bar for image mixed content. If the policy is set to false, autoupgrades will be disabled for audio and video, and no warning will be shown for images. This policy does not affect other types of mixed content other than audio, video, and images. This policy will no longer take effect starting in Google Chrome 84.

SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.title: Suppress the unsupported OS warning
SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.description: Suppresses the warning that appears when Google Chrome is running on a computer or operating system that is no longer supported.

SyncDisabled.title: Disable synchronization of data with Google
SyncDisabled.description: Disables data synchronization in Google Chrome using Google-hosted synchronization services and prevents users from changing this setting.

SyncTypesListDisabled.title: Sync types to disable
SyncTypesListDisabled.description: If this policy is set, all specified data types will be excluded from synchronization both for Google Sync as well as for roaming profile synchronization.

TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.title: Enable TLS 1.3 hardening for local anchors
TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.description: Enable a TLS 1.3 security feature for local trust anchors. This policy controls a security feature in TLS 1.3 which protects connections against downgrade attacks. It is backwards-compatible and will not affect connections to compliant TLS 1.2 servers or proxies. However, older versions of some TLS-intercepting proxies have an implementation flaw which causes them to be incompatible.

TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.title: Do not set window.opener for links targeting _blank
TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.description: Setting the policy to Disabled allows popups targeting _blank to access (via JavaScript) the page that requested to open the popup. Setting the policy to Enabled or leaving it unset causes the window.opener property to be set to null unless the anchor specifies rel="opener".

TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.title: Enable ending processes in Task Manager
TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.description: If set to false, the 'End process' button is disabled in the Task Manager.

ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.title: Third Party Storage Partitioning Blocked For Origins
ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify top-level (the url in the tab's address bar) origins which block third-party storage partitioning (partitioning of cross-origin iframe storage). If this policy is left not set or a top-level origin doesn't match then the value from DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSetting will be used.

TotalMemoryLimitMb.title: Total Memory Limit
TotalMemoryLimitMb.description: Configures the amount of memory that a single Google Chrome instance can use before tabs start being discarded (I.E. the memory used by the tab will be freed and the tab will have to be reloaded when switched to) to save memory. The minimum allowed value is 1024.

TranslateEnabled.title: Enable Translate
TranslateEnabled.description: Enables the integrated Google Translate service on Google Chrome.

URLAllowlist.title: Allow access to a list of URLs
URLAllowlist.description: Allows access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to the URL block list. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLBlacklist.title: URL Blacklist
URLBlacklist.description: This policy prevents the user from loading web pages from blacklisted URLs. The denylist provides a list of URL patterns that specify which URLs will be denied. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLBlocklist.title: URL Blocklist
URLBlocklist.description: This policy prevents the user from loading web pages from blocked URLs. The blocklist provides a list of URL patterns that specify which URLs will be denied. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

URLWhitelist.title: Allow access to a list of URLs
URLWhitelist.description: Allows access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to the URL denylist. A URL pattern is formatted according to https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blacklist-filter-format.

UnsafelyTreatInsecureOriginAsSecure.title: Origins or hostname patterns for which restrictions on insecure origins should not apply
UnsafelyTreatInsecureOriginAsSecure.description:
Deprecated in M69. Use OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOrigin instead.

The policy specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (such as "*.example.com") for which security restrictions on insecure origins will not apply.

UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled.title: Enable URL-keyed anonymized data collection
UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled.description: Enable URL-keyed anonymized data collection in Google Chrome and prevents users from changing this setting.

UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.title: Enable user agent client hints
UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.description: When enabled the User-Agent Client Hints feature sends granular request headers providing information about the user browser and environment.

UserDataDir.title: Set user data directory
UserDataDir.description: Configures the directory that Google Chrome will use for storing user data. See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used.

UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.title: User data snapshot retention limit
UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.description: Limits the number of user data snapshots retained for use in case of emergency rollback. If this policy is not set, the default value of 3 is used. If the policy is set to 0, no snapshots will be taken.

UserFeedbackAllowed.title: Allow user feedback
UserFeedbackAllowed.description: Allow user feedback. If the policy is set to false, users can not send feedback to Google.

VideoCaptureAllowed.title: Allow or deny video capture
VideoCaptureAllowed.description:
If enabled or not configured (default), the user will be prompted for
video capture access except for URLs configured in the
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls list which will be granted access without prompting.

VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.title: URLs that will be granted access to video capture devices without prompt
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.description:
Patterns in this list will be matched against the security
origin of the requesting URL.  If a match is found, access to audio
capture devices will be granted without prompt.

WPADQuickCheckEnabled.title: Enable WPAD optimization
WPADQuickCheckEnabled.description: Allows to turn off WPAD (Web Proxy Auto-Discovery) optimization in Google Chrome.

WebAppInstallForceList.title: WebApp Force Install List
WebAppInstallForceList.description: Specifies a list of websites that are installed silently, without user interaction, and which cannot be uninstalled nor disabled by the user.

WebComponentsV0Enabled.title: Re-enable Web Components v0 API until M84
WebComponentsV0Enabled.description: The Web Components v0 APIs (Shadow DOM v0, Custom Elements v0, and HTML Imports) were deprecated in 2018, and have been disabled by default starting in M80. This policy allows these features to be selectively re-enabled until M84.

WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.title: Allow WebDriver to Override Incompatible Policies
WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.description: This policy allows users of the WebDriver feature to override policies which can interfere with its operation.

WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.title: Allow legacy TLS/DTLS downgrade in WebRTC
WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.description: f enabled, WebRTC peer connections can downgrade to obsolete versions of the TLS/DTLS (DTLS 1.0, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1) protocols. When this policy is disabled or not set, these TLS/DTLS versions are disabled.

WebRtcEventLogCollectionAllowed.title: Allow collection of WebRTC event logs from Google services
WebRtcEventLogCollectionAllowed.description: If the policy is set to true, Google Chrome is allowed to collect WebRTC event logs from Google services (e.g. Google Meet), and upload those logs to Google.

WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.title: Allowed WebRTC local IP URLs
WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.description: Patterns in this list will be matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If a match is found or chrome://flags/#enable-webrtc-hide-local-ips-with-mdns is Disabled, the local IP addresses are shown in WebRTC ICE candidates. Otherwise, local IP addresses are concealed with mDNS hostnames.

WebRtcUdpPortRange.title: Restrict the range of local UDP ports used by WebRTC
WebRtcUdpPortRange.description: If the policy is set, the UDP port range used by WebRTC is restricted to the specified port interval (endpoints included).

WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.title: Automatically grant permission to these sites to connect to USB devices with the given vendor and product IDs
WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of urls that specify which sites will automatically be granted permission to access a USB device with the given vendor and product IDs.

WebUsbAskForUrls.title: Allow WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbAskForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to ask the user to grant them access to a USB device.

WebUsbBlockedForUrls.title: Block WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are prevented from asking the user to grant them access to a USB device.

TargetVersionPrefix.title: Chrome Update Version Pin
TargetVersionPrefix.description: Pin an application to a single version. This stops your devices from updating to versions of the app beyond the number you specify. This should be done only temporarily, such as while testing a new version.

UpdateDefault.title: Chrome Update
UpdateDefault.description:
Enable auto-updates & installs = Turns on auto-updates. Chrome updates are always applied when detected by Google Software Update.
Install updates at scheduled update checks = Manual update checks will not install updates.
Turn off updates = Stops Google Software Update automatically updating all users to the latest stable version of Chrome. Updates are only applied when the user manually checks for updates.
Updates never applied = Never update Chrome

TargetVersionPrefix.title: Backup & Sync Update Version Pin
TargetVersionPrefix.description: Pin an application to a single version. This stops your devices from updating to versions of the app beyond the number you specify. This should be done only temporarily, such as while testing a new version.

UpdateDefault.title: Backup & Sync Update
UpdateDefault.description:
Enable auto-updates & installs = Turns on auto-updates. Backup & Sync updates are always applied when detected by Google Software Update.
Install updates at scheduled update checks = Manual update checks will not install updates.
Turn off updates = Stops Google Software Update automatically updating all users to the latest stable version of Backup & Sync. Updates are only applied when the user manually checks for updates.
Updates never applied = Never update Backup & Sync

TargetVersionPrefix.title: Chat Update Version Pin
TargetVersionPrefix.description: Pin an application to a single version. This stops your devices from updating to versions of the app beyond the number you specify. This should be done only temporarily, such as while testing a new version.

UpdateDefault.title: Chat Update
UpdateDefault.description:
Enable auto-updates & installs = Turns on auto-updates. Chat updates are always applied when detected by Google Software Update.
Install updates at scheduled update checks = Manual update checks will not install updates.
Turn off updates = Stops Google Software Update automatically updating all users to the latest stable version of Chat. Updates are only applied when the user manually checks for updates.
Updates never applied = Never update Chat

com.google.drivefs.title: Drive File Stream Update settings
com.google.drivefs.description: Configure Drive File Stream update settings

TargetVersionPrefix.title: Drive File Stream Update Version Pin
TargetVersionPrefix.description: Pin an application to a single version. This stops your devices from updating to versions of the app beyond the number you specify. This should be done only temporarily, such as while testing a new version.

UpdateDefault.title: Drive File Stream Update
UpdateDefault.description:
Enable auto-updates & installs = Turns on auto-updates. FileStream updates are always applied when detected by Google Software Update.
Install updates at scheduled update checks = Manual update checks will not install updates.
Turn off updates = Stops Google Software Update automatically updating all users to the latest stable version of FileStream. Updates are only applied when the user manually checks for updates.
Updates never applied = Never update FileStream

ComponentUpdatesEnabled.title: Enable Global Component Updates
ComponentUpdatesEnabled.description: Even if you turn off automatic updates for Chrome Browser, browser components won't automatically stop updating, including Adobe Flash, Widevine DRM - for encrypted media -, and the Chrome updater recovery component.

DownloadPreference.title: Global Download Preference
DownloadPreference.description: This preference is referenced in an example property list in the documentation, but is not discussed. So it exists, but what it manages and the possible string values are not known.

UpdateDefault.title: Global Google Update
UpdateDefault.description:
Enable auto-updates & installs = Turns on auto-updates. Updates are always applied when detected by Google Software Update.
Install updates at scheduled update checks = Manual update checks will not install updates.
Turn off updates = Stops Google Software Update automatically updating all users to the latest stable version of Google apps. Updates are only applied when the user manually checks for updates.
Updates never applied = Never update Google apps

UpdatesSupressedDurationMin.title: Global Google Update Schedule - Duration
UpdatesSupressedDurationMin.description: The length of time, in minutes, that auto-updates can be made. If you set this value to 0, the system behaves as if no update window is specified.

UpdatesSupressedStartHour.title: Global Google Update Schedule - Start Hour
UpdatesSupressedStartHour.description: The time in 24-hour clock format, that auto-updates start. Use a value between 0 - midnight - and 23.

UpdatesSupressedStartMinute.title: Global Google Update Schedule - Start Minute
UpdatesSupressedStartMinute.description: The minute, within the starting hour, that auto-updates start. Use a value between 0 and 59.

com.google.drivefs.settings.title: Google Drive for desktop
com.google.drivefs.settings.description: Use this section to define settings for Google Drive for desktop

AllowedAccountsPattern.title: Allowed Accounts Pattern
AllowedAccountsPattern.description: Regular expression indicating accounts that are allowed to sign in on this machine.

AutoStartOnLogin.title: Auto Start on Login
AutoStartOnLogin.description: Start Drive for desktop automatically on session login.

ContentCacheMaxKbytes.title: Max Content Cache Size
ContentCacheMaxKbytes.description: Sets the limit on content cache size in kilobytes. The limit is capped at 20% of the available space on the hard drive regardless of the setting value.

ContentCachePath.title: Content Cache Path
ContentCachePath.description: Sets the path to the content cache location on a connected APFS or HFS+ file system.

DefaultMountPoint.title: Default Mount Point
DefaultMountPoint.description: Set the mounted drive path. You can include tilde (~) or environment variables in the path.

DisableCRLCheck.title: Disable CRL Check
DisableCRLCheck.description: This disables checking Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) provided by certificate authorities. If not explicitly set, this defaults to true if TrustedRootCertsFile is provided, otherwise false.

DisableLocalizedVirtualFolders.title: Disable Localized Virtual Folders
DisableLocalizedVirtualFolders.description: Disables localized names for My Drive, Shared drives, and Computers. Names remain in en-US instead of being localized to the OS system language.

DisableMeetOutlookPlugin.title: Disable Meet Outlook Plugin
DisableMeetOutlookPlugin.description: Disables the Microsoft Outlook Meet plugin that's bundled with Drive for desktop.

DisableOnboardingDialog.title: Disable Onboarding Dialog
DisableOnboardingDialog.description: Disables the welcome window for new users.

DisableOutlookPlugin.title: Disable Outlook Plugin
DisableOutlookPlugin.description: Disables the Microsoft Outlook Google Drive attachment plugin that's bundled with Drive for desktop.

DisableRealTimePresence.title: Disable Real Time Presence
DisableRealTimePresence.description: Disables real-time presence in Microsoft Office (https://support.google.com/drive/answer/7329379#realtime)

DisableSSLValidation.title: Disable SSL Validation
DisableSSLValidation.description: This disables validating SSL traffic. Traffic will still be encrypted, but we will not validate that the SSL certificates of the upstream servers are all valid.

MinFreeDiskSpaceKBytes.title: Minimum Free Disk Space
MinFreeDiskSpaceKBytes.description: Controls the amount of local space used by Drive for desktop's cache. Stops writing content to the disk when free disk space gets below this threshold, in kilobytes.

OpenOfficeFilesInDocs.title: Open Office Files In Docs
OpenOfficeFilesInDocs.description: When using Copy to clipboard on MS Office files synced by Drive for desktop, create links that open in the respective Google Docs Editor instead of the read only Google Drive web preview.

PromptToBackupDevices.title: Prompt to back up devices
PromptToBackupDevices.description: Enable Prompt me to back up devices setting.

TrustedRootCertsFile.title: Trusted Root Certs File
TrustedRootCertsFile.description: This is the full path to an alternate file to use for validating host SSL certificates. It must be in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. Set this if your users are on networks with decrypting proxies.

AboutText.title: About Text
AboutText.description: Custom text to display at launch.

AllowedPathRegex.title: Allowed Path Regex
AllowedPathRegex.description: Path regexes (ICU format) of binaries to allow. Lower precedent than binary, certificate, and Team ID scopes.

BannedBlockMessage.title: Banned Block Message
BannedBlockMessage.description: Custom message when a binary is blocked by a rule.

BlockedPathRegex.title: Blocked Path Regex
BlockedPathRegex.description: Path regexes (ICU format) of binaries to block. Lower precedent than binary, certificate, and Team ID scopes.

ClientAuthCertificateCN.title: Client Certificate Common Name
ClientAuthCertificateCN.description: The Common Name of a certificate in the System keychain to be used for sync authentication.

ClientAuthCertificateFile.title: Client Certificate File Path
ClientAuthCertificateFile.description: Location of a PKCS#12 certificate to be used for sync authentication.

ClientAuthCertificateIssuerCN.title: Client Certificate Issuer Common Name
ClientAuthCertificateIssuerCN.description: The Issuer Name of a certificate in the System keychain to be used for sync authentication.

EnableBadSignatureProtection.title: Bad Signature Protection
EnableBadSignatureProtection.description: Block binaries with a bad signing chain, unless explicitly allowed.

EnableMachineIDDecoration.title: Enable Machine ID Decoration
EnableMachineIDDecoration.description: Appends the MachineID to the end of each log line if enabled.

EnablePageZeroProtection.title: Enable Page Zero Protection
EnablePageZeroProtection.description: Block 32-bit binaries missing the __PAGEZERO segment, unless explicitly allowed.

EnableSysxCache.title: Enable Sysx Cache
EnableSysxCache.description: Enable secondary cache. Improves performance when multiple EndpointSecurity system extensions are installed.

EventDetailText.title: Event Detail Text
EventDetailText.description: The text of the button for Event Detail URL.

EventDetailURL.title: Event Detail URL
EventDetailURL.description:
The URL to open when the user gets a block notification. If unset, the button will not be displayed. Can include the following variables for substitution:
%file_identifier% - SHA-256 of the file that was blocked
%bundle_or_file_identifier% - SHA-256 of the file that was blocked or the bundle containing it, if available
%file_sha% - Deprecated, acts like bundle_or_file_identifier
%machine_id% - ID of the machine
%username% - The executing user
%serial% - System's serial number
%uuid% - System's UUID
%hostname% - System's full hostname

EventLogType.title: Event Log Type
EventLogType.description: syslog: Sent to ASL or ULS (if built with the 10.12 SDK or later); filelog: Sent to a file on disk. Use EventLogPath to specify a path.

FailClosed.title: Deny on Read Error
FailClosed.description: Deny execution in LOCKDOWN mode if there is an error reading or processing an executable file.

FileChangesRegex.title: File Changes Regex
FileChangesRegex.description: Path regexes (ICU format) to monitor for file changes.

MachineIDKey.title: Machine ID Key
MachineIDKey.description: The key to use on Machine ID Plist.

MachineIDPlist.title: Machine ID Plist
MachineIDPlist.description: The path to a plist that contains the MachineOwnerKey / value pair.

MachineOwnerKey.title: Machine Owner Key
MachineOwnerKey.description: The key to use on Machine Owner Plist.

MachineOwnerPlist.title: Machine Owner Plist
MachineOwnerPlist.description: The path to a plist that contains the MachineOwnerKey / value pair.

MailDirectory.title: Mail Directory
MailDirectory.description: The base directory used to save mail files.

MailDirectoryEventMaxFlushTimeSec.title: Mail Max Event Buffer
MailDirectoryEventMaxFlushTimeSec.description: Maximum time (seconds) events will stay buffered in memory before being flushed to disk.

MailDirectoryFileSizeThresholdKB.title: Mail Max File Size
MailDirectoryFileSizeThresholdKB.description: Per-file size limit (KB) for files stored in the event log mail directory.

MailDirectorySizeThresholdMB.title: Mail Max Size
MailDirectorySizeThresholdMB.description: Total file size limit (MB) for all files stored in the event log mail directory.

MetricFormat.title: Metric Format
MetricFormat.description: The key to use on Machine ID Plist.

MetricURL.title: Metric URL
MetricURL.description: URL describing where monitoring metrics should be exported.

ModeNotificationLockdown.title: Lockdown Notification Text
ModeNotificationLockdown.description: Custom message when entering LOCKDOWN mode.

ModeNotificationMonitor.title: Monitor Notification Text
ModeNotificationMonitor.description: Custom message when entering MONITOR mode.

ServerAuthRootsData.title: Server Authentication Certificate Roots
ServerAuthRootsData.description: X.509 certificate (.pem) for inclusion on device. A valid PEM containing one or more certificates to be used for certificate pinning.

ServerAuthRootsFile.title: Server Authentication Certificate Roots (Local)
ServerAuthRootsFile.description: Path to an on-disk X.509 certificate (.pem). A valid PEM containing one or more certificates to be used for certificate pinning.

SyncEnableCleanSyncEventUpload.title: Enable Upload Clean Syncs
SyncEnableCleanSyncEventUpload.description: Upload events to the sync server even if a clean sync is requested.

UnknownBlockMessage.title: Unknown Block Message
UnknownBlockMessage.description: Custom message when an unknown binary is blocked.

KeyEscrowInterval.title: Recovery key re-escrow interval
KeyEscrowInterval.description: Time interval in Hours for how often Crypt tries to re-escrow the key to Crypt-Server after the first successful escrow.

OutputPath.title: Recovery key plist path
OutputPath.description: Path where the recovery key plist is written to disk.

PostRunCommand.title: Recovery key error command
PostRunCommand.description: Command that is run after Crypt has detected an error condition with a stored key that cannot be resolved silently - either it has failed validation or the server has instructed the client to rotate the key. These cannot be resolved silently on APFS volumes, so the user will need to log in again. If you have a tool that can enforce a logout or a reboot, you can run it here.

RemovePlist.title: Leave recovery key plist on disk
RemovePlist.description: By default, the plist at /var/root/crypt_output.plist with the FileVault Key will be removed once it has been escrowed. If this is set to True the key will remain as root read only.

RotateUsedKey.title: Rotate recovery key on each use. (Only HFS-formatted disks)
RotateUsedKey.description: If the recovery key plist is still present on the disk, rotates the recovery key after the key is used to unlock the disk.

SkipUsers.title: Users ignored
SkipUsers.description: Local users that will not be forced to enable FileVault.

ValidateKey.title: Validate recovery key
ValidateKey.description: If the recovery key plist is still present on the disk, validates the recovery key. If the key fails validation, the plist is removed so it can be regenerated on next login.

CopyPkgsToRepo.title: Copy package to repository upon import

MoveInstallerItemsWithPkginfos.title: Move installer items when moving pkginfo files

UpdateCatalogsOnSave.title: Write changed catalog files to repository on save
UpdateCatalogsOnSave.description: When saving, write changed catalog files to repository.

UpdateManifestsOnSave.title: Write changed manifest files to repository on save
UpdateManifestsOnSave.description: When saving, write changed manifest files to repository.

UpdatePkginfosOnSave.title: Write changed pkginfo files to repository on save
UpdatePkginfosOnSave.description: When saving, write changed pkginfo files to repository.

logToFile.title: Log to file
logToFile.description: Send log statements to a file in ~/Library/Logs/MunkiAdmin/

logToSyslog.title: Log to Apple System Log
logToSyslog.description: Send log statements to Apple System Log, so they show up in Console.app.

makecatalogsOnlyIfNeeded.title: Only run makecatalogs if pkginfo files were changed

makecatalogsPath.title: makecatalogs Path
makecatalogsPath.description: The path to the makecatalogs binary.

makecatalogsSkipPkgCheck.title: Skip checking of pkg existence when running makecatalogs

makepkginfoPath.title: makepkginfo Path
makepkginfoPath.description: The path to the makepkginfo binary.

sidebarDeveloperMinimumNumberOfPackageNa.title: Developer Minimum Number of Package Names in Sidebar
sidebarDeveloperMinimumNumberOfPackageNa.description: The minimum number of package names a developer must have in order to be shown in the sidebar.

sortFeaturedItemsByTitle.title: Keep featured items sorted by name

sortManagedInstallsByTitle.title: Keep managed installs sorted by name

sortManagedUninstallsByTitle.title: Keep managed uninstalls sorted by name

sortManagedUpdatesByTitle.title: Keep managed updates sorted by name

sortOptionalInstallsByTitle.title: Keep optional installs sorted by name

startupWhatToDo.title: On Startup
startupWhatToDo.description: Determines what MunkiAdmin's startup behavior is. Leave unspecified or set to integer 1 for the default behavior, which is "Prompt to Select a Repository."

AlertText.title: Alert Text
AlertText.description: Custom Big Sur Blocker alert text.

AlertTitle.title: Alert Title
AlertTitle.description: Custom Big Sur Blocker alert title.

bundleIDsToBlock.title: Additional Bundle IDs to Block
bundleIDsToBlock.description: Add any additional bundle identifiers to have Big Sur Blocker block those items as well.
