FilesOnDemandEnabled.description: When set to true, new users who set up the sync app will download online-only files by default. When set to false, Files On-Demand will be disabled and users won't be able to turn it on.

HideDockIcon.title: Hide Dock Icon
HideDockIcon.description: Hides the OneDrive dock icon even when the application is running.

HydrationDisallowedApps.title: HydrationDisallowedApps
HydrationDisallowedApps.description:
String in JSON format. AppID can be either the BSD process name or the bundle display name. 
MaxBuildVersion denotes the maximum build version of the application that will be blocked. 
MaxBundleVersion denotes the maximum bundle version of the application that will be blocked.

IsHydrationToastAllowed.title: IsHydrationToastAllowed
IsHydrationToastAllowed.description: When set to false, toasts will not appear when applications trigger the download of file contents.

KFMBlockOptIn.title: Block Opt-in
KFMBlockOptIn.description: If enabled, will prevent KFM opt-in.

KFMBlockOptOut.title: Block KFM Opt-out
KFMBlockOptOut.description: If enabled, prevents users from redirecting their known folders to the Mac.

KFMOptInWithWizard.title: Prompt Users to Move Known Folders

KFMSilentOptInDesktop.title: Silently Opt in Desktop to Known Folders
KFMSilentOptInDesktop.description: Enable to silently opt-in the user's Desktop folder.

KFMSilentOptInDocuments.title: Silently Opt in Documents to Known Folders
KFMSilentOptInDocuments.description: Enable to silently opt-in the user's Documents folder.

KFMSilentOptInWithNotification.title: Silently Opt in with Notification
KFMSilentOptInWithNotification.description: If enabled, displays a notification to users after their folders have been redirected.

OpenAtLogin.title: Open at Login
OpenAtLogin.description: Automatically start OneDrive when the user logs in.

SharePointOnPremFrontDoorUrl.title: SharePoint Server Front Door URL
SharePointOnPremFrontDoorUrl.description: The URL of the on-premises SharePoint Server.

SharePointOnPremPrioritzationPolicy.title: SharePoint OnPrem Prioritization
SharePointOnPremPrioritzationPolicy.description: Determines whether or not the client should set up sync for SharePoint Server or SharePoint Online first during the first-run scenario.

SharePointOnPremTenantName.title: SharePoint Server Tenant Name
SharePointOnPremTenantName.description: The name that will be used when creating a folder to sync the on-premises SharePoint Server files.

UploadBandwidthLimited.title: Maximum Upload Bandwidth
UploadBandwidthLimited.description: Upload throughput in KB/sec that the sync client can use.

AllowedEmailDomains.title: Allowed Email Domains
AllowedEmailDomains.description: Specify one or more domains users are allowed to add in Outlook. Format strings as regular expressions. Does not remove or disconnect accounts already added in Outlook. Supports regular expressions to allow for catching multiple domains.

AutomaticallyDownloadExternalContent.title: Automatically Download External Content
AutomaticallyDownloadExternalContent.description: Set when pictures are automatically downloaded from the Internet for email.

CalendarFirstDayOfWeek.title: Calendar: First Day of the Week
CalendarFirstDayOfWeek.description: Set the first day of week in calendar view.

DefaultEmailAddressOrDomain.title: Default Email Address or Domain
DefaultEmailAddressOrDomain.description: Set the domain or full email address of Office 365 mailbox to be added on first launch. The full email address or domain specified will be added in Outlook instead of the Office activation email address. For a domain use "example.com" formatting (no "@") and the alias/username from the activation email address will be combined with the domain entered in this pref key.

DefaultWeatherLocation.title: Weather: Default Location
DefaultWeatherLocation.description: Set default location for weather in calendar view. Use the format returned by the weather location search within Outlook. Example: "Paris, France"

DisableExport.title: Disable Export
DisableExport.description: Prevent users from being able to export archive files (.olm).

DisableImport.title: Disable Import
DisableImport.description: Prevent users from being able to import archive files (.olm and .pst) and Outlook 2011 for Mac data.

DisableModernAuth.title: Disable Modern Authentication
DisableModernAuth.description: Disable Modern Authentication connections from Outlook.

DisablePreviewForSMIME.title: Disable Preview for SMIME
DisablePreviewForSMIME.description: Disable preview generation for encrypted email messages.

DisableSignatures.title: Disable Signatures
DisableSignatures.description: Prevent users from being able to create, edit, and add client-side signatures.

DisableSkypeMeeting.title: Disable Skype Meetings
DisableSkypeMeeting.description: Prevent users from adding Skype for Business online meeting details to events.

DisableTeamsMeeting.title: Disable Teams Meetings
DisableTeamsMeeting.description: Prevent users from adding Teams online meeting details to events.

EnableNewOutlook.title: Enable New Outlook
EnableNewOutlook.description: Lets users on the production channel try out the new Outlook. This key can be used to manage the deployment and default position of the new Outlook switch.

FirstRunExperienceCompletedO15.title: First Run Experience Completed
FirstRunExperienceCompletedO15.description: Disable the offer to import mailbox or setup an email account in Outlook 2016.

HideCanAddOtherAccountTypesTipText.title: Hide text about adding non-corporate mailboxes
HideCanAddOtherAccountTypesTipText.description: Hide the "Did you know? Outlook supports…" text in the Set Up Your Email success dialog box. Only hides text. Does not impact ability to add non-corporate mailboxes.

HideFoldersOnMyComputerRootInFolderList.title: Hide Local Folders
HideFoldersOnMyComputerRootInFolderList.description: Prevent users from viewing local On My Computer folders in the sidebar. Found under Outlook > Preferences > General > Sidebar.

NSRequiresAquaSystemAppearance.title: Disable Dark Mode
NSRequiresAquaSystemAppearance.description: Disable macOS Dark Mode settings for application.

OverrideAccountConfigurationWindow.title: Suppress Account Configuration Window
OverrideAccountConfigurationWindow.description: Disable account configuration window when the profile is empty.

PII_And_Intelligent_Services_Preference.description: Suppress the "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog and auto-accept the terms in 16.17 through 16.27.

SendAllTelemetryEnabled.description: Set to FALSE to send minimal heartbeat data, no application usage, and no environment details.

SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisable.description: Sends crash reports even if telemetry is disabled. Will only be evaluated if 'Send Telemetry Data' is FALSE.

SignInOptions.title: Sign In Options
SignInOptions.description: Prevent users from signing in to any O365 service. This has the added effect of making sure users store no data online via microsoft servers.

TrustO365AutodiscoverRedirect.title: Suppress Office 365 Autodiscover Redirect Warning
TrustO365AutodiscoverRedirect.description: Suppress the warning when Autodiscover is redirected from HTTP to HTTPS.

Weather_update_automatically.title: Weather: Update Automatically
Weather_update_automatically.description: Prevent users from choosing Update Location Automatically for weather location.

googlePromoTriggeredPref.title: Suppress Google Contacts/Calendar dialog
googlePromoTriggeredPref.description: Disable promotion dialog about adding Google Contacts/Calendar.

kFREEnterpriseTelemetryInfoKey.description: Suppresses a temporary Privacy and Services Update dialog in 16.27 ONLY. (Was previously used for a similar purpose in 16.13.1 but the key was recycled.)

autoAcceptTimeout.description: Auto-Accept timeout for users without Server-side Conversation History.

autoDetectAutoDicoveryURLs.title: Server Discovery Method
autoDetectAutoDicoveryURLs.description: Specify how Skype for Business identifies the transport and server to use during sign-in. (The misspelling of Discovery in the key is intentional.)

sipAddress.title: SIP Address
sipAddress.description: The SIP address (Email) used to sign-in to Skype for Business.

trustedDomainList.title: Trusted Domain List

userName.title: Username

warnWhenUnknownLocationForE911.title: Warn Unknown Location for Emergency 911
warnWhenUnknownLocationForE911.description: Warns the user when dialing an emergency number from an unknown location.

com.microsoft.autoupdate.fba.title: Microsoft AutoUpdate FBA
com.microsoft.autoupdate.fba.description: Use this section to define settings for Microsoft AutoUpdate FBA for Mac

SendAllTelemetryEnabled.title: Send Telemetry Data
SendAllTelemetryEnabled.description: Controls wether diagnostic data transmission is on or off.

AcknowledgedDataCollectionPolicy.title: Acknowledged Data Collection Policy
AcknowledgedDataCollectionPolicy.description: The first time Version 4.12 or later of Microsoft AutoUpdate is launched, users will see a Required Data Notice dialog which provides them with information about what data from MAU is sent to Microsoft. If you don't want your users to see this Required Data Notice dialog for Microsoft AutoUpdate, you can set the following preference. Regardless of which value you set, the dialog won't be shown to your users. If you let your users see this dialog, then when the user chooses OK, the value RequiredDataOnly is used and the dialog is not shown to the user again.

Applications.title: Applications
Applications.description: Register applications that Microsoft AutoUpdate should update. If this is not managed MAU might have issues finding updates for applications that a user has never opened. Language Code IDs are legacy and always "1033".

UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.title: Update Deadline: Days Before Forced Quit
UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.description: Force quit this application and update X number of days after MAU first detects the update on each computer. Can be used in conjunction with the higher level option of the same setting for more restrictive per-application updating.

UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.title: Update Deadline: Days Before Forced Quit
UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.description: Force quit this application and update X number of days after MAU first detects the update on each computer. Can be used in conjunction with the higher level option of the same setting for more restrictive per-application updating.

UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.title: Update Deadline: Days Before Forced Quit
UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.description: Force quit this application and update X number of days after MAU first detects the update on each computer. Can be used in conjunction with the higher level option of the same setting for more restrictive per-application updating.

ChannelName.title: Channel Name
ChannelName.description: Set the update channel that is used to check for updates. Click the documentation link for more information about which channel to use.

DisableInsiderCheckbox.title: Disable Insider Checkbox
DisableInsiderCheckbox.description: Set this option to disable the "Join the Office Insider Program..." checkbox.

EnableCheckForUpdatesButton.title: Enable Check for Updates Button
EnableCheckForUpdatesButton.description: Disable this option to make the "Check for Updates" button in unavailable.

ExtendedLogging.title: Enable Extended Logging
ExtendedLogging.description:
Enabled extended logging for Microsoft AutoUpdate operations.
Writes logs to: /Library/Logs/Microsoft/autoupdate.log

HowToCheck.title: How to Check for Updates
HowToCheck.description: Control how updates are checked for and handled.

IgnoreUIOpenAfterInstall.title: Ignore UI Open After Install
IgnoreUIOpenAfterInstall.description: Enable this option to prevent MAU UI from launching after install.

ManifestServer.title: Manifest Server
ManifestServer.description: Force Microsoft AutoUpdate to pull collateral using a custom server. This is good when enterprise wants to have strict control on which version of Office applications get installed. Ensure that a trailing slash is used when specifying the value as this is mandatory. This requires "ChannelName" to be set to "Custom".

SendAllTelemetryEnabled.title: Send Telemetry Data
SendAllTelemetryEnabled.description: Set to false to send minimal heartbeat data, no application usage, and no environment details. Replaced by "AcknowledgedDataCollectionPolicy" in MAU 4.12.

StartDaemonOnAppLaunch.title: Start Daemon on App Launch
StartDaemonOnAppLaunch.description: Enable this option to trigger the MAU Daemon when other Office applications are launched.

UpdateCache.title: Update Cache Server
UpdateCache.description: Force Microsoft AutoUpdate to pull update binaries from a custom server. This is good when internet bandwidth is limited. Ensure that a trailing slash is used when specifying the value as this is mandatory.

UpdateCheckFrequency.title: Update Check Frequency
UpdateCheckFrequency.description: Change how often the Microsoft AutoUpdate daemon will look for updates. The default is 720 minutes (12 hrs). By reducing this value MAU will look for updates sooner.

UpdateDeadline.ApplicationsForcedUpdateS.title: Update Deadline: Applications Forced Update Schedule
UpdateDeadline.ApplicationsForcedUpdateS.description: Configure a deadline for a specific update version at a specific date and time for each application.

/Applications/Company Portal.app.title: Company Portal
/Applications/Company Portal.app.description: Schedule an update for Company Portal.

ForcedUpdateDate.title: Forced Update Date
ForcedUpdateDate.description: The date and time to force the update.

/Applications/Microsoft Defender ATP.app.title: Microsoft Defender ATP
/Applications/Microsoft Defender ATP.app.description: Schedule an update for Microsoft Defender ATP.

ForcedUpdateDate.description: The date and time to force the update.

/Applications/Microsoft Edge.app.description: Schedule an update for Microsoft Edge.

/Applications/Microsoft PowerPoint.app.description: Schedule an update for Microsoft PowerPoint.

/Applications/Microsoft Word.app.description: Schedule an update for Microsoft Word.

ForcedUpdateDate.title: Forced Update Date
ForcedUpdateDate.description: The date and time to force the update.

/Applications/Skype for Business.app.title: Skype for Business
/Applications/Skype for Business.app.description: Schedule an update for Skype for Business.

ForcedUpdateDate.title: Forced Update Date
ForcedUpdateDate.description: The date and time to force the update.

/Library/Application Support/Microsoft/M.title: Microsoft AutoUpdate
/Library/Application Support/Microsoft/M.description: Schedule an update for Microsoft AutoUpdate.

ForcedUpdateDate.title: Forced Update Date
ForcedUpdateDate.description: The date and time to force the update.

UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.title: Update Deadline: Days Before Forced Quit
UpdateDeadline.DaysBeforeForcedQuit.description: Force quit applications and update X number of days after MAU first detects the update on each computer.

UpdateDeadline.FinalCountDown.title: Update Deadline: Final Countdown Timer
UpdateDeadline.FinalCountDown.description: How many minutes is the final countdown timer once the update deadline is reached.

UpdateDeadline.StartAutomaticUpdates.title: Update Deadline: Start Automatic Updates
UpdateDeadline.StartAutomaticUpdates.description: How many days in advance of the deadline that Automatic Download and Install mode begins. Temporarily overrides "HowToCheck" with "AutomaticDownload" until all updates are applied.

UpdaterOptimization.title: Updater Optimization
UpdaterOptimization.description: If you have a security agent like CrowdStrike installed and updates cause beachballs; Set UpdaterOptimization preference to "CPU" to prefer file-based delta updates (instead of binary deltas). The trade-off will be larger monthly updates.

IsAttachedEnabled.title: IsAttachedEnabled
IsAttachedEnabled.description: Disable attaching the file that caused the crash in the crash report. If you are working in a sensitive business it is recommended to set this to false.

IsStoreLastCrashEnabled.title: IsStoreLastCrashEnabled
IsStoreLastCrashEnabled.description: Will store the last crash report in the following path: ~/Library/Group Containers/UBF8T346G9.ms/MerpTempItems

SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisable.title: SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisabled
SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisable.description: Disable upload of telemetry data in Crash Reports.

AllowVisualBasicToBindToSystem.title: Allow Visual Basic to Bind to System
AllowVisualBasicToBindToSystem.description: Determines if macros are allowed to use a DECLARE to bind to the system() OS API. This API allows macros to execute arbitrary external processes and pass them arbitrary data on the command line.

ConnectedOfficeExperiencesPreference.title: Connected Experiences, Most
ConnectedOfficeExperiencesPreference.description: You can use this preference to control whether most connected experiences are available to your users.

DefaultsToLocalOpenSave.title: 'On My Mac' as default open and save location
DefaultsToLocalOpenSave.description: When set to true will force the open/save panel to ‘On My Mac' instead of 'Online Locations'.

DiagnosticDataTypePreference.title: Diagnostic Data
DiagnosticDataTypePreference.description: Diagnostic data is used to keep Office secure and up-to-date, detect, diagnose and remediate problems, and also make product improvements.

DisableVisualBasicExternalDylibs.title: Disable Visual Basic External Dylibs
DisableVisualBasicExternalDylibs.description: Controls the ability for 3rd party vendors to use a DECLARE statement to bind a Visual Basic symbol name to an external procedure in the local OS.

DisableVisualBasicMacScript.title: Disable macros from invoking the MacScript() Visual Basic API.
DisableVisualBasicMacScript.description: The DisableVisualBasicMacScript setting determines if macros are allowed to invoke the MacScript() Visual Basic API. This API allows macros to execute arbitrary processes via AppleScript by including "do shell script ..." in the AppleScript code.

DisableVisualBasicToBindToPopen.title: Disable Visual Basic to Bind to Popen
DisableVisualBasicToBindToPopen.description: Determines if macros are allowed to use a DECLARE to bind to the popen() OS API. This API allows macros to execute arbitrary external processes and pass them arbitrary data on the command line.

HasUserSeenEnterpriseFREDialog.title: Has User Seen First Run Experience
HasUserSeenEnterpriseFREDialog.description: Setting this option to TRUE will suppress the 'Your privacy options' dialog for Volume License users only.

InstallAutoUpdate.title: Install AutoUpdate (MAU)
InstallAutoUpdate.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing AutoUpdate. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallDefender.title: Install Defender
InstallDefender.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing Defender. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallExcel.title: Install Excel
InstallExcel.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing Excel. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallOneDrive.title: Install OneDrive
InstallOneDrive.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing OneDrive. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallOneNote.title: Install OneNote
InstallOneNote.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing OneNote. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallOutlook.title: Install Outlook
InstallOutlook.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing Outlook. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallPowerPoint.title: Install PowerPoint
InstallPowerPoint.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing PowerPoint. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallTeams.title: Install Teams
InstallTeams.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing Teams. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

InstallWord.title: Install Word
InstallWord.description: Uncheck (FALSE) to prevent the Office suite installer from installing Word. (Not needed if you want to use default value of TRUE.)

OfficeActivationEmailAddress.title: Activation Account
OfficeActivationEmailAddress.description: This value pre-fills the account authentication field for O365 users and sets the 'Belongs to' field in the About Box for both O365 and VL users.

OfficeAutoSignIn.title: Auto Sign In
OfficeAutoSignIn.description: Automatically configure Office 365 mailbox on first launch for Outlook. Will suppress first run dialogs for Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneNote. For new installations from the Mac App Store, will bypass the first run dialogs that ask users if they wish to purchase a new Office 365 subscription.

OfficeExperiencesAnalyzingContentPrefere.title: Connected Experiences: Analyzing Content
OfficeExperiencesAnalyzingContentPrefere.description: Connected experiences that analyze your content are experiences that use your Office content to provide you with design recommendations, editing suggestions, data insights, and similar features. For example, PowerPoint Designer or Researcher in Word.

OfficeExperiencesDownloadingContentPrefe.title: Connected Experiences: Downloading Content
OfficeExperiencesDownloadingContentPrefe.description: Connected experiences that download online content are experiences that allow you to search and download online content including templates, images, 3D models, videos, and reference materials to enhance your documents. For example, Office templates or PowerPoint QuickStarter.

OptionalConnectedExperiencesPreference.title: Connected Experiences, Optional
OptionalConnectedExperiencesPreference.description: In addition to the connected experiences above, there are some optional connected experiences that you may choose to allow your users to access. For example, the LinkedIn features of the Resume Assistant in Word or the Weather Bar in Outlook, which uses MSN Weather.

SendAllTelemetryEnabled.title: Send Telemetry Data
SendAllTelemetryEnabled.description: Controls wether diagnostic data transmission is on or off.

ShowDocStageOnLaunch.title: Show Document Selector
ShowDocStageOnLaunch.description: Show or Hide the Document gallery selector when office applications are launched.

ShowWhatsNewOnLaunch.title: Show 'What's New' dialogs
ShowWhatsNewOnLaunch.description: A setting of FALSE supresses all "What's new" messages for all suite apps: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and OneNote.

TermsAccepted1809.title: Accept Office 2019 Use Terms
TermsAccepted1809.description: If you don't want your users to see the Office 2019 Use Terms dialog, and instead accept the terms on their behalf, set this value to TRUE.

VBAObjectModelIsTrusted.title: VBA Object Model is Trusted
VBAObjectModelIsTrusted.description: Controls the ability for Office to write to the VB project through the VBA object model.

VisualBasicMacroExecutionState.title: VisualBasic macro security level
VisualBasicMacroExecutionState.description:
The VisualBasicMacroExecutionState1 setting controls whether macros are ever allowed to execute, and what the user experience is when opening
a file that contains a macro. By default, macros will only run after the user is presented with an alert when opening a file that contains a macro. The
user must make a choice whether to allow or deny macros for each individual file, each time that file is opened.

kCUIThemePreferencesThemeKeyPath.title: Theme
kCUIThemePreferencesThemeKeyPath.description: Set the theme used by Microsoft Office.

msoridDefaultMinimumSeverity.title: Minimum severity for authentication requests logging
msoridDefaultMinimumSeverity.description: Set value to 200 if 'logging for authentication requests' (msoridEnableLogging) is enabled.

msoridEnableLogging.title: Enable logging for authentication requests
msoridEnableLogging.description: Increase logging levels for authentication requests. Enable Minimum Severity (msoridDefaultMinimumSeverity) option if this key is enabled.

PII_And_Intelligent_Services_Preference.title: Suppress 'Use Intelligent Services' dialog (2/2)
PII_And_Intelligent_Services_Preference.description: Suppress the "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog and auto-accept the terms in 16.17 through 16.27.

SendASmileEnabled.title: Send A Smile Enabled
SendASmileEnabled.description: This key when set to false will deactivate the ability for users to use the "Smile" feature to send feedback to Microsoft.

SendAllTelemetryEnabled.title: Send Telemetry Data
SendAllTelemetryEnabled.description: Set to FALSE to send minimal heartbeat data, no application usage, and no environment details.

SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisable.title: Send Crash Reports even with Telemetry Disabled
SendCrashReportsEvenWithTelemetryDisable.description: Sends crash reports even if telemetry is disabled. Will only be evaluated if 'Send Telemetry Data' is FALSE.

SignInOptions.title: Sign In Options
SignInOptions.description: Prevent users from signing in to any O365 service. This has the added effect of making sure users store no data online via microsoft servers.

kFREEnterpriseTelemetryInfoKey.title: Suppress Privacy and Services dialog
kFREEnterpriseTelemetryInfoKey.description: Suppresses a temporary Privacy and Services Update dialog in 16.27 ONLY. (Was previously used for a similar purpose in 16.13.1 but the key was recycled.)

kFREIntelligenceServicesConsentV2Key.title: Suppress 'Use Intelligent Services' dialog (1/2)
kFREIntelligenceServicesConsentV2Key.description: Suppress the "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog and auto-accept the terms in 16.17 through 16.27.

kFRETelemetryConsentKey.title: Suppress 'Connected Services' dialog
kFRETelemetryConsentKey.description: Disable the "Connected Services" dialog for MSA-based (personal) accounts.

kSubUIAppCompletedFirstRunSetup1507.title: First Run Setup Completed
kSubUIAppCompletedFirstRunSetup1507.description: Controls the original "What's New" dialog and Office 365 activation prompt on first launch. Replaced by 'OfficeAutoSignIn' in the main Office profile starting in version 16.17 and should not be used for Office 2019.

ClientSettings.EnforceCredSSPSupport.title: Enforce Cred SSP Support
ClientSettings.EnforceCredSSPSupport.description: Support for all possible values of the "EnableCredSspSupport" and "Authentication Level" RDP file settings if this key is set to 0.

ClientSettings.FirstRunExperienceLaunche.title: Disable First Run Dialog
ClientSettings.FirstRunExperienceLaunche.description: Disable the first run dialog "Help us make your experience better".

antivirusEngine.title: Antivirus engine preferences
antivirusEngine.description: Manages the preferences of the antivirus component of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

allowedThreats.title: Allowed threats
allowedThreats.description: Specify threats by name that are not blocked by Defender for Endpoint on Mac. These threats will be allowed to run.

disallowedThreatActions.title: Disallowed threat actions
disallowedThreatActions.description: Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected. The actions included in this list are not displayed in the user interface.

enableFileHashComputation.title: Configure file hash computation feature
enableFileHashComputation.description: When this feature is enabled, Defender for Endpoint will compute hashes for files it scans.

enforcementLevel.title: Enforcement level for antivirus engine
enforcementLevel.description: Enforcement level of antivirus engine. On-demand: Files are scanned only on demand; Passive: Same as on-demand, but also security intelligence updates are enabled, and the status menu icon is hidden; Real-time: Scan files as they are accessed.

exclusions.title: Scan exclusions
exclusions.description: Specify entities excluded from being scanned.

$type.title: Type
$type.description: Specify content excluded from being scanned by type.

extension.title: File Extension
extension.description: Specify content excluded from being scanned by file extension.

isDirectory.title: Directory
isDirectory.description: Indicate if the path property refers to a file or directory.

name.title: Process
name.description: Specify a process for which all file activity is excluded from scanning. The process can be specified either by its name (e.g. cat) or full path (e.g. /bin/cat).

path.title: Path
path.description: Specify content excluded from being scanned by full file path.

exclusionsMergePolicy.title: Exclusion merge policy
exclusionsMergePolicy.description: This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own exclusions.

maximumOnDemandScanThreads.title: Degree of parallelism for on-demand scans
maximumOnDemandScanThreads.description: The number of threads used to perform the scan.

scanAfterDefinitionUpdate.title: Run a scan after definitions are updated
scanAfterDefinitionUpdate.description: Specifies whether to start a process scan after new security intelligence updates are downloaded on the device.

scanArchives.title: Scan archives (on-demand antivirus scans only)
scanArchives.description: Specifies whether to scan archives during on-demand antivirus scans.

scanHistoryMaximumItems.title: Maximum number of items in the antivirus scan history
scanHistoryMaximumItems.description: The maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history.

scanResultsRetentionDays.title: Antivirus scan history retention
scanResultsRetentionDays.description: The number of days (1-180) that results are retained in the scan history on the device.

threatTypeSettings.title: Threat type settings
threatTypeSettings.description: Specify how certain threat types are handled.

value.title: Action
value.description:
Specify what action to take when a threat of the type specified in the preceding section is detected. Choose from the following options:
Audit: your device is not protected against this type of threat, but an entry about the threat is logged.
Block: your device is protected against this type of threat and you are notified in the user interface and the security console.
Off: your device is not protected against this type of threat and nothing is logged.

threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy.title: Threat type settings merge policy
threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy.description: Specify the merge policy for threat type settings. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined settings (merge) or only administrator-defined settings (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own settings for different threat types.

cloudService.title: Cloud-delivered protection preferences
cloudService.description: Configure the cloud-driven protection features of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled.title: Enable / disable automatic security intelligence updates
automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled.description: Determines whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically.

automaticSampleSubmission.title: Enable / disable automatic sample submissions
automaticSampleSubmission.description: Determines whether suspicious samples are sent to Microsoft.

cloudBlockLevel.title: Configure cloud block level
cloudBlockLevel.description: Determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint will be in blocking and scanning suspicious files.

diagnosticLevel.title: Diagnostic collection level
diagnosticLevel.description: Determines the level of diagnostics sent by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to Microsoft.

enabled.title: Enable / disable cloud-delivered protection
enabled.description: Specify whether to enable cloud-delivered protection on the device or not.

deviceControl.title: Device control policy
deviceControl.description: Device control can be used to customize the URL target for notifications raised by device control, and allow or block removable devices.

navigationTarget.title: Customize URL target for notifications raised by device control
navigationTarget.description: Configure the URL that is opened when end users click the notification shown when a device control policy is enforced.

enforcementLevel.title: Policy enforcement level
enforcementLevel.description: Set the removable media enforcement level.

permission.title: Default permission level
permission.description: The default permission level for devices that do not match anything else in the policy.

edr.title: Endpoint detection and response preferences
edr.description: Manage the preferences of the endpoint detection and response (EDR) component.

tamperProtection.title: Tamper protection
tamperProtection.description: Tamper protection helps prevent unauthorized removal of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

enforcementLevel.title: Enfocement level
enforcementLevel.description: Specify the enforcement level for tamper protection.

userInterface.title: User interface preferences
userInterface.description: Manage the preferences for the user interface.

consumerExperience.title: Control sign-in to consumer version of Microsoft Defender
consumerExperience.description: Specify whether users can sign into the consumer version of Microsoft Defender.

hideStatusMenuIcon.title: Hide status menu icon
hideStatusMenuIcon.description: Specify whether to hide the status menu icon in the top-right corner of the screen.

userInitiatedFeedback.title: Show option to send feedback
userInitiatedFeedback.description: Specify whether users can submit feedback to Microsoft by going to Help > Send Feedback.

server_host.title: Server Host
server_host.description: FQDN taken from inside the square brackets in the file name of the client .dmg.

SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.title: Automatic Update Install Prompt
SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.description: Controls the automatic update install prompt. When enabled, presents users with the option to allow automatic download and install of available updates. If disabled, disallows automatic updates and requires manual installation every time.

SUAutomaticallyUpdate.title: Enable Automatic Silent Updates
SUAutomaticallyUpdate.description: Controls automatic silent updates. If enabled, users will not be informed about updates and updates will be silently installed when the app quits.

SUFeedURL.title: Sparkle Feed URL
SUFeedURL.description: Setting this to a non-existent URL will disable the ability for users to manually check for updates. Useful when you intend to use your own software distribution mechanism to deploy updates.

SUScheduledCheckInterval.title: Automatic Update Check Interval
SUScheduledCheckInterval.description: Controls the automatic update check interval. The default is 1 day (86400 seconds). Setting to 0 disables updates.

SUSendProfileInfo.title: SUSendProfileInfo
SUSendProfileInfo.description: When running software update checks, submit anonymous computer profile data to AirServer.

UseLionStyleFullscreen.title: UseLionStyleFullscreen
UseLionStyleFullscreen.description: Enable this setting if you want to use the native macOS fullscreen mode - slower.

UserDeviceName.title: UserDeviceName
UserDeviceName.description: Use this field to override the name of the computer that appears on the AirPlay network.

UserLosslessAudioReceiverName.title: UserLosslessAudioReceiverName
UserLosslessAudioReceiverName.description: Only enable this preference when you wish to set a custom name for the device running AirServer in the AirPlay device list.

autoLaunch.title: autoLaunch
autoLaunch.description: Have AirServer launch on system startup.

com.airserverapp.PasswordType.title: com.airserverapp.PasswordType
com.airserverapp.PasswordType.description: Choose authentication method when connecting to AirServer. While a Fixed Password is an available setting, it's not possible to define this password via profile.

com.airserverapp.SoftwareDecoderOnly.title: com.airserverapp.SoftwareDecoderOnly
com.airserverapp.SoftwareDecoderOnly.description: Enable this setting if your AirPlay device regularly freezes or if you notice green artifacts when using AirPlay mirroring. This is common on older Macs that do not properly support hardware-accelerated video encoding.

com.airserverapp.alwaysOnTop.title: com.airserverapp.alwaysOnTop
com.airserverapp.alwaysOnTop.description: Enable this setting if you want AirServer windows to be on top of all other windows.

com.airserverapp.audioBufferSize2.title: com.airserverapp.audioBufferSize2
com.airserverapp.audioBufferSize2.description: Use this setting to tweak multi-room audio sync when streaming music from iTunes.

com.airserverapp.dualAirplay.title: Enable Dual-Airplay Device
com.airserverapp.dualAirplay.description: This option creates a second AirPort Expresss-like audio receiver suffixed with an Ex. Streaming music to this endpoint will force the iOS device to stream your music in lossless quality. Enabling this setting can also allow you to watch a video on your iOS device and send only the audiostream to the AirServer.

com.airserverapp.linkMasterVolume.title: com.airserverapp.linkMasterVolume
com.airserverapp.linkMasterVolume.description: If enabled, changing the volume on your iOS device will change the volume of your preferred output sound device; otherwise AirServer will lower the streaming music volume.

com.airserverapp.mirroringOptimizedFor2.title: com.airserverapp.mirroringOptimizedFor2
com.airserverapp.mirroringOptimizedFor2.description: Here you can set the mirroring resolution AirServer provides to your iOS device. 'Retina' is recommended for all users, but if you are having connection problems, try the 1080p option. Do not enable this preference if you wish use the default 'Retina - High Quality' resolution setting.

com.airserverapp.slowNetwork.title: com.airserverapp.slowNetwork
com.airserverapp.slowNetwork.description: Enabling this setting will lower the mirroring quality by half but uses four times less bandwidth.

showInDock.title: showInDock
showInDock.description: Use this setting to toggle between running AirServer in the Dock and in the menu bar.

TextFieldFloat02.title: TextFieldFloat 02: Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Title
TextFieldFloat02.description: TextField Float with a long title.

TextFieldFloat03.title: TextFieldFloat 03: Long Description
TextFieldFloat03.description: TextFieldFloat with a long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long description.

TextFieldFloat10.description: TextFieldFloat with a max value of: 99

TextFieldFloat11.description: TextFieldFloat with a min value of: 1

TextFieldFloat12.title: TextFieldFloat 12: Min and Max Value
TextFieldFloat12.description: TextFieldFloat with a min value of: 1 and max value of: 99

TextFieldInteger02.title: TextFieldInteger 02: Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Title
TextFieldInteger02.description: TextField Integer with a long title.

TextFieldInteger03.description: TextFieldInteger with a long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long description.

TextFieldInteger10.description: TextFieldInteger with a max value of: 99

TextFieldInteger11.description: TextFieldInteger with a min value of: 1

TextFieldInteger12.description: TextFieldInteger with a min value of: 1 and max value of: 99

Exclude01.description: Exclude always if Item01 is selected.

Exclude02.description: Exclude always if Item02 or Item03 is selected.

Exclude04.description: Exclude always if Item05 or Item06 is NOT selected.

Require03.description: Require always if Item02 or Item03 is selected.

Require09.description: Require push if Item04 is NOT selected.

Require10.description: Require push if Item05 or Item06 is NOT selected.

Slider01.title: Slider 01: Range List 2 Items
Slider01.description: Slider with a range list of two items: [5.0, 10.0].

Slider02.title: Slider 02: Range List 3 Items and Titles
Slider02.description: Slider with a range list of three items: [5.0, 10.0, 15.0] and titles.

Slider03.title: Slider 03: Range List 4 Items
Slider03.description: Slider with a range list of four items: [5.0, 6.0, 17.0003212, 20.0].

Slider04.title: Slider 04: Range List 5 Items and Mixed Titles
Slider04.description: Slider with a range list of five items: [0.01, 0.02, 0.13, 0.23, 0.92] and mixed titles.

Slider05.title: Slider 05: Range List 20 Items
Slider05.description: Slider with a range list of twenty items: [1.0...1.19].

Slider06.title: Slider 06: Range List 20 Items and Short Titles
Slider06.description: Slider with a range list of twenty items: [1.0...1.19] with short titles.

Slider07.title: Slider 07: Range List 20 Items and Medium Titles
Slider07.description: Slider with a range list of twenty items: [1.0...1.19] with medium titles.

Slider08.title: Slider 08: Range List 20 Items and Long Titles
Slider08.description: Slider with a range list of twenty items: [1.0...1.19] with long titles.

Slider09.title: Slider 09: Range List 20 Items and Too Long Titles
Slider09.description: Slider with a range list of twenty items: [1.0...1.19] with too long titles.

TableView01.title: TableView 01: Array of Strings
TableView01.description: TableView representing an array of strings.

TableView02.title: TableView 02: Array of Strings with a title
TableView02.description: TableView representing an array of strings with a title.

TableView03.title: TableView 03: Array of Strings with a title
TableView03.description: TableView representing an array of integers with a title.

TableView04.title: TableView 04: Array of Strings with a title
TableView04.description: TableView representing an array of strings as PopUp Buttons.

TableView05.title: TableView 05: Array of Strings with a title
TableView05.description: TableView representing an array of strings as ComboBoxes.

TableView06.title: TableView 06: Array of Booleans
TableView06.description: TableView representing an array of booleans.

TableView07.title: TableView 07: Array of Dictionaries with included array
TableView07.description: TableView representing an array of dictionaries which in turn has an array.

TextField02.title: TextField 02: Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Long Title

TextField03.title: TextField 03: Long Description
TextField03.description: TextField with a long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long long description.

TextField10.title: TextField 10: Format
TextField10.description: TextField with a required format of a MAC address: ^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$

com.secondsonconsulting.baseline.title: Baseline by Second Son Consulting
com.secondsonconsulting.baseline.description: Baseline by Second Son Consulting Configuration

BailOutFile.title: Bail Out File
BailOutFile.description: Define a file path. If this file exists at any point while Baseline is running, Baseline will exit and will not process additional items.

BlurScreen.title: Blur Screen
BlurScreen.description: This setting controls whether Baseline uses the SwiftDialog --blurscreen feature. Default is true. If you set to false, consider using --ontop in your DialogListOptions key

Button1Enabled.title: Button 1 Enabled
Button1Enabled.description: This setting enables SwiftDialog "Button 1" (the OK button) on the Baseline List View. This allows users to dismiss the list view and continue working while Baseline runs. By default this button is disabled.

CleanupAfterUse.title: Cleanup After Use
CleanupAfterUse.description: This setting controls whether Baseline deletes it's install directory after use: /usr/local/Baseline.

DialogFailureOptions.title: Dialog Failure Window Options
DialogFailureOptions.description: SwiftDialog options for the Failure Dialog window.

DialogListOptions.title: Dialog List Window Options
DialogListOptions.description: SwiftDialog options for the primary Baseline progress list window.

DialogSuccessOptions.title: Dialog Success Window Options
DialogSuccessOptions.description: SwiftDialog options for the Success Dialog window.

ExitCondition.title: Exit Condition
ExitCondition.description: Define a file or folder path. If this file or folder exists, Baseline will exit quietly without processing any items.

IgnoreDefaultInstallomatorOptions.title: Ignore Default Installomator Options
IgnoreDefaultInstallomatorOptions.description: By default, Baseline uses "NOTIFY=silent" and "BLOCKING_PROCESS_ACTION=kill" Installomator options. Setting this to True means Baseline will not use those options.

InitialScripts.title: InitialScripts
InitialScripts.description: Define scripts that are run immediately as the user logs in.

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Arguments you want to pass to the script when it is run.

DisplayName.title: Display Name
DisplayName.description: The name you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this script is run.

MD5.title: MD5
MD5.description: The expected MD5 of the script being run.

ScriptPath.title: Script Path
ScriptPath.description: A path to the script you want to run. Can be a local file path or a URL.

Installomator.title: Installomator Labels
Installomator.description: Define Installomator labels to be run by Baseline.

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Arguments you want to pass to the Installomator command for this label.

DisplayName.title: Display Name
DisplayName.description: The name you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this Installomator label is processed.

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: The icon you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this Installomator label is processed. Can be a URL or local file path.

Subtitle.title: Subtitle
Subtitle.description: The subtitle text to appear on this line item.

InstallomatorSwiftDialogIntegration.title: Use Installomator SwiftDialog Integration
InstallomatorSwiftDialogIntegration.description: Tell Installomator to use it's built in SwiftDialog integration for the List View.

LogOut.title: Force Log Out
LogOut.description: This setting controls whether Baseline forces a restart after completion.

Packages.title: Packages
Packages.description: Define Packages to be run by Baseline

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Arguments you want to pass to the installer command for this package.

DisplayName.title: Display Name
DisplayName.description: The name you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this package is installed.

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: The icon you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this package is installed. Can be a URL or local file path.

MD5.title: MD5
MD5.description: The expected MD5 of the package being installed.

PackagePath.title: Package Path
PackagePath.description: A path to the package you want to install. Can be a local file path or a URL.

Subtitle.title: Subtitle
Subtitle.description: The subtitle text to appear on this line item.

TeamID.title: TeamID
TeamID.description: The expected TeamID of the package being installed.

ProgressBar.title: Show Progress Bar
ProgressBar.description: This setting controls whether Baseline displays a progress bar.

ProgressBarDisplayNames.title: Show Display Names on Progress Bar
ProgressBarDisplayNames.description: This setting controls whether Baseline displays the current item being processed under the progress bar.

ReinstallDialog.title: Reinstall SwiftDialog
ReinstallDialog.description: This setting controls whether Baseline will reinstall SwiftDialog as the final step before completion. Default behavior if this key is omitted will reinstall SwiftDialog if a custom PNG is found in /Library/Application Support/Dialog/Dialog.png.

Restart.title: Force Restart
Restart.description: This setting controls whether Baseline forces a restart after completion.

Scripts.title: Scripts
Scripts.description: Define Scripts to be run by Baseline

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Arguments you want to pass to the script when it is run.

DisplayName.title: Display Name
DisplayName.description: The name you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this script is run.

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: The icon you want to appear in the SwiftDialog menu as this script is run. Can be a URL or local file path.

MD5.title: MD5
MD5.description: The expected MD5 of the script being run.

ScriptPath.title: Script Path
ScriptPath.description: A path to the script you want to run. Can be a local file path or a URL.

Subtitle.title: Subtitle
Subtitle.description: The subtitle text to appear on this line item.

OptionalArguments.title: Optional Arguments
OptionalArguments.description: There are a number of optional arguments to change Renew to look and act how you want.

AdditionalAggressiveOptions.title: Additional Aggressive Mode Options
AdditionalAggressiveOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Aggressive Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for advanced options.

AdditionalDialogOptions.title: Additional Dialog Options
AdditionalDialogOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for all dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for advanced options.

AdditionalNormalOptions.title: Additional Normal Options
AdditionalNormalOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Normal Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for advanced options.

AdditionalNotificationOptions.title: Additional Notification Options
AdditionalNotificationOptions.description: Use this key to pass additional options you want for only Notification Mode dialog events. See SwiftDialog documentation for advanced options.

AggroMessage.title: Aggressive Message
AggroMessage.description: The message body you want in your Aggressive Mode dialog windows. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --message

BannerImage.title: Banner Image
BannerImage.description: Use this key to designate a file path to a Banner Image for your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialog windows. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --bannerimage

BannerImageDarkMode.title: Banner Image Dark Mode
BannerImageDarkMode.description: Use this key to designate a file path to a Banner Image for your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialog windows.  Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode banners. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --bannerimage

Deadline.title: Deadline
Deadline.description: Use this option to enable "Deadline" mode. If a device's uptime exceeds the "Deadline" value in days, Renew will enter Aggressive Mode regardless of the remaining deferrals.

DeferralButtonText.title: Deferral Button Text
DeferralButtonText.description: What do you want your deferral button to say? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --button1text

MessageIcon.title: Message Icon
MessageIcon.description: The icon used in your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialogs. Use "none" to disable.  This can be a path to an image file, an app, or an SF symbol by using "SF=symbol.name". This maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

MessageIconDarkMode.title: Message Icon Dark Mode
MessageIconDarkMode.description: The icon used in your Normal and Aggressive Mode dialogs. Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode icons.This can be a path to an image file, an app, or an SF symbol by using "SF=symbol.name". This maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

NoDeferralsRemainingButtonText.title: "No Deferrals Remaining" Button Text
NoDeferralsRemainingButtonText.description: What do you want your deferral button to say when it's greyed out in Aggressive Mode? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --button1text

NotificationIcon.title: Notification Icon
NotificationIcon.description: This is the icon included on the right side of the Dialog Notification. Can be an app or a file path. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

NotificationIconDarkMode.title: Notification Icon Dark Mode
NotificationIconDarkMode.description: This is the icon included on the right side of the Dialog Notification. Can be an app or a file path. Use this key if you have to differentiate between light and dark mode icons. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --icon

NotificationMessage.title: Notification Message
NotificationMessage.description: The message body you want in your Notification Center alerts. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --message

NotificationSubtitle.title: Notification Subtitle
NotificationSubtitle.description: The subtitle field of your notifications. Maps to SwiftDialog option: --subtitle

RestartButtonText.title: Restart Button Text
RestartButtonText.description: What do you want your "Restart Now" button to say? Maps to SwiftDialog option: --infobuttontext

SecretQuitKey.title: Secret Quit Key
SecretQuitKey.description: This key in combination with the "Command" key will allow you to quit a dialog window without restarting. Cannot be set to Q! Omit this to leave the default combination (Cmd+]. Maps to SwiftDialog option --quitkey

ShowDeferralCount.title: Show Deferral Count
ShowDeferralCount.description: If true, an additional sentence is added to your Normal Mode dialog windows indicating how many deferrals the user has remaining. Omit this key if you don't want the extra information.

Title.title: Title
Title.description: The title of your dialog windows and notifications. Maps to the swiftDialog option: --title

RequiredArguments.title: Required Arguments
RequiredArguments.description: There are four required arguments to make a valid Renew configuration.

DeferralDuration.title: Deferral Duration
DeferralDuration.description: The minimum number of hours between when a user is notified that they need to restart.

MaximumDeferrals.title: Maximum number of deferrals
MaximumDeferrals.description: This is the maximum number of deferrals a user receives before Renew enters "Aggressive" mode. Set to '-1' to disable deferrals.

NotificationThreshold.title: Notification Threshold
NotificationThreshold.description: The number of times the user will get a macOS Notification Center event prior to the full Swift Dialog experience. Set to '-1' to configure an infinite threshold.

UptimeThreshold.title: Uptime Threshold
UptimeThreshold.description: The number of days which a device is online prior to the Renew experience starting.

SKAllowStealthUpgrade.title: SKAllowStealthUpgrade
SKAllowStealthUpgrade.description: Supress installation prompt for Privilege Helper Tool.

BrandedText.title: BrandedText
BrandedText.description: Display organizational branding. Maximum of 25 characters in length - including spaces and punctuation. Requires DetectX Swift to be registered.

FobWhitelist.title: Fob Allowlist
FobWhitelist.description: Array of strings of key words to be ignored by Folder Observer.

ObserverButton.title: ObserverButton
ObserverButton.description: Custom button text for the Folder Observer alert. Requires DetectX Swift to be registered.

ObserverIcon.title: ObserverIcon
ObserverIcon.description: Path to custom image for the Folder Observer alert. By default, shows the DetectX Swift icon. Requires DetectX Swift to be registered.

ObserverMessage.title: ObserverMessage
ObserverMessage.description: Custom message for the Folder Observer alert. Requires DetectX Swift to be registered.

ObserverTitle.title: ObserverTitle
ObserverTitle.description: Custom title for the Folder Observer alert. Requires DetectX Swift to be registered.

SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.title: Automatic Update Install Prompt
SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.description: Controls the automatic update install prompt. When enabled, presents users with the option to allow automatic download and install of available updates. If disabled, disallows automatic updates and requires manual installation every time.

SUAutomaticallyUpdate.title: Enable Automatic Silent Updates
SUAutomaticallyUpdate.description: Controls automatic silent updates. If enabled, users will not be informed about updates and updates will be silently installed when the app quits.

SUFeedURL.title: Sparkle Feed URL
SUFeedURL.description: Setting this to a non-existent URL will disable the ability for users to manually check for updates. Useful when you intend to use your own software distribution mechanism to deploy updates.

SUScheduledCheckInterval.title: Automatic Update Check Interval
SUScheduledCheckInterval.description: Controls the automatic update check interval. The default is 1 day (86400 seconds). Setting to 0 disables updates.

VisualUpdates.title: VisualUpdates
VisualUpdates.description: In the DetectX Swift GUI, display a visual button to indicate software updates are available.

folderObserver.title: folderObserver
folderObserver.description: Folder Observer notifies users when changes are made to the LaunchDaemons and LaunchAgents folders.

ignoreKeywords.title: ignoreKeywords
ignoreKeywords.description: Registered users can specify key words to be ignored by the Folder Observer action when changes are made to the LaunchDaemons and LaunchAgents folders. This allows you to stop the alert from being thrown when items whose file name contains the key word is added or removed from one of the Launch folders.

whitelist.title: Allowlist
whitelist.description: Allowlist of file paths that produce false positives in DetectX Swift. Can be full path or in users' home folders.

path.title: path
path.description:
Paths of files to whitelist:
ex. /Library/Scripts/script.sh
ex. ~/Library/Preferences/preference.plist

ClientEnvironment.title: Client Environment
ClientEnvironment.description: Configures the client to run in either commercial mode or government compliance mode (GovSlack).

DefaultSignInTeam.title: Default Team / Workspace
DefaultSignInTeam.description: Sets the default team/workspace for Slack sign-ins.

ClientEnvironment.title: Client Environment (Default)
ClientEnvironment.description: Configures the client to run in either commercial mode or government compliance mode (GovSlack) by default. The user can still change this setting.

DownloadPath.title: Download Path (Default)
DownloadPath.description: Defines the download location for documents from Slack. This must be a valid user accesible path. The user can still change this setting.

HardwareAcceleration.title: Hardware Acceleration (Default)
HardwareAcceleration.description: Enables or disable hardware accelerated rendering via GPU. The user can still change this setting.

ReleaseChannel.title: Release Channel (Default)
ReleaseChannel.description: Configure the client to receive updates from either the production or beta channel. The user can still change this setting.

DownloadPath.title: Download Path
DownloadPath.description: Defines the download location for documents from Slack. This must be a valid user accessible path.

HardwareAcceleration.title: Hardware Acceleration
HardwareAcceleration.description: Enable or disable hardware accelerated rendering via GPU.

ReleaseChannel.title: Release Channel
ReleaseChannel.description: Configure the client to receive updates from either the production or beta channel.

SlackDefaultSignInWorkspace.title: Default Workspace
SlackDefaultSignInWorkspace.description: Sets the default workspace for Slack sign-ins.

SlackNoAutoUpdates.title: Disable Automatic Updates
SlackNoAutoUpdates.description: When true, disables Slack's built-in automatic update mechanism. Useful if you update Slack using a tool like Munki.

ADDomain.title: ADDomain
ADDomain.description: Defines the AD domain you're working with.

AutoConfigure.title: Auto Configuration Scheme
AutoConfigure.description: Keyword to determine what auto configuration scheme to use.

AutoRenewCert.title: Automatic Certificate Renewal
AutoRenewCert.description: Number of days until the certificate expires before automatically renewing it.

CaribouTime.title: Carrie the Caribou Icons
CaribouTime.description: Changes the icon set to Carrie the Caribou.

ChangePasswordOptions.title: Change Password Options
ChangePasswordOptions.description: Task, URL or App path for ChangePasswordType. (<<serial>>, <<fullname>>, <<shortname>> and <<domain>> are currently supported as substitutions)

CleanCerts.title: Automatic Certificate Cleaning
CleanCerts.description: Automatically remove extra certificates from the user's keychain. This will leave the 2 newest and the 2 oldest certificates.

DontShowWelcome.title: Don't Show NoMAD Welcome Window
DontShowWelcome.description: Hides the Welcome window on first launch.

DontShowWelcomeDefaultOn.title: Don't Show Again Welcome Window Checkbox
DontShowWelcomeDefaultOn.description: Shows the Welcome Screen, but checks the "Don't show again" box by default. Useful for when you want to show the Welcome screen only once.

ExportableKey.title: Exportable Private Key
ExportableKey.description: Allows the private key from any NoMAD generated certificate to be exported.

GetCertificateAutomatically.title: Get Certificates Automatically
GetCertificateAutomatically.description: Automatically request a certificate for a user when they don't have a valid certificate in the keychain.

GetHelpOptions.title: Get Help Options
GetHelpOptions.description: URL or Path for GetHelpType (<<serial>>, <<fullname>>, <<shortname>> and <<domain>> are currently supported as substitutions)

HideExpirationMessage.title: Hide Password Expiration Message
HideExpirationMessage.description: Message text to show in the menu bar when the password countdown has been suppressed.

HideGetSoftware.title: Hide 'Get Software' Menu Item
HideGetSoftware.description: Hides the Get Software menu item.

HideHelp.title: Hide 'Help' Menu Item
HideHelp.description: Hides the Get Help menu item.

HideLockScreen.title: Hide 'Lock Screen' Menu Item
HideLockScreen.description: Hides the Lock Screen menu item.

HideRenew.title: Hide 'Renew Tickets' Menu Item
HideRenew.description: Hides the Renew Tickets menu item.

HideSignOut.title: Hide 'Sign Out' Menu Item
HideSignOut.description: Hides the Sign Out menu item.

IconOff.title: NoMAD Disconnected Icon
IconOff.description: Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected.

IconOffDark.title: NoMAD Disconnected Dark Icon
IconOffDark.description: Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected in dark mode.

IconOn.title: NoMAD Connected Icon
IconOn.description: Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is connected.

IconOnDark.title: NoMAD Connected Dark Icon
IconOnDark.description: Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is connected in dark mode.

LightsOutIKnowWhatImDoing.title: Hide NoMAD Menubar Icon
LightsOutIKnowWhatImDoing.description: Removes the icon from the menu bar. Note that NoMAD still is in the menu bar, just with no icon and taking up less space.

LocalPasswordSyncDontSyncLocalUsers.title: Local Users to Not Sync Password

LocalPasswordSyncDontSyncNetworkUsers.title: Network Users to Not Sync Password

LocalPasswordSyncOnMatchOnly.title: Only Sync Local Password on Match

LoginItem.title: NoMAD Login Item
LoginItem.description: Adds NoMAD to the user's start up items.

MenuAbout.title: 'About' Menu Item Text
MenuAbout.description: Menu item text for the About item.

MenuChangePassword.title: 'Change Password' Menu Item Text
MenuChangePassword.description: Menu item text for the Change Password item.

MenuFileServers.title: 'File Servers' Menu Item Text
MenuFileServers.description: Menu item text for the File Servers item.

MenuGetCertificate.title: 'Get Certificate' Menu Item Text
MenuGetCertificate.description: Menu item text for the Get Certificate item.

MenuGetHelp.title: 'Get Help' Menu Item Text
MenuGetHelp.description: Menu item text for the Get Help item.

MenuGetSoftware.title: 'Get Software' Menu Item Text
MenuGetSoftware.description: Menu item text for the Get Software item.

MenuHomeDirectory.title: 'Home Directory' Menu Item Text
MenuHomeDirectory.description: Menu item text for the Home Directory item.

MenuPasswordExpires.title: Password Expiration Menu Item Text
MenuPasswordExpires.description: Menu item text for the password expiration item before a user logs in.

MenuRenewTickets.title: 'Renew Tickets' Menu Item Text
MenuRenewTickets.description: Menu item text for the Renew Tickets item.

MenuUserName.title: Username Menu Item Text
MenuUserName.description: Menu item text for the user name item before a user logs in.

MenuWelcome.title: Custom Welcome Window Path
MenuWelcome.description: Path to a folder containing an index.html file and associated resources for displaying as a Welcome window.

MessageLocalSync.title: Local Password Sync Message
MessageLocalSync.description: Message text for when a user is asked for their local password to sync their network password to their local account.

MessageNotConnected.title: Not Connected to Domain Message
MessageNotConnected.description: Message text to show in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected to the AD domain.

MessagePasswordChangePolicy.title: Password Change Policy Message
MessagePasswordChangePolicy.description: Message text to display in the password change dialog to help the user understand how complex they need to be.

MessageUPCAlert.title: Unannounced Password Changes Message
MessageUPCAlert.description: Message to be shown in an UPCAlert notification.

MountSharesWithFinder.title: Mount Shares with Finder
MountSharesWithFinder.description: Use the Finder instead of the API for automounted file shares.

PasswordExpireAlertTime.title: Password Expiration Alert Time
PasswordExpireAlertTime.description: Number of seconds before a user's password expiration that an alert is shown. (Set to 0 to never be bothered. Defaults to 15 days or 1,296,000 seconds.)

PasswordExpireCustomAlertTime.title: Password Expiration Custom Alert Time
PasswordExpireCustomAlertTime.description: Number of days remaining before the custom alert is shown, and in red.

PasswordExpireCustomWarnTime.title: Password Expiration Custom Warning Time
PasswordExpireCustomWarnTime.description: Number of days remaining before the custom alert is shown, and in yellow.

PasswordPolicy.title: Password Policy
PasswordPolicy.description: Complexity policy for changing the password via Kerberos.

minLowerCase.title: Minimum Lowercase Letters
minLowerCase.description: Minimum # of lowercase letters required in password

minMatches.title: Minimum Password Policy Matches
minMatches.description: Minimum # of password policies that must be met (not including length)

minNumber.title: Minimum Numbers
minNumber.description: Minimum # of numbers required in password

minSymbol.title: Minimum Symbols
minSymbol.description: Minimum # of symbols required in password

minUpperCase.title: Minimum Uppercase Letters
minUpperCase.description: Minimum # of uppercase letters required in password

PersistExpiration.title: Persist Password Expiration Countdown
PersistExpiration.description: Shows the password expiration countdown even when the user is not logged into the domain.

SelfServicePath.title: Self Service Path
SelfServicePath.description: File path for a Self Service application not found automatically.

ShowHome.title: Show 'Home' Menu Item
ShowHome.description: Shows the Home Directory share menu item.

SignInCommand.title: Post Sign In Command
SignInCommand.description: Path to a script or command to be run after a successful sign in.

SignInWindowAlert.title: Force Sign In Window on Top
SignInWindowAlert.description: Makes the Sign In window the foremost window when a user is not signed in.

SignInWindowAlertTime.title: Force Sign In Window on Top Timer
SignInWindowAlertTime.description: Time in seconds between the SignInWindowAlert making the Sign In window the foremost window.

SignInWindowOnLaunch.title: Show Sign In Window on Launch
SignInWindowOnLaunch.description: Shows the Sign In window on launch.

SignInWindowOnLaunchExclusions.title: Sign In Window User Exclusions
SignInWindowOnLaunchExclusions.description: Local users that will not be shown the Sign In window automatically.

SignOutCommand.title: Post Sign Out Command
SignOutCommand.description: Path to a script or other binary to be run on sign out.

StateChangeAction.title: Network Change Action
StateChangeAction.description: Path to a script that will be launched on network changes.

Template.title: Windows Certificate Authority Template
Template.description: Certificate template to request when using the Windows CA.

TitleSignIn.title: Sign In Window Title
TitleSignIn.description: Title of the Sign In window.

UPCAlert.title: Unannounced Password Changes Alert
UPCAlert.description: Alerts the user to Unannounced Password Changes, typically when the password was changed in AD and not from the user's system.

UPCAlertAction.title: Unannounced Password Changes Action
UPCAlertAction.description: Path to a script or other binary to execute when a UPC Alert occurs.

UseKeychainPrompt.title: Sign In Window Keychain
UseKeychainPrompt.description: Shows the Sign In window on launch unless the user has a password in the keychain.

WifiNetworks.title: Wi-Fi Networks
WifiNetworks.description: A list of wireless networks that the certificate created by NoMAD should be associated with.

X509CA.title: Windows Certificate Authority
X509CA.description: FQDN of the Windows web CA for NoMAD to use for certificates.

PresentedDataPrivacy.title: Suppress Data Privacy Screen
PresentedDataPrivacy.description: Suppresses the first run Data Privacy screen

PresentedEducation.title: Suppress Education Screens
PresentedEducation.description: Suppresses the first run Education screens

network.title: Network Subdomain
network.description: A pre-configured Twingate network subdomain (eg. autoco from autoco.twingate.com). This avoids users needing to enter your Twingate network address on first run.

startAtLogin.title: Start At Login
startAtLogin.description: Starts the Twingate Client upon user login

CreateAdminIfGroupMember.title: Create Admin If Group Member
CreateAdminIfGroupMember.description: List of groups that should have members be given local administrator status. Local administrator status can be given on first authentication when account created, or on later sign in of existing user when a group member. Administrator status not removed if group membership later revoked. Set as an Array of Strings of the group identifier.

CreateAdminUser.title: Create User as Admin
CreateAdminUser.description: When set to true and the user account is created, the user will be a local admin.

EnableFDE.title: Enable Full Disk Encryption (FDE)
EnableFDE.description: Enabled FDE enabled at first login on APFS disks.

EnableFDERecoveryKey.title: Save PRK
EnableFDERecoveryKey.description: Save the Personal Recovery Key (PRK) to disk for the MDM Escrow Service to collect.

EnableFDERecoveryKeyPath.title: FDE Recovery Key Path
EnableFDERecoveryKeyPath.description: Specify a custom path for the recovery key.

HomeAppendDomain.title: Home Append Domain
HomeAppendDomain.description: Append the domain name to the share defined in the profile.

HomeMountEnabled.title: Home Mount Enabled
HomeMountEnabled.description: Show and mount home directory from AD profile if defined.

KeychainReset.title: Keychain Reset
KeychainReset.description: Reset the keychain without prompting if the login password doesn't match the local password.

PasswordOverwriteSilent.title: Overwrite Password Silently
PasswordOverwriteSilent.description: Update the password silently to the new one. Used with the KeychainReset if the user has a secure token.

Shares.title: Shares
Shares.description: Add menu item and mount/automount shares

ConnectedOnly.title: ConnectedOnly
ConnectedOnly.description: Allow mounting only if network connection is detected

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name of share to show in menu

aliasName.title: Alias Name
aliasName.description: Name of OIDC claim that contains an alias to add to a user account. Usually this is the "upn" (eg syd@twocanoes.com) so the user can log in at the standard login window the same as the IdP login window. Adds the value to record name of the user account as an alias.

allowUsersClaim.title: Allow Users Claim
allowUsersClaim.description: The claim that contains the value to check for in the allowedUsersArray. Both must be defined.

allowedUsersArray.title: Allowed Users
allowedUsersArray.description: List of users that are allowed to log in. An empty array or undefined array means any user can log in as long their cloud credentials are valid. The preference allowUsersClaim must be defined to a claim in the idToken that identifies the users. For example, if the allowUsersClaim is set to upn and the allowedUsersArray is set to an array that contains fred@twocanoes.com and the upn of a logging in user is fred@twocanoes.com, they would be allowed to log in. barney@twocanoes.com would not.

autoRefreshLoginTimer.title: Automatically Refresh Login Window (seconds)
autoRefreshLoginTimer.description: Timer for automatically refreshing login screen in seconds. If set to 0, does not automatically refresh.

claimsToAddToLocalUserAccount.title: Claims To Add To Local User Account
claimsToAddToLocalUserAccount.description: List of claims that should be added to the user local account. Will be prefixed with _xcreds_oidc_. Set as an Array of Strings of the claim.

clientID.title: Client ID
clientID.description: The OIDC client id public identifier for the app.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description: Client Secret sometimes required by identity provider.

cloudLoginText.title: Cloud Login Text
cloudLoginText.description: Text for return to cloud login on Mac login screen

discoveryURL.title: Discovery URL
discoveryURL.description: The discovery URL provided by your OIDC / Cloud provider. For Google it is typically https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration and for Azure it is typically https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/.well-known/openid-configuration.

hideIfPathExists.title: Hide If Path Exists
hideIfPathExists.description: Don't show the UI if this key is defined and a file or folder exists at this path.

idpHostName.title: idpHostName
idpHostName.description: Hostname of the page that has the password field. When the user submits the form, XCreds will use idpHostName to identify a page it needs to look for the password field. The password value is identified by an HTML id defined by passwordElementID. If this value is not defined. XCreds will look for login.microsoftonline.com and accounts.google.com. This value is commonly set for other IdP’s and for Azure environments that use ADFS.

idpHostNames.title: idpHostNames
idpHostNames.description: array of hostnames of the page that has the password field.

loadPageInfo.title: LoadPage Info
loadPageInfo.description: When no network connection or a profile is not defined, this text is shown in an HTML view to the user when cloud login is configured.

loadPageTitle.title: LoadPage Title
loadPageTitle.description: When no network connection or a profile is not defined, this title is shown in an HTML view to the user when cloud login is configured.

localAdminPassword.title: Local Admin Password
localAdminPassword.description: Password of local admin user. DO NOT SET THIS IN PREFERENCES. It is recommended to set this with the settingsOverrideScriptPath script. This user is used to reset the keychain if the user forgets their local password and to setup a secure token for newly created users.

localAdminUserName.title: Local Admin User Name
localAdminUserName.description: Username of local admin user. DO NOT SET THIS IN PREFERENCES. It is recommended to set this with the settingsOverrideScriptPath script. This user is used to reset the keychain if the user forgets their local password and to setup a secure token for newly created users.

loginWindowBackgroundImageURL.title: Login Window Background Image URL
loginWindowBackgroundImageURL.description: URL to an image to show in the background while logging in. Default value: file:///System/Library/Desktop Pictures/Monterey Graphic.heic.

loginWindowHeight.title: Login Window Height
loginWindowHeight.description: Login Window webview height (Integer). If this is not defined, it will be full height. Minimum value of 150.

loginWindowWidth.title: Login Window Width
loginWindowWidth.description: Login Window webview width (Integer). If this is not defined, it will be full width. Minimum value of 150.

mapKerberosPrincipalName.title: Map Kerberos Principal Name
mapKerberosPrincipalName.description: The OIDC claim that has the kerberos principal name. This is used when logging in with OIDC and ADDomain is defined. During login, the claim that contains the kerberos principal name will be read and the local account will set dsAttrTypeNative:_xcreds_activedirectory_kerberosPrincipal to the kerberos principal name. The menu item will then use this value and the password to get a kerberos ticket.

map_firstname.title: First Name OIDC Mapping
map_firstname.description: Local DS to OIDC Mapping for First Name. Default value: “given_name”. map_firstname should be set to an OIDC claim for first name.

map_fullname.title: Full Name OIDC Mapping
map_fullname.description: Local DS to OIDC Mapping for Full Name. Default value: “name”. map_fullname should be set to an OIDC claim for full name.

map_lastname.title: Last Name OIDC Mapping
map_lastname.description: Local DS to OIDC Mapping for Last Name. Default value: “family_name”. map_lastname should be set to an OIDC claim for last name.

map_username.title: Username OIDC Mapping
map_username.description: Local DS to OIDC Mapping for Name. Default value: “name”. map_username should be set to an OIDC claim for name.

menuItemWindowBackgroundImageURL.title: Menu Item Window BackgroundImageURL
menuItemWindowBackgroundImageURL.description: URL to an image to show in the background of the window that appears when logged in and prompting for Active Directory username and password.

linkOrAppPath.title: Web page URL or local path to app

passwordChangeURL.title: Password Change URL for Menu
passwordChangeURL.description: Add a menu item for changing the password that will open this URL when the menu item is selected.

passwordElementID.title: passwordElementID
passwordElementID.description:
Password element id of the html element that has the password. It is read by using JavaScript to get the value (for example, for Azure, the JavaScript document.getElementById('i0118').value is sent. If this default is not set, standard values for Azure and Google Cloud will be used. To find out this value, use a browser to inspect the source of the page that has the password on it. Find the id of the textfield that has the password. Fill in the password and then open the JavaScript console. Run:

document.getElementById('passwordID').value
