changing “passwordID” to the correct element ID. If the value you typed into the textfield is returned, this is the correct ID.

passwordPlaceholder.title: Password Placeholder Text
passwordPlaceholder.description: Placeholder text in local / AD login window for password

redirectURI.title: Redirect URI
redirectURI.description: The URI passed back to the webview after successful authentication. Default value: xcreds://auth/

refreshRateHours.title: Password Change Check Rate Hours
refreshRateHours.description: The number of hours between checks. Default value: 3. Minimum value: 0. Max value: 168.

refreshRateMinutes.title: Password Change Check Rate Minutes
refreshRateMinutes.description: The number of minutes between checks. Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0. Max value: 59. This value is added to refreshRateHours. If refreshRateHours is 0, minimum for refreshRateMinutes becomes 5.

ropgClientID.title: ROPG Client ID
ropgClientID.description: (Deprecated in v4.0) ROPG Client ID for use when checking password.

ropgClientSecret.title: ROPG Client Secret
ropgClientSecret.description: (Deprecated in v4.0) ROPG Client Secret for use when checking password.

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description:
Scopes tell the identify provider what information to return. Note that the values are provided with a single space between them.

Provide the following values the follow IdPs:

Google: profile openid email
Azure: profile openid offline_access

Note that Google does not support the offline_access scope so instead use the preference shouldSetGoogleAccessTypeToOffline. Azure provides unique_name which is mapped to the local user account by using the prefix before “@” in unique_name and matching to the short name of a user account. Google provides “email” and is matched in the same way.

settingsOverrideScriptPath.title: Override Script Path
settingsOverrideScriptPath.description: Script to override defaults. Must return valid property list with specified defaults. Script must exist at path, be owned by _securityagent and writable and executable only by _securityagent.

shareMenuItemName.title: Share Menu Item Name
shareMenuItemName.description: Name for Shares menu item. Default: "Shares".

shouldAllowKeyComboForMacLoginWindow.title: Should Allow Key Combo For Mac Login Window
shouldAllowKeyComboForMacLoginWindow.description: Allow key combo (control-option return) to switch logon window. Use command-option-control-return for Mac Login Window.

shouldDetectNetworkToDetermineLoginWindo.title: Should Detect Network To Determine Login Window
shouldDetectNetworkToDetermineLoginWindo.description: Check if network is up. If not, select username and password login window.

shouldLoginWindowBackgroundImageFillScre.title: Login Window Background Image Fill Screen
shouldLoginWindowBackgroundImageFillScre.description: Set the background image to Fill Screen rather than Fit to Screen

shouldPreferLocalLoginInsteadOfCloudLogi.title: Prefer Local Login over Cloud Login
shouldPreferLocalLoginInsteadOfCloudLogi.description: Favor using XCreds' local login screen over the cloud login UI.

shouldPromptForADPasswordChange.title: Should Prompt For AD Password Change
shouldPromptForADPasswordChange.description: If the domain controller returns back that the password is expired or needs to be changed, prompt the user. If this is set to false, login will fail and an error message will be shown.

shouldPromptForMigration.title: Should Prompt for Migration
shouldPromptForMigration.description: Prompt for local account username and password if no account was mapped and there are standard users already on the system.

shouldSetGoogleAccessTypeToOffline.title: Request Google Refresh Token
shouldSetGoogleAccessTypeToOffline.description: When using Google IdP, a refresh token may need be requested in a non-standard way.

shouldShowAboutMenu.title: Show About Menu
shouldShowAboutMenu.description: Show the About Menu item menu. Default value: true

shouldShowCloudLoginByDefault.title: Show Cloud Login By Default
shouldShowCloudLoginByDefault.description: Determine if the Mac login window or the cloud login window is shown by default.  When not set or set to true, show cloud login. If false, shows Mac login.

shouldShowConfigureWifiButton.title: Show Configure WiFi
shouldShowConfigureWifiButton.description: Show Configure WiFi button in XCreds Login.

shouldShowLocalOnlyCheckbox.title: Show Local Only Checkbox
shouldShowLocalOnlyCheckbox.description: Show the local only checkbox on the local login page

shouldShowMacLoginButton.title: Show Mac Login Window button
shouldShowMacLoginButton.description: Show the Mac Login Window button in XCreds Login.

shouldShowPreferencesOnStart.title: Show Preferences on Startup
shouldShowPreferencesOnStart.description: Show Settings on start if none are defined. Default value: false

shouldShowQuitMenu.title: Show Quit Menu Item
shouldShowQuitMenu.description: Show Quit in the menu item menu. Default value: true

shouldShowRefreshBanner.title: Show Refresh Banner
shouldShowRefreshBanner.description: Show text at the top of the prompt window when tokens expire.

shouldShowSignInMenuItem.title: Show Sign In Menu Item
shouldShowSignInMenuItem.description: Determine if the Sign In menu item is shown in the XCreds menu. When not set or set to true, show Sign In. If false, the Sign In menu item is hidden.

shouldShowSupportStatus.title: Show Support Status Message
shouldShowSupportStatus.description: Show message in XCreds Login reminding people to buy support.

shouldShowVersionInfo.title: Show Version and Build Number
shouldShowVersionInfo.description: Show the version number and build number in the lower left corner of XCreds Login.

shouldSwitchToLoginWindowWhenLocked.title: Should Switch To Login Window When Locked
shouldSwitchToLoginWindowWhenLocked.description: When set to true and the user locks the current session, XCreds will tell the system to switch to Login Window. The current session will stay active but the user will login with the XCreds Login Window to resume the session.

shouldUseROPGForLoginWindowLogin.title: Use ROPG when logging in at login window
shouldUseROPGForLoginWindowLogin.description: When verifying password in the login window, use ROPG.

shouldUseROPGForMenuLogin.title: Use ROPG For Menu Login
shouldUseROPGForMenuLogin.description: When verifying password in the menu app, use ROPG.

shouldUseROPGForPasswordChangeChecking.title: Should Use ROPG For Password Change Checking
shouldUseROPGForPasswordChangeChecking.description: When verifying local password matches cloud password in the background, use ROPG. If set to false, the refresh token will be used to verify password change.

shouldVerifyPasswordWithRopg.title: Use ROPG when testing password
shouldVerifyPasswordWithRopg.description: (Deprecated in v4.0) When verifying password in the menu app, use ROPG.

showDebug.title: Show Debug Message
showDebug.description: Show push notifications for authentication progress. Default value: false

username.title: Local Username
username.description: When a user uses cloud login, XCreds will try and figure out the local username based on the email or other data returned for the IdP. Use this value to force the local username for any cloud login. Provide only the shortname.

usernamePlaceholder.title: Username Placeholder Text
usernamePlaceholder.description: Placeholder text in local / AD login window for username

verifyPassword.title: Verify Cloud Password
verifyPassword.description: When cloud password is changed and the local keychain password and local user account needs to be changed, a verification dialog can be shown to verify the password. Default value: true

com.unity3d.UnityEditor5.x.title: Unity Editor
com.unity3d.UnityEditor5.x.description: Use this section to define settings for Unity Editor

EditorUpdateShowAtStartup.title: Show Unity Editor updater at launch
EditorUpdateShowAtStartup.description: Check to show the Unity Editor updater at launch

ReopenLastUsedProjectOnStartup.title: Open previously opened project at launch
ReopenLastUsedProjectOnStartup.description: Check to open the previously opened project at launch

com.vpntracker.365mac.title: VPN Tracker
com.vpntracker.365mac.description: Manage settings in VPN Tracker for Mac, iPhone or iPad – the multi protocol VPN client for enterprise teams. Visit vpntracker.com/goto/profile to learn more.

Managed_Onboarding_Email.title: Email address
Managed_Onboarding_Email.description: You can optionally set the email address the user will use to sign in to VPN Tracker, when deploying a personalized profile.

Managed_Onboarding_EmailDomains.title: Allowed email domains
Managed_Onboarding_EmailDomains.description: A comma-separated list of email domains that users are allowed to use when joining your team.

Managed_Onboarding_FamilyName.title: Surname
Managed_Onboarding_FamilyName.description: Used in the onboarding greeting and during VPN Tracker account registration for new users.

Managed_Onboarding_FullName.title: Full name
Managed_Onboarding_FullName.description: Full name of the user displayed during onboarding. If given name and family name are set, this value is ignored.

Managed_Onboarding_GivenName.title: Given name
Managed_Onboarding_GivenName.description: Used in the onboarding greeting and during VPN Tracker account registration for new users.

Managed_Onboarding_Greeting.title: Greeting text
Managed_Onboarding_Greeting.description: Greeting text to show instead of the default "Welcome, {name}".

Managed_Onboarding_TeamAPIToken.title: Team API Token
Managed_Onboarding_TeamAPIToken.description: The team's API Token – find it at my.vpntracker.com/teamprofile.

Managed_Onboarding_TeamUUID.title: Team UUID
Managed_Onboarding_TeamUUID.description: Have new users automatically join your organization's VPN Tracker team and automatically receive their VPN connection. Find yours at my.vpntracker.com/teamprofile.

corp.sap.privileges.title: SAP Privileges
corp.sap.privileges.description: Use this section to define settings for the SAP Privileges app

DockToggleMaxTimeout.title: Dock Toggle Max Timeout
DockToggleMaxTimeout.description: Set a maximum timeout for the Dock tile's Toggle Privileges command. This generally works the same way as the DockToggleTimeout but allows the user to choose every timeout value up to the one specified. If set to 20 min. for example, the user may decide to set it to a value below 20 instead of being forced to use the 20 minute timeout.

DockToggleTimeout.title: Dock Toggle Timeout
DockToggleTimeout.description: Sets a fixed timeout for the Dock tile's Toggle Privileges command. After this time, the admin rights are removed and set back to standard user rights. A value of 0 disables the timeout and allows the user to permanently toggle privileges.

EnforcePrivileges.title: Enforce Privileges
EnforcePrivileges.description: Enforces certain privileges. Whenever Privileges.app or the PrivilegesCLI command line tool are launched, the corresponding privileges are set.

LimitToGroup.title: Limit to Group
LimitToGroup.description: Limits the usage of Privileges.app to the given user group.

LimitToUser.title: Limit to User
LimitToUser.description: Limits the usage of Privileges.app to the given user account.

ReasonMinLength.title: Reason Minimum Length
ReasonMinLength.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters the user has to enter as the reason for becoming an admin.

ReasonRequired.title: Reason Required
ReasonRequired.description: If ReasonRequired is set to true, the user must provide a reason for needing admin rights.

EnableTCP.title: Enable TCP
EnableTCP.description: If set to true, the log messages are sent via TCP instead of UDP. By default, messages are sent via UDP.

ServerAddress.title: Server Address
ServerAddress.description: This will usually be an IP address, unless the syslog server is set up to respond using a DNS hostname.

ServerPort.title: Server Port
ServerPort.description: The port of the logging server.

MaximumMessageSize.title: Maximum Message Size
MaximumMessageSize.description: Specify the maximum size of the syslog message (header + event message). If the syslog message is larger than the specified maximum, the message will be truncated at the end.

RequireAuthentication.title: Require User Authentication
RequireAuthentication.description: Requires authentication before using Privileges.app. If set to true, the logged-in user is prompted to authenticate via Touch ID or by entering their account password.

autostart.title: Enable Autostart
autostart.description: Optional. If set to true, the app will be launched on user-login.

canChangeAutostart.title: Can Change Autostart
canChangeAutostart.description: Optional. If set to false, the user can not change the Autostart option.

canQuit.title: Allow to Quit App
canQuit.description: Optional. If set to true, the user can quit the app

helpURL.title: Help URL
helpURL.description: Configure a help URL to help users interact with the application.

authType.title: Authentication type
authType.description: Authentication type for the share, it can be either through Kerberos (krb) or using a username/password (auth). Default: Kerberos.

mountPoint.title: Mount point name (Optional)
mountPoint.description: Optional: Change the mount point name for the network share. Leave blank for the default value (recommended)

networkShare.title: Server and share
networkShare.description: Example: smb://filer.your.domain.tld/share. Note: %USERNAME% will be replaced with the current user's login name.

username.title: Username (Optional)
username.description: Optional: Predefine a username for authentication using username/password

networkShares.title: Network shares
networkShares.description: Array with all network shares. Example: smb://filer.your.domain/share. Note: %USERNAME% will be replaced with the login name of the current user.

unmountOnExit.title: Unmount Shares on Exit
unmountOnExit.description: Configure a help URL to help users interact with the application.

baseURL.title: URL
baseURL.description: The base URL to the folder containing the images.txt file or JSON information. Do NOT include trailing backslash.

groupLabel.title: Group Label
groupLabel.description: String to be added after the baseURL.  Using images.txt this adds after the baseURL and before images.txt.  Using JSON this adds after the baseURL. Can be used to specify a folder on web server with different images.txt or as ? parameter string for JSON feed.

reloadContentTimer.title: Reload Image List Time
reloadContentTimer.description: Time between reloading the list of image links

rotateImageTimer.title: Image Rotation Time
rotateImageTimer.description: Time each image will stay on screen.

shouldDisplayName.title: Display Device Name
shouldDisplayName.description: Show name of device on screen

shouldUseJSON.title: Use ConfBoard JSON data file
shouldUseJSON.description: Base URL is a JSON file or feed not text list of URIs.

ExclusionSets.title: Exclusion Sets
ExclusionSets.description: Exclude any character set you'd like from the randomly generated password.

FirstPass.title: First Password
FirstPass.description: Use this key if your LAPS Admin is a FileVault user. The script will read this key in if there isn't a keyhcain entry in System keychain for macOSLAPS. Once this has been completed, the keychain entry will then be used.

Lowercase.title: Minimum Lowercase Letters
Lowercase.description: The minimum number of lowercase letters in a generated password.

Number.title: Minimum Numeric Characters
Number.description: The minimum number of numeric characters in a generated password.

Symbol.title: Minimum Symbols
Symbol.description: The minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters in a generated password.

Uppercase.title: Minimum Uppercase Letters
Uppercase.description: The minimum number of uppercase letters in a generated password.

fr.handbrake.HandBrake.title: Handbrake
fr.handbrake.HandBrake.description: Use this section to define settings for the Handbrake video transcoder

SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.title: Automatic Update Install Prompt
SUAllowsAutomaticUpdates.description: Controls the automatic update install prompt. When enabled, presents users with the option to allow automatic download and install of available updates. If disabled, disallows automatic updates and requires manual installation every time.

SUAutomaticallyUpdate.title: Enable Automatic Silent Updates
SUAutomaticallyUpdate.description: Controls automatic silent updates. If enabled, users will not be informed about updates and updates will be silently installed when the app quits.

SUFeedURL.title: Sparkle Feed URL
SUFeedURL.description: Setting this to a non-existent URL will disable the ability for users to manually check for updates. Useful when you intend to use your own software distribution mechanism to deploy updates.

SUScheduledCheckInterval.title: Automatic Update Check Interval
SUScheduledCheckInterval.description: Controls the automatic update check interval. The default is 1 day (86400 seconds). Setting to 0 disables updates.

io.tailscale.ipn.macos.title: Tailscale (MAS)
io.tailscale.ipn.macos.description: Configure settings for the Mac App Store variant of the Tailscale client.

AllowIncomingConnections.title: Allow incoming connections
AllowIncomingConnections.description: Determines whether Tailscale should allow incoming connections to the device.

ExitNodeAllowLANAccess.title: Allow Local Network Access when an exit node is in use
ExitNodeAllowLANAccess.description: Allow Local Network Access determines whether users can still access devices on the local network while using an exit node.

ExitNodeID.title: Forced Exit Node ID
ExitNodeID.description: Forces the Tailscale client to always use the given exit node. This can be useful if you wish to route all Internet traffic through a node for inspection or logging purposes. Users won't be able to disable or choose another exit node when this policy is active. A message will be displayed in the client UI informing users about this restriction. The value for this key should be the ID of an exit node device. You can find the ID for any device in your tailnet by looking at the Machines page of the admin console, or by using the Tailscale API. Note that if a forced exit node goes offline, Internet connectivity will be unavailable on client devices until the exit node comes back online.

ExitNodesPicker.title: Show/hide exit nodes picker
ExitNodesPicker.description: Shows or hides all UI items to choose an exit node in the Tailscale client.

ForceEnabled.title: Force Tailscale to always be running
ForceEnabled.description: When set to true, this boolean instructs Tailscale to always be connected and actively monitor the tunnel state for disconnections. The Disconnect toggle will be disabled, to prevent users from disabling the VPN themselves. An attempt to disconnect will present a banner informing the user the organization’s policy prevents Tailscale from being disconnected. If the client detects the VPN tunnel is down because the Tailscale VPN process was terminated, Tailscale will automatically restart it and reconnect. You might want to use this policy together with an always-on VPN configuration profile.

HiddenNetworkDevices.title: Hide categories of network devices
HiddenNetworkDevices.description: Can be used to hide one or more categories of network devices normally displayed in the Tailscale client. Administrators can choose to hide: devices owned by the current user; devices owned by other users; tagged devices. If all three options are chosen, the "Network Devices" menu item disappears entirely and users aren’t able to see any device on the tailnet.

IPAddressCopiedAlertSuppressed.title: Suppress IP Address Copied notifications
IPAddressCopiedAlertSuppressed.description: When you use the Tailscale menu bar item to copy to the Clipboard the IP address of a device, a notification displaying the IP address is presented. Use this to suppress this Copied IP address to clipboard notification.

KeyExpirationNotice.title: Key Expiration Notice Interval
KeyExpirationNotice.description: The KeyExpirationNotice policy controls how long before key expiry should a notice be displayed. The default is 24 hours ("24h"). Use a Go-style Duration for this policy value, for instance "24h" or "5h25m30s".

LoginURL.title: Custom control server URL
LoginURL.description: The LoginURL policy can be used to specify a custom control server URL. This should not be changed unless you are not using the standard Tailscale server. Use this policy if you’re deploying your own server, such as Headscale.

ManageTailnetLock.title: Show/hide tailnet lock settings
ManageTailnetLock.description: Shows or hides the "Manage Tailnet lock" menu item.

ManagedByCaption.title: Organization Details: Caption
ManagedByCaption.description: Specifies a caption to be displayed in the Managed By view in the Tailscale client. Use this string value to provide your users with information on how to reach support resources for Tailscale in your organization.

ManagedByOrganizationName.title: Organization Details: Name
ManagedByOrganizationName.description: Specifies the name of the organization managing Tailscale, for instance “XYZ Corp, Inc.”. The value will be displayed in the Tailscale client, so that users can easily reach your internal support resources.

ManagedByURL.title: Organization Details: Support URL
ManagedByURL.description: Specifies a URL pointing to a help desk webpage, or other helpful resources for users in the organization. Clicking the Support button in the Tailscale UI will open this webpage.

PostureChecking.title: Gather device posture data
PostureChecking.description: Enables gathering of device posture data.

ResetToDefaults.title: Show/hide the "Reset to Defaults" menu item
ResetToDefaults.description: Shows or hides the "Reset to Defaults" menu item.

RunExitNode.title: Show/hide "Run as Exit Node" menu item
RunExitNode.description: Shows or hides the "Run as Exit Node" menu item, controlling the user's ability to toggle this option.

StartOnLoginMenuItem.title: Show/hide "Start on Login" menu item
StartOnLoginMenuItem.description: Shows or hides the "Start on Login" menu item, controlling the user's ability to toggle this option.

Tailnet.title: Suggested or required tailnet name
Tailnet.description: Specify a tailnet, and its identity provider will be used on the login page. If the policy value is prefixed with "required:"", Tailscale will force that identity provider to be used and won’t allow logging in with anything else.

TailscaleOnboardingSeen.title: Suppress the first launch onboarding flow
TailscaleOnboardingSeen.description: When you start Tailscale on your Mac for the first time, an onboarding flow is presented. It explains the Tailscale privacy policy, and guides the user in setting up the VPN configuration on their Mac. You might want to disable this onboarding flow if you are going to automatically set up the VPN configuration on the system by using a configuration profile. In order to do so, this boolean suppresses the onboarding flow when Tailscale launches for the first time and the value is set to true.

TailscaleStartOnLogin.title: Automatically start Tailscale when the user logs in
TailscaleStartOnLogin.description: The first time the application is opened on a Mac, Tailscale installs a macOS login helper. This allows Tailscale to start automatically when the user logs into their account. This boolean controls whether the login helper should start Tailscale at login time.

TestMenu.title: Show/hide Debug menu
TestMenu.description: Shows or hides the debug menu in the Tailscale client. On macOS, this system policy will also hide any information displayed when holding down the Option key while clicking on the Tailscale menubar item.

UpdateMenu.title: Show/hide "Update Available" menu item
UpdateMenu.description: Shows or hides the "Update Available" menu item which appears when a newer version of Tailscale is available.

UseTailscaleDNSSettings.title: Use Tailscale DNS Settings
UseTailscaleDNSSettings.description: Determines whether to apply the DNS configuration provided by the coordination server when the tunnel is connected.

UseTailscaleSubnets.title: Use Tailscale Subnets
UseTailscaleSubnets.description: Determines whether the client accepts subnets advertised by other nodes in your tailnet.

io.tailscale.ipn.macsys.title: Tailscale (Standalone)
io.tailscale.ipn.macsys.description: Configure settings for the Standalone variant of the Tailscale client.

AllowIncomingConnections.title: Allow incoming connections
AllowIncomingConnections.description: Determines whether Tailscale should allow incoming connections to the device.

ApplyUpdates.title: Show/hide the automatic updates settings UI
ApplyUpdates.description: Use this if you do not want to allow the user to turn the automatic installation of updates on or off. When set to hide, the "Automatically install updates" menu item won’t be shown to the user, and the user won’t be able to configure automatic updates.

ExitNodeAllowLANAccess.title: Allow Local Network Access when an exit node is in use
ExitNodeAllowLANAccess.description: Allow Local Network Access determines whether users can still access devices on the local network while using an exit node.

ExitNodeID.title: Forced Exit Node ID
ExitNodeID.description: Forces the Tailscale client to always use the given exit node. This can be useful if you wish to route all Internet traffic through a node for inspection or logging purposes. Users won't be able to disable or choose another exit node when this policy is active. A message will be displayed in the client UI informing users about this restriction. The value for this key should be the ID of an exit node device. You can find the ID for any device in your tailnet by looking at the Machines page of the admin console, or by using the Tailscale API. Note that if a forced exit node goes offline, Internet connectivity will be unavailable on client devices until the exit node comes back online.

ExitNodesPicker.title: Show/hide exit nodes picker
ExitNodesPicker.description: Shows or hides all UI items to choose an exit node in the Tailscale client.

ForceEnabled.title: Force Tailscale to always be running
ForceEnabled.description: When set to true, this boolean instructs Tailscale to always be connected and actively monitor the tunnel state for disconnections. The Disconnect toggle will be disabled, to prevent users from disabling the VPN themselves. An attempt to disconnect will present a banner informing the user the organization’s policy prevents Tailscale from being disconnected. If the client detects the VPN tunnel is down because the Tailscale VPN process was terminated, Tailscale will automatically restart it and reconnect. You might want to use this policy together with an always-on VPN configuration profile.

HiddenNetworkDevices.title: Hide categories of network devices
HiddenNetworkDevices.description: Can be used to hide one or more categories of network devices normally displayed in the Tailscale client. Administrators can choose to hide: devices owned by the current user; devices owned by other users; tagged devices. If all three options are chosen, the "Network Devices" menu item disappears entirely and users aren’t able to see any device on the tailnet.

IPAddressCopiedAlertSuppressed.title: Suppress IP Address Copied notifications
IPAddressCopiedAlertSuppressed.description: When you use the Tailscale menu bar item to copy to the Clipboard the IP address of a device, a notification displaying the IP address is presented. Use this to suppress this Copied IP address to clipboard notification.

KeyExpirationNotice.title: Key Expiration Notice Interval
KeyExpirationNotice.description: The KeyExpirationNotice policy controls how long before key expiry should a notice be displayed. The default is 24 hours ("24h"). Use a Go-style Duration for this policy value, for instance "24h" or "5h25m30s".

LoginURL.title: Custom control server URL
LoginURL.description: The LoginURL policy can be used to specify a custom control server URL. This should not be changed unless you are not using the standard Tailscale server. Use this policy if you’re deploying your own server, such as Headscale.

ManageTailnetLock.title: Show/hide tailnet lock settings
ManageTailnetLock.description: Shows or hides the "Manage Tailnet lock" menu item.

ManagedByCaption.title: Organization Details: Caption
ManagedByCaption.description: Specifies a caption to be displayed in the Managed By view in the Tailscale client. Use this string value to provide your users with information on how to reach support resources for Tailscale in your organization.

ManagedByOrganizationName.title: Organization Details: Name
ManagedByOrganizationName.description: Specifies the name of the organization managing Tailscale, for instance “XYZ Corp, Inc.”. The value will be displayed in the Tailscale client, so that users can easily reach your internal support resources.

ManagedByURL.title: Organization Details: Support URL
ManagedByURL.description: Specifies a URL pointing to a help desk webpage, or other helpful resources for users in the organization. Clicking the Support button in the Tailscale UI will open this webpage.

PostureChecking.title: Gather device posture data
PostureChecking.description: Enables gathering of device posture data.

ResetToDefaults.title: Show/hide the "Reset to Defaults" menu item
ResetToDefaults.description: Shows or hides the "Reset to Defaults" menu item.

RunExitNode.title: Show/hide "Run as Exit Node" menu item
RunExitNode.description: Shows or hides the "Run as Exit Node" menu item, controlling the user's ability to toggle this option.

SUAutomaticallyUpdate.title: Install updates automatically
SUAutomaticallyUpdate.description: If you are using the Standalone version of Tailscale for macOS, the client can also install updates automatically. This feature also relies on the Sparkle framework. We recommend that you always turn this feature on, in order to ensure your users receive any security updates in a timely manner. However, if you manually manage updates, or prefer your users to be notified but to manually update, you can disable the automatic installation. When set to false, the standalone variant of Tailscale for macOS will require user input before updates are installed.

SUEnableAutomaticChecks.title: Check for updates automatically
SUEnableAutomaticChecks.description: If you are using the Standalone version of Tailscale for macOS, the client will periodically check for updates automatically and notify the user that a new version is available, using the Sparkle framework. We recommend that you leave this feature on, in order to ensure your users receive any security updates in a timely manner. However, you might prefer to manually deploy updates and disable notifications of new available versions. Set this value to false to disable automatically checking for updates.

StartOnLoginMenuItem.title: Show/hide "Start on Login" menu item
StartOnLoginMenuItem.description: Shows or hides the "Start on Login" menu item, controlling the user's ability to toggle this option.

Tailnet.title: Suggested or required tailnet name
Tailnet.description: Specify a tailnet, and its identity provider will be used on the login page. If the policy value is prefixed with "required:"", Tailscale will force that identity provider to be used and won’t allow logging in with anything else.

TailscaleOnboardingSeen.title: Suppress the first launch onboarding flow
TailscaleOnboardingSeen.description: When you start Tailscale on your Mac for the first time, an onboarding flow is presented. It explains the Tailscale privacy policy, and guides the user in setting up the VPN configuration on their Mac. You might want to disable this onboarding flow if you are going to automatically set up the VPN configuration on the system by using a configuration profile. In order to do so, this boolean suppresses the onboarding flow when Tailscale launches for the first time and the value is set to true.

TailscaleStartOnLogin.title: Automatically start Tailscale when the user logs in
TailscaleStartOnLogin.description: The first time the application is opened on a Mac, Tailscale installs a macOS login helper. This allows Tailscale to start automatically when the user logs into their account. This boolean controls whether the login helper should start Tailscale at login time.

TestMenu.title: Show/hide Debug menu
TestMenu.description: Shows or hides the debug menu in the Tailscale client. On macOS, this system policy will also hide any information displayed when holding down the Option key while clicking on the Tailscale menubar item.

UnstableUpdates.title: Allow updating to unstable builds
UnstableUpdates.description: Setting UnstableUpdates to "never" means that your users won’t be able to update to unstable versions of the client from the in-app UI. You can deploy this policy to prevent non-tech-savvy users from enrolling in pre-release builds of the client, which might be more prone to issues.

UpdateMenu.title: Show/hide "Update Available" menu item
UpdateMenu.description: Shows or hides the "Update Available" menu item which appears when a newer version of Tailscale is available.

UseTailscaleDNSSettings.title: Use Tailscale DNS Settings
UseTailscaleDNSSettings.description: Determines whether to apply the DNS configuration provided by the coordination server when the tunnel is connected.

UseTailscaleSubnets.title: Use Tailscale Subnets
UseTailscaleSubnets.description: Determines whether the client accepts subnets advertised by other nodes in your tailnet.

AutoLaunchedApplicationDictionary-manage.title: Launch network home share point at login
AutoLaunchedApplicationDictionary-manage.description: Automatically launch the users network home share point when logging in.

AuthenticateAsLoginUserShortName.title: Authenticate with short name.
AuthenticateAsLoginUserShortName.description: Authenticate to the URL with the current users short name. Required if URL is specified, but not for Path

DisableLoginItemsSuppression.title: Disable shift to suppress login items
DisableLoginItemsSuppression.description: Prevent users from disabling login items launching using the Shift key.

ADExpirationShow.title: ADExpirationShow
ADExpirationShow.description: Shows a menu item beneath the current user's name showing the user's password expiration as determined by AD.

ActionsUpdateTime.title: ActionsUpdateTime
ActionsUpdateTime.description: Number of minutes between updating the Actions Menu.

AuthServer.title: AuthServer
AuthServer.description: URL for the Okta server, note no preceding https: is required.

AutoAuth.title: AutoAuth
AutoAuth.description: Determines if web extensions automatically authenticate via the NoMAD Pro UI.

ChangePasswordOrder.title: ChangePasswordOrder
ChangePasswordOrder.description: Determines the order and setting for the password change menu. NOT IMPLEMENTED YET, THERE IS NO DOCUMENTATION ON THIS KEY.

ChangePasswordTimer.title: ChangePasswordTimer
ChangePasswordTimer.description: Time in minutes until the user is prompted to sign in again after a Password Change.

CheckSafariExtension.title: CheckSafariExtension
CheckSafariExtension.description: Determines if the user is warned that the NoMAD Pro extension has not been enabled in Safari.

DontShowWelcome.title: DontShowWelcome
DontShowWelcome.description: Disables the showing of the welcome splash screen on launch.

ExpirationWarningDays.title: ExpirationWarningDays
ExpirationWarningDays.description: Number of days remaining before sending notifications via the Notification Center.

ExportableKey.title: ExportableKey
ExportableKey.description: Allows the private key of the user certificate to be exported.

GetHelpOptions.title: GetHelpOptions
GetHelpOptions.description: URL or Path for GetHelpType (<<serial>>, <<fullname>>, <<shortname>> and <<domain>> are currently supported as substitutions)

HideChangePassword.title: HideChangePassword
HideChangePassword.description: Hides the Change Password menu item.

HideGetHelp.title: HideGetHelp
HideGetHelp.description: Hides the Get Help menu item.

HideGetSoftware.title: HideGetSoftware
HideGetSoftware.description: Hides the Get Software menu item.

HideLockScreen.title: HideLockScreen
HideLockScreen.description: Hides the Lock Screen menu item.

HideSignIn.title: HideSignIn
HideSignIn.description: Hides the Sign In menu item.

IgnoreDomainReachability.title: IgnoreDomainReachability
IgnoreDomainReachability.description: Determines if SRV record lookups are used to determine if the AD domain is reachable.

KerberosRealm.title: KerberosRealm
KerberosRealm.description: Kerberos realm to use to get Kerberos tickets as a side effect of authentication.

KerberosRenew.title: KerberosRenew
KerberosRenew.description: Determines if the Kerberos tickets should be renewed or not.

KerberosShortName.title: KerberosShortName
KerberosShortName.description: The shortname to use for Kerberos tickets. If unset the sign in name is used.

KerberosShortNameAsk.title: KerberosShortNameAsk
KerberosShortNameAsk.description: Determines if the user is asked to enter their Kerberos short name on first sign in.

KerberosShortNameAskMessage.title: KerberosShortNameAskMessage
KerberosShortNameAskMessage.description: The message text when asking the user for their Kerberos short name.

KeychainItems.title: KeychainItems
KeychainItems.description: Items to update when the user's local password is updated as well.

KeychainItemsDebug.title: KeychainItemsDebug
KeychainItemsDebug.description: Updates keychain items on every sign in. Used for debugging.

LDAPServers.title: LDAPServers
LDAPServers.description: Specific Domain Controllers to use for AD lookups.

LabelPassword.title: LabelPassword
LabelPassword.description: The text label for the password field in the Sign In window.

LabelUsername.title: LabelUsername
LabelUsername.description: The text label for the username field in the Sign In window.

LicenseFile.title: LicenseFile
LicenseFile.description: The contents of a .nomadlicense file encoded as Base64 data.

LocalPasswordSync.title: LocalPasswordSync
LocalPasswordSync.description: Determines if the Okta password is synchronized with the local account.

LocalPasswordSyncMessage.title: LocalPasswordSyncMessage
LocalPasswordSyncMessage.description: The alert dialog text that the user is presented with when asked to enter in his or her local password.

LocalPasswordSyncOnMatchOnly.title: LocalPasswordSyncOnMatchOnly
LocalPasswordSyncOnMatchOnly.description: Only sync the password if the Okta account name is the same as the local account name.

MenuAbout.title: MenuAbout
MenuAbout.description: Menu item text for the About item.

MenuActions.title: MenuActions
MenuActions.description: Menu item text for the Actions item.

MenuChangePassword.title: MenuChangePassword
MenuChangePassword.description: Menu item text for the Change Password item.

MenuGetHelp.title: MenuGetHelp
MenuGetHelp.description: Menu item text for the Get Help item.

MenuGetSoftware.title: MenuGetSoftware
MenuGetSoftware.description: Menu item text for the Get Software item.

MenuIcon.title: MenuIcon
MenuIcon.description: Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar.

MenuLockScreen.title: MenuLockScreen
MenuLockScreen.description: Menu item text for the Lock Screen item.

MenuPreferences.title: MenuPreferences
MenuPreferences.description: Menu item text for the Preferences item.

MenuSignIn.title: MenuSignIn
MenuSignIn.description: Menu item text for the Sign In item.

MessagePasswordChangePolicy.title: MessagePasswordChangePolicy
MessagePasswordChangePolicy.description: Message text when changing password via Kerberos for the AD complexity policy.

MessagePluginDisabled.title: MessagePluginDisabled
MessagePluginDisabled.description: Text to show when alerting the user that the Safari plugin has not been enabled.

PasswordChangeCommand.title: PasswordChangeCommand
PasswordChangeCommand.description: Script or other binary to run when a password is successfully changed.

PasswordExpirationMenu.title: PasswordExpirationMenu
PasswordExpirationMenu.description: Determines if the countdown before password expiration is shown in the menu.

PasswordExpirationMenuDays.title: PasswordExpirationMenuDays
PasswordExpirationMenuDays.description: Number of days remaining before the password expiration countdown is shown in the menu bar.

PasswordPolicy.title: PasswordPolicy
PasswordPolicy.description: Complexity policy for changing the password via Kerberos.

PeriodicUpdateTime.title: PeriodicUpdateTime
PeriodicUpdateTime.description: Time in minutes between periodic background updates.

SelfServicePath.title: SelfServicePath
SelfServicePath.description: File path for a Self Service application not found automatically.

SignInCommand.title: SignInCommand
SignInCommand.description: Path to a script or other binary to be run after a successful sign in.

SignInLogo.title: SignInLogo
SignInLogo.description: Path to a logo file. The space is 342x90 pixels.

Template.title: Template
Template.description: Certificate template to request when using the Windows CA.

TicketsOnSignIn.title: TicketsOnSignIn
TicketsOnSignIn.description: Causes NoMAD Pro to get Kerberos Tickets.

TitleSignIn.title: TitleSignIn
TitleSignIn.description: Title of the Sign In window.

UseKeychain.title: UseKeychain
UseKeychain.description: Determines if the Okta password is stored in the user's keychain.

UseKeychainPrompt.title: UseKeychainPrompt
UseKeychainPrompt.description: Shows the Sign In window on launch unless the user has a password in the keychain.

UseKeychainPromptExlusions.title: UseKeychainPromptExlusions
UseKeychainPromptExlusions.description: List of users that can ignore the keychain prompt.

WarnOnPasswordExpiration.title: WarnOnPasswordExpiration
WarnOnPasswordExpiration.description: Determines whether NoMAD Pro should warn the user on sign in if the password is about to expire.

WifiNetworks.title: WifiNetworks
WifiNetworks.description: A list of wireless networks that the certificate created by NoMAD Pro should be associated with.

X509CA.title: X509CA
X509CA.description: FQDN of the Windows web CA for NoMAD Pro to use for certificates.

ADDomain.title: Active Directory Domain
ADDomain.description: Defines the AD domain you're working with.

AdditionalADDomainList.title: Domain Dropdown List
AdditionalADDomainList.description: List of LDAP servers to display in the pulldown menu in the Login Window. Users can select a domain from the menu and then only enter the shortname in the text field.

AdditionalADDomains.title: Additional Active Directory Domains
AdditionalADDomains.description: List of domains to append at the loginwindow. If not set, the standard Managed Domain policy will apply.

AllowNetworkSelection.title: Show Network Selection
AllowNetworkSelection.description: If enabled, the network selection button is shown

BackgroundImage.title: Login Window Background Image
BackgroundImage.description: Path to the background image to be used.

BackgroundImageAlpha.title: Login Window Background Image Alpha
BackgroundImageAlpha.description: Alpha value of the background image.

BackgroundImageData.title: Background Image Data
BackgroundImageData.description: Background to display on the login screen.

CreateAdminIfGroupMember.title: Group Membership to Create Admin Users
CreateAdminIfGroupMember.description: List of groups that should have its members created as local administrators.

CreateAdminUser.title: Create Admin Users
CreateAdminUser.description: Will place any local user created at login by NoMAD Login in the local admin group.

CustomNoMADLocation.title: Custom NoMAD Location
CustomNoMADLocation.description: If defined it specifies the custom location of the application to be given access to the keychain item.

DefaultSystemInformation.title: Default System Information
DefaultSystemInformation.description: Defines which system information should be showed on login window, by default

DemobilizeForcePasswordCheck.title: Demobilize Force Password Check
DemobilizeForcePasswordCheck.description: If true, a password input at the NoMAD login window will be required to demobilize

DemobilizeSaveAltSecurityIdentities.title: Demobilize Preserve AllSecurityIdentities
DemobilizeSaveAltSecurityIdentities.description: If true, the AltSecurityIdentities user record attribute should be preserved, useful when moving from mobile accounts with smart card mapping implemented.

DemobilizeUsers.title: Demobilize Users
DemobilizeUsers.description: Will convert a previously cached mobile account from AD into a regular local user account on login.

EULAPath.title: End User License Agreement Save Path
EULAPath.description: Path to save acceptance records to.

EULASubTitle.title: End User License Agreement Subtitle
EULASubTitle.description: Text for a subtitle in the EULA window.

EULAText.title: End User License Agreement Text
EULAText.description: Text to present in the EULA window.

EULATitle.title: End User License Agreement Title
EULATitle.description: Text for the large title in the EULA window.

EnableFDE.title: Enable FileVault on APFS
EnableFDE.description: On systems using the APFS filesystem, this key will enable FileVault encryption as the user is signing in for the first time.

EnableFDERecoveryKey.title: Enable FileVault Recovery Key
EnableFDERecoveryKey.description: Write the output of the fdesetup command to /var/db/.NoMADFDESetup

GUIDTool.title: GUID Tool
GUIDTool.description: String to determine the path of an executable that is run when a new user is created. It is expected to return the GUID that the user should be created with. It passes in the new users username as the first argument, default is to use the built in functionality

GuestUserAccountPasswordPath.title: Guest User Password Path
GuestUserAccountPasswordPath.description: The path to write out the guest users randomly generated password

GuestUserAccounts.title: Guest User Accounts
GuestUserAccounts.description: List of names that can be entered into the username field to trigger a guest user creation

GuestUserFirst.title: Guest User First Name
GuestUserFirst.description: Defines the first name of the guest user account

GuestUserLast.title: Guest User Last Name
GuestUserLast.description: Defines the last name of the guest user account

KeychainAddNoMAD.title: Add NoMAD to Keychain
KeychainAddNoMAD.description: Add a NoMAD entry into the keychain.

KeychainCreate.title: Create Keychain
KeychainCreate.description: Create keychain if it does not exist.

KeychainReset.title: Reset Keychain if Password Doesn't Match
KeychainReset.description: Reset keychain if login password doesn't match.

LDAPOverSSL.title: LDAP Over SSL
LDAPOverSSL.description: Determines if NoMAD Login uses LDAP over SSL.

LDAPServers.title: LDAPServers
LDAPServers.description: List of LDAP servers that you would like to use for AD authentication instead of using SRV record lookup.

LastUser.title: Last User Shortname
LastUser.description: Shortname of the last user to login. This allows NoMAD to login on first launch.

LoginLogo.title: Login Logo
LoginLogo.description: Path to the logo to display on the login screen. If set to NONE, no logo will be shown.

LoginLogoAlpha.title: Login Logo Alpha
LoginLogoAlpha.description: Alpha value of the logo image.

LoginLogoData.title: Login Logo Data
LoginLogoData.description: Logo to display on the login screen.

LoginScreen.title: macOS Style Login Window
LoginScreen.description: If set to yes, a macOS-style loginscreen will be presented instead of the NoMAD Login loginwindow style.

ManageSecureTokens.title: Enable Secure Token Management
ManageSecureTokens.description: This key will enable SecureToken management capabilites in NomadLogin 1.4. This utilizes a service account which can be modified from default using the below optional preferences.

MessagePasswordSync.title: Password Sync Message
MessagePasswordSync.description: Message to show when the password needs to sync

NTtoADDomainMappings.title: NTtoADDomainMappings
NTtoADDomainMappings.description: Maps NT to AD Domains. e.g. NOMAD: nomad.menu, would allow a user to sign in as "NOMAD\user" and that would be converted to "user@nomad.menu" before authenticating to AD.

NotifyLogStyle.title: Add Notify to Management Log File
NotifyLogStyle.description: Adds the appropriate log file to the the Notify mechanism.

PowerControlDisabled.title: Hide Shutdown and Restart
PowerControlDisabled.description: If set to yes, hides the shutdown and restart buttons

RecursiveGroupLookup.title: Recursive Group Lookup
RecursiveGroupLookup.description: If set to yes, group membership lookups should be done recursively

SecureTokenManagementEnableOnlyAdminUser.title: Enable Only Admin User
SecureTokenManagementEnableOnlyAdminUser.description: If enabled, the SecureToken service account will only enable administrative users created with NoMAD Login.

SecureTokenManagementOnlyEnableFirstUser.title: Only Enable First User
SecureTokenManagementOnlyEnableFirstUser.description: If enabled, NoMAD Login will only enable the first user that is eligable for a SecureToken, and delete the service account afterwards.

SecureTokenManagementPasswordLength.title: Service Account Password Length
SecureTokenManagementPasswordLength.description: Defines a custom SecureToken service account password length.

UIDTool.title: UID Tool
UIDTool.description: String to determine the path of an executable that is run when a new user is created. It is expected to return the UID that the user should be created with. It passes in the new users username as the first argument, default is to use the built in functionality

UseCNForFullName.title: Use User Common Name for Full Name
UseCNForFullName.description: Use the the user's CN from AD instead of attempting to create the user name from the first and last name attributes of the user's AD record.

UseCNForFullNameFallback.title: Use User Common Name for Full Name Fallback
UseCNForFullNameFallback.description: Uses the CN as the fullname on the account when the givenName and sn fields are blank

UserInputLogo.title: User Input Logo
UserInputLogo.description: Path to a logo file to use for the UserInput mechanism.

UserInputOutputPath.title: User Input / Output Path
UserInputOutputPath.description: Path where the userinfo.plist will be written.

UserInputUI.title: UserInputUI
UserInputUI.description: UI elements shown during the UserInput mechanism.

UserProfileImage.title: User Profile Image
UserProfileImage.description: Path to an image to set as the user profile image.

UsernameFieldPlaceholder.title: Username Field Placeholder
UsernameFieldPlaceholder.description: Placeholder text to show in the username textfield.

HomeMount.title: HomeMount
HomeMount.description: This is a dictionary of attributes for scenarios where the user's home profile should be mounted.

Groups.title: Groups
Groups.description: Only mount the home for members of these AD groups. Enter 'All' to allow all users and groups to mount their home.

Mount.title: Auto Mount Home
Mount.description: Mount the user's home automatically or not.

Options.title: Options
Options.description: Array of optional mount options. Refer to documentation for more information.

IgnoreShareNames.title: Ignored Shares
IgnoreShareNames.description: Specify a list of shares you'd like to ignore. (Time Machine is now ignored by default.)

Shares.title: Shares
Shares.description: Array of dictionaries of each share and their settings.

AutoMount.title: AutoMount
AutoMount.description: If enabled, will auto mount share.

ConnectedOnly.title: ConnectedOnly
ConnectedOnly.description: If enabled, will only mount on domain.

Groups.title: Groups
Groups.description: An array of AD groups allowed to mount the share.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name as it will appear in the NoMAD menu item.

Options.title: Options
Options.description: Array of optional mount options. Refer to documentation for more information.

URL.title: URL
URL.description:
The actual URL of the mount point in the form of "smb://dc1.nomad.test/Homes".

For the URLs, you can use variable substitution to allow for custom mounts without having to create even more XML. NoMAD understands <<domain>>, <<fullname>>, <<serial>>, <<shortname>>, <<upn>> and <<email>>

Version.title: Configuration Version
Version.description: This is the version number of the configuration specification.

allNetworkInterfaces.title: Show All Active Network Interfaces
allNetworkInterfaces.description: When enabled in the detail level, Particulars displays information about the primary active network interface. This setting expands that to include information about all active network interfaces.

appStoreVersionCheck.title: Checking for new version in the Mac App Store
appStoreVersionCheck.description: Particulars checks for new Particulars versions in the Mac App Store. This check can be disabled.

coreCount.title: CPU Core Count
coreCount.description: Adds a count of CPU cores to the CPU particular. Changing this setting requires a restart of the application to take effect.

desktopBottomMargin.title: Desktop Bottom Margin
desktopBottomMargin.description: Overrides desktopMargin for the bottom desktop margin

desktopLeftMargin.title: Desktop Left Margin
desktopLeftMargin.description: Overrides desktopMargin for the left desktop margin

desktopMargin.title: Desktop Margin
desktopMargin.description: When displaying system information on the desktop, Particulars uses all available screen size, inset by a default margin of 21pt. Margins can be adjusted.

desktopPosition.title: Desktop Position
desktopPosition.description: Sets the relative position of desktop system information.

desktopRightMargin.title: Desktop Right Margin
desktopRightMargin.description: Overrides desktopMargin for the right desktop margin

desktopTopMargin.title: Desktop Top Margin
desktopTopMargin.description: Overrides desktopMargin for the top desktop margin

detailLevel.title: Detail Level
detailLevel.description: Adjust detail level options. See documentation URL for instructions.

dhcpLeaseRemaining.title: Show DHCP Lease Time Remaining
dhcpLeaseRemaining.description: In the default network information, Particulars shows the DHCP server address and the length of the DHCP lease. This setting adds the remaining lease time.

diskFreeSpace.title: Disk Free Space Format
diskFreeSpace.description: Free/available disk space can be displayed in multiple ways. See documentation URL for options.

diskFreeSpaceNonBootVolumes.title: Show Disk Free Space for Non-Boot Volumes
diskFreeSpaceNonBootVolumes.description: By default, Particulars only shows disk space for the boot disk. Enable this setting to show disk space for other disks.

dropShadow.title: Drop Shadow
dropShadow.description: Determines whether the desktop system information has a drop shadow behind it.

explicitNoNetworkConfiguration.title: Explicit No Networks Detected message
explicitNoNetworkConfiguration.description: Displays an error message if no active network interfaces are found (assuming network is enabled in 'detailLevel').

firstRunDone.title: Skip the First Run Experience
firstRunDone.description: On first run, Particulars displays a welcome window that describes how it runs on the desktop and then hides all other apps and opens the settings window. To skip this first run experience, enable this setting. (Enabling labMode implies this setting.)

footerText.title: Footer
footerText.description: Footer text is displayed in a separate paragraph below all particulars. Any leading or trailing whitespace is removed when displayed.

headerText.title: Header
headerText.description: Header text is displayed in a separate paragraph above all particulars. Any leading or trailing whitespace is removed when displayed.

hideDockIcon.title: Hide Dock Icon
hideDockIcon.description: Enabling this setting removes Particulars from the macOS Dock. Changing this setting while Particulars is running will automatically restart Particulars and open the Settings window.

ignoreHiding.title: Ignore Hiding
ignoreHiding.description: When Particulars is running with the Dock icon shown, it will be hidden along with all other apps when you select Hide Others from another application's menu. This preference allows you to keep Particulars visible.

labMode.title: Lab Mode
labMode.description: Lab Mode eases the deployment of Particulars in a computer lab or other mass deployment. See the documentation for more information.

labelCase.title: Label Case
labelCase.description: Sets the letter case of the labels. Each case option has a corresponding number.

lightDarkText.title: Light or Dark Text
lightDarkText.description: Particulars has 3 options for the shade of the desktop system information: automatic, light text, or dark text. The automatic setting scans the current desktop picture to determine what setting to use. If battery life or performance is a concern, use light or dark.

macAddressFormat.title: MAC Address Format
macAddressFormat.description: By default, MAC (Media Access Control) addresses are formatted with colon separators and in lowercase. Use this setting to select another MAC address format.

menuBarWidgetAppearance.title: Menu Bar Widget Appearance
menuBarWidgetAppearance.description: Sets the appearance of the menu bar widget.

menuBarWidgetTextSize.title: Menu Bar Widget Text Size
menuBarWidgetTextSize.description: Sets the preferred text size in the menu bar widget in points. The default is 12. Values below 9 and above 24 are ignored. (Value may be scaled down to fit.)

networkDetailLevel.title: Network Detail Level
networkDetailLevel.description: By default, all network information is displayed except the Wi-Fi SSID. It is possible to construct a custom set of network information. Use this preference to create a custom network detail level. See documentation URL for instructions.

networkNotifications.title: Network Notifications
networkNotifications.description: When enabled, Particulars will post system notifications when it detects a change in the primary IPv4 address or the public IP address. Notifications are also governed by settings in the Notifications pane of System Settings.

operatingSystemVersionName.title: Operating System Version Name
operatingSystemVersionName.description: This setting adds the operating system version's marketing name (e.g., Big Sur, Catalina, etc) to the Operating System particular.

preferredDisplay.title: Preferred Display
preferredDisplay.description: Sets the display (or monitor) on which Particulars will show desktop system information. If the display is later unavailable, Particulars will default back to the primary display. The value is an integer, taking 2 for the 2nd display, for example.

showMenuBarExtra.title: Show Particulars in the Menu Bar
showMenuBarExtra.description: Adds an item to the macOS menu bar that allows quick access to system information. Secondary-clicking on the menu bar item shows a menu with settings, copying, and other functions.

showOnDesktop.title: Show Particulars on the Desktop
showOnDesktop.description: The default mode of Particulars is to present system information on the desktop. This can be disabled, usually in favor of showing Particulars in the menu bar.

subnetMaskCIDRNotation.title: Use CIDR Notation for Subnet Mask
subnetMaskCIDRNotation.description: This setting displays subnet masks in the short CIDR (Classless Inter-domain Routing) notation. For example, 255.255.254.0 will show as /23.

textSize.title: Text Size
textSize.description: Sets the preferred text size for the desktop system information in points. The default is 18. Values between 12 and 24 are typical. (Value may be scaled down to fit.)

textTheme.title: Text Theme
textTheme.description: Sets the theme of desktop system information. Each theme has a corresponding number.

coreCount.title: Show CPU Core Count
coreCount.description: Adds a count of CPU cores to the CPU item. Changing this preference requires a restart of the application/widget to take effect.

detailLevel.title: Detail Level
detailLevel.description: Adjust detail level options. See documentation URL for instructions.

dhcpLeaseRemaining.title: Show DHCP Lease Time Remaining
dhcpLeaseRemaining.description: Particulars shows the DHCP server address and the length of the DHCP lease. Setting this preference will also show the remaining lease time.

diskFreeSpace.title: Show Disk Free Space
diskFreeSpace.description: Free/available disk space can be displayed in multiple ways. See documentation URL for options.

labMode.title: Lab Mode
labMode.description: Lab Mode eases deployment of Particulars in a computer lab or data center.

labelCase.title: Label Case
labelCase.description: Sets the letter case of the labels. Each case option has a corresponding number.

macAddressFormat.title: MAC Address Format
macAddressFormat.description: By default, MAC (Media Access Control) addresses are formatted with colon separators and in lowercase. Use this preference to select another MAC address format.

networkDetailLevel.title: Network Detail Level
networkDetailLevel.description: By default, all network information is displayed. It is possible to construct a custom set of network information. Use this preference to create a custom network detail level. See documentation URL for instructions.

subnetMaskCIDRNotation.title: Subnet Mask CIDR Notation
subnetMaskCIDRNotation.description: Use this preference to have Particulars display subnet masks in the short CIDR (Classless Inter-domain Routing) notation. For example, 255.255.254.0 will show as /23.

CustomColor.title: macOS Accent Color
CustomColor.description: Custom color in HEX for all symbols. Leave empty to use macOS Accent Color.

CustomColorDarkMode.title: macOS Dark Mode Accent Color
CustomColorDarkMode.description: Custom color in HEX for all symbols in Dark Mode. Leave empty to use macOS Accent Color or CustomColor if specified.

ErrorMessage.title: Error Message
ErrorMessage.description: Shown when clicking an action that results in an error.

ExtensionLinkA.title: Support App Extension A: Link
ExtensionLinkA.description: The Bundle Identifier of the App, URL or command to open.

ExtensionLinkB.title: Support App Extension B: Link
ExtensionLinkB.description: The Bundle Identifier of the App, URL or command to open.

ExtensionSymbolA.title: Support App Extension A: Symbol
ExtensionSymbolA.description: The SF Symbol shown in extension A.

ExtensionSymbolB.title: Support App Extension B: Symbol
ExtensionSymbolB.description: The SF Symbol shown in extension B.

ExtensionTitleA.title: Support App Extension A: Title
ExtensionTitleA.description: The title shown in extension A.

ExtensionTitleB.title: Support App Extension B: Title
ExtensionTitleB.description: The title shown in extension B.

ExtensionTypeA.title: Support App Extension A: Type
ExtensionTypeA.description: Type of link the item should open. Can be anything like screen sharing tools, company stores, file servers or core applications in your organization.

ExtensionTypeB.title: Support App Extension B: Type
ExtensionTypeB.description: Type of link the item should open. Can be anything like screen sharing tools, company stores, file servers or core applications in your organization.

FirstRowLinkLeft.description: The Bundle Identifier of the App or URL that should be opened, command or script to be run.

FirstRowLinkMiddle.description: The Bundle Identifier of the App or URL that should be opened, command or script to be run.

FirstRowSubtitleRight.title: First Row Right Subtitle
FirstRowSubtitleRight.description: Subtitle text will appear under title when the user hovers over the button. Ignored if left empty.

FirstRowSymbolLeft.description: The SF Symbol shown in the button.

FirstRowSymbolMiddle.title: First Row Middle Symbol
FirstRowSymbolMiddle.description: The SF Symbol shown in the button.

FirstRowSymbolRight.description: The SF Symbol shown in the button.

FirstRowTitleMiddle.description: The text shown in the button label.

FirstRowTitleRight.description: The text shown in the button label.

FirstRowTypeMiddle.title: First Row Middle Link Type
FirstRowTypeMiddle.description: Type of link the item should open. Can be anything like screen sharing tools, company stores, file servers or core applications in your organization.

FirstRowTypeRight.description: Type of link the item should open. Can be anything like screen sharing tools, company stores, file servers or core applications in your organization.

FooterText.title: Footer Text
FooterText.description: Text shown at the bottom as footnote

HideFirstRow.title: Hide First Row
HideFirstRow.description: Hides the first row of configurable items.

HideMajorUpdates.title: Hide Major macOS Updates / Upgrades
HideMajorUpdates.description: Ignore macOS major updates. This will prevent the menu bar icon and the macOS version info item from showing an available major update.

HideSecondRow.title: Hide Second Row
HideSecondRow.description: Hides the second row of configurable items.

InfoItemFive.title: Info Item 5
InfoItemFive.description: Info item shown in the third row left.

InfoItemFour.title: Info Item 4
InfoItemFour.description: Info item shown in the second row right.

InfoItemOne.title: Info Item 1
InfoItemOne.description: Info item shown in the upper left corner.

InfoItemSix.title: Info Item 6
InfoItemSix.description: Info item shown in the third row right.

InfoItemThree.title: Info Item 3
InfoItemThree.description: Info item shown in the second row left.

InfoItemTwo.title: Info Item 2
InfoItemTwo.description: Info item shown in the upper right corner.

Logo.title: Light Mode Logo
Logo.description: Path to the logo shown in the top right corner when the app opens. Scales to 48 points maximum height.

LogoDarkMode.title: Dark Mode Logo
LogoDarkMode.description: Path to the logo shown in the top right corner when the app opens for Dark Mode. Scales to 48 points maximum height.

NotificationIcon.title: Notification Icon
NotificationIcon.description: Path to a custom square image to be shown in alerts and the about window.

OpenAtLogin.title: Open At Login
OpenAtLogin.description: Launch Support automatically at login and keep it open (macOS 13 and higher). This setting is ignored if a legacy LaunchAgent is installed/active. Disable this if you don't want to open Support at login or use your own LaunchAgent

PasswordExpiryLimit.title: Password Expiration Limit
PasswordExpiryLimit.description: Days until password expiry after which a notification badge is shown, disabled by default

PasswordLabel.title: Password Label
PasswordLabel.description: Alternative text label shown in the Password info item.

SecondRowLinkLeft.description: The Bundle Identifier of the App or URL that should be opened, command or script to be run.

SecondRowSubtitleLeft.description: Subtitle text will appear under title when the user hovers over the button. Ignored if left empty.

SecondRowSubtitleMiddle.description: Subtitle text will appear under title when the user hovers over the button. Ignored if left empty.

SecondRowSubtitleRight.description: Subtitle text will appear under title when the user hovers over the button. Ignored if left empty.

SecondRowSymbolLeft.description: The SF Symbol shown in the button.

SecondRowTitleMiddle.description: The text shown in the button label.
